25,health,Indeed,p_a469687c8573c4cc,Consultant – Patient-Centered Endpoints,IQVIA, Amsterdam,"This Consultant job represents a great career opportunity with IQVIA’s Patient Centered Endpoints (PCE) team. The aim of the team is to ensure that the patient voice is adequately considered in clinical trial outcomes and beyond. We lead the industry in the application of scientific methods to measure the patient experience of their disease and of new treatments, often through the development and application of Clinical Outcomes Assessment (COA) and Patient Reported Outcome (PRO) tools. Our diverse team of Patient Centered Endpoints experts works together to develop, deploy, and validate COA instruments that capture patient-centric data, analyze and interpret outcomes, and translate the information to advance the initiatives of life science companies.

The Consultant role is key to this fast-growing, highly successful team that operates from multiple locations across the US and Europe. We are one of IQVIA’s global centres of excellence and we have experts in strategic consulting, COAs, psychology, epidemiology, regulatory strategy, statistics and psychometrics, and digital data collection.
The position is preferably office based in Basel, Amsterdam, Paris, Madrid, Cambridge, Reading, London, Munich or Warsaw. However, home based applicants will also be considered.
Responsibilities

Consultants are responsible for managing projects in the field of patient-centred endpoints and communicating insights and recommendations to clients. In this central role in project delivery, Consultants are supported by senior colleagues, and encouraged in their career development.
Client Focused:
Develop a broad knowledge of patient science and how it addresses client needs for evidence generation and dissemination
Serve as the day-to-day manager for projects
Perform quantitative or qualitative analysis to identify client issues and develop client deliverables
Direct junior team members
Create reports, presentations and workshops
Communicate findings and recommendations to the project team and the client
Assist with business development and proposals
Identify opportunities for expansion of PCE offerings or improvements to practices
Engage in thought leadership (e.g. publications) and development of intellectual property for use on future engagements
Practice Building:
Support people-related activities such as recruitment, training and development
Lead special initiatives such as knowledge management and process improvement
Essential experience, skills and education required
2+ years in consulting within the pharmaceutical and/or healthcare industry with evidence of career progression is mandatory for the role
Minimum of 1+ years project management experience

A strong academic track record including a relevant advanced academic degree (e.g. biological sciences, public health, epidemiology, psychology, sociology, health economics) and/or 3 or more years relevant experience
Familiarity with COA/PRO, patient preference and/or real-world evidence methods
Excellent conversational and business English (written and oral)
column2: additional languages an advantage

column1: Well-developed written and verbal communication skills including presenting, facilitating meetings and workshops, business and report writing
Demonstrable analytical, interpretative and problem-solving skills
Strong capability in juggling priorities so that deadlines are met while retaining consistently high quality outcomes
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with others in and across the organization to accomplish team goals
Adaptability and an ability to learn quickly and apply new knowledge
Knowledge of consulting methodologies, tools, and techniques
What we offer
A great role in an international organization where learning and development are central
Coaching and training to strengthen skills such as project management and business development
A personal development plan and regular discussions to work on professional development
A dynamic, flexible, open and informal working environment and a close team that values teamwork and co-creation
Interesting projects in an exciting field
Regular meetings and inspiration sessions with colleagues
#LI-NATALIAROTH

At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 67,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=a469687c8573c4cc&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=dfc4417c678f9298&assa=5465,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=a469687c8573c4cc&fccid=6b7a1dfe07e7f037&vjs=3,4 dagen geleden,4 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

26,health,Indeed,p_3dbf0f8f26156b5e,Health & Safety Manager BU Food (location flexible EU),Trivium Packaging, Schiphol,"Trivium Packaging is a global leader in metal packaging with more than 60 locations worldwide and employs close to 8,000 people and has annual revenue of approximately $2.7 billion. Trivium serves a diverse range of customers in a variety of end markets such as food, seafood, pet food, nutrition, beauty and personal care, household care and premium beverages.
Health & Safety Manager BU Food
Location: Europe, close to an airport
Territory: Europe
Role Description

The BU Health & Safety Manager provides strategic direction and support to BU/plant Health & Safety related activities to ensure a safe place to work and strive for a zero harm working environment. The H&S Manager will ensure (legal) compliance with local, governmental, ISO 45001 and Trivium Packaging regulations and guidelines. Furthermore to develop and implement the BU Food Health & Safety strategy in accordance with Trivium Packaging goals & objectives. In this function you will be the functional lead for the team of local H&S Managers in strong relationship with Plant Managers and GM as well as in daily business. Provide support to the Global/European Head of H&S where required.
Key Responsibilities
Coordinates Business Unit topics with GM Food and/or European Head of H&S
Regular visits to plants (audits, status visits, incident investigation, training, etc.)
Supports and ensures a good quality of monthly H&S figures reporting
Presents H&S topics during BU management meetings
Ensures good quality of accident reporting and investigation following the Trivium guidelines
Support local teams in reaching Trivium Packaging H&S goals & objectives, deliver required training and guidance
Development and implementation of standards, procedures and Triviums leading KPI’s
Participates actively in Group H&S meetings and Working groups
Provides, structured, initiation of new plant H&S Managers, General Managers, etc.
Co-ordinates H&S activities associated with organizational closure, divestiture, or acquisitions
Expert role for H&S related topics and provide Risk Management Guidance
Challenges (Plant) Management in order to implement and achieve BU initiatives, reach the Trivium Safety Indicators and other relevant BU topics
Promote a positive Health and Safety culture across the business
Ensures continuous improvement in order to meet the challenging 5 year goals
Reports directly to the GM Food and has a dotted line to the European Head of H&S
High percentage of travelling throughout Europe is expected
Knowledge / Skills / Experience
Bachelor degree and at least a certification in Safety, e.g. NEBOSH diploma or equivalent
A minimum of 5 to 8 years of relevant work experience in an international leading H&S position, preferably in a manufacturing environment
Ability to work as a team member across Europe and to coordinate negotiations with various international contacts
People manager with excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Experienced trainer and facilitator. Strong intercultural competences
Modern approach to Health & Safety
Reliable, trustworthy, transparent, persistent, rigorous, can do attitude, mobility
Ability to work within an ambiguous, fast-moving environment

column1: 29,health,Indeed,p_37c2060fda3272d2,Program Coordinator,uButler, Amsterdam Centrum,"Are you structured and do you always think in terms of solutions? uButler is looking for a Program Creator who strives for continuous improvement!

uButler is a 24/7 service that provides assistance to international local hires that need to find their way in the Netherlands. Our Relocation Assistants, who work under the alias ‘Sophie’, arrange everything that a newcomer needs when settling in a new country via our special created software. Think about opening a bank account, taking out health insurance to arrange personal matters, like arranging a holiday or looking for a hobby. Our golden formula of well-trained people, combined with a smart system, ensures that international local hires will find their way in the Netherlands within a few weeks! Are you the new link in this technical and innovative start-up?

As the Program Coordinator you are at the heart of the company to ensure that the right information reaches the right people at any given moment in time. At uButler the provision of correct information is of great importance to offer an excellent service to our users at all times. With the help of our self-developed 'knowledge base', you manage which information is visible to users, their employers and your colleagues. In addition, you know everything about the programs we offer and you write work descriptions that the Relocation Assistants can follow to complete the various requests. Besides your regular tasks, you are constantly improving the service by developing the processes within the program or devising new ways to share our knowledge in an effective manner. To do so, you can put yourself in the shoes of both users and colleagues to think of what they may need. The users come from all over the world, so flawless English writing and speech is a must. An eye for detail, the intrinsic drive to improve and innovative thinking is what allows you to take the uButler formula to the next level!
What are your responsibilities?
Composing and improving the service program
Managing the knowledge base per company
Writing work descriptions for the Relocation Assistants
Devising and creating ways of sharing information
Connecting different departments within uButler through information provision
What do we ask from you?
+2 years of professional work experience
Fulltime available
Living in Amsterdam or surrounding area
Flawless in English and Dutch
Creative and solution-oriented
Clear and enterprising
What’s in it for you?
Full time contract
A company laptop
A subscription to Swapfiets
Room for own initiatives and improvements
Being part of a cool team, we are always in for a good joke!
An extensive lunch every day
Legendary drinks and outings!
Do we have your attention?
Nice! Our mission is to create the best digital relocation service and we will not stop until we succeed! Do you want to be part of this great journey? Register quickly or contact:
Medea Weertman | HR-manager | careers@ubutler.nl | +316 18 53 81 81",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 30,health,Indeed,p_9b6d21853575e564,NL Compliance Officer,Currencycloud, Amsterdam,"NL Compliance Officer
Ready to shape tomorrow?

Currencycloud is somewhere where innovative thinking and the power of technology know no limits. We know that the success of the business depends on the people who keep it moving, which is why we are looking for exceptional talent to join our international payments revolution.
About the role...
This is a senior role which combines responsibilities for Currencycloud B.V. and other Group companies. It reports directly into the MLRO (based in London).
The details...
The main responsibilities will be:
Responsible for the Currencycloud B.V. AML framework
Maintain our local AML policies and procedures and liaise with the MLRO/Head of Compliance Operations in the UK to make sure local policies align with the Group policy framework
Lead the relationship with De Nederlandsche Bank (DNB) and other European regulators
Ensure that the company remains up to date with all relevant regulatory developments in the EU

Responsible for all day to day compliance activities within Currencycloud B.V. (escalations and approvals for client onboarding and transaction monitoring) supported by the Group compliance operations function
Determine whether suspicious activity reports have substance and require disclosure to the relevant authorities
Prepare monthly AML management information for Currencycloud B.V. and report back to the Group MLRO with conclusions and recommendations
Work closely with sales and other stakeholders in the business to advise on new EU clients or business opportunities
Support the Group MLRO on various projects including delivery of compliance training, preparation of the annual risk assessment and updating the Group AML policy framework
Skills, Knowledge & Expertise
Hands on and independent
Have an interest in the payments, financial services, technology or FX industry
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Excellent team working skills, ability to manage own workload and tenacious attention to detail
Masters in Law degree (or equivalent)
Understanding of AML legislation within financial services
Your benefits...
At the moment we are transitioning from an office based working environment to a remote first company, so we have adapted our already great benefits package to reflect this.

We now offer a day off each month for your mental health on top of the 25 days annual leave allowance and a day off for your birthday. Our comprehensive health care includes mental health support service access and we have live streamed health based activities like Yoga and Barre classes each week! We also run fortnightly company updates hosted by our CEO to keep employees up to date on developments and also include an open forum for employees to ask questions.
If you think your skills and experience match what we are looking for and you’d like to join a Fintech industry unicorn, please get in touch!
For recruiters: we aren’t currently looking for additional support on this role and won’t be accepting any unsolicited CVs
About Currencycloud

Currencycloud is a global payments platform built on smart technology that takes the complexity out of moving money. Developers use our API building blocks to build customised payment solutions. Whether you want to embed our payments infrastructure into your products or services, or build on top of it, we’ll fit into your business in a way that works for you.
We take care of all the intricacies and regulatory hurdles involved with cross-border payments, giving you the tools to globalise your business.

Our cloud-based platform removes that complexity from international transactions, giving you clarity and control over your business so you can focus on the things that matter: your customers. With enterprise-class solutions for clients and partners such as Visa and Starling Bank, Currencycloud understands your needs and can help with market-leading products.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=9b6d21853575e564&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=d9dc888d2bda2c3c&assa=3950,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=9b6d21853575e564&fccid=affdf1e411b75152&vjs=3,3 dagen geleden,3 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
31,health,Indeed,p_7767bb2ae7187500,"NEW CONTRACT - Regulatory Affairs CMC Consultant – EU & International Regions, NL",ADV Talent Partners, Amsterdam,"Job Description
NEW CONTRACT - Regulatory Affairs CMC Consultant – EU & International Regions
Location: Netherlands but home working available until post COVID
We have a new Regulatory Affairs CMC contact role for a global Pharmaceutical Company with home working options available.

You will operating in a Global Regulatory Affairs department leading and managing major RA CMC activities around MAA’s and major lifecycle initiatives for EU and major International markets, for 2 leading products and their API’s.
Responsibilities:
Strategy, planning, definition of content, preparation, review and approval of global CMC submissions for assigned projects/products to achieve timely approvals to meet business needs.
Identifying supporting CMC documents required for global submissions and negotiates the delivery of approved technical source documents in accordance with project timelines.

Writing and approval of CMC sections for submissions (i.e. for briefing documents, clinical trial applications, registrations, post-approval submissions, PIPs) and responses to health authority questions in line with agreed global regulatory strategy, and within agreed timelines.

You will be joining a highly experienced, but very friendly regulatory team in a company with a relaxed and flexible way of working. The rate is very good and the projects are interesting and require good amounts of leadership and strategic input. Strong experience in Regulatory CMC leadership, submissions and lifecycle maintenance is essential for the role.
The contract will last 12months, with a strong possibility of an extension.
To Apply!

To apply for this role, please press the red “Apply for position” button, or contact Theo Moore on +44 (0)207 801 3384 in full confidence to receive more details on this role or to hear about other available opportunities.

We provide a high level of service because we believe this matters. Our people place individuals at the Specialist, Expert, Regional and Global Head levels, so if you want some advice on when or how to make your next step, or to understand what that next step might look like, let’s collaborate and explore these ideas with each other. ADV Talent Partners only advertise around 30% of our active roles, so for us to really help you, please Register or call us. We provide permanent and contract roles in the following areas, across the USA, Europe and Asia Pacific. General switchboard number +44 (0)207 801 3380.

GDPR & Data Protection: Your information is safeguarded for GDPR, and you will have the right to edit, amend or delete and ’’be forgotten’’ at any time after your initial registration.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=7767bb2ae7187500&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=bff0f4cb7e17a025&assa=4856,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=7767bb2ae7187500&fccid=f94f2fe19869476a&vjs=3,3 dagen geleden,3 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

32,health,Indeed,p_dba8aab9659f6b0b,CRO Specialist,Holland  Barrett, Amsterdam,"Ben je op zoek naar een baan met veel vrijheid en ruimte voor eigen ideeën? Heb je ervaring op het gebied van Conversie- en UX optimalisatie binnen een e-commerce omgeving? Vind je het leuk om een team te coachen en te trainen? Lees dan snel verder!
Wat ga je doen?

Als ervaren CRO Specialist maak je onderdeel uit van het Benelux Digital team van Holland & Barrett. In deze functie kruip je in huid van onze klanten en staat hun 'Journey' centraal. Het belangrijkste uitgangspunt: hoe kunnen we onze klanten een optimale, naadloze en enthousiasmerende winkelervaring bieden!

In deze functie analyseer je klantgedrag op de Benelux websites van Holland & Barrett en ben je in staat om je observaties te vertalen naar duidelijke verbetervoorstellen voor UX en conversie. Je bent in staat om kennis op te bouwen, naar binnen te halen en te delen met je collega’s. Continu leren is hierbij van belang.
Je bent daarnaast ook verantwoordelijk voor het beheren en het opzetten van de roadmap voor doorontwikkeling en weboptimalisatie.
Verder houd je je bezig met:
het monitoren van conversie doelstellingen
column2: je stuurt bij, bij afwijkingen en beheert dashboards aangaande deze doelstellingen

column1: het analyseren en verzamelen van informatie, onder andere door het analyseren van analytics en het opzetten van multivariatie en A/B testen
het identificeren van verbeteringen via voornamelijk eigen analyses maar ook extern onderzoek en bijvoorbeeld analyses van de usability, web-analist of business intelligence
het geven van onafhankelijke adviezen voor het verbeteren van campagnes op de website, op basis van bewezen successen
het uitwerken van ideeën (samen met de UX designer) in wireframes, mock-ups en prototypes en toetst deze bij stakeholders
wat er in de markt speelt en je past de nieuwste technieken toe

het testen en implementeren van nieuwe projecten en (opgeleverde) features, A/B of multivariate testen en koppelingen met systemen (tbv. UX en conversie). Je zorgt ervoor dat deze goed presteren op alle browsers en devices voordat deze live worden gezet
het in de gaten houden van de snelheid en site performance
column2: je bent als één van de eerste stand-by wanneer er bugs of site issues plaatsvinden

column1: UK stakeholder management, je communiceert en beheert de backlog, planning en voortgang van de Benelux webroadmap in nauwe samenwerking met het team in Nederland en de UK.
Het team, totaal 13 collega’s, bestaat uit Online Merchandisers, E-mail marketeers, een Loyalty marketeer, een performance marketeer, een SEO specialist, een webanalist en een online marketeer.
In deze functie rapporteer je aan Rachel, onze Head of Digital. Je zal ook nauw samenwerken met het iedereen van het digital team en de (conversie) specialisten op ons hoofdkantoor in de UK.
Profiel
Je beschikt over minimaal HBO werk- en denkniveau
Je hebt circa 3-5 jaar relevante werkervaring opgedaan in een soortgelijke functie binnen een e-commerce omgeving
Je hebt ervaring met conversie-optimalisatie en het uitvoeren van A/B- en M/V testen
Je bent data driven en gebruikt deze mindset in de besluitvoering
Je weet hoe je een roadmap beheert en opzet
Je hebt een sterke commerciële focus
Je hebt ervaring met Google Analytics en andere web-analytics tooling
Je hebt kennis van UX en het maken van wireframes en/of mock-ups
Je beheerst zowel de Nederlandse- als de Engelse taal goed in woord en geschrift (Frans is een pré)
Je kunt je bovendien vinden in de volgende eigenschappen: communicatief sterk, teamplayer, organisatiesensitief, zelfstandig, proactief en ondernemend.
Wat wij je bieden

Holland & Barrett biedt een interessante functie in een succesvolle en informele omgeving aan, waarbij er ruimte is om jezelf te ontwikkelen en nieuwe ideeën te realiseren. Binnen onze organisatie zijn doorgroeimogelijkheden een prioriteit. Verder bieden we een goed salaris welke afhankelijk is van jouw ervaring. Tevens hebben wij goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals personeelskorting, pensioenregeling, 28 vakantiedagen, een eigen training Academy, gratis fruit, een eigen gym op kantoor (maar momenteel werken we natuurlijk vanuit huis) en diverse collectiviteitskortingen op zorgverzekeringen.
Sollicitatieprocedure
Heb je interesse in deze functie? Solliciteer dan direct met jouw CV en motivatiebrief via de solliciteerbutton op onze website.

Indien je positief bent geselecteerd dan word je uitgenodigd voor een telefonische screening met onze recruiter. Mocht je na deze screening positief worden bevonden, dan plannen we zo snel mogelijk een eerste sollicitatiegesprek met jou in. Je kunt maximaal twee gespreksrondes verwachten.
Over ons

Holland & Barrett is een van de meest geliefde en vertrouwde merken in biologische voeding, vitaminen, supplementen en clean beauty, allemaal verkocht door goed opgeleide en gekwalificeerde adviseurs. Holland & Barrett heeft meer dan 1.300 winkels wereldwijd, waarvan meer dan 230 in Nederland en België. Met meer dan 1300 werknemers in de winkels en het hoofdkantoor in Amsterdam, is de Benelux de grootste van Holland & Barretts internationale markten én een van de meest concurrerende.

Holland & Barrett is sterk gegroeid over de afgelopen jaren, en onze groei is de laatste tijd – om overduidelijke redenen – alleen maar versneld. Ondertussen hebben we onze operatie en cultuur versterkt om nóg klantgerichter te worden, en de wereldwijde leider in health en wellness. We nodigen jou uit om hieraan deel te nemen en om verdere groei als echte omnichannel retailer mogelijk te maken.

*** Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld. Aan CV's die ongevraagd worden aangeleverd kunnen geen rechten worden ontleend.***",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=dba8aab9659f6b0b&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=d181c04446d29559&assa=6019,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=dba8aab9659f6b0b&fccid=344344dda6e83d9f&vjs=3,3 dagen geleden,3 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
33,health,Indeed,p_718bc6b658d1c579,"The Kraft Heinz International Management Trainee Program (Amsterdam, Milan, Paris, Madrid)",Kraft Heinz Company, Amsterdam,"Kraft Heinz, The Company

As one of the world’s largest food and beverage companies, we are proud to spark joy around mealtimes with a global portfolio of more than 200 brands. Some are iconic brands like Philadelphia Cream Cheese, Kraft Peanut Butter, Kraft Dinner and Heinz Ketchup. Others are fast growing new sensations that defy status quo like CRAVE. No matter the brand, we are united under one vision To Be the Best Food Company, Growing a Better World . Bringing this vision to life are our 36,000+ teammates around the world, making food people love.

Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership and commitment with Rise Against Hunger. And we also stand committed to sustainability, and the health of our planet and its people.

Every day, we are transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you’re passionate like us - and ready to create the future, build on a storied legacy, and participate as a conscientious global citizen - there’s one thing to do join us.
Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration
We’re not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. It all comes down to the way we empower our people to own their work. It’s true Our employees are our competitive advantage.

As part of the Kraft Heinz family you’re supported to grow and achieve. You’re recognized and rewarded for outstanding performance at every level. You’re given the opportunity to leave your mark and build legacies. But you won’t do it alone. This is where our values and teamwork thrives and collaborative spirit fuels every day.
Job Description
Program details
· Program Start Date: September 2021
· Duration: 12-month program
· Contract: permanent contract from the start of the trainee program
· Business Function: Sales- Marketing- Finance- Operations- People & Performance
For a place in our Amsterdam - Milan - Paris - Madrid office apply from October 2020 here.
If you are interested in one of our other Trainee locations: Moscow - Warsaw or Dubai check out our website.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Permanent working rights in at least one of the countries you are applying for is a MANDATORY REQUIREMENT (Orientation Year visa not considered). Candidates without working rights are not considered in the application process.
Kraft Heinz Vision

At Kraft Heinz- our vision is to sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally. To be #1 in taste elevation by making life delicious. Like our passion for developing great foods- we are also dedicated to the development of great leaders. The Kraft Heinz International Management Trainee Program (IMTP) is a highly competitive development program for candidates seeking an exciting leadership career with Kraft Heinz.
The Kraft Heinz International Trainee Program:

Our 12-month immersive program will develop you into a future leader of our company. The program is designed for top talent who seek a performance-based culture that is built on meritocracy- ambition- hard-work and passion.

During our 12-month program you will join a class of other ambitious Trainees to learn directly from Kraft Heinz leaders- travel to all areas of our organization to see exactly how the Heinz ketchup gets made and have multiple opportunities to work directly in our business. As a Kraft Heinz Trainee you will be adding value as a full-time employee from day one
column2: doing real work and delivering real results.

column1: Your journey will start with a functional bootcamp - you will get a hands-on induction into all the different functions to accrue the experiences you will need to be successful as a future leader within Kraft Heinz. This is followed by a field sales placement to get to know our consumer as we are consumer obsessed. During the program you will get to work on a business project and experience a business placement. At the conclusion of the 12-month program Kraft Heinz Trainees will be placed into functions across our company where they can add immediate value.
Profile – Basic Qualifications:
· University Master degree.
· Graduated on or after 2020 from any discipline
· Max. working experience: 1 year after graduation
· Good knowledge of the English language
· Ability and willingness to relocate
· Impressive extra- curriculars
· Valid working rights for the country you are applying for are required
What we are looking for in our talent:
· You are consumer obsessed
· You dare to do better every day
· You champion great people
· You demand diversity
· You do the right thing
· You own it
This is how we win:
· We work as a team- Energize self and others
· We Inspire excellence- Model lifelong learning- curiosity and creativity
· We navigate our future- Be courageous in the face of uncertainty
Our offer:
· Permanent contract at the start of the Trainee Program
· Intensive training and exposure to different Business Units
· Business support and mentorship throughout the program
· Highly competitive benefits
Location(s)

34,health,Indeed,pj_3d54c6a903eaf95f,Safety Manager,Linesight, Nederland,"Safety Manager
Position Summary:

The Safety Manager is responsible for setting out the vision for the management of health, safety and wellbeing during the project from commencement through construction, commissioning and handover. The Safety Manager will be responsible for the development and implementation of the health and safety required for the construction of the project, ensuring compliance with all relevant legislation. The successful candidate will provide directional support in the planning, measuring, reviewing and auditing of safety activities on both a day to day and a strategic basis in relation to the construction of the project.
Role and Responsibilities:
Develop and implement a safety strategy for the project
Prepare procedures including safety statement, risk assessments and safety related protocols to ensure compliance
Lead the maintenance of ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and OHSAS 18001 systems as appropriate
Conduct risk assessments and ensure measures to control risks are implemented and monitored
Ensure safety management arrangements and requirements are established and implemented by the contractor
Provide guidance and support/assistance to the team for effective implementation on their role and duties for the project
Engage with all project stakeholders to ensure implementation of regulations pertaining to health and safety
Support the implementation of best practice safety standards where practicable

Enhance and improve existing construction safety management procedures through a visible on-site presence, and through active participation in all aspects of day-to-day health & safety management on the projects
Participate in safety auditing processes across the project through
Provide reports and progress updates on all aspects of safety management for the project
Participate in the review and assessment of accidents, incidents and near-miss reporting including the evaluation of findings and monitoring the implementation of corrective and preventive measures
Actively engage in project meetings, training workshops, daily activity briefings and management reviews
Desired Experience and Education:
Degree related to construction and safety
Chartered status
Extensive safety experience on large scale construction projects
Computer literate (MS Office and other relevant IT packages)
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) with the ability to engage at all levels
Must be able to work well in a team

Are you looking for a career with a leading global organization, working on a dynamic range of projects? Linesight has been providing professional consultancy services, management support and strategic advice to the global construction industry since 1974. We offer you the opportunity to progress your career, work on exciting projects with world-renowned clients, and be a part of a fast-growing, fast-paced global team.

We have deep domain knowledge and experience spanning a multitude of sectors including Commercial, Data Centers, Life Sciences, Healthcare, High-Tech Industrial, Hospitality, Education, Residential and Retail. As an organization, we seek out innovative self-starters with the skills to deliver exceptional outcomes for our clients, and the desire to shape the environments in which we live.

column1: 37,health,Indeed,p_75e741c1e07427ac,Logistics Analyst,Kraft Heinz Company, Amsterdam,"Kraft Heinz, The Company

As one of the world’s largest food and beverage companies, we are proud to spark joy around mealtimes with a global portfolio of more than 200 brands. Some are iconic brands like Philadelphia Cream Cheese, Kraft Peanut Butter, Kraft Dinner and Heinz Ketchup. Others are fast growing new sensations that defy status quo like CRAVE. No matter the brand, we are united under one vision To Be the Best Food Company, Growing a Better World . Bringing this vision to life are our 36,000+ teammates around the world, making food people love.

Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership and commitment with Rise Against Hunger. And we also stand committed to sustainability, and the health of our planet and its people.

Every day, we are transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you’re passionate like us - and ready to create the future, build on a storied legacy, and participate as a conscientious global citizen - there’s one thing to do join us.
Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration
We’re not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. It all comes down to the way we empower our people to own their work. It’s true Our employees are our competitive advantage.

As part of the Kraft Heinz family you’re supported to grow and achieve. You’re recognized and rewarded for outstanding performance at every level. You’re given the opportunity to leave your mark and build legacies. But you won’t do it alone. This is where our values and teamwork thrives and collaborative spirit fuels every day.
Job Description
About the Position

We have an excellent opportunity available for a Logistics Analyst to make a difference at Kraft Heinz. The Logistics Analyst lies within the Benelux S&OP and Logistics Team. You’ll be working in a high performing team, alongside peers always trying to reach the next level. You’ll be reporting into the Logistics Support Manager of Benelux.
The position will require exposure to internal and external stakeholders and the primary responsibilities include:
Aligning with Marketing and Demand Planning the new product development requirements
Creating in SAP the repack finished goods, the packaging materials specifications and the BOMs
Ordering packaging materials from our suppliers to ensure the repack schedule is realized
Maintaining the Repack Packaging Cards and aligning the schedule with the repack provider
Owning the pallet declaration, administration and payment process,
Estimating and reporting the Logistics KPIs
Maintaining the Master Data of our product portfolio
Taking part in Continuous Improvement Projects
Qualifications
Hard Skills

38,health,Indeed,p_0d554b9204e398f7,Customer Success Specialist,project44, Amsterdam,"Our mission is to usher in a new era of trust and predictability to transportation and logistics, but there's still a lot of work to be done. The industry is massive, as is the opportunity. We're looking for bright, ambitious individuals to join our growing global team and help us enable a more productive and successful world. We're changing the way the world ships, and we're looking for you to help us get there!
Why project44?

The role

We are looking for a Customer Success Specialist who will be accountable for making sure our customers have world-class customer experience. column1: 39,health,Indeed,p_f01b004b378bb769,Operations Coord 2 (Lifecycle Safety),IQVIA, Amsterdam,"Be a part of a global team to help ensure the safety profile of a COVID-19 vaccine with opportunities to improve worldwide public health.

Use your scientific and foreign language expertise to join the world’s leading comprehensive pharmaceutical safety services organization on a fast-growing team performing medical information call centre services.
Manage the administrative support across all Lifecycle Safety service lines to the SO and LSM functions as appropriate. Provide support to administrative team members.
The Role:

Review, assess and process safety data and information, across service lines, received from various sources and distribute reports/data onwards to both internal and external third parties, following applicable regulations SOPs and internal guidelines under guidance and support of senior operation team members.
Key responsibilities:

Assist in processing of Lifecycle Safety data by collecting and tracking incoming Adverse Events(AE)/endpoint information, determining initial/update status of incoming events, tracking timelines for completion of event processing, distributing event information to appropriate project personnel in the workflow for continued processing, review and preparation of end point documentation, transfer of events to client and other parties as identified by operations lead, obtaining confirmation of report receipt and track submission and assuming workflow responsibilities for various projects.

May assist with project workflow including database entry, quality control activities, and generation of Lifecycle Safety data reports, preparation of Lifecycle Safety submission dossiers, assisting with deadline quality measurements, as directed by operations team member or manager.

Assist with administrative team support e.g. project start-up tasks, creation and maintenance of project files, systems access requests periodic distribution of AE listings and shipping of information supplies to sites as directed by senior operations team member.

May coordinate, schedule and submit safety reports to regulatory authorities, marketing authorization holders, investigators, customers and operations team in accordance with deadlines perform project administrative tasks such as creation of labels using investigator list, maintenance of personal safety files for mail merges and regulatory documents, copying of documents, envelope stuffing, tracking and filing of submission dossiers, and distributing listings to client and/or operations team members.

Creating, maintain and track case folders, filing, retrieving and distribution of case folders to operations team members, assisting in maintenance of document control storage and relevant applications/systems as directed.

Archiving case folders and project files after event closure, coordination of transfer of archived material to company/customer archive storage facilities after study closure, assisting in creation of records management processes and procedures, providing key input to operations team on acquisition and/or upgrade of records management application/systems and serving as liaison between Lifecycle Safety department and records management department.

May assist with system support tasks such as utilizing design specifications, study form, and protocol to create project specific entry specifications and annotated project forms for database under guidance from operations lead and/or manager
creating project tracking spreadsheets and associated tracking entry specifications
assisting in database validation through performance of user testing
performing ad hoc database searches for operations team leads
assisting operations team member in assessing database setup needs
assist with project phone/fax line set-up as required
escalating any system/equipment problem.

Oversee and co-ordinate administrative support by coordinating team/department/customer/project oversight group meetings, coordinating stationery orders, dispatching documents via courier services, reserving meeting rooms and IT equipment and providing administrative support where required. Identify and record process or quality problems and bring them to the attention of a senior team member.
Participate in continuous improvement of all departmental processes and procedures by identifying and implementing efficiencies in workflow and/or case processing.
Co-ordinate, oversee and delegate resource tasks to administrative team members as appropriate and monitor the intake of cases and archiving process when multiple coordinators are involved.
Involvement and contribution in local/global department committees.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Minimum Required Education and Experience:
Must be Fluent in English plus one other language from – French or Spanish or Italian or Dutch or German or Baltic and Nordic languages.
2 years’ relevant work experience.
Equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Skills and Abilities:
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
Good knowledge of medical terminology.
Working knowledge of applicable Safety Database.
Self-motivated and flexible.
Ability to follow instructions/guidelines, utilize initiative and work independently.
Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients. Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

40,health,Indeed,p_24a71c09492fda48,Breakfast Supervisor,Hilton Hotels  Resorts, Amsterdam,"Work Locations
Hilton Amsterdam
Apollolaan 138
Amsterdam 1077 BG
Join the classic and iconic Hilton Amsterdam!

Hilton Amsterdam is a renowned property with 271 hotel rooms, 21 banquet rooms, authentic Italian restaurant and a nautical style bar at a unique location. Famous for John Lennon and Yoko Ono's 1969 ‘bed-in for peace' and Hilton's first hotel in the Netherlands. The iconic hotel is built on the baseline of Plan Zuid, a district designed by prominent architect Berlage, which highlights the Amsterdam School of architecture and contains boutiques, designer shops and couture houses .

Located in this iconic hotel is our Roberto’s restaurant. The modern-classic interior reflects the atmosphere and ambience of the elegant 50s and 60s in Italy. In the morning we serve breakfast to our hotel guests and during lunch and dinner we provide a high level of à la carte service. Roberto’s is a local restaurant!
Job description
As a Breakfast Supervisor, you will be responsible for supervising the breakfast service at Roberto’s and delivering an exceptional Guest and Team Member experience.
More specifically, your role includes the following responsibilities to be performed to the highest standards.
Supervises the breakfast service in the restaurant
Anticipates guests’ needs by constantly evaluating the environment and guests for cues.
Delivers legendary guest service by acting with a “guest comes first” attitude
Manages guest queries in a timely and efficient manner
Ensures compliance of Hilton brand standards
Communicates and delegates tasks to the team to ensure a smooth running of each shift
Assists with training by positively reinforcing successful performance and giving encouraging coaching as needed
Develops positive relationships with team members by understanding and addressing individual motivation, needs and concerns
Organizes opening and closing duties as assigned. Follows Hilton’s operational policies and procedures, including those for cash handling and safety and security
Assist the Food and Beverage management team
Complies with hotel security, fire regulations and all health and safety legislations
Assists other departments wherever necessary and maintain good working relationships
Required skills and competencies
A Breakfast Supervisor serving Hilton is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members to uphold the highest quality in service.
In order to successfully fill this role, we ask the below attitude, skills, and values.
You are a morning person (your shift starts at 6.30!)
You are committed to delivering high levels of customer service
You always act with integrity, honesty and knowledge that promote the culture, values and mission of Hilton
You maintain a calm demeanor during periods of high volume to keep operating to standard and to set a positive example to the team
Excellent communication skills required in Dutch and English, knowledge of the Italian language is a plus
Minimum one year of relevant experience in a supervisory role
Good organizational skills and ability to lead a team
Basic computer knowledge (Word, Outlook, Excel and cashiering systems)
Flexible in working hours – available to work during weekends and occasional coverage of evening shifts according to business needs
What can you expect from us?
Besides being listed as a Great Place to Work in the Large & Multinational workplaces we offer you the following:
Intensive training period and a personal development program
Internal transfer and promotion possibilities
Travel allowance
Employee discount on Hilton Worldwide hotel rooms via our international Hilton travel program
Employee discount of 50% on Food & Beverage at Hilton Worldwide hotels
Annual team outings, staff party and quarterly team member forums
Young and vibrant team that has a work hard/play hard attitude to life and who enjoy having fun at work as well.
Have we sparked your interest? Don’t hesitate, apply now and join the Hilton family!
EOE/AA/Disabled/Veterans
Schedule
: Full-time
Brand : Hilton Hotels & Resorts
Shift
: Day Job
Job Level
: Supervisor/Team Leader

42,health,Indeed,p_a13524925c3ca73e,STORE MANAGER - AMSTERDAM,Starbucks, Amsterdam,"By bringing people together over coffee, Starbucks has become one of the world’s best-known and best loved companies. Working at Starbucks is a lot like working with your friends! When you work here, you’re not an “employee” – we call ourselves “partners” because we believe in shared common goals and mutual success. Our partners are our most valuable resource.
Come and build your career at Starbucks!

Starbucks is known for developing extraordinary leaders who drive business success by doing the right thing for partners (employees), customers and communities – globally. As a Starbucks leader you are driven by a deep sense of purpose. You are aspirational - never a bystander. You take action to make a positive difference every day, and you inspire others to do the same.

Our Store Managers bring the Starbucks experience to life by managing store operations, driving financial success, building great teams, and building a meeting place in their communities. They delight and uplift customers through a human connection. Their work goes beyond a perfectly made beverage
column2: it’s about human connection. They enjoy being able to achieve these aspirations autonomously, while leveraging our world class brand and business practices.

column1: The store manager is responsible for acting in accordance with, and as an ambassador of Starbucks guiding principles, culture and values
column2: embracing our coffee culture and keeping it at the heart of everything we do.

Well organised, detail oriented with the ability to multi-task

column1: 44,health,Indeed,p_b7db4556c9a1b8c6,"Associate Manager, Safety Operations Team",IQVIA, Amsterdam,"Do you have a passion for healthcare and patient safety? Can you lead people to be the best that they can? The Safety Operations team at IQVIA is a cornerstone to how we support our clients and patients in pushing healthcare forward. This Associate Manager role will provide comprehensive safety services across the lifecycle of pharmaceutical compounds and medical devices, from first in human clinical trials through to post-approval, marketed product, and regulatory safety requirements.

Using your scientific knowledge of pharmacovigilance, safety, and your ability to manage a team you’ll be responsible for delivering industry leading services under the guidance of expert team. You’ll be given the opportunity to contribute to Global initiatives working closely in collaboration with Senior Management supporting the achievement of local and global deliverables and metrics.

45,health,Indeed,p_3b80bf5f7321cf88,External Relations Officer,RIPE NCC, Amsterdam,"As External Relations Officer you develop and enhance relationships with stakeholders of the RIPE NCC, while providing insight and analysis of relevant developments and trends to audiences, both internal and external. You also represent the organisation at international and inter-governmental meetings. This is a meaningful and rewarding role within the organisation, driving projects that have real impact on the work of the RIPE NCC and that support the technical core of the Internet, collaborating with a diverse team of dedicated and highly-performing professionals.
External Relations Officer
Based in The Netherlands
37.5 hours per week

The RIPE NCC is the Regional Internet Registry (RIR) for Europe, the Middle-East and parts of Central Asia. Next to being the authority on Internet number resources, it is a neutral source of data and analysis, and a centre of Internet technical expertise. It is also a strong advocate (and an example) of the open, inclusive multistakeholder model of Internet governance. We are seeking an External Relations Officer that can engage with public sector and industry stakeholders in the Netherlands, the institutions and agencies of the European Union, and globally-oriented forums such as the United Nations and the OECD. You will have the opportunity to help shape the RIPE NCC’s strategy and activity in relation to dossiers such as the EU Digital Services Package, the EU Network Information Security Directive, and the future direction and evolution of the UN Internet Governance Forum.
In this role you will:
Facilitate open communication and discussion between stakeholders, developing and implementing targeted stakeholder engagement strategies
Inform relevant stakeholders on RIPE NCC’s position, mission, policies and practices in a positive, constructive, and consistent manner
Follow, investigate, and report on community needs, developments and viewpoints

Encourage stakeholders from other sectors (including the public sector and civil society) to engage with and participate in RIPE, and to support the RIPE NCC in its role as the Regional Internet Registry
Promote and encourage access, diversity, and inclusivity in RIPE and other Internet governance discussions
Represent the RIPE NCC conferences and meetings, report on and contribute to the discussions, and ensure that internal and external stakeholders are alerted to any relevant outcomes
Coordinate with colleagues across the RIPE NCC organisation to leverage their expertise and account for their concerns and strategic objectives
What we expect from you:
Relevant University degree related to European and/or International Relations/External Relations/Public Affairs
Three to five years of relevant working experience with developing/implementing public affairs strategies or public policy
Active and knowledgeable in the Internet industry or with public sector experience in the digital domain, ideally with a strong network in European governments and EU institutions
Professionally fluent English and Dutch in order to operate effectively with internal and external stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to prepare concise, informative briefings, articles, and analyses, both in written form and delivered to an audience, either in person or via remote meetings platforms
Ability to build and maintain a professional network, strong relationship building skills, and a collaborative mindset
A fast thinker, able to forge and foster coalitions, and to build compromise without losing sight of the organisation’s strategic objectives and desired outcomes

Looking beyond the global pandemic, a willingness to travel (globally) to attend and participate in meetings, and with a willingness to adapt working hours to accommodate colleagues, stakeholders and partners in other time zones
Openness to working in an innovative company structure, focused heavily on self-organisation (e.g. Holacracy)
What you can expect from us:
A role where you can drive impactful projects and where your expertise and knowledge are valued
An annual salary between EUR 50,000 and EUR 72,000 (before tax). This includes the standard 8% annual “holiday pay” and a 5% end-of-year bonus

Excellent secondary benefits: a non-contributory pension scheme, health insurance coverage for you and your family, annual technology budget for your internet connectivity and 30 vacation days plus 3 collective days, extra annual budget for health and transportation purposes
A generous training budget per year which can be used for professional development
The External Relations department

Our international team works with colleagues from across the organisation to better understand and connect with the RIPE NCC’s stakeholders and communities of interest. The importance of Internet technologies for our economies and societies, and the rapidly evolving technological and regulatory landscape, demands creativity and innovation. The RIPE NCC’s role in providing one of the core functions on the Internet means that there are many eyes turned toward the services we provide and our role in maintaining the stability and security of an ever-growing Internet. If you’re an out-of-the-box thinker, have a collaborative mindset, are authentic and empathetic, and like to work on exciting projects, we think you’d fit in well with our dynamic team of public affairs, technical and communications experts.
About the RIPE NCC

The RIPE NCC is a not-for-profit organisation founded on the belief that the Internet should be governed openly, transparently and in partnership with the wider Internet community. We are one of the oldest Internet organisations in Europe and proud of our legacy.

Our strongest asset is our staff. We bring together 160 people from more than 38 countries in our modern, vibrant office in the east wing of Amsterdam Central Station. At the moment, we are working fully remotely because of the pandemic. Our official working language is English, but more than 30 languages are spoken by our colleagues. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our goal is the same: we work for the good of the Internet.
How to apply

If you are interested in this position, please click on the Apply Button and fill in the short application form. Send it to us together with your CV and motivation letter (in English only please). 46,health,Indeed,p_b1f56c710a78e2a3,Registry Services Manager,RIPE NCC, Amsterdam,"In this role you will lead an international and experienced Registry Services team in a unique, not-for-profit organisation that has a significant impact on the Internet. If you have a coaching leadership style, strong interpersonal skills and experience with leading an operations customer service team, then the RIPE NCC is the place to be!
Registry Services Manager
Currently remotely, when possible from our office at Amsterdam Central Station
Full-time position

The purpose of this role is to drive the registry operations to surpass the expectation of the membership and RIPE community. You oversee the registry operations to ensure an up to date and accurate registration of unique Internet number resources for RIPE NCC’s service region. Also, you will be overseeing the policy development process regarding implementation, promotion and development of global Internet IP address policies.

As Registry Services Manager you will be responsible for leading and coaching an international team of around 40 Internet Resource Analysts and Customer Service professionals. Your role is to support, guide and facilitate the team and help them grow and make them shine. As an experienced manager you know how to engage and inspire the team, lead them through change processes and facilitate self-management within the policies and procedures. You will report to the Chief Operations Officer and will work closely with the Software Engineering Manager.
In this role you will also:
Ensure effective operations of the team and proactively build a positive team culture
Lead risk and impact analysis of policy proposals and requirements set by the RIPE community
Oversee and facilitate the establishment of internal and external procedures and advice on policy compliant changes
Manage the continuous improvements and maintenance of registry applications and tools in collaboration with the Software Engineering department
Guide and direct the Registry Services investigations team and make decisions with regards to arbitration cases in cooperation with the management team and Legal department
Participate in stakeholder engagement and outreach activities, pro-actively represent RIPE NCC and present on behalf of it
Work together with internal stakeholders to communicate and embed strategic management decisions via objectives, accountabilities and monitoring of progress
What we expect from you:
Eight years’ experience leading operations teams or complex to customer services
Ability to develop, manage and monitor financial plans and forecasts
Contribute to strategic management vision, objectives, processes and planning
Demonstrable experience in a coaching leadership style and HR related responsibilities (recruiting/onboarding/performance management)
Experience with formal audits to ensure compliance with organisational standards for activities, processes, data, products and services
Excellent communication, presentation, project management and influencing skills on all seniority levels. You are fluent in English
Possess strong interpersonal, relationship-building and networking skills and you can handle conflicts effectively
Ability to prioritise, manage organisational changes and handle crisis situations
What you can expect from us:
An international, flexible and informal work environment where your expertise and knowledge are valued
An annual salary between EUR 84,000 and EUR 120,000 (before tax). This includes the standard 8% annual “holiday pay” and a 5% end-of-year bonus

Excellent secondary benefits: a non-contributory pension scheme, health insurance coverage for you and your family, annual technology budget for your internet connectivity and 30 vacation days plus 3 collective days, extra annual budget for health and transportation purposes
A generous training allowance per year which can be used for professional development
The Team
Registry services department

Our international team of 40 colleagues is responsible for some of the RIPE NCC’s key services: distribution and management of Internet number resources, implementation of community policies, providing support and knowledge to our members and the wider Internet community. We are at the forefront of the Internet developments. If you’ve been following the industry closely, you will know that the remaining IPv4 address pool has been exhausted. This means that you will be part of a transition towards managing the lifecycle of IPv6 space rather than the distribution of IPv4, and towards the growth in the IPv6 adoption. You will have a leading part in ensuring that the Internet registry remains as strong and accurate as ever.
About the RIPE NCC

The RIPE NCC is a not-for-profit organisation founded on the belief that the Internet should be governed openly, transparently and in partnership with the wider Internet community. We are one of the oldest Internet organisations in Europe and proud of our legacy.

Our backgrounds are diverse, but our goal is the same: we work for the good of the Internet.

47,health,Indeed,p_f0141d2d53b6bd20,Amsterdam UMC Fellowship,Academisch Medisch Centrum, Amsterdam,"What you are going to do

The Amsterdam UMC Fellowship offers the opportunity for an outstanding, internationally recognized, postdoctoral researcher to further develop his/her own research line and to set up his/her own research group within Amsterdam UMC. The candidate must have the potential to advance to full professor within eight years.

To apply, you are requested to fill in the applicant form (https://www.amc.nl/web/leren/research-62/research/amsterdam-umc-fellowship-4.htm), which includes a description of the planned research that the applicant wish to conduct at Amsterdam UMC. A letter of support from the head of the hosting department at Amsterdam UMC is also requested. Both can be emailed to Fellowship@amsterdamumc.nl.

There will be a strict selection procedure and an assessment might be part of the selection. More information and the application form can be found at https://www.amc.nl/web/leren/research-62/research/amsterdam-umc-fellowship-4.htm.
What we expect from you

Prestigious personal grant laureate at midcareer level. For example a (nearly) successful completion of a prestigious personal grant at junior postdoc level or an active VIDI, ERC Starting grant or an equivalent.
Alignment of their research topic with one of the eight research institutes of Amsterdam UMC (https://www.amsterdamumc.org/research.htm)
Excellent publication record
Experience in research management
Demonstrable affinity with education
Experience abroad

To apply, you are requested to fill in the applicant form (https://www.amc.nl/web/leren/research-62/research/amsterdam-umc-fellowship-4.htm), which includes a description of the planned research that the applicant whishes to conduct at Amsterdam UMC. A letter of support from the head of the hosting department at Amsterdam UMC is also requested. Both can be emailed to Fellowship@amsterdamumc.nl.

There will be a strict selection procedure and an assessment might be part of the selection. More information and the application form can be found at https://www.amc.nl/web/leren/research-62/research/amsterdam-umc-fellowship-4.htm.
Where you are going to work

Amsterdam Research (https://www.amsterdamumc.org/research.htm) brings together opinion leading academic research in the field of Health & Life Sciences developed in the Amsterdam region. In doing so – and on the authority of the two medical centers and the two universities – Amsterdam has eight Research Institutes, each with dedicated expertise and focus on particular disease indications.

Amsterdam UMC is one of the foremost research organizations in the Netherlands, as well as one of its largest hospitals. It is a world in which patient care, research and education are integrated, and in which people are always central. It is full of possibilities for talented individuals who are looking for a place where they can excel.

Our research covers the whole spectrum of biomedical research: from fundamental science and proof-of-concept studies to applied clinical studies, health services research and medical informatics. This concentration of expertise make the centers a breeding ground for fruitful scientific collaborations. In this way, we aim to respond effectively to the current and future medical needs.

Our biomedical researchers have access to high-quality facilities and the relevant patient material. The scientific careers of talented young researchers are stimulated by the ‘Principal Investigator’ system, which challenges them to develop their own lines of research. For more information, please go to https://www.amsterdamumc.org/research.htm.
What we offer you

We offer you ample opportunity for development, deepening and broadening, additional training and a place to grow! Working at Amsterdam UMC means working in an inspiring and professional environment where development is encouraged in every respect.

The Amsterdam UMC Fellowship consists of maximum € 750,000 for a maximum of five years. The award can be spent on salary of the applicant, a PhD student and/or bench fee. It spans a five-year period with an interim evaluation after two years.

The Fellowship includes a tenure track with the possibility to acquire a tenured position after 5 years. Amsterdam UMC offers a stimulating 5-year career and personal development trajectory in a challenging research environment.
In addition to excellent accessibility by public transport, AMC location also has a sufficient number of parking spaces for employees.
Pension is accrued at the ABP. Amsterdam UMC contributes a large part of the premium (70%).
We have a very active staff association and organise various (sports) activities and events throughout the year.
For an overview of all our other terms of employment, see https://werkenbijamc.nl/arbeidsvoorwaarden/.
Let’s meet
If you would like to apply directly, please send your application to fellowship@amsterdamumc.nl.
If you would like more information, please feel free to contact Leonie van Duivenvoorde (Senior Policy Advisor Research), via Fellowship@amsterdamumc.nl.

Applicants are requested to fill in the applicant form, which includes a description of the planned research that the applicant wishes to conduct at Amsterdam UMC. A letter of support from the head of the hosting department at Amsterdam UMC is also requested. Both can be emailed to Fellowship@amsterdamumc.nl. There will be a strict selection procedure and an assessment might be part of the selection. More information and the application form can be found at https://www.amc.nl/web/leren/research-62/research/amsterdam-umc-fellowship-4.htm.
We look forward to meeting you!

A screening may be part of the selection procedure. This requires access to DigiD.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=f0141d2d53b6bd20&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=1f8ce6d25442d010&assa=5317,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=f0141d2d53b6bd20&fccid=280e9a541be45c33&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

50,health,Indeed,p_3a08fed702bc25b0,"Global Senior Manager Diversity, Inclusion, & Belonging - Employee Activation",Bookingcom, Amsterdam,"In 2019 Booking.com was names #1 in the Financial Times Diversity List out of 700 employers assessed on diversity of gender, age, ethnicity, disability and sexual orientation.As we approach our third year of having a centre of excellence dedicated to Diversity & Inclusion, Wellbeing, and employee volunteerism we find ourselves taking a broader role across our organisation but also our corporate portfolio. As such, we are looking to add a seasoned professional with deep global D&I experience.

As we approach our third year of having a centre of excellence dedicated to Diversity & Inclusion, Wellbeing, and employee volunteerism we find ourselves taking a broader role across our organisation but also our corporate portfolio. As such, we are looking to add a seasoned professional with deep global D&I experience.

As a Diversity & Inclusion Senior Manager you are responsible for thought leadership in the development, implementation and monitoring of Inclusion, Diversity, & Belonging (IDB) strategy & programs. This role is responsible for leading and driving cross business strategy, communications, interventions, and initiatives that create and foster an open and inclusive environment for the organisation in a global environment.

This leader will also be responsible for creating our strategy and deployment of our colleague activation work (e.g., employee resource groups, rewards & recognition for being change agents, ambassador programs, etc.) and working with various parts of the organisation to promote employee activation around inclusive policy, interventions, etc. inside and outside of the organisation.

You bring deep experience within this field, in building internal and external programs, and supporting internal stakeholders, including our executive committee, to deliver on IDB initiatives across a global multi-office environment.
This role is preferably based in our Global HQ in Amsterdam, but open to location.
Role Responsibilities:
Function as a second to our Global Director Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging, Wellbeing, and Volunteerism in the creation of strategy.
Drive the building of high performing teams by connecting the business needs to IDB opportunities.

Proactively evaluate and predict strategic interventions where Booking.com needs to develop and critically evaluate impact against industry standards and innovations particularly in the areas of leadership competency & well-being/mental health.
Contribute to the development of our enhanced People data strategy and success metrics, and continuously track, to ensure an equal and diverse spread of people across the organisation
Drive knowledge and expertise with various senior stakeholders in the People department to attract, retain and promote a diverse workforce for the organisation
Lead business unit development of IDB goals both in product and colleague interventions
Work with the internal communications team create awareness around our diversity statement
Your experience and skills:
Experience with building global programs while understanding the complexity of local differences across the globe
Experience in driving employee activation strategy around such efforts as employee resource groups, volunteerism, internal champions etc.
Experience in working in a multi stakeholder environment and continuous representing all stakeholders and their needs
Experience managing up to include senior leaders
5+ years of relevant work experience highly desirable
Previous experience in the areas of social justice, identity theory, equality programs, etc.
Previous experience in a fast paced commercial and international environment (preferably e-commerce)
Excellent verbal and written communication and editing skills in English
Strong organisational and program management skills
Ability to translate business strategies into practical solutions that strengthen our core values
Ability to influence and align stakeholders and define clear goals and progress
Ability to work independently to plan and prioritise workload in line with business needs
Strong employee experience focus and proactive attitude

A educational background in Human Resources, Sociology, Psychology, Anthropology, or other human related field is highly desirable",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=3a08fed702bc25b0&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=1e770d7f4dfa37ca&assa=2704,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=3a08fed702bc25b0&fccid=62ee2fabbf8c93c5&vjs=3,13 dagen geleden,13 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

52,health,Indeed,p_f942b787453451cd,Public Relations Manager,SkinVision, Amsterdam Noord,"Did you know that 1 in 5 people get skin cancer during their lifetime? Not many people do, you can help change that.

At SkinVision, every single day is an opportunity to make a difference. We are on a mission to saving the lives of 250,000 people in the next ten years by revolutionizing the way we care about our skin. Our technology allows users to take ownership of their health, recognising signs of skin cancer from anywhere, at any time.

We are hiring a Public Relations Manager who will play an invaluable role in ensuring that SkinVision is able to effectively communicate its mission and vision to all external stakeholders through the development and execution of planned PR moments for key markets. In this role you will you work closely with our marketing and management team, bringing our business to the next level by telling our story to different audiences while building confidence and trust in our application.

The Public Relations Manager is responsible for nurturing a strong industry network, increasing awareness of our services to potential customers by developing a positive image of our company to the outside world through effective and proactive communication with the media.
Daily Drivers
Develop and execute marketing communications plans including strategy and goals.
Coordinate all public relations activities.
Leverage existing media relationships and cultivate new contacts within business and industry media.
Build relationships with researchers and other health related specialists to grow industry awareness.
Create content for press releases, articles and skin cancer campaigns.
Align with management to advise and execute on best strategies based on your understanding of the local and global health landscape.
What you will bring in
Minimum education needed is Bachelor degree in communications, marketing, advertising or related field.
Hands on experience of at least 8 years in public relations, communications or journalism with an affinity for the medical (devices) industry.
Proven track record crafting and executing successful public relations campaigns at both local and global level.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build and maintain positive relationships with media partners.
Strong communication skills combined with experience effectively speaking and writing to different audiences.
A positive and engaging attitude paired with an entrepreneurial spirit.
Proficiency of English language both verbally and written. Domain of other languages are certainly a plus.
Not sure if you are qualified?

Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women tend to only apply only when they check every box. If you feel energised by our mission and would like to use your first-class talent to accelerate the growth of SkinVision but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still apply. We'd love to receive your application and see if you could be a great fit.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)
