column1: 53,health,Indeed,p_87ef1a7f95c49fd5,Country Operations Manager,Lemonade Insurance Company, Amsterdam,"Amsterdam, Netherlands | General & Administration | Full-time

We’re looking for a super energetic, positive-minded, multi-tasker who is eager to take ownership and initiative leading and supporting large-scale cross functional projects in different European countries.

You’ll keep track on all aspects of Lemonade’s business in your country and work with all the functional managers to make sure Lemonade’s business in your country is a success. You’ll conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis to help managers identify priorities, understand the market, and prepare business plans, reports and presentations for different teams.
If you’re obsessed with finding ways to make the impossible happen, enjoy solving big problems in creative ways, and love facilitating success, this one's for you!
This position is intended for candidates with experience in the Insurance sector in one or more EU countries. Please read the job requirements carefully before submitting your application.
Requirements
3+ years experience managing cross functional projects and driving change and innovation in organizations within the insurance sector (a must)
Intimate knowledge and working experience in one or more European countries. Fluent in English and native in at least one more EU country language (a must).
Willingness to relocate to Tel Aviv - we’ll provide support with your visa application
Loves getting shit done!
Excellent leadership and personal skills
All around team player, fast self-learning individual
Self-organized, process driven
Proven track record of using strategic business thinking to add value
Ability to pick things up quickly and adapt in a fast-paced environment
Strategic thinker, natural problem solver
Strong communication skills
About Lemonade

Lemonade is a licensed insurance carrier offering renters, homeowners, and pet health insurance in the United States, contents and liability insurance in Germany and the Netherlands, and renters insurance in France. We’re powered by artificial intelligence and behavioral economics, and driven by social good.

A Certified B-Corp, Lemonade donates unused premiums to nonprofits selected by its community as part of our annual Giveback program. We incorporate our values into everything we do—from our business model to our office culture.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=87ef1a7f95c49fd5&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=c9529791bc8ff9c5&assa=5820,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=87ef1a7f95c49fd5&fccid=b5b758716098f3ec&vjs=3,13 dagen geleden,13 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

54,health,Indeed,pj_4edf620e58a43a85,R&D EXPERT ENVIRONMENT & HEALTH DATA (relocation Belgium),Vito, Nederland,"Wil je in Europa mee de richting bepalen voor het gebruik van complexe milieugezondheidsdata, ter ondersteuning van het Europese duurzaamheidsbeleid?VITO zet met haar onderzoeksprogramma ‘Duurzame gezondheid’ volop in op het ondersteunen van de maatschappelijke transities naar een preventiever gezondheidssysteem. Wij willen jou in ons team om onze expertise op vlak van data management en analyse te versterken, om milieugezondheidsonderzoek te faciliteren en nog beter te vertalen naar oplossingen voor lokale, Vlaamse en Europese overheden en ondernemingen. Spreekt volgend takenpakket jou aan?Binnen een groot Europees partnerschap word je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen en toepassen van richtlijnen met betrekking tot databeheer (opslag, delen en koppelen van data, standaardisatie, harmonisatie, kwaliteitscontrole, beveiliging) en data-analyse. Je behoudt het overzicht over experts en organisaties binnen en buiten VITO die beheer van data rond chemische stoffen, milieuverspreiding, humane blootstelling, toxiciteit, gezondheid, leefomgeving en levensstijl praktisch organiseren.Jouw inhoudelijke focus ligt op het ontwikkelen en toepassen van nieuwe methoden om integratie en analyse van complexe, heterogene, persoonsgebonden en decentrale milieu- en gezondheidsdata in Europa te verbeteren.Daarnaast ben je thuis in concepten zoals FAIR data en Open data, en ken je de vereisten van GDPR.Concreet verwachten we van jou het volgende:Je leidt de uitvoering van een werkpakket in Europees beleidsondersteunend onderzoek, coördineert het internationale team en zorgt voor de tijdige oplevering van resultaten.Je werkt nauw samen met de projectenmanager, je collega’s van het projectteam, alsook met de klant om noden te bepalen en klantgerichte oplossingen te definiëren binnen afgesproken tijd- en budgetlimieten. Je vertaalt de onderzoeksresultaten in bruikbare adviezen voor collega’s en de klant.Je overtuigt partners en klanten met je kennis over data-analyse, visie op databeheer en oog voor innovatie .Je neemt initiatief om in nieuwe onderzoeksvoorstellen het “data-denken” en integratie van diverse omgevings- en gezondheidsdata op te nemen, in samenspraak met je teamleden.Je presenteert onderzoeks- en projectresultaten op internationale fora en zorgt ook voor kennisoverdracht naar teamleden.Je bouwt je internationale netwerk uit met onderzoekspartners en overheidsklanten, om nieuwe opportuniteiten voor VITO te creëren in het domein van milieu-gezondheid.*KWALIFICATIESJe beschikt over een diploma in de wetenschappen, bij voorkeur een PhD en met specialisatie of relevante ervaring op vlak van databeheer en data-analyse in life sciences. Bijkomende achtergrondkennis over milieugezondheid is waardevol.Je hebt ervaring met data-analytische methodes zoals regressieanalyse, longitudinale analyse, de verwerking van omics-data en met technieken voor analyse van heterogene en decentrale datasets, zoals data fusion, federated learning, ….Je hebt ervaring met statistische/mathematische software als R, Matlab,... en met programmeren in bv. Python.Je hebt ervaring met de technische aspecten van databeheer en datacommunicatie zoals web services, REST API’s, data- en netwerkencryptie, identificatie en authenticatie, data-standaarden en ontologieën, ...Je hebt een klantgerichte houding en oog voor opportuniteiten.Je bent een teamplayer en relatiebouwer die graag in een interdisciplinaire omgeving werktJe bent communicatief sterk en in staat om je helder uit te drukken in het Engels en dit zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.Verder ben je een creatieve, flexibele denker en doener, vanuit een wetenschappelijk kritische instelling.AANBODEen competitief salarisVerschillende extralegale voordelen waaronder vergoedingen, verzekeringen, een moduleerbaar pakket vakantiedagenFlexibiliteit in werkuren en werkplaatsInnovatie is onze troef, we geven onze medewerkers de kansen om zich bij te scholen en bij te blijven binnen hun vakgebied, meer nog
column2: we verwachten dit.De mogelijkheid om deel uit te maken van een internationaal belangrijke speler, gekend voor zijn vooruitstrevend technologisch onderzoek en wetenschappelijke consultancyDe kans om actief bij te dragen aan lokale, nationale en mondiale duurzame ontwikkelingenREQUISITIELocatie: MolJobfield: R&D & EngineeringJob Types: Full-time, column1: 55,health,Indeed,p_b371b32bba403939,"DIGITAL PROJECT LEADER - GROUP DIGITAL, INGKA GROUP",IKEA, Amsterdam,"WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU

Because you truly have a passion for Project management with a desire to make connections across different disciplines together with deep knowledge within one of these particular areas of specialization:
a. Data and data Security
b. Finance
c. IT
d. Business Development
You also have a strong background and interest in business strategy and a successful track record of managing business change and transformation.
To succeed as Digital Project Leader, you preferable have a proven advanced training in Project Management or equivalent as well as:
2-5 years of experience in leading projects in a technical environment

knowledge and experience working with various technology platformsknowledge of project governance processes including risk management techniquesextensive ability to set goals, follow through, deliver and follow upexperience of using a data-driven approach to decision making, both in day-to-day management and in making strategic trade-offsexcellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to engage and communicate with senior business-leaders and Technology Leadership

It’s incredibly important to have strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build trustful relationships and sound judgements with ability to make timely and effective decisions managing and leading teams and stakeholders.
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

You will be responsible for planning, driving, leading and delivering on assigned projects within Group Digital’s project office. You will be leading, coaching and developing the digital project team members, driving consistency of ways of working and promoting best practices in project execution. This involves:
driving and delivering assigned projects, including time, cost, scope and quality according to expectationsIdentifying, mitigating, monitoring and controlling risks to keep projects on track

Managing dependencies and interfaces between projects and line organisation to ensure common expectationsManaging procurement and vendor relations within projects, including follow up on performance and deliveries from vendor, to secure lowest cost of delivery and delivery according to expectationsPerforming project reporting, through providing Digital Project Office Team Manager with key milestones, updates and content for measuring and following up project quality and performanceDriving continuous improvement of quality and performance in assigned projects in agreement with the assigned Senior Project Leader for the projectIdentifying, planning and following up on stakeholders to ensure alignment and harmonised expectations
Working in compliance with all aspects of how we work with projects as planning, execution and quality assurance process, steering and follow up in order to promote best practices
ABOUT THIS WORK AREA

Group Digital set the digital agenda to keep IKEA leading in an uncertain and fast-moving environment. We drive the development, provision and operation of our digital products and services through the use of new and existing technology and agile delivery methods to deliver at pace. At the same time, we provide a home for digital skills to both develop and extend the technical, people and business skills needed to ensure continuous development and growth of our digital capability.
QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!

If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please reach out to recruiter Sofia South at sofia.south@ingka.com. If you have questions about the role, please reach out to hiring manager Farzin Saber at farzin.saber@ingka.ikea.com
Please note
Our primary concern since the outbreak of corona virus has been the health and safety of our co-workers and candidates. Because of this, we have adapted our recruiting processes to be fully digital.

We would love to meet our candidates face to face, but to prevent the spread of the virus this recruitment will be handled through digital appointments and solutions.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=b371b32bba403939&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=e6e74a52a2bc7345&assa=7601,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=b371b32bba403939&fccid=af17ea0d1d6bbbba&vjs=3,13 dagen geleden,13 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
56,health,Indeed,p_e56e283b2a7a7a97,Workplace Services Lead,JLL, Amsterdam,"Role Summary

Our Workplace Services Leads are instrumental in driving our vision of “Creating inspirational, sustainable workplace experiences for our people and communities”. They must be visible and influential leaders of talented individuals and teams accountable for delivery of outstanding facilities and services. Their role is to design, communicate and deliver integrated, innovative and differentiated workplace solutions for our client. They have accountability for all strategic and operational activity including, but not limited to EH&S, client and customer interaction, work place modernisation and standardisation as well as managing the site-based teams for properties in their areas of responsibility.

The Workplace Services Manager for Project Apollo will be accountable for the delivery of the real estate portfolio across all service lines on the account, including Transaction Management, Portfolio planning and strategy, Project Management and Facilities Management
Overall Role & Major Responsibilities
Core Competencies
Build on the existing safety culture driving risk reduction, demonstrate a culture of care and be incident free
Drive the JLL HSSE program of “One Team – Safer Together”
Continuously deliver a reliable and compliant workplace, ensuring it is fit for purpose for local business requirements
Work with the EMEA Account Lead, Client and Key Stakeholders in defining workplace strategies to support the concepts of Hub, Club, Home and Roam
Rollout key initiatives including but not limited to systems and data utilisation.
Work with the EMEA Account Director and Finance Director to develop and manage budgets in conjunction with the site leads
Be a change champion in reducing the carbon footprint through energy efficiency and the adoption of renewable energies to achieve a target of net zero by 2030
Build, drive and report on initiatives to reduce waste, water and resources
Motivate our teams to deliver a workplace which inspires talent to succeed and nurtures their health and wellbeing
Manage Site Managers/Subject Matter Experts (SME) work streams to support the delivery teams across the region
Ensure consistent reporting and coordination regionally
Using data to drive strategic decisions
Support the EMEA Account Director to drive and achieve goals and objectives including P&L, risk, energy targets and the account SLAs & KPIs
Manage the sub-regional FM delivery ensuring standards are maintained and be a contact point for any FM account related issues, provide training, and support in issue resolution
Build and maintain client relationships
Work with local clients to develop, cascade, deliver and report shared goals and objectives and ensure these are cascaded at all levels
Develop strong relationships with clients, key stakeholders, customers including setting up regular customer forums to promote 360 feedback
Utilise the data suite to analyse and report opportunities for service enhancement and support the client in cost v quality making decisions
Ensure close contact is established with client organizations to remain abreast of current strategy, thinking, policies and procedures

In collaboration with the EMEA Account Lead embed a strong governance framework including presenting at– Annual, Quarterly & monthly governance meetings and ensure direct reports do the same for their areas of responsibility
Develop and Lead a high performing team
Work with regional Human Resources lead on recruitment and selection strategies ensuring roles are filled with top talent
Build a high performing diverse and inclusive workforce
Work with regional Human Resources to develop regional training and skills development programs, ensuring all staff have the right qualifications and training for their roles
Ensure succession plans are in place for key roles
Achieve financial results
Working with their direct reports drive the enhancement of local budget ownership and control by reducing cost without impact to quality
Working with the EMEA Account Lead compile and deliver monthly financial updates demonstrating control and knowledge
In conjunction with EMEA Account Lead, support the preparation of accurate budgets and forecasts
Work with the EMEA Account Lead to develop the annual client plans including driving Risk and opportunities
Deliver the contract commitments
Increase regional integration and collaboration through the vested culture to drive innovation.
Reduce the carbon footprint through energy efficiency and the adoption of renewable energies to achieve a target of net zero by 2030 or sooner.
Ensure account delivers against contract deliverables – meeting all KPI’s, budget targets and project commitments for all service lines.
Manage the change control process for own areas of responsibility
Ensure the delivery of engineering and maintenance services.
Drive the client’s workplace improvement strategies
Compliance and risk management delivery
Build on the existing safety culture to drive risk reduction, demonstrate a culture of care and be incident free.
Ensure all defined services are completed in accordance with quality operating procedures and statutory requirements.
Ensure compliance with company policies – guidelines and values, local laws and the guidelines of client’s organisation.
Ensure there is no, or minimal, downtime of critical services.
Senior Management Team Responsibilities
Be the leader of HSSE, demonstrate through own actions and leadership
Be the Incident owner and controller for all significant escalations
Escalate issues and concerns timely to both the client organisation and internally
Active participation or representation in all in-Country management meetings
Identify issues and assess problems using a logical and rational approach and develop options and strategies to resolve
Organize regular operational meeting to ensure the SMEs and hub/country leads are aligned
Organize regular forums for networking and engagement for senior regional management
Personal Competencies, Attributes & Knowledge
Ability to influence, partner and operate strategically are critical competencies.
Energy and drive to develop the customer experience
Good understanding of current industry technology and with a drive for market knowledge future enhancements
Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills via multiple media.
Commercially and financially astute.
Strategic thinking and decision making.
Able to lead and inspire, guide and coach, and develop the performance of those managed either remotely or in person.
Seeks feedback to inform quick decision making.
Has courage to make tough decisions (fail fast)
Excellent relationship, and stakeholder management skills.
Able to work in a complex environment and comfortable with ambiguity

57,health,Indeed,p_ae2174097a73ff95,Campaigner,Plastic Soup Foundation, Amsterdam,"Datum 01 feb. 2021
Vervaldatum 15 feb. 2021
Aantal uren 40 uur
Plaats Amsterdam
Betaald Ja
Organisatie Plastic Soup Foundation
Organisatie

De tsunami van plasticsoep zo snel mogelijk stoppen! Dát is kort gezegd de missie van Plastic Soup Foundation. Lukt dat niet, dan zadelen we toekomstige generaties op met de gevolgen van een verschrikkelijke plaag. Plastic Soup Foundation is daarmee een ‘single issue’-milieuorganisatie. We houden ons met één ding bezig: het stoppen van de plasticvervuiling bij de bron. Om dat doel te bereiken leggen we graag de vinger op de zere plek, vooral bij de industrie en de overheid. Ook benadrukken we steeds meer de relatie tussen plastic en menselijke gezondheid, zoals met onze Plastic Health Summit en de campagnes op het terrein van microplastics en plasticafval. Educatie vormt vanzelfsprekend een belangrijke pijler van ons werk, want kinderen zijn de toekomst. De bron van die plasticvervuiling zijn we trouwens vaak zelf
column2: de plasticsoep begint al voor je eigen deur op de stoep. We kunnen met z’n allen echt veel meer doen dan we geneigd zijn te denken!

column1: Plastic Soup Foundation is op zoek naar een enthousiaste Campaigner voor ons Plastic Waste programma. Hieronder vallen projecten als Trash Hunters, World Cleanup Day, Plastic Smart City Amsterdam en Schone Rivieren. Deze projecten richten zich op dataverzameling en identificering van zwerfafval. Als Campaigner vertaal je droge data over Plastic Waste in het milieu in concrete en aansprekende campagnetaal en houd je bedrijven en overheden verantwoordelijk.
Taken
Samen met het multidisciplinaire campagneteam ontwikkel je een bedrijvencampagne rondom zwerfafval, gericht op het transformeren van de industrie
Je integreert de lopende projecten onder deze strategie en stemt dit af met de projectleider Schone Rivieren
Je coördineert het multidisciplinaire projectteam rondom Plastic Waste met hierin communicatie- en thematische experts
Je draagt zorg voor inhoudelijk en strategisch leiderschap voor je campagne
Je beheert zwerfafval data die worden gegenereerd met behulp van een app en – in samenwerking met een multidisciplinair team – analyseer je deze en zet deze om in concrete campagnedoelen en acties
Je zet social media krachtig en effectief in op dit thema en je identificeert kansen voor mediawerk
Je initieert en voert constructief-kritische gesprekken met bedrijven en overheden over het aanpassen van hun beleid en hun acties
Functie-eisen en profiel
Je bent een ervaren campaigner met lef, en gevoel voor strategie en beïnvloeding
Je bent een enthousiaste, gedreven, flexibele en ervaren teamspeler
Je bent zelfstandig, proactief en een creatieve denker
Je hebt een uitstekende Nederlandstalige pen
column2: blogs en persberichten schrijven gaat je gemakkelijk af

column1: Je bent in staat om op strategische wijze social media in te zetten om campagnetargets te beïnvloeden
Je bent in staat om je werk goed te plannen en organiseren, ook onder tijdsdruk
Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring op HBO (+)/WO-niveau
Ervaring met bedrijvencampagnes en -onderhandelingen is een pré
Ons aanbod
Wij bieden een jaarcontract voor 5 dagen per week (40 uur).
Het gaat om een bijzondere en uitdagende functie binnen een zeer dynamische organisatie.
Informeren en solliciteren

Graag ontvangen we jouw CV en motivatiebrief via applications@plasticsoupfoundation.org. De sluitingsdatum voor de vacature is 15 februari 2021.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=ae2174097a73ff95&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=337ff24585ef96f4&assa=297,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=ae2174097a73ff95&fccid=6d20ee1d8aad8246&vjs=3,13 dagen geleden,13 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
58,health,Indeed,p_01f6438d395504de,Gastvrouw/Gastheer,Stichting TanteLouise, Nieuwe Haven,"Locatie
Woonzorgcentrum De Nieuwe Haven in Dinteloord
Uren per week
24 uur per week
Werk- en denkniveau
MBO werk- en denkniveau
Gastvrouw/Gastheer
Locatie De Nieuwe Haven
voor 24 uur per week
Waar ga je werken?

Woonzorgcentrum De Nieuwe Haven ligt centraal in het dorp Dinteloord aan de rand van een mooi park waar bewoners regelmatig in wandelen. Het kleine gebouw, waar het vriendelijke en gastvrij wonen is, biedt ruimte aan 45 ouderen met een zorgindicatie.

Onze bewoners ontmoeten elkaar graag op de gang, in recreatiezaal ‘de Roef’, in eetzaal ‘de Kombuis’ of in het winkeltje ‘de Parlevinker’, waar bewoners hun dagelijkse boodschappen kunnen doen. Naast het nuttigen van de maaltijden worden hier ook regelmatig gezamenlijke activiteiten georganiseerd, zoals een creatieve middag, bingo, panbiljart, koffiedrinken, theater en zangmiddagen of -avonden.
Wie ben jij?

Als Gastvrouw/Gastheer draag je samen met je collega’s het gastvrijheidsconcept uit. Je ontvangt zowel telefonisch als persoonlijk bewoners en bezoekers en verwijst hen door waar nodig. Je verricht zowel administratieve- als horecawerkzaamheden, zoals het verzorgen van koffie en thee en het uitserveren van de maaltijden. Tevens word je ingezet in de winkel.

Je hebt bij voorkeur een opleiding tot Gastvrouw/Gastheer afgerond. Je heb ervaring in horeca gerelateerde werkzaamheden. Je bent op de hoogte van HACCP en Sociale Hygiëne. Daarnaast heb je kennis van Word en Excel en beschik je over de gewenste mondelinge en schriftelijke vaardigheden. Je kunt zelfstandig, maar ook in teamverband werken en hebt een goede beroepshouding en cliëntgerichte benadering. Uiteraard ben je klantvriendelijk, gastvrij en collegiaal. Je bent hét visitekaartje van de locatie en bewaakt de gastvrijheid van de afdeling horeca.

Je hebt een professionele en flexibele instelling en vindt werken in wisselende diensten en in het weekeinde geen probleem. Je bent ook inzetbaar op andere locaties van tanteLouise. Zo werkt locatie De Nieuwe Haven in Dinteloord bijvoorbeeld nauw samen met de locatie Onze Stede in Steenbergen.
Wat bieden we je?
Werken bij tanteLouise biedt veel variatie. Je kunt rekenen op een afwisselende, zelfstandige functie met veel sociale contacten en een prettige werksfeer. Verder bieden wij een:
een gemiddelde werkweek van 24 uur per week
salaris volgens de cao VVT in FWG 25
een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,33% in november en onregelmatigheidstoeslag

TanteLouise wil graag haar waardering tonen aan haar medewerkers, o.a. in de vorm van een vitaliteitsprogramma. Dit programma is gericht op gezondheidsbevordering. Onderdelen daarvan zijn: vers seizoen fruit op alle locaties, health testen, fietsplan, culturele uitstapjes en interessante workshops.
Waar wacht je op?

Sta je te trappelen om in De Nieuwe Haven aan de slag te gaan en wil je meteen solliciteren, stuur tante dan een brief met daarin je CV en je motivatie. Dat kan heel gemakkelijk via de solliciteerbutton (onderin beeld). We nemen je sollicitatie direct in behandeling.

Heb je nog vragen? Pak dan je telefoon en neem contact op met onze afdeling P&O, via het telefoonnummer 0164 713300. Of bel met Mascha Pouw-van der Maas, Coördinator Facilitair, via het telefoonnummer 06 83805407.
Bij indiensttreding dient een Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag te worden overlegd.
Intussen zijn wij wel razend benieuwd, want word jij in De Nieuwe Haven onze nieuwe collega? Leuk!
Wil je meteen reageren? Klik dan op onderstaande button!

The role of the Insights Manager will be to support the Compliance Team in becoming a truly data-led department. We are looking for someone who is self-driven, highly analytical, enjoys problem-solving, and is comfortable working on concurrent projects.
The Details

61,health,Indeed,p_d11d1b9705d7fd3f,"Medior Advisor Gender and monitoring, evaluation and learning",KIT Royal Tropical Institute, Amsterdam,"Title: Medior Advisor
Department: Sutainable Economic Development and Gender
Hours: 32-38 hours a week
Location: Amsterdam
Salary indication: Based on qualifications and experience salary will be between 3550 to 4088 gross per month, based on a 40 hour work week.
More information: For further information please contact Elsbet Lodenstein (e.lodenstein@kit.nl)
Apply before: February 10th 2021

The KIT Royal Tropical Institute in Amsterdam is a centre of expertise for sustainable economic development, gender, health care and intercultural communication. We provide advisory services and training, and carry out research, in order to build and share knowledge on a wide range of development issues. Our focus on both policy and practice is key to our approach to development. We bring experience and translate initiatives from the field to the policy debate and we help bring theory into practice. We navigate and stimulate interactions between global, national and local levels of interventions. KIT is a not-for-profit applied knowledge institute in international development.
Apply here!
About KITs gender work

KIT’s Gender team is an international team of gender specialists that focuses on gender and rights analysis, gender integration, capacity development and research. We work on both stand-alone women’s rights initiatives, and gender and rights issues in agriculture, financial inclusion, business, and health. Together with partners and clients KIT Gender facilitates and documents critical reflection and gender knowledge development, supports the development of policies and strategies and the monitoring and evaluation of programmes that focus on gender equality and rights outcomes.

KIT Gender is expanding its work on women and girls’ rights, leadership, and empowerment. We offer capacity building trajectories to management and staff of partner organisations working in these fields. Together with women’s rights organisations, NGOs and civil society organisations, we develop gender-transformative approaches to programming, monitoring, evaluation and learning.
About the role

We are currently seeking candidates for the position of Medior Advisor Gender and Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (MEL) to strengthen our women and girls’ rights work. In this role, the advisor will provide advisory and applied knowledge services to a number of partners including NGOs, CSOs, women’s rights organisations, governmental and funding institutions. The advisor will provide advice in support of gender integration in programmes and MEL and will support gender capacity building. The advisor will primarily contribute to the conceptualization and design of gender-transformative approaches to monitoring, evaluation and learning and will implement MEL activities with partners in a multi-country gender equality and women’s rights project. The advisor will also provide support to other KIT projects working around gender integration, particularly within MEL.
Main responsibilities
In collaboration with, and under guidance of project team colleagues, take part in the:

Design and implementation of capacity assessments of civil society organisations and NGOs and develop and implement capacity development programs (training and other forms of knowledge sharing) at international, regional and national levels, with a focus on gender-transformative MEL and the use of innovative online tools.

Conceptualise, design and undertake qualitative and/or quantitative studies (applied or operational research, baseline studies, mid-term reviews, evaluations) to inform programming and develop knowledge for influencing policy and practice.
Support the team in further expanding work in the areas of women and girls’ rights and gender equality by developing project proposals and liaising with donors and partners.
Contribute to gender team learning and knowledge development
column2: contribute to strategic positioning of KIT’s gender work, nationally and internationally.

column1: Contribute to knowledge dissemination through online platforms.
Provide a contribution to the KIT’s policy development and priority setting informed by current gender and development debate in particular.
Job requirements

Academic qualification (minimum of Master degree) in social sciences, for example anthropology, human geography, political sciences, development studies – preferably with a strong and focused specialisation in gender studies.

A minimum of six years of working experience in gender and international development in MEL and applied research positions, capacity strengthening, advisory/consultancy work, and institutional change with government and non-government institutions. Work experience abroad of 6 months or more is an advantage.
Strong expertise in the gender dimensions of development, particularly in gender equality, women and girls’ empowerment, social justice, human rights and transformative change
column2: knowledge of feminist epistemologies, methodologies and tools is an advantage.

column1: Experience in gender integration within MEL, preferably the design and implementation of gender-transformative or participatory approaches to MEL throughout the project cycle from design phase, baseline/endline and routine monitoring.
Demonstrated experience with social science research methods. Expertise with mixed methods approaches is preferred, experience with quantitative methods and analysis is an advantage.
Demonstrated experience with online facilitation and the use of online tools for data collection, monitoring, evaluation and learning.

Under guidance and with support of senior colleagues, be able to work independently in performing tasks in a project team, in contributing to acquiring assignments and writing proposals, in undertaking advisory and other assignments and writing analytical reports and recommendations.
Team player with excellent listening and problem solving skills. Capacity to work within a diverse multicultural team and maintain good working relations with global partners.
Fluency in English. Working knowledge of French and/or Arabic is an additional advantage.
Excellent writing skills and record of publishing is an asset.
Regular short–term travel is required for this position.
Additional information

The initial appointment is for one year, 32 to 38 hours/week, subject to renewal. KIT values diversity of race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, and national origin and is taking steps to become a more inclusive place to work, taking into account diverse needs and personal circumstances. The advisor will join an international team working in a multidisciplinary unit of 36 advisors and will be part of the Gender team consisting of 8 advisors.
We offer

The salary will be in accordance with the KIT salary rates, based on qualifications and experience, with a minimum of €3550 to a maximum of €4088 (gross per month, 40-hour work week). Additional 8% holiday allowance and admission to the KIT pension fund (ABP) and opportunities for training and personal development.
Information

For further information please contact Elsbet Lodenstein (e.lodenstein@kit.nl). General information about KIT and its departments can be found on www.kit.nl. Reader more about KIT’s gender work on www.kit.nl/gender.
Application procedures
Please submit a cover letter and C.V. by close of business (CET) February 9th 2021, using the link below.

66,health,Indeed,p_3c5151d5989db315,Education Advisor for M & E and Data Analysis (Cambodia),VSO Nederland, Amsterdam,"Vakgebied: Onderwijsadviseur
Startdatum: Per direct
FTE: 1.0
Type onderwijs:
Functie omschrijving:
Role overview

At the request of the Ministry and CDP partners, the Education Advisor for M & E and Data Analysis will contribute to more robust and systemised monitoring & evaluation activities and data analysis, which is linked to improving quality of education planning and policy. He/she will provide technical assistance to personnel from the Department of M & E (approx. 60% of the time) and the Department of EMIS (approx. 40% of the time). The job purpose is to increase capacities of their staff through blended approaches of on-the-job training, coaching and mentoring on the following focused areas:
(i)Results-Based Management (RBM) report (ii)Education Congress report (iii)Statistical analysis for report writing (iv)Improving the quality of data collected from sub-national levels

The job holder will also work collaboratively with another existing VSO adviser for the Departments of Planning and Policy to support harmonization of different capacity building practices of the 4 departments supporting education planners at the sub-national levels towards achieving the cross departmental outcomes under CDPF framework.Skills, qualifications and experience
Education, Experience, Knowledge and Skills required:
Education:
Master degree in management or education studies and/or other relevant fields.
Work experience:
At least 10 years of experience in the field of educational management, planning and capacity building, preferably in field of M & E and data analysis.
Excellent knowledge of and experience from working with at least one of VSOs core approaches: social inclusion and gender, social accountability, and resilience.
Knowledge:
Extensive experience and knowledge in capacity development including coaching and mentoring and on-the-job training and of at least one of the following areas:
Data analysis, statistical knowledge and M&E
Social Inclusion and gender in Education sector
Experience of working in a developing country preferably in the field of education.
Understanding/Knowledge of the value of volunteering in the education sector.
Skills:
Excellent communication skills and ability to present information in a clear and concise manner including verbal and written fluency in English.
Excellent skills in Microsoft Office (i.e. Word, Excel and Power Point).
Excellent skills in building effective work relationships built on trust and mutual accountability.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to inspire others.
Excellent coordination and planning skills with experience of delivering results under high pressure.
Able to work in a cross-cultural context.
Ability to analyse situations and finding innovative solutions to possible challenges.
Ability to be flexible including being open to change, uncertainty and new opportunities.
Desirable:
Experience of working in central or local government in an education context.
Experience of volunteering for development.
Understanding/Knowledge of participatory approaches.
Experience of working within a Non-Governmental Organisation (NGO) and with volunteers.
Competencies and Behaviour

At VSO we believe progress is only possible by working together. Whether you want to join us as an employee, or as a volunteer working in your own country, overseas or online, our selection process includes an assessment based on these core competencies:
Ability to be open minded and respectful
Ability to be resilient and adaptive to new situations
Ability to facilitate positive change and build sustainable working relationships
Ability to seek and share knowledge
Equal Opportunities
VSO promotes equal opportunities and values a diverse workforce.
Allowance

As a VSO volunteer, you will be sharing your skills with local communities on a full time basis. VSO will cover your travel, vaccinations, accommodation, and medical insurance costs, along with a local living allowance which will be paid in local currency. This allowance meets reasonable living expenses in country, but will not be enough to send money home. You will also receive some financial support to contribute to your on-going expenses at home.
Accommodation
VSO works with some of the poorest communities in the world which means accommodation varies and will be basic.
Some background about VSO

Much has changed since VSO started 60 years ago. Weve gone from being a UK charity to a truly global development organisation. In 2016/2017 alone, we worked with over 7,000 volunteers from all over the world and from all backgrounds to deliver services that had an impact on the lives of almost 2.6 million people in the 24 countries where we work. Our programmes focus on the areas of health, education and livelihoods, with an increasing emphasis on resilience building, social accountability, gender and social inclusion. We believe progress is only possible when we work together and that strong partnerships are crucial to delivering positive change. Thats why we work with over 500 partner organisations, from local and national governments, to businesses, NGOs, funders, charities and community groups. Currently, over 30% of our people are recruited from within the country in which they work, and we continue to grow the share of community and national volunteers involved in our programmes. We also send increasing numbers of volunteers from one developing country to another. However, our vision has remained the same
column2: to build a world without poverty.

column1: Omschrijving organisatie:

VSO stimuleert duurzame ontwikkelingssamenwerking. Samen zorgen we voor betere gezondheid, toegankelijk onderwijs n helpen we mensen aan werk en inkomen op die plekken op de wereld waar dat het hardst nodig is. We doen dat op aanvraag van landen in Afrika en Azi. Vakdeskundigen werken gedurende langere tijd samen met lokale collegas en delen hun kennis en vaardigheden. Tegen een lokaal salaris omdat gelijkwaardigheid essentieel is om vooruitgang te boeken. Ons doel: de weerbaarheid van gemeenschappen vergroten en een blijvende verandering ontketenen.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=3c5151d5989db315&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=73a593224260f215&assa=2815,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=3c5151d5989db315&fccid=c04cd7af2ce131cd&vjs=3,Zojuist geplaatst,Zojuist geplaatst,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

67,health,Indeed,p_cba6030cb5881733,Producer - Film & Photography,VanMoof, Amsterdam,"As a Producer, you’ll be part of VanMoof’s in-house Production Team. You’ll coordinate the organisation and execution of production projects. Projects will range from our ‘always on’ video content, like our Bike Hunting series, to communication and photography briefs.

Together with the Brand Content and the Creative Teams, you’ll turn briefs into production plans and work using both internal resources and external creatives to concept, execute, and deliver content. This is a hands-on role, and you’ll be getting involved at every stage of the production journey.

That means you’ll need to be a natural multitasker who’s not afraid to go the extra mile and roll your sleeves up when necessary. Someone who can think on their feet and always stay one step ahead of any problems that may arise.
What you’ll do
Translate ideas and concepts into workable production schedules and budgets.
Work closely with our creative team and external partners throughout the production process, sharing your expertise and industry instincts.
Maintain sky-high standards across all of our in-house content.
Assist the Head of Production in managing schedules and budgets, assigning resources, and finding partners, directors, producers, and other vital talent to make the best creative work possible.

Coordinate the film and photography production process, making sure we have everything we need throughout the pre-production, shooting, post-production, and final delivery of content across all channels.
Motivating our global team of Bike Hunters to deliver the best content possible.
Coordinate the whole Bike Hunting content flow, from monitoring coordinates to facilitating hunts.
What you'll bring
At least 3 years experience in film and photography production.
A creative eye, with a practical understanding of what makes a good story and how to develop it.
Evidence of strong organizational skills.
Hand-on mentality – not afraid to get stuck in all aspects of production.
Great communication and problem-solving skills.
Flexibility – prepared to work irregular hours if needed.
The ability to work under pressure and adapt quickly to operational changes.
Excellent English skills, both written and spoken.
A valid EU driver’s license.
Based in the Netherlands and willing to commute in the Amsterdam area
What you'll get
26 paid holidays for you to unwind
Your very own VanMoof bike (lend-lease)
Laptop, screens, and software tools
Insider experience in a rapidly-growing international company
Healthy lunch provided when in the office
Special snacks, tasty coffee (and lots of tea) when in the office
Weekly Bootcamp, Weekly Yoga, Onefit discount & Classpass credits.
Discount on Dutch Health Insurance
About us

We’re obsessed with cities. So are our bikes. Truly city-proof, they shrink long commutes, scare off bike thieves, and amplify your pedal power. We made it our mission to get the next billion on bikes. Join us on this journey.

Job descriptions are difficult to interpret. We understand you might not tick all the above boxes. The truth is, we don't either. If you feel excitement about our upcoming challenges, we encourage you to apply now!",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=cba6030cb5881733&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=ab26f649a1e9567b&assa=3689,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=cba6030cb5881733&fccid=2ba499fda0a1408f&vjs=3,Zojuist geplaatst,Zojuist geplaatst,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

68,health,Indeed,pj_dfd1c74e9cb8d1aa,QHSE Officer,Kloosterboer, Amsterdam,"Ben je pragmatisch en ga je oplossingsgericht te werk? Heb je enkele jaren ervaring met QESH en ben je op zoek naar een veelzijdige functie waarin kwaliteit en veiligheid centraal staat?Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!Als QESH (Quality, Environment, Safety and Health) Officer ondersteun je, op het gebied van kwaliteit, milieu, veiligheid en gezondheid, de diverse Kloosterboer locaties in de regio Noord.Je levert als QESH Officer een hands-on bijdrage aan het signaleren, ontwikkelen, implementeren, uniformeren, optimaliseren en zelfstandig borgen van de kwaliteit en veiligheid binnen de locaties IJmuiden/Velsen, Harlingen en Scheveningen.Wat ga je doen, o.a.? Is aanspreekpunt op gebied van QESH, zowel intern als voor derden
column2: Ontwikkelt de benodigde processen aangaand veiligheidsbewustzijn op de locaties
column3: Signaleert risico’s, adviseert, indien nodig ontwikkelt en geeft input naar anderen ten aanzien van gesignaleerde risico’s
column4: Zorgt dat alle Qesh gerelateerd documentatie juist en volledig is
column5: Ondersteunen/ voorbereiding bij een Interne audit gekoppeld aan vereisten voor certificaten (BRC, IFS, AEO...)Maakt werkinstructies , loopt veiligheidsrondes (Site tour, brand apparatuur) volgt op en borgt in ons systeem
column6: Contact persoon voor externe bedrijven gerelateerd aan Qesh.Melden, verwerken, opnemen en opvolgen van incidentenDraagt zorg voor ontruimingsoefeningen, goed werkend BHV team en up to date Contingency planWerkt samen met Kloosterboer Qesh team aan corporate thema’sGeeft voorlichting, training, uitleg en toolboxen aan medewerkers met betrekking tot QESHAdviseert en ondersteunt de General Managers van de diverse locatiesKennis- en ervaringsvereisten: Je hebt een afgeronde Hbo-opleiding richting Mvk/HvK
column7: Geeft training on the best practice
column9: 3-5 jaar ervaring, waarvan 1-2 jaar ervaring in de logistiek of scheepvaart.Ervaring Werkervaring in de logistiek/scheepvaart, bij voorkeur in koel-/vriesterminalErvaring in een operationele omgeving loods/magazijn/scheepvaart.Vaardigheden en eigenschappen Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift.PragmatischFlexibelHands on mentaliteitReisbereidheidWij bieden jou: Een goed salaris, afhankelijk van ervaring en opleidingDe mogelijkheid om jezelf verder te ontwikkelenGoede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaardenEen dynamische omgeving bij een groeiende organisatie.Wil jij bij Kloosterboer komen werken?Solliciteer dan direct met je CV en korte motivatie. Heb je nog vragen? Bel dan met Vanessa Thijssen, via telefoonnummer 0251-261111.Soort dienstverband: Fulltime",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 69,health,Indeed,p_4ba79b7a5d3c281b,Talent Acquisition Internship,Abbott Laboratories, Hoofddorp,"About Abbott

Abbott is a global health care company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of health care. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 160 countries and employs approximately 109,000 people.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES ?
Support the recruitment team on different tasks, such as candidate sourcing, joining recruitment intake sessions, High quality data driven reporting.
Overseeing the hiring life-cycle of our internships within the Netherlands – creating job ads, working with universities and colleges, pre-screening candidates, and everything that goes between
Supporting our Employer Branding initiatives through our career website and social media
Working on different kinds of projects, e.g. conducting market research.
EDUCATION & COMPETENCIES?
You have a passion for talent management and Data
You are fluent in the Dutch & English language, both spoken and written form
You have very good communication skills
You are available 4 or 5 days per week, for at least 6 months
You are solution-focused, detail-oriented, and you have a proactive attitude
You can work independently and in a team.
WHAT WE OFFERWAT HEBBEN WIJ JOU TE BIEDEN?
A dynamic team who is always there to support you
Work at the #1 top employer in the Netherlands for 2 consecutive years
A paid internship
HOW TO APPLY?

If you are enthusiastic about this position, we look forward to receiving your cv and motivation. You can apply via the website and if you want more information, please contact Milan Wörpel , via , milan.woerpel@abbott.com",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 70,health,Indeed,p_6b19ced70242095f,Stafmedewerker onderwijs en kwaliteitszorg,VUmc, Amsterdam Zuid,"Wat ga je doen

Als stafmedewerker onderwijs en kwaliteitszorg heb je een afwisselend takenpakket, met als rode draad het adviseren en ondersteunen van de opleidingsdirecteuren bij het implementeren van beleid en vernieuwingen binnen de opleidingen en bij het aanscherpen en vastleggen van de opleidingsplannen.
In deze rol:
zal je veel werkzaam zijn voor de master geneeskunde
doe je proactief beleidsvoorstellen ten aanzien van de verbetering van de opleidingen, op basis van o.a. het universitaire beleid
werk je hands-on mee aan onderwijsnotities
werk je samen met collega’s binnen team Strategie en Beleid van Onderwijs (SBO) en wissel je binnen en buiten Amsterdam UMC kennis uit met betrekking tot onderwijsbeleid

ben je tevens mede verantwoordelijk voor het initiëren, begeleiden en implementeren van diverse onderwijskundige projecten met betrekking tot het bachelor- en masteronderwijs geneeskunde en de biomedische masteropleidingen
volg je (inter)nationale ontwikkeling op het gebied van onderwijs en gezondheidszorg en denk je mee over gevolgen voor de opleidingen.
draag je bij aan de kwaliteitscyclus met betrekking tot de onderwijsactiviteiten binnen de Faculteit der Geneeskunde en dan met name gericht op de master geneeskunde.
Wat we van je verwachten
Wij zoeken een stafmedewerker met in ieder geval de volgende kennis en vaardigheden:

academisch werk- en denkniveau: bij voorkeur een afgeronde opleiding onderwijskunde of andere relevante opleiding (bijvoorbeeld in een (bio)medische richting of Health Sciences), aangevuld met onderwijskundige ervaring
aantoonbare affiniteit met zorg
aantoonbare ervaring met projectmanagement
uitstekende mondelinge en schriftelijke beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal en een bondige en toegankelijke schrijfstijl
ervaring in initiëren, schrijven en presenteren van beleidsnotities
gedegen kennis van geautomatiseerde systemen (MS Office) en social media.

Jij bent in het bezit van goede organisatorische kwaliteiten en met jouw procesmatige inzicht weet jij ook onder druk het overzicht te bewaren. Je kunt snel schakelen tussen strategisch en tactisch niveau. Je herkent jezelf in de proactieve houding die wij vragen en bent daarnaast gericht op een goede samenwerking met collega’s van verschillende niveaus binnen de organisatie. Met jouw uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden en vanuit jouw adviserende rol ben jij een volwaardige gesprekspartner voor de (arts)docenten. Daartoe is het ook van belang dat jij een gevoel hebt voor de verhoudingen en cultuur binnen het (medisch) academische werkveld.
Ben jij enthousiast over de ontwikkeling van het medisch onderwijs en wil jij graag bijdragen aan de innovatie van onze opleidingen, dan ontmoeten wij jou graag!
Waar ga je werken
Binnen Amsterdam UMC vervult het Instituut voor Onderwijs en Opleiden (IOO) voor locatie VUmc de regierol binnen de (bio-)medische, paramedische en verpleegkundige opleidingen.

De Faculteit der Geneeskunde Vrije Universiteit is als onderdeel van het IOO verantwoordelijk voor de bachelor- en masteropleiding geneeskunde en de masteropleidingen Oncology, Cardiovascular Research, Epidemiologie en HGZO. Als stafmedewerker onderwijs maak je deel uit van het team SBO, bestaande uit 20 stafmedewerkers. SBO heeft als taak de opleidingen beleidsmatig te innoveren, adviseren en ondersteunen.
Wat we je bieden
Salarisschaal 10: 2911 tot 4615 euro bruto bij een fulltime dienstverband (afhankelijk van opleiding en ervaring).
Naast een goed basissalaris bieden we onder andere 8,3% eindejaarsuitkering en 8% vakantietoeslag. Wil jij weten wat je gaat verdienen? Bereken dan hier jouw netto salaris (onder voorbehoud).
Gratis en onbeperkt toegang tot het trainingsaanbod van onze online leeromgeving GoodHabitz.
Je pensioen wordt opgebouwd bij het ABP. Amsterdam UMC draagt 70% van deze premie bij.
Wij vergoeden 75% van je OV reiskosten en bieden daarnaast een fietsregeling.
Wij hebben een zeer actieve personeelsvereniging en een Jong Amsterdam UMC en organiseren vanuit beide verschillende (sportieve) activiteiten en evenementen door het jaar heen.
In eerste instantie bieden wij jou een jaarcontract, met uitzicht op verlenging.
Bij gebleken gelijke geschiktheid krijgen interne kandidaten voorrang op externe kandidaten.

Amsterdam UMC heeft een open cultuur. Dit betekent dat wij hopen dat iedereen zich welkom voelt bij onze organisatie en dat wij streven naar het bieden van gelijke kansen aan iedereen. Wij nodigen dan ook alle geïnteresseerden van harte uit om te reageren op deze vacature.
Voor meer informatie over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden kijk op onze website.

Een referentiecheck kan onderdeel zijn van de selectieprocedure. Daarnaast is het aanvragen van een VOG (Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag) voor iedere nieuwe medewerker verplicht. De aanvraag voor een VOG wordt opgestart vanuit VUmc zodra de nieuwe medewerker is aangesteld.
Voor medewerkers die in de directe patiëntzorg gaan werken, kan een uitgebreide screening onderdeel zijn van de procedure. Klik hier voor meer informatie en of deze op jou van toepassing is.
Ben je werkzaam in een zorggerelateerde functie, dan is een aanstellingskeuring ook onderdeel van jouw selectieprocedure.
Bijzonderheden
De eerste ronde gesprekken zullen plaatsvinden op 23 of 25 februari 2021.
Bij vragen kan je contact opnemen met Anne Drost via onderstaand nummer. Indien nodig of gewenst, zal zij jouw vraag doorzetten naar Miriam van Strien.
Laten we kennismaken
Bel ons gerust!
Voor inhoudelijke informatie kun je contact opnemen met Miriam van Strien, teamleider SBO, via 06-25261481.
Voor meer informatie over de sollicitatieprocedure kun je contact opnemen met Anne Drost, corporate recruiter, via 06-25261481.
Je kunt uiterlijk tot en met 15 februari 2021 solliciteren via de button.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=6b19ced70242095f&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=7e7b4dfc2c7f1ab0&assa=6426,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=6b19ced70242095f&fccid=3efba77b340e53f5&vjs=3,Zojuist geplaatst,Zojuist geplaatst,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
71,health,Indeed,p_30c5c846596d9390,Copywriter (Dutch),Inside Ideas, Amsterdam,"Role: Copywriter
Location: Netherlands
ROLE MISSION

Working in partnership with our client the Copywriter will need to combine a deep understanding of the trends and concerns inherent to the healthcare industry with a varied skill set that will include copywriting, investigative research, scriptwriting, conceptual thinking, and content project planning. The role will primarily involve writing for digital/web: you'll help brands fit their tone of voice to this landscape and advise on content that'll powerfully connect with consumers. To do this you'll need to be an expert storyteller able to find interesting and engaging ways of dramatizing subject matters, extremely digitally savvy, and comfortable writing with SEO in mind.
THIS ROLE IS RIGHT FOR YOU IF...
You are someone who is looking for an opportunity to innovate with brands, involving the development of strategy, creative concepts, content, and campaign implementation
ABOUT THE TEAM YOU WILL BE JOINING

We are looking for a copywriter, who can work remotely from NL or based in France and can do remote/office work. You will need to speak Dutch and English (fluent). French is a plus as our studio is based in Paris.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING IN YOUR ROLE
Write, research, and conceptualize creative, innovative content that brings readership and encourages sharing
Write short and long-form articles
Repurpose existing content for different uses
Master a variety of brand voices
Work closely with clients to create strong concepts from initial briefing through to execution
Set tone and drive creativity, working closely with the Account Director and Data Strategists to ensure creative excellence
Maintain a high awareness of relevant trending topics and news to identify content opportunities
Be responsible for working with internal teams to gather input and validate the content
Ensure consistency and quality across all written content
Present and articulate concepts to clients.
WHAT SKILLS WILL HELP YOU BE SUCCESSFUL
Strong experience writing for digital. Must be comfortable creating content with SEO in mind
A background in a corporate or journalism environment
A thorough understanding of the language and needs inherent to writing for health brands
Experience in publishing through social media channels and content management systems
A powerful grasp of how content can play out across multiple mediums
Able to use data and insight to inform creative
A flair for words
The ability to think conceptually when needed. Experience working as part of a traditional creative team (designer and copywriter) would be helpful
Demonstrated ability to combine and translate complex material from different sources and contexts into stories and content that engage and resonate with target audiences
Confident in presenting and communicating clearly to other team members and clients.
ABOUT OUR COMPANY

Many companies talk about having a unique and thriving business model, but the Inside Ideas Group truly does. This means that we have been named in the top 500 of the Financial Times fastest-growing companies in Europe 2018!

What IIG does is provide clients with dedicated, on-site agencies that are built from the ground up. These agencies live and work right at the very heart of our client's organization. Delivering precisely the skills and capacity they require, complemented by brand talent from our whole business on everything from planning to execution
This business model creates a truly entrepreneurial, fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment to work in!
OUR VALUES
We are a company built on our values

We’re on the search for an empathetic, communicative individual to join our claims experience team. If you have a background in customer experience and a genuine passion for helping others, you’re going to love this opportunity.

In this role, you’ll work closely with Lemonade’s Claims Experience Adjusters to settle property loses and defy customer expectations along the way. With a customer-first mindset, you’ll be responsible for handling simple or fast-track claims. For more info about the role, check out our latest Transparency Chronicle.

Previous experience in handling claims.
Proficient in English and another European language
Comfortable articulating yourself on the phone as well as in email
A fast learner, self-driven with willingness to roll up your sleeves

A lot of empathy, patience, and a positive approach to work and life
Comfortable with and adaptable to new technology and business tools

About Lemonade

Lemonade is a licensed insurance carrier offering renters, homeowners, and pet health insurance in the United States, contents and liability insurance in Germany and the Netherlands, and renters insurance in France. We’re powered by artificial intelligence and behavioral economics, and driven by social good.

A Certified B-Corp, Lemonade donates unused premiums to nonprofits selected by its community as part of our annual Giveback program. We incorporate our values into everything we do—from our business model to our office culture.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=b2a7729979af8408&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=139688aef3f3fb87&assa=3186,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=b2a7729979af8408&fccid=b5b758716098f3ec&vjs=3,5 dagen geleden,5 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
74,health,Indeed,p_6265a5cb086f1c33,Client Onboarding Manager,Currencycloud, Amsterdam,"Client Onboarding Manager
Ready to shape tomorrow?

Currencycloud is somewhere where innovative thinking and the power of technology know no limits. We know that the success of the business depends on the people who keep it moving, which is why we are looking for exceptional talent to join our international payments revolution.
About the role...

Our Compliance Department is looking for a talented Client Onboarding Manager to lead our Client Onboarding Teams. The Client Onboarding Manager will report into the Head of Compliance Operations in London.
Key Responsibilities
Responsible for day to day running of the client onboarding and team management
Be the one who inspires, motivates and coaches Team Leaders and the Team
Deliver training sessions and workshops to the Client Onboarding Teams and the wider business
Reviewing and reporting on metrics and taking ownership of improving both team performance and financial crime measures
Proactively identify trends and potential issues in services and resolve before any disruption occurs
Work closely with the Head of Compliance Operations and Transaction Monitoring Manager to identify inefficiencies and implement improvements to the process as well as systems used
Be the escalation point for complex compliance queries and review high risk accounts
Work cross-departmentally to proactively identify and resolve any queries and complaints
Coordinating and leading on projects within the onboarding teams as per the agreed timelines
Act as a bridging point between our London and Cardiff Compliance Teams.
Other ad-hoc tasks
Skills Knowledge and Expertise
Minimum 3 years working experience in the financial sector with a focus on team management
Proven client onboarding experience with a methodical and process driven approach
In-depth knowledge of AML regulations and best practices
Strong understanding of financial crime controls and its application to client onboarding processes
Experience in the Financial Technology (FinTech) sector is welcomed
Self-driven, highly analytical
A natural leader able to motivate and inspire team members to excel
Have exceptional organisational skills and pay attention to detail
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills with the ability to influence others
Ability to prioritise work by taking the impact and scale of the work into consideration, as well as manage time effectively to meet deadlines
Entrepreneurial mindset and a willingness to get your hands dirty
Benefits
At the moment we are transitioning from an office based working environment to a remote first company, so we have adapted our already great benefits package to reflect this.

We now offer a day off each month for your mental health on top of the 25 days annual leave allowance and a day off for your birthday. Our comprehensive health care includes mental health support service access and we have live streamed health based activities like Yoga and Barre classes each week! We also run fortnightly company updates hosted by our CEO to keep employees up to date on developments and also include an open forum for employees to ask questions.
If you think your skills and experience match what we are looking for and you’d like to join a Fintech industry unicorn, please get in touch!
For recruiters: we aren’t currently looking for additional support on this role and won’t be accepting any unsolicited CVs
About Currencycloud

Currencycloud is a global payments platform built on smart technology that takes the complexity out of moving money. Developers use our API building blocks to build customised payment solutions. Whether you want to embed our payments infrastructure into your products or services, or build on top of it, we’ll fit into your business in a way that works for you.
We take care of all the intricacies and regulatory hurdles involved with cross-border payments, giving you the tools to globalise your business.

Our cloud-based platform removes that complexity from international transactions, giving you clarity and control over your business so you can focus on the things that matter: your customers. With enterprise-class solutions for clients and partners such as Visa and Starling Bank, Currencycloud understands your needs and can help with market-leading products.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=6265a5cb086f1c33&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=5c94fbd88bbd0225&assa=4057,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=6265a5cb086f1c33&fccid=affdf1e411b75152&vjs=3,5 dagen geleden,5 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

75,health,Indeed,p_2f385681be7ecb88,M Ventures Associate,Merck KGaA, Amsterdam,"A career at our company is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 57,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in healthcare, life science and performance materials. For more than 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others.

Your role: Join us and be a part of our strategic corporate venture capital fund. With a total investment volume of EUR 400 million and a focus on Biotech (Healthcare and Lifesciences) and Technology (Performance Materials, Frontier Tech and Sustainability), our fund is a well-established “evergreen” investment fund, and with an active investment portfolio of 50 investee companies. In this role, as part of the Biotech team, you will evaluate investment opportunities in companies that are expected to have future strategic value for our Healthcare and Life Sciences businesses. You will manage deal flow, review business plans, provide recommendations to the team, co-ordinate with internal functions and provide feedback to potential investee companies. You will define, in collaboration with research, development and commercial functions, the focus areas for investment activity. Your scope also focuses on supporting other transactions, such as spin-offs and equity components of licensing transactions. You will support the company strategy development by providing inputs from the external Life Sciences environment and initiate strategy discussions around new developments in the industry and/or novel activities for the company based on close knowledge of industry developments.
Who you are:
You completed a PhD, MSc or MD degree in Biology, Pharmacy, Medicine, Chemistry or Software applied to Biotech
column2: or a related field

column1: You gained 2+ years’ experience in Venture Capital, investment banking, or international consulting environment, alternatively in a strategic operational role in a highly sector relevant company

You have strong valuation skills and understanding of (preferred) equity and equity related structures commonly applied in the biotech industry
You have in depth understanding of corporate finance, capital budgeting and accounting, with respect to the biotech industry
You have the ability to drive projects to conclusion and entrepreneurial spirit
You possess strong interpersonal and intercultural skills, ability to lead cross functional international project teams and present to senior management
You have the ability and willingness to travel up to 50% depending on project load
You possess excellent English skills (Written, Oral, Negotiations)

What we offer: With us, there are always opportunities to break new ground. We empower you to fulfil your ambitions, and our diverse businesses offer various career moves to seek new horizons. We trust you with responsibility early on and support you to draw your own career map that is responsive to your aspirations and priorities in life. Join us and bring your curiosity to life!

76,health,Indeed,p_b791e30ae77c058f,Coach Alkmaar,NewFysic, Alkmaar,"NewFysic verandert levens. Dat is onze missie en passie en daar doen wij alles voor. Heb jij passie voor gezonde voeding en ben jij een duizendpoot die naast coaching kan zorgen dat de vestiging op rolletjes loopt én dat onze missie zoveel mogelijk mensen bereikt? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

NewFysic heeft 35 vestigingen verspreid over heel Nederland. De NewFysic methode is een gezonde manier van afslanken met bewezen duurzame resultaten. Een voedingsplan op maat, persoonlijke coaching en ondersteuning door eiwitsupplementen vormen de pijlers van het succes achter deze methode.
De functie:

Als coach bij NewFysic ben je verantwoordelijk voor de begeleiding van onze klanten gedurende hun afslankproces. Onze klanten variëren van jong tot oud. Je adviseert hun over hun voedingsplan en onze producten die het afslankproces verder ondersteunen.

Je bent enthousiast, commercieel en haalt veel voldoening uit het coachen van je klanten en het verkopen van afslank ondersteunende producten. Het is een uitdagende en dynamische functie met veel verantwoordelijkheid en zelfstandigheid in een snelgroeiend, jong bedrijf.
Wie ben jij?
Passie met gezonde voeding & health
Empathisch vermogen
Dienstverlenende instelling
Discreet
Flexibel, accuraat en zelfstandig
Commercieel ingesteld
Verzorgd/representatief uiterlijk
Woonachtig in Alkmaar of omstreken
Achtergrond in diëtiek is een pré, maar passie voor voeding, health en vooral mensen is voor ons het belangrijkste!
Wat bieden wij?
Een uitdagende baan met de kans om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen
Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden
De kans om mensen hun levens te veranderen
De mogelijkheid om een opleiding te volgen
Vragen?
Heb je nog vragen? Neem gerust contact op via 088 323 00 01.
Solliciteren?

Ben jij nog steeds enthousiast over de functie van coach en herken jij jezelf in het profiel? Dan komen wij graag met jou in contact, solliciteer snel doormiddel van het versturen van je CV en motivatiebrief met een recente foto naar: hr@newfysic.nl,
Een assessment behoort tot de mogelijkheid van de procedure.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)
