column1: 126,health,Indeed,p_2950a414b05dc7c4,Digital Strategy Consultant (DigitalBCG),Boston Consulting Group, Amsterdam,"Location:
Amsterdam
Geography:
Europe & The Middle East
Capabilities:
Big data & advanced analytics, Strategy, Technology & digital, Transformation and BCG TURN
Industries:

Automotive & Mobility, Biopharmaceuticals, Consumer products, Energy & environment, Engineered products & infrastructure, Financial institutions, Health care payers & providers, Insurance, Media & entertainment, Medical devices & technology, Metals & mining, Process industries & building materials, Public sector, Retail, Technology industries, Telecommunications, Transportation, travel & tourism
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.
Digital BCG

BCG has a long history of driving growth by embracing innovation and new ways of thinking. Through DigitalBCG, we bring together a diverse mix of consultants and digital specialists to ensure that we are supporting our clients throughout their digital transformation journeys. We work with our clients to fully understand the impact of digital on their business and set priorities that will transform their vision into value. Whether it be developing new technologies to support their core business, making better use of their data, or pursuing entirely new sources of revenue, our aim is to achieve radical improvements in productivity, flexibility, and speed. We are innovating how our clients are using artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, internet of things, personalization, blockchain technologies, and more to gain competitive advantage.

DigitalBCG encompasses a broad set of data, digital, and technology capabilities from BCG consulting teams and practices, along with our business units such as BCG Digital Ventures, BCG Platinion, and BCG GAMMA.
Practice Area Profile

BCG’s Technology Advantage (TA) practice focuses on helping clients deliver competitive advantage and business superior performance through the use of data, technology and digital. TA is the fastest growing practice at BCG and at the heart of the strategic impact we have with our clients. Our consultants and experts globally work across all industries and provide deep experience and expertise across a number of topics including: * Digital Transformation * Data & Digital Platforms * Software & Agile * Digitizing the Tech Function
What You'll Do

Our world is being driven by digital and at BCG we are at the heart of it. In DigitalBCG, you would use your expertise and generalist consulting skillset to help CEOs and their teams solve their most pressing challenges, and think about how digital and technology will change the shape of their business.

You would help your clients answer questions such as “How will AI disrupt my business model?”, “How can businesses use data and analytics to create highly-personalized outreach delivered through a seamless omnichannel experience?”, “How can I ship higher quality digital services to my customers faster by using agile?” and much more.
As a member of our team, you would work on a variety of these topics, applying your consulting skills to strategic digital, technology, and digital transformation questions.

As a Consultant, you will be given end-to-end responsibility for the larger and more complex “modules” within a BCG project, and begin to develop specialized knowledge to help you solve our clients’ problems. You’ll work closely with clients to understand their issues, create strategies for change, win buy-in for your recommendations, and collaborate with fellow BCGers to transform client potential into performance.

A broad skillset and passion for digital & technology is important. As part of our digitally-focused consulting team, you would work on a variety of digital topics, applying generalist consulting skills to strategic digital & technology questions. You will be supported by an extensive training curriculum (the same programme as all BCG consultants), plus digital-specific training and mentoring to help you build your skills.
What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications)
We’re looking for exceptional talent from consulting or industry to join us. You would typically:
Have a minimum of 4 years’ experience working:
with a leading consulting firm (focused on technology/digital initiatives)
in a corporate role focused on technology/digital initiatives (e.g. business analyst)
in a tech start-up leadership role
column2: or in a ""consulting-like"" industry (e.g. digital strategy, digital marketing)

column1: Have an outstanding academic track record from a leading university
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills in Dutch and English
Who You'll Work With
Our consultants within DigitalBCG are an integral part of BCG's core consulting team
column2: we work side-by-side with all practice areas to create value & competitive advantage for our clients.

column1: We offer multiple career paths for the world’s best talent to have a real impact on business and society. As part of our team, you will benefit from the breadth and diversity of what we are doing today and where we are headed next. We count on your authenticity, exceptional work, and strong integrity. In return, we are committed to supporting you in discovering the most fulfilling career journey possible—and unlocking your potential to advance the world.
TO JOIN US
All candidates must complete an online application to be considered.
Date Posted:

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E-Verify Employer.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=2950a414b05dc7c4&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=d7709e2ae6b7ff40&assa=9385,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=2950a414b05dc7c4&fccid=b95f9eb47968fa13&vjs=3,29 dagen geleden,29 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

127,health,Indeed,p_760db0358be7190d,Senior CRA,IQVIA, Amsterdam,"IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.
Clinical FSP Business

IQVIA clinical FSP business is unique. Our teams are dedicated to a single sponsor partner, where the common goal is quality delivery for our clients. We set ourselves apart with collaboration and face to face contact both at start up and during the clinical study.

Leadership recognises the skills, talent and experience of our clinical teams and strives to build upon this as the function evolves and grows. Our managers understand the sponsors priorities and the individual aspects of each model. Focus is given to career development from day one, including new hire orientation and onboarding, day to day problem solving and training and development.

Unique to the FSP model, our team contributes to the pipelines of the specific sponsor and therefore our CRAs are ‘indication and molecule experts’. Additionally, IQVIA’s FSP business works with the Sponsors SOP’s, creating more continuity for both parties.
Our models offer excellent opportunities for experienced CRA’s to expand their knowledge and skills.
#LI-MS3
#CRASDAJD
What we Offer:
Excellent salary and benefits package
Company car or car allowance
We invest in keeping our teams stable, so workload is consistent
We offer genuine career development opportunities for those who want to grow as part of the organisation
We give the chance to work on cutting edge medicines, right at the forefront of new medicine development
Role Details:
Working in partnership with a single-sponsor
Usually allocated to 1-2 protocols (likely to be in the areas of Oncology, Neurology, Immunology and/or Diabetes)
Responsible for approximately 10 sites
On site between 6 and 9 days per month, dependant on the sponsor
All CRAs and SCRAs are allocated a dedicated IQVIA Line Manager
Fantastic work/life balance
Sponsor model has reduced travel (approx. 30% or less) due to using ‘Fit for Purpose Monitoring’ which incorporates remote monitoring therefore there is less need for on-site visits
Responsibilities:
Site management and monitoring activities across the Netherlands
Work with sites to adapt, drive and track subject recruitment plan
Provide protocol and study training to the assigned sites
Create and maintain monitoring visit reports and action plans
If appropriate, co-monitor, train and mentor junior members of the team
Become part of our team.
We believe in hiring the best talent in the industry.
To become part of our team, you should:
Have a degree in Life Sciences or have equivalent experience
Have at least 2 years of independent on-site monitoring experience
Be experienced in handling multiple protocols across a variety of drug indications with good time management skills
Have in depth GCP knowledge
Be flexible with the ability to travel nationwide
Hold a full and clean driving license
Possess strong communication, written and presentation skills are a must (must have fluency in English and Dutch language)

With the merger between Quintiles and IMS Health, we now have access to significant data pools allowing better site selection and recruitment. This helps drive performance of sites making the CRA role more efficient and discussions at site more productive. It’s the next generation of clinical development
Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!

131,health,Indeed,p_7b5123077b138993,Buyer VakantieVeilingen - Wonen en Huishouden,Emesa, Amsterdam,"Wie ben jij?

Jij bent een commerciële dealmaker die goed bekend is met de inkoop van producten en ervaring heeft in een van de categorieën Wonen, Huishouden en Kerst. Je weet (potentiële) partners in deze branches proactief te benaderen en een commerciële win-win situatie te creëren. Je werkt aan het op- en uitbouwen van een duurzame relatie met nieuwe en bestaande partners zonder daarbij de commerciële korte termijn doelstellingen uit het oog te verliezen. Je gaat voor het benutten van kansen en bent target-gedreven, creatief, commercieel sterk, overtuigend en een echte netwerker.
Herken jij jezelf hierin en ben je nieuwsgierig naar deze functie? Lees dan snel verder!
Wat ga je doen?

Als buyer ben je zelfstandig verantwoordelijk voor het op- en uitbouwen van jouw categorieën met onze bestaande leveranciers en ga jij continu op zoek naar nieuwe kansen. De invulling van de categorieën Wonen, Huishouden en Kerst: Jij weet als geen ander wat er in de markt te krijgen is en weet wat onze klanten willen, zowel in Nederland, als België. Met deze kennis benader jij leveranciers op proactieve en creatieve wijze en overtuigt ze op basis van hun behoefte van de voordelen die samenwerking met Emesa voor hen met zich meebrengt.

Om nieuwe assortiment te sourcen, werk je vanuit kantoor, maar ben je ook onderweg naar leveranciers & beurzen in binnen- & buitenland (EU en China), zodra Corona het weer toelaat. Jouw onderhandeling skills en tactieken weet je zo in te zetten dat je altijd de beste deal voor onze klanten scoort, en daarbij een win-win situatie creëert voor Emesa en onze partners. Ook analyseer je klantenfeedback over onze producten en ga je vanuit daar met onze leveranciers aan de slag om de producten die in het Verre-Oosten geproduceerd worden nog verder te ontwikkelen en te verbeteren.
Van het eerste contact tot het succesvol sluiten van de deal en het bijbehorende (langere termijn) accountmanagement: jij bent verantwoordelijk voor het gehele proces!

Vanuit jouw commerciële expertise werk je mee aan het opstellen van een helder categorieplan, om van daaruit concrete targets te formuleren voor zowel korte als langere termijn. Daarnaast initieer je verbeteringen op ons platform die bijdragen aan meer omzet, een betere klantervaring en een betere NPS.
Team Products

De afdeling International Products, waar alle producten voor onze labels Vakantieveilingen, slajeslag en Vavabid worden ingekocht en geveild, is de snelst groeiende afdeling binnen Emesa, daarom zijn we op zoek naar nieuwe buyers. Omdat deze afdeling snel groeiend is, zijn er bij bewezen succes, ook voldoende doorgroeimogelijkheden. Het huidige team bestaat uit 12 FTE, waarbij je rapporteert aan de Category manager en veel samenwerkt met de Category specialist, marketing en uiteraard de andere buyers.
Wat verwachten we van jou?
Minimaal HBO werk- en denkniveau
0-3 jaar relevante werkervaring in zelfstandige commerciële functie
Aantoonbare affiniteit met de inkoop van producten en ervaring in minimaal één van de drie categorieën: Wonen, Huishouden en Kerst
Je wordt sterk gedreven door het behalen van commerciële resultaten
Je bent ondernemend, marktgericht en komt met creatieve oplossingen
Je toont initiatief en bent overtuigend
Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal
Je voelt je thuis in een snel veranderende omgeving.
+ Ervaring met sourcen in het Verre Oosten is een pre
+ Ervaring met online media / e-commerce is een pre
Een dag als Buyer?

“Het is maandagochtend 8:30 uur, je opent snel je laptop met een kopje koffie want je bent benieuwd hoe jouw categorieën de week ervoor hebben gepresteerd. Je analyseert de resultaten en verwerkt deze met een toelichting in het slide deck voor de wekelijkse team meeting. Je merkt op dat enkele artikelen meer zijn verkocht dan verwacht, dus schakel je direct met je leverancier om te kijken of er nog voorraad beschikbaar is tegen de best mogelijke prijs.
Over 2 weken staat er een jaargesprek op de planning met jouw belangrijkste leverancier. Je begint aan de voorbereiding van de presentatie en spart met je manager over de te volgen strategie.
’s Middags heb je een kennismaking met een potentiële nieuwe leverancier, ditmaal via Microsoft Teams. Voordat je het gesprek in gaat, bereid jij je goed voor, zodat je gedegen het gesprek in gaat.
Daarna ga je aan de slag met de kwartaalplanning voor Q2, je werkt ver vooruit, omdat de fabriek in China tijd nodig heeft om jouw exclusieve productlijn te fabriceren en te versturen naar Nederland.

Voordat jij je laptop dichtklapt, check je samen met de category specialist welke promoties en activaties er aangaan komen en bepalen jullie het assortiment en de benodigde voorraad. Om 16:30 uur bel je via Teams in voor de wekelijkse (virtuele) Bootcamp les, zo begin je fit aan je werkweek.""
Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Natuurlijk word je maandelijks beloond met een goed salaris incl. een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling. Je bouwt aan je toekomst door deelname aan onze pensioenregeling. Ook bieden we je een uitgebreide aanvullende verzekering op het gebied van arbeidsongeschiktheidsrisico's
Mogelijkheden om je commerciële vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen binnen een snel groeiende, informele en resultaatgerichte e-commerce organisatie
Een veelzijdige, afwisselende plek met jonge en enthousiaste collega's in een leuke veranderingsgerichte organisatie
Veel zelfstandigheid en verantwoordelijkheid en ruimte voor eigen inbreng

We hebben oog voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Daar ben je bij Emesa primair zelf verantwoordelijk voor, maar met onze Emesa Academy, individuele trainingen en vele doorgroeimogelijkheden dragen we daar graag aan bij

Met de uitgebreide lunch en koffiebar beneden kom jij vol energie de werkdag door. Mocht het weer mogelijk zijn: Op vrijdagmiddag sluiten we de week af met een VrijMiBo :-) en zorgt de Emesa Health Club dat je fit blijft.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=7b5123077b138993&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=031a731872817b23&assa=4928,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=7b5123077b138993&fccid=67d4b8bca8c0b716&vjs=3,29 dagen geleden,29 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
132,health,Indeed,p_8454cc6c7f0f0dfd,"'PSS Officer' based in Nicosia, Cyprus",War Child, Amsterdam Oost,"RECRUITMENT SUBJECT TO FUNDING CONFIRMATION

War Child Holland (WCH) is an international non-governmental organization that works exclusively to improve the well-being and resilience of children and youths affected by violence and armed conflict. From its branch in Cyprus, WCH and its partners support children affected by the conflict in Syria through an integrated mix of child protection, education and psychosocial support interventions, while working closely with their caregivers, families and wider communities for maximum and durable impact.

We are seeking to strengthen our team and we are currently seeking an entrepreneurial and passionate Psychosocial (PSS) Officer to join our dynamic team of professionals dedicated to helping children and their families positively deal with the consequences of being exposed to armed conflict.
Your Challenge

Responsible for developing partner capacity in Psychosocial Support programming the PSS Officer will support the PSS Advisor in monitoring implementation quality, advising partner staff with regard follow up, and support in the supervision of PSS field activities.
Result Areas
Effective capacity building:

Deliver training courses and capacity building sessions to partners via Webex, Skype or Zoom, on PSS methodologies and materials (PSS foundations, DEALS, SRA, PFA and others). Face to face training could be an option where feasible.

Support the PSS Advisor to contextualize training materials as necessary and convey this to partners. Review IASC MHPSS guidelines and child protection sub-cluster content to ensure capacity building is effective and innovative, with a focus on the outcome on children.
Contribute to the development of PSS capacity building plans, and use these to move forward after project kick-off, through regular partner reviews and check in meetings.
Conduct coaching and supervision sessions with partner facilitators.
Support and follow up with partners to plan and conduct coaching and supervision sessions to build internal capacity.
Reporting & information sharing:
Compile reports on training sessions and capacity of partners to review action plans and follow up on areas of technical implementation / additional training needs.

Develop relationships with partner focal points, to facilitate effective capacity building cycles, follow up on PSS implementation within partner organisations, and support staff capacity development in the field.
Liaise with Programme Implementation team and attend internal update meetings on specified projects, maintaining action plans, and following up on key actions related to PSS delivery.
Expanding networks and coordination:
Keep up-to-date on the context and explore other trainings that are available in and outside of War Child.
Attend coordination meetings on behalf of the PSS Advisor when requested, and participate in War Child global PSS working groups as agreed with PSS Advisor.
Your Profile
Relevant academic background
At least 3 years of relevant expertise in the fields of Mental Health and / or PSS
Experience delivering training (remotely if possible) and strong understanding of adult learning pathways
Previous experience working with children/refugees/vulnerable populations.
Strong communication skills, fluency in Arabic and English (verbal & written)
Excellent presentation skills
Positive attitude and strong interpersonal skills
Flexibility
Cultural sensitivity
Attention to detail with strong follow up
Team oriented, with ability to work efficiently independently
We Offer

A dynamic and challenging work environment, with opportunities to grow and enhance your skills. A fair salary and comprehensive secondary benefits including opportunities to develop professionally. Working as part of a multinational team who are hands on to make change happen!
Job Location
Nicosia, Cyprus. Given the current travel restrictions due to COVID-19, a temporary duty station of Amman or Beirut will be considered for the initial work period.
Contract
Recruitment is subject to funding confirmation. The contract will be for at least 1 year with the intention to prolong. This is a national position based within the EU with local labour conditions.
Salary
Grade D (Scale - Eur 1, 527 – 2, 310 gross per month)
How to apply
Interested and qualified candidates are invited to upload their CV and a short cover letter, in English here before 20 December 2020.
Apply for this position
The safety of children is essential to War Child. War Child does not tolerate or accept any form of abuse. This subject is addressed in our recruitment and selection procedures.

Moreover, the accepted candidates will be required to state their commitment/ intent to be aware, consider and adhere to the minimum standards applicable in development and humanitarian settings, such as humanitarian values and principles, Sphere Humanitarian Charter, Standards in the Humanitarian Standards Partnership, Core Humanitarian Standard, International Humanitarian Law, Code of Conduct for the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement and Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs) in Disaster Relief and IASC Six Core Principles Relating to Sexual Exploitation and Abuse.

134,health,Indeed,pj_dbe3b6634edaed36,HSE-Manager,Aalberts integrated piping systems, Hilversum,"Krijg jij energie wanneer je naast het concreet vormgeven van het HSE-beleid ook eindverantwoordelijk mag zijn voor de uitvoering hiervan? Heb jij een duidelijke visie op het gebied van health, safety and environment? Ben je ook in staat om de organisatie op een gedegen niveau te adviseren? En kun jij leidinggeven aan de volgende stap naar professionalisering? Wij zijn op zoek naar een HSE-manager met HSE-verantwoordelijkheid in de breedste zin van het woord!
Jouw uitdaging als HSE-Manager

De afgelopen jaren heeft Aalberts integrated piping systems een sterke ontwikkeling en groei doorgemaakt. Dit vraagt om ook op gebied van HSE te professionaliseren. Op hoofdlijnen is er een HSE-beleid gedefinieerd. Het wordt jouw taak het HSE-beleid verder uit te werken en te implementeren. Hierbij ligt een sterke focus op veiligheid met daarbij het creëren van een veiligheidscultuur op de locaties Hilversum en Zeewolde. Gezondheid en milieu komen ook zeker aan bod. Hierbij kun je onder andere denken aan vraagstukken rondom het creëren van een comfortabele werkplek voor de medewerkers, maar ook het bewust omgaan met het milieu en de gevolgen voor de omgeving. Naast het definiëren van het beleid ben jij ook verantwoordelijk voor de borging daarvan. Bijvoorbeeld door het (laten) uitvoeren van HSE-audits en inspecties.

Door jouw kennis op het gebied van HSE weet jij het management te adviseren en te overtuigen met betrekking tot de te nemen stappen. In jouw functie rapporteer je aan de business unit director. Verder werk je nauw samen met de collega’s van de afdelingen Kwaliteit, Facility en Productie.
We gaan altijd voor de beste oplossing. Wat zijn jouw kwaliteiten?

De collega die wij zoeken is procesmatig sterk onderlegd, heeft overtuigingskracht en is daadkrachtig. Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar werkervaring opgedaan in een vergelijkbare functie binnen de maakindustrie. Uiteraard ben je flexibel, communicatief vaardig (in het Engels en Nederlands in woord en geschrift) en kun je uitstekend samenwerken.
Verder vragen we:
minimaal een afgeronde hbo-opleiding in de richting van Hogere Veiligheidskunde (HVK) (Technische) Bedrijfskunde (TBK) of Procesmanagement
dat je minimaal 40 uur per week beschikbaar bent
dat je woonachtig bent in de regio Amersfoort, Amsterdam, Hilversum, Utrecht of Zeewolde.
Wat bieden we je als HSE-Manager?

Wij bieden je een zeer gedreven werkomgeving in een organisatie die groot genoeg is om de complexiteit van een rol als HSE-manager te ervaren maar ook zeker klein genoeg om daadwerkelijk het verschil te kunnen maken. Je krijgt alle ruimte om invulling te geven aan het nemen van initiatief en je persoonlijke ontwikkeling. We zijn financieel gezond en dat maakt dat we gericht kunnen en blijven investeren in een betere toekomst. We bieden een uitstekend salaris passend bij jouw kennis, ervaring en capaciteiten. Wij bieden je tevens uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden.
Hierbij kun je denken aan:
8% vakantiegeld
27 vakantiedagen
7 collectieve adv-dagen
pensioenregeling met 50% werkgeversbijdrage
reiskostenvergoeding
collectieve ziektekostenverzekering
vrijwillige WGA-hiaatregeling

135,health,Indeed,p_4924209e19253b1f,Chief Operating Officer,Synthesis Retreat, Amsterdam,"Since 2018, Synthesis has been offering legal, medically supervised and science-based psychedelic retreats in Amsterdam for open-minded seekers who want to utilize moderate-to-high doses of psilocybin truffles to catalyze creative breakthroughs, explore consciousness, find meaning, improve confidence, and open up to a mystical experience.

138,health,Indeed,p_8bb00c3f7806ce3b,CFO,LIME SearchConnection, Amsterdam,"Job Description

The Renewal Workshop (TRW) is the leading provider of circular solutions for apparel and textile brands. They are organized around the idea that businesses have multiple responsibilities for generating positive, lasting value. The Renewal Workshop is here to solve hard problems and to create circular systems that make things better. Their work is to do what is good and right for people and for the planet:

to reduce waste and restore valueto create jobs and treat people fairlyto serve customers kindly and work with partners cooperatively. They consciously choose to act with love in what we do and how we do it.

The CFO role is a position for an experienced finance person who wants to dig in and define strategy, analysis, funding, KPIs, and business models for a fast growing circular economy company. While as a young company TRW has strong financial control and management, as they scale they need to take it to the next level. And now as a global company with operations in the US and EU, the company is faced with financial management across multiple systems of reporting, taxation, and employee management. This is the ideal opportunity to define how a key player in the apparel circular economy ecosystem scales, gets investment, manages global growth, and evolves to serve brands and customers with a zero-waste revenue-generating solution.
Typical duties include:
Budget
Ensure there is a clear global budget and projections for the company
Manage the process for developing circle budgets in both EU and US and quarterly check-ins
Purchase/Expense policy management
Weekly cashflow management
Monthly budget progression and projection management and analysis
Working with outsourced/contracted bookkeeping resources in US and EU.
Strategic Finance
Evolve the business model and unit economics model of the business to allow for replication and scale
In partnership with the founders and board, develop the long term investment and debt strategy for the company
Research, develop and test new financial models for the circular businesses including internally and with our brand partners
Work with brand partners to educate on circular economy finances
Development and management of the financial models, projection models, and scenario models to meet financial needs of the business but also of our brand partners
Explore opportunities for US and EU grants and work with grant writers and consortium partners to secure funding for innovative circular projects.
Operations Analysis
Ensure the production teams have the information they need to plan, balance, innovate, and improve processes and efficiency
Create and manage tools to enable the financial analysis of operational costs using production data
Work directly with production leads to create and review KPIs to provide financial insights into process analysis and improvements
Develop ROI models for capex investments in automation to improve efficiency and reduce cogs.
Board and Founder Support
Ensure the company has the financial sophistication of a global enterprise and can report out to various stakeholders including the board of directors and investors
Collaborate with founders on the development of yearly strategy and long-term strategic planning
Co-lead future fundraising efforts with the founders, preparing the company for and participating in discussions with potential Series B investors
Prepare financials for reporting and collaborate with founders on quarterly board presentations and company strategy.
Financial Compliance
Ensure the company is compliant with legal and regulatory filings and work with our outsourced tax accountants to ensure accurate submission of corporate taxes in both the US and EU
Work with HR to manage and analyse employee benefits, health care, and pension programs
Ensure financial compliance with employee contracts.
Finance Circle Lead
Lead the finance circle pulling together the appropriate stakeholders for regular meetings
Set, track, and assign projects and goals for the circle
Attend weekly General Circle meetings to represent finance and KPI reporting.
Ideal candidate profile
Education & Experience Qualifications
Preference for a candidate who has taken a company through a significant growth period (ie: Post-Series A to pre-Series B)
Preference for start-up or scale-up experience
Preference for experience in fundraising from VC or PE
Preference for candidates with work experience in both US and EU
Experience working at a manufacturer or consumer goods company that has direct management of their operations and/or production
Apparel or textile brand experience preferred but not necessary
Experience working with many different stakeholders who have competing objectives to achieve goals.
Key Competencies & Technical Skills
Great attention to detail
Loves to tackle big projects that need processes and tools developed
Great listening skills, known for being a good listener and hearing what people need in order to serve them best
Strategic thinker, able to foresee needs and plan for them
Great communication skills - supporting MANY stakeholders and communication styles
Service oriented
Fluent in English.
Organisation

The Renewal Workshop (TRW) is the leading provider of circular solutions for apparel and textile brands. TRW is helping brands reduce their negative environmental impacts and expand their businesses by adopting circular practices. TRW offer Apparel and Textile Renewal, Sales Channel Management for Renewed Products, Circular Mapping, Data Collection and Textile Recycling R&D.

Their proprietary Renewal System takes discarded apparel and textiles and turns them into Renewed Products, upcycling materials or feedstock for recycling. TRW tracks data on everything that flows through the system offering comprehensive insights never before available on products lifetime value and impact. The Renewal Workshop operates a zero waste circular system that recovers value out of what has already been created as a way of serving customers, partners, and planet.

140,health,Indeed,p_837a5b4257d758c5,Principal Data Scientist Forecasting/ Personalization & Relevance,ahold, Zaandam,"Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek

Do you want to make big impact, work for over 10 international brands within Ahold Delhaize (e.g. Albert Heijn, Bol.com. Delhaize, Stop & Shop and Food Lion) and work within our newly formed European Data Science & Analytics team? Then we are looking for you.

Within Ahold Delhaize we are looking for a Principal Data Scientist Forecasting and a Principal Data Scientist Personalization & Relevance. As you being the expert in one of these domains you will work closely together with our data science and analytics teams from our brands (Albert Heijn, Delhaize, Etos etc.) and the regional US team. We seek mutual opportunities, work together on implementing state-of-the-art data solutions and help them taking data science and analytics to a higher level. You are an expert in identifying, implementing and improving data solutions driving sustainable value for our customers and businesses. You participate in the cross functional scrum teams with the lead brand and you have a strong vision on data solutions. As Principal Data Scientist you will create impact at scale, as we want to scale and leverage these solutions across the brands.

In this European team we are organized around three domains within data science: forecasting, search and personalization & relevance. In the team you will be working with data scientists, data analysts, data governance experts, experimentation experts and ML engineers. Examples of products you will be working on are developing customer demand forecasting models for our e-Commerce businesses, workforce planning models for our distribution centers and replenishment models for our stores.

Next to this, you will also set up and lead the global data science community with this domain. You will build connections with the data scientists across Ahold Delhaize who are working on models and solutions, such that knowledge, best practices and algorithms can be shared. This community of practice will be enhancing transparency, collaboration and developing together.
As our Principal Data Scientist you are the most important Data Science go to person within your domain. You collaborate with various levels in our company
column2: from data scientist up to senior leadership. To do so, you’re a pragmatic scientist who still likes getting his/her hands dirty. As you are the expert within Forecasting you will spread your knowledge across our company. In this way you will improve numerous products and the experiences of millions of customers every single day.

column1: ?As Principal Data Scientist at Ahold Delhaize you:
Act as thought leader on Forecasting or Personalization & Relevance to our colleagues and external stakeholders.
Collaborate & inspire our business in identifying, understanding and prioritizing business needs into data science solutions.
You understand what it takes to develop a model, industrialize the model and improve it via experimentation.
Provide input on future development and possibilities to support strategic (mid- to long term) planning of data science.
You understand the importance of fairness and ethical use of AI.
Build a network of relevant people to gain excess to cutting edge data methodologies and share knowledge and best practices within personalization and relevance.
Explore new data science solutions for our brands and keep developing business driven data science solutions.
Have a strong focus on creating value.
Coach/mentor a team of data scientists and lead our community of practice.
Have a pragmatic mindset
column2: you understand the larger data science picture, the spot on the horizon, but also have a very pragmatic approach to this.

column1: Your Office.?

As Principal Data Scientist you will work at and across Ahold Delhaize where approximately 370,000 employees worldwide serve over 50 million customers a week. Locally, you’ll be working with 1,500 colleagues in Zaandam, the Netherlands. We improve and innovate every day, supporting our trusted local brands and reinforcing our role as a leader in retail and e-commerce.

You will be joining the newly formed Data Science & Analytics team. In this team we deliver scalable data products and building bridges between the different data science & analytics teams from our brands.
Covid-19

Our main priority continues to be the health and safety of our employees and customers. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, this position will be remote until further notice. We will continue monitor the circumstances and when we feel comfortable, this position will return to our Headquarters in Zaandam, where you will have the opportunity to collaborate face-to-face with a talented and diverse group of colleagues. This also means that all job interviews for this position will take place via video calls.
Dit bieden we jou

At Ahold Delhaize we want to grow. That is only possible if you grow with us. That is why you get access to best in class guidance and inspiring training, to shape your own development and career. As we work together to build on our brand as well as your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week):
a gross yearly salary up to € 90K + 8% vacation pay, so you can enjoy a well-deserved rest.
a bonus on top of your salary.
a very good pension plan with a personal contribution of 6.2%.
20 vacation days.
A budget choice which you can decide whether you spend it on extra days (+12,5 days), discounts or pay-outs.
the possibility to attend training courses at our expense.?
attractive discounts on various insurance policies.
a laptop and telephone.
10% discount on your grocery shopping in our Albert Heijn stores, up to € 300 per year.
flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home.
a travel allowance for traveling to and from Zaandam, when we return to office.
A new role in a new team, where you can add a lot of value.
Dit breng je mee
At Ahold Delhaize, you'll be working for one of the world's biggest retailers, and we know you are bursting with the ambition to keep up with us. You supplement this ambition with:
a Master in Data Science, Mathematics, Econometrics, A.I., Computer Science or other relevant (technical) studies. If no relevant study, demonstrably relevant experience and results.
7+ years of experiencing in designing and building end-to-end AI/ML solutions on cloud infrastructure - Azure is preferred.
practical knowledge of orchestrating production ML pipelines with CI/CD flows
being a power-user of open-source eco-system of algorithms and tools for forecasting or personalization & Relevance.
great communication skills
column2: you explain complex matter in an easy and enthusiastic way to business stakeholders and connect (to) people.

column1: deep knowledge of sequence modeling including statistical models like- ARIMA, classical models like - LGBM, state of the art models like- Transformers, LSTM, Neural networks.

For the forecasting domain: experience with CPG industry demand forecast/ models like online demand forecast for web shops, replenishment algorithms at different labels of granularity – SKU level, store level, warehouse level and supplier level.
For the personalization & relevance domain: good experience with CPG industry relevant personalization models like promotion personalization, search personalization, contextual cross-sell.
advanced statistical knowledge of hypothesis testing, A/B testing, ANOVA, correlations, similarity measures, factors of variations, different probability distributions.
experience working with both continuous, categorical and nominal data as input to models.
several examples of successfully implemented data science projects.
Apply.?

Do you want to play an active role in changing the food retail landscape as we know it? Then hop onboard and join us on our expedition. Apply now via the button on this page. We ask you not to send a standard motivation letter, but to formulate an answer to the following questions:
Why would you like to work for Ahold Delhaize?
Why do you think you will be successful in this position and what kind of technical skills do you bring with you for this role?
What?is one of your personal strengths and one skill you wish to improve or develop?
Want to learn more first, before you apply? Maureen Ensink, Talent Acquisition Partner Data Science & Analytics is happy to tell you everything about this vacancy via maureen.ensink@aholddelhaize.com

Senior
Data-science

141,health,Indeed,p_82962cb79527f832,UX WRITER - Browse & Inspire,adidas, Amsterdam,"THE OPPORTUNITY
We're looking for a UX Writer to join our Amsterdam-based Browse & Inspire team.
People come into our digital store hoping to be inspired and expecting that we'll advise them on the perfect products for them - whether it's to relax, to compete, or anything in between.

We're obsessed with solving problems like preventing injuries by guiding people to the perfect shoe for their game. We're brave enough to tackle complex challenges like bra fitting for different body types. And we are bold enough to dream of unique ways to showcase and differentiate our products to meet all style needs.
This all happens within an innovative and meaningful experience that represents the very best adidas has to offer, anywhere.
Key responsibilities:
Own the UX writing process end to end: from identifying opportunities to research, testing, and translations
Drive community initiatives and help combine the right practices, people, and tools to mature the practice
Collaborate and co-create with design, product, and language specialists to form a holistic UX approach
Create and execute on a strategic level but also get hands-on and granular with the details
Define and develop an effective blueprint for the UX writing team to scale
Coordinate closely with language specialists to bring their market-specific knowledge to our UX process
WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Our UX writers are passionate, outspoken advocates for our users' needs and aren't afraid to shake things up. We want innovators and experts who can help mature our practice and create delightful experiences that feel distinctly adidas.
You're a good fit for the role if:
You've got 5+ years' experience writing for product teams
You're most at home in an agile/Scrum environment
You're an effective communicator, comfortable presenting complex topics and decisions at all levels
You have experience with coordinating localisation for global audiences
You're a creator at heart. You're deeply passionate about your craft and can balance consistency with creativity
You champion accessibility and inclusivity throughout the user journey
You're familiar with experimentation and research
column2: you can test, validate, and iterate on your solutions

column1: You can source, interpret, and implement feedback and insights into your content design decisions

ABOUT US
At adidas we believe that through sport, we have the power to change lives.
There's plenty of change around right now as workouts move from the gym to the garage and we take a timeout from many of the activities we're passionate about.
Our ambition is to be the best sport brand in the world and with that comes plenty of challenges. We thrive on solving these with the imagination and experience of our incredible teammates.
We're all on the home team for now - we'd love for you to join ours.
WHAT YOU'LL GET

We get it, you want to know more than what we stock the fridges with. We asked our teammates for their favourite things about life at adidas, they said: the collaborative, supportive culture, the amazing team, and the sense of pride and purpose in their
work. You'll get all that, plus:
Generous employee discount on our brands
Fitness activities
Opportunity to work for a truly global, multicultural team
Learning and development support
Discounted health insurance
HOW TO APPLY
Please note: though our teammates hail from all corners of the world, our working language is English so this is a requirement for all roles.
Hit 'Apply' and submit your CV along with a portfolio or samples of work that showcase your craft expertise.

142,health,Indeed,p_354ef7eb1a63ccc4,Projectmanager zorgkwaliteit,Wikiwork, Amsterdam,"Introductie

Heb jij een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding en begrijp jij goed hoe de medische wereld in elkaar zit? Ben jij goed in het analyseren van data en heb jij overtuigingskracht & de skills om medisch specialisten inhoudelijk te adviseren op het gebied van betaalbare en toegankelijke zorg? Join the team!
Organisatie

Deze leuke werkgever biedt jou een mooie kans! Je komt terecht bij een jong, hip bedrijf waar je veel eigen verantwoordelijkheid krijgt. Buiten het werk om wordt er veel aandacht besteed aan leuke dingen, zoals een tafeltenniscompetitie, gezamenlijke lunch, trainingen en borrels. Gezellige collega’s gegarandeerd!
Functie
In deze rol werk je nauw samen met data scientists en analyseer je waar de kansen liggen m.b.t. het kostenbeleid
in de zorg (bijv. behandeldeclaraties)
In combinatie met kwaliteitsbehoud stel je een praktisch bruikbaar advies op, gericht op de specifieke zorginstelling

Je werkt met/voor medisch specialisten in verschillende zorginstellingen, zoals ziekenhuizen en apotheken. Je gaat met specialisten inhoudelijk in overleg met als doel betaalbare en toegankelijke zorg. Ook voor hen biedt dit voordelen, bijvoorbeeld op het gebied van inkoopvoorwaarden en administratieve processen. Je hoeft dus niks te ‘verkopen’, alleen de data overtuigend te presenteren
Wekelijks krijg je training vanuit het bedrijf zodat je je vaardigheden kunt trainen
Je levert in deze functie absoluut een maatschappelijk relevante bijdrage!
Functie-eisen
Je hebt een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding, bij voorkeur in de richting van Gezondheidswetenschappen, Verpleegkunde, Biomedische Wetenschappen, Zorgmanagement, Health Education of Health Economics
Voor deze rol zoeken we 2 leuke kandidaten: een junior + een medior met wat meer werkervaring
Het is belangrijk dat je begrijpt hoe de medische wereld in elkaar zit. Ervaring in communicatie met medisch specialisten is absoluut een pre!
Je bent goed in analyseren, bent oplossingsgericht en stevig & overtuigend in je communicatie
Je woont in (de buurt van) Amsterdam en bent 32-40 uur beschikbaar
Aanbod

Je krijgt in deze rol een goed (bovengemiddeld!) salaris. Daarnaast wordt er gewerkt met bonussen en je krijgt de beschikking over een auto, laptop en telefoon van de zaak. Niks te klagen dus! Verder is de werklocatie wisselend, afhankelijk van de afspraken werk je op kantoor of ben je ‘onderweg’. Lekker flexibel dus.
Sollicitatie

143,health,Indeed,p_98f12146fd9eb099,Clinical Research and Development Lead,GSK, AmsterdamZuidoost,"Site Name: Amsterdam, Rixensart, Wavre, Italy - Siena
Posted Date: Jan 14 2021

Are YOU energized by an opportunity to accelerate and deliver a clinical data strategy that drives the opportunity to protect people from infectious diseases? If so, this Clinical Research & Development Lead role could be an exciting opportunity to explore.

As a Clinical Research & Development Lead, you will participate to Phase I-IV Clinical Development activities within a program or group of related programs within the context of the GSK Vaccines process in order to ensure the high quality and on-time delivery of all clinical data that will allow world-wide registration in compliance with the clinical development plan, good clinical practices (GCP), and GSK Vaccines standard operating procedures (SOP).
This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career, these responsibilities include some of the following:

1. Participate in Clinical Development activities for a study or a number of studies within a specific program or group of related programs - Design clinical trial protocols, and author clinical study reports and publications of high scientific, operational and ethical standards
column2: Ensure consistency of data within program and across projects
column3: Reporting full accountability to Clinical and Epidemiology Research & Development Project Lead.

column1: 2. Bear primary responsibility and accountability for scientific, medical quality, medical/legal and human safety aspects and timeliness of clinical trial synopses and protocols and all clinical trial documents, including the Investigator’s Brochure and the Clinical Study Report.

3. Supervise the study conduct and serve as the accountable for the overall delivery of the clinical trial, analyze and interpret the results as a subject matter expert and assure that results meet the highest standards of quality and ethical conduct.
4. Serve as a scientific and management reference for the project (internally/externally), assuming accountability for the medical/legal and human safety aspects of the clinical study
5. As a member of the Clinical Project Team, always actively participate and engage within the project matrix, to achieve team objectives
6. Actively participate in preparing the clinical portion of the regulatory files and the registration process, including labelling
7. Provides support to Marketing/Business Development throughout product life cycle in order to achieve Company’s objectives
8.Collect scientific information and review GSK Vaccines project related documents and publications.
Why YOU?
Basic Qualifications:
We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:

MD or PhD specializing in the field of pediatrics, obstetrics and gynecology, infectious diseases, clinical epidemiology, or pharmacoepidemiology. Previous experience in clinical vaccinology is an asset.

Minimum 1 year industry experience or minimum 5 years experience working in a scientific or medical institution (if not an MD, prior experience as Principal Investigator, Medical Monitor or commensurate to Clinical Research Scientist position)
Excellent knowledge of spoken and written English
Ability to translate scientific skills in the field of vaccines and clinical research into business-driven strategies.
Understanding of GCP and ICH guidelines
column2: experience working with Regulatory functions a plus.

column1: Ability to work well within a matrix environment, balance priorities, and independently handle multiple tasks through good planning, project administration, organization skills.
Ability to critically analyze information, identify strengths and weaknesses of approaches and proactively develop remedial actions to mitigate risks.
Effective ability to prioritize tasks and deliver on deadlines, with high performance standards and a commitment to excellence.
Knowledge and understanding of vaccines, clinical research, and biomedical research regulation
Preferred Qualifications:
If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:
Strategic thinking skills and achievement oriented.
Needs to possess highly effective communication skills and be capable of presenting ideas and data clearly to various audiences.
Working knowledge and understanding of causes of infectious diseases, health interventions and the global public health landscape.
Sensitivity to the needs of a diversified ethnic groups and ability to build rapport across the spectrum
License to practice medicine and board and/ or professional certification is an asset
Why GSK?
Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture.

These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. As GSK focuses on our values and expectations and a culture of innovation, performance, and trust, the successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities:
Agile and distributed decision-making – using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk.
Managing individual and team performance.
Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution.
Implementing change initiatives and leading change.
Sustaining energy and well-being, building resilience in teams
Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning both internally and externally
Developing people and building a talent pipeline
Translating strategy into action - a compelling narrative, motivating others, setting objectives and delegation
Building strong relationships and collaboration, managing trusted stakeholder relationships internally and externally
Budgeting and forecasting, commercial and financial acumen.
If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US).

GSK is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.
Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. 144,health,Indeed,p_2881ca4cd3e5c9cc,Business Consultant IAM,ahold, Zaandam,"Your new job and office
Passionate about IAM? Then you cannot pass on the opportunity to work for a global IAM team, working on global innovation and change projects.

As our Business Consultant IAM, you help us define IAM requirements and to roll out global initiatives on a local scale. Your ultimate challenge is to ensure that, despite the complexity, the user experience for your local stakeholders (offices, stores, HQ's and distribution centers) is a smooth and innovative one.

We hope you like a good challenge because we are currently transitioning from IBM identity stack to Azure Active Directory and Saviynt. And as you can imagine, this entails many exciting projects where you will act as a delegator. That means that you will need to be knowledgeable on a technical level, but your focus is on coordinating the technical implementation by others.

In that capacity, you cover IAM initiatives for the Netherlands as well as the rest of our global portfolio. You work closely with your peers in Belgium and the United States. You will also work to coordinate with IAM architects, engineers, and project managers. Together you play an essential role in optimizing our domains and information security.
As an IAM Specialist, make an impact at Ahold Delhaize by:
driving the Identity and Access Management (IAM) service portfolio for The Netherlands, including the IAM governance model and identity roadmap delivery.

supporting, delivering, and maintaining the IAM roadmap, acting as a security ambassador, and providing direction and IAM expertise for business enablement (stores, brands, distribution centers, and headquarters).
supporting, delivering, and maintaining the access management roadmap, focusing on enterprise single sign-on, overall access management, privileged user management, and multifactor authentication.

identity operations management: establishing, managing, and maintaining IAM operations, focusing on consolidation of provisioning methods, integration of identity stores, work towards role-based access, centralization of the authentication methods, and managing high privileged accounts and associated solutions.
ensuring close communication with stakeholders like Cyber Defense, Architects, and the business.
Your new office

Working as a Business Consultant IAM, you do at and with Ahold Delhaize. With around 370,000 employees worldwide for more than 50 million customers per week. By doing better together and innovating every day, we strengthen our pioneering role. This way, we build trusted local brands. You will find your new workplace at the vibrant office of Ahold Delhaize in Zaandam, with the GSO (Global Support Office), to be precise. GSO sets global strategic frameworks, facilitates sharing best practices, and encourages economies of scale for the entire organization.
What do we offer?

Here at Ahold Delhaize, we aim to grow. This is only possible if you grow along with us. That’s why we help you take your career and personal development in the direction you want to go. As we work together to build on our brand as well as your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week):
A competitive salary up to 80K gross annually
Access to best-in-class guidance and inspiring training to shape your development and career.
20 vacation days, and Personal Budget for you to decide whether to spend it on 12,5 extra vacation days, discounts, or a pay-out.
Flexible working hours.
A laptop and telephone.
An excellent pension plan with a personal contribution of 6.2%
A travel allowance for traveling to and from Zaandam.
A bonus on top of your salary.
Attractive discounts on various insurance policies.
10% discount on your grocery shopping in our Albert Heijn stores, up to €300 per year.
Covid-19

Our main priority continues to be the health and safety of our employees and customers. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, this position will be remote until further notice. We will continue to monitor the circumstances, and when we feel comfortable, this position will return to our Headquarters in Zaandam. There you will have the opportunity to collaborate face-to-face with a talented and diverse group of colleagues. This also means that all job interviews for this position will take place through video calls.
Requirements

At Ahold Delhaize, you work for one of the largest retailers in the world. To keep up with us, you are bursting with ambition. For this vacancy of Business Consultant IAM, you possess the ability to build effective relationships with colleagues and stakeholders to get the job done. You thrive in a dynamic and international work environment where planning and setting priorities are challenging. You complete this with:
a bachelor's degree from a relevant education such as computer science or IT.
3-5 years of experience within an Identity and Access Management domain.
A track record of coordinating changes in the IAM domain on a large scale.
Knowledge of Azure Active Directory, CyberArk PAM, and Saviynt.
Knowledge of IBM identity stack is a plus.
Nice-to-have:
CISSP, CISM, or Microsoft Certified: Azure Security Engineer Associate.
Apply now

Seeing is believing. This is true in our stores, as well as in our head office in Zaandam. It could be your new workplace, where you, as an IAM Business Consultant, have influence over the most renowned retail markets in the Netherlands. Apply now!

146,health,Indeed,p_f813a8cc3e2997f9,Digital Product Manager,ahold, Zaandam,"Your new job and office
Will you help enable us to offer the best-in-class customer experience across our global digital channels? Apply now for the role of Digital Product Manager at Ahold Delhaize.

Our Digital Product Managers are responsible for the evolution of our digital products – mobile and web – used by customers in-store, and online to order for delivery or pickup. Also, Digital Product Managers are responsible for the evolution of our digital capabilities – such as, payments and loyalty. They are responsible for understanding customer needs (consumer and brand customers), prioritizing solutions based on value in the product roadmap, and delivering product requirements (in the form of features and epics) and product design (in collaboration with the design team) to development teams. If you are a product manager with expertise in these areas, that this role is for you.

You will develop the product strategy and be responsible for the realization, in partnership with our design and development teams to deliver digital products and/or capabilities to our great local brands. You will help our customers make their online purchases quickly, easily and securely, and enable them to use our digital product to make their store visits more convenient.
As Digital Product Manager, you will make an impact at Ahold Delhaize by:
enabling best-in-class customer experiences across our channels (online and in-store)
defining, implementing and communicating our strategy across our business
defining the roadmap that delivers on the strategy, in collaboration with stakeholders
working with design, brands, IT, and other stakeholders to define the desired customer experience and to implement new capabilities and experiences
managing and working with our partners in the realization of the strategy
What do we offer?

Working as a Digital Product Manager you do at and with Ahold Delhaize. With around 370,000 employees worldwide for more than 50 million customers per week. On a slightly smaller scale you work with 1,500 colleagues from the Netherlands. By doing better together and innovating every day, we strengthen our pioneering role. And this way we also build trusted local brands. Strong brands where you will find a lot of knowledge, experience and effectiveness.

You will find your new workplace at our vibrant head office, right next to the Zaandam station. On the fifth floor within the Digital Experience Team, to be precise. Everything you do together with your colleagues is immediately visible in our stores and at people's homes. Curious about the people you work with directly? As Digital Product Manager you are part of the European Digital Organization responsible for all European brands of Ahold Delhaize in their respective countries like Albert, Mega Image and Maxi. Our Digital Organization designs digital products and services. Here you will work together with Product Managers, Program Managers and Designers to deliver the best customer experiences.
Covid-19

Our main priority continues to be the health and safety of our employees and customers. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, this position will be remote until further notice. We will continue monitor the circumstances and when we feel comfortable, this position will return to our bustling Headquarters in Zaandam, where you will have the opportunity to collaborate face-to-face with a talented and diverse group of colleagues.

At Ahold Delhaize we want to grow. That is only possible if you grow with us. That is why you can go in all directions with us career-wise and in your personal development. While we work together to build our brand and your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours a week):
a gross montly salary up to €7100,-
flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home.
a very good pension plan with a personal contribution of 6.2%.
reimbursement of your travel expenses to and from Zaandam.
20 vacation days.
a personal budget, which you can decide to spend on extra vacation days, discounts or pay-outs.
the possibility to attend training courses at our expense.
a bonus on top of your salary.
attractive discounts on various insurance policies.
a laptop and telephone.
a 10% discount on your grocery shopping in our Albert Heijn stores, up to € 300 per year.
regularly fun promotions and delicious tastings with free products.
Requirements

You have a real passion and a clear vision for the future of digital grocery customer experience, the ambition to bring that vision to life and the ability to drive initiatives, with minimal supervision. You will combine your relentless customer-focus with a strong sense of user experience, technical fluency and business acumen. You also have the ability to effectively operate in a large matrix organization and to work effectively with stakeholders and partners across the organization.
a Bachelor’s degree in Design, Technology or Business Studies
fluent and strong English communication skills (writing and speaking).
at least 7 years of experience working in e-commerce and digital.
experience in leading and running complex projects and/or programs.
a genuine passion for improving customer experiences.
a strong technical foundation and business acumen.
strong leadership and interpersonal skills.
efficient decision making skills
the ability to prioritize well.
the ability to anticipate and resolve problems.
a proven record of creative and critical thinking capabilities.
self-motivation and a clear dedication to your profession.
the ability to work well independently.
Apply now

Seeing is experiencing. This applies to our stores and certainly to our head office in Zaandam. Perhaps your new workplace where you as Digital Product Manager have an influence on the most famous Dutch retail brands. Apply now.
In addition, we would like to ask you not to send a standard motivation letter, but to formulate an answer to the following questions:
Why would you like to work for Ahold Delhaize?
Why do you think you will be successful in this position? Please avoid words which are already in the vacancy text, make it personal.
Please indicate one of your personal strengths and one skill you wish to improve or develop.

148,health,Indeed,pj_83015c7d8fc9ad55,Online Marketeer,APoint, AmsterdamZuidoost,"Wat ga je doen

Als Online Marketeer help je met het uitrollen van de online strategie van onze organisatie. Daarnaast help je ons door een (nieuw) Marketing Automation platform te implementeren.

Je komt terecht bij ons Marketing team dat bestaat uit een Teamleider Marketing en een marketing medewerker. Je gaat samenwerken met marketingbureaus om onze online marketing omgeving te optimaliseren. Je vindt het leuk om een professionaliseringsslag te maken door jouw kennis en ervaring met online marketing.

Je hebt een hands-on mentaliteit en krijgt dingen voor elkaar. Je kruipt graag in de huid van onze (potentiële) klanten om zo een optimale digitale customer journey te creëren.

Je beschikt over een relevante afgeronde HBO opleiding, aangevuld met tenminste 2 jaar relevante werkervaring

149,health,Indeed,p_0510ba7301893c26,Director UX Research,adidas, Amsterdam,"THE OPPORTUNITY
We're looking for a Director of UX Researcher to join our Amsterdam-based UX Research team.

We want our digital experiences to be intuitive and delightful to use but our scope runs far beyond usability testing. We ensure that the user is placed at the heart of the design process so that our products become truly relevant for them.

Our focus is exploring and identifying our users' intents and the related needs, expectations, and desires. We do so to understand why they exhibit certain behaviours or where their attitudes towards our digital experiences stem from.
These efforts culminate in valid, reliable, and objective insights for our teams. Our product is certainty - certainty in the decision to be made and certainty in the actions to be taken.
Key responsibilities
Promote a user-centric approach to product development by educating and inspiring others
Work closely with senior stakeholders to prioritise research opportunities
Hire great talent and combine the right practices, people, and tools to grow the research team
Translate business goals into actions and opportunities for your area
Set expectations and ambitions for your area and build a highly collaborative team culture
WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Our researchers are passionate user advocates and excellent communicators. We're looking for people who feel at home in a fast-paced product environment and are comfortable with context switching across a variety of initiatives and audiences.

You'll be creating a platform for your team to learn, grow, and deliver impact. You'll provide thought leadership and mentoring to empower your team to deliver well-informed, objective, data-oriented insights.
You're a good fit for the role if
You've spent 10+ years researching for diverse audiences and have experience leading teams
You can still get your hands dirty with projects and inform strategy and approach
You're an effective communicator and can present, debate, and form consensus on complex topics at all levels
You've got experience designing, leading, and implementing research projects at scale
You're passionate about evolving traditional research methods and exploring new ways of gathering insights
ABOUT US
At adidas we believe that through sport, we have the power to change lives.
There's plenty of change around right now as workouts move from the gym to the garage and we take a timeout from many of the activities we're passionate about.
Our ambition is to be the best sport brand in the world and with that comes plenty of challenges. We thrive on solving these with the imagination and experience of our incredible teammates.
We're all on the home team for now - we'd love for you to join ours.
WHAT YOU'LL GET

We get it, you want to know more than what we stock the fridges with. We asked our teammates for their favourite things about life at adidas, they said: the collaborative, supportive culture, the amazing team, and the sense of pride and purpose in their
work. You'll get all that, plus
Generous employee discount on our brands
Fitness activities
Opportunity to work for a truly global, multicultural team
Learning and development support
Discounted health insurance
HOW TO APPLY
Does this sound like your sort of challenge? We want to hear from you!
Though our teammates hail from all corners of the world, our working language is English so this is a requirement for all roles.

Hit 'Apply' and if you're a good fit for the role we'll reach out to chat.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=0510ba7301893c26&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=26f704532e7420c4&assa=663,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=0510ba7301893c26&fccid=8686937f641f561b&vjs=3,6 dagen geleden,6 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

151,health,Indeed,p_aa72b4be06b1dc16,Qesh Officer regio Noord,Kloosterboer, VelsenZuid,"QESH Officer (Regio Noord)
Ben je pragmatisch en ga je oplossingsgericht te werk? Heb je enkele jaren ervaring met QESH en ben je op zoek naar een veelzijdige functie waarin kwaliteit en veiligheid centraal staat?
Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!
Als QESH (Quality, Environment, Safety and Health) Officer ondersteun je, op het gebied van kwaliteit, milieu, veiligheid en gezondheid, de diverse Kloosterboer locaties in de regio Noord.

Je levert als QESH Officer een hands-on bijdrage aan het signaleren, ontwikkelen, implementeren, uniformeren, optimaliseren en zelfstandig borgen van de kwaliteit en veiligheid binnen de locaties IJmuiden/Velsen, Harlingen en Scheveningen.
Wat ga je doen, o.a.?
Is aanspreekpunt op gebied van QESH, zowel intern als voor derden
Ontwikkelt de benodigde processen aangaand veiligheidsbewustzijn op de locaties
Signaleert risico’s, adviseert, indien nodig ontwikkelt en geeft input naar anderen ten aanzien van gesignaleerde risico’s
Zorgt dat alle Qesh gerelateerd documentatie juist en volledig is
Ondersteunen/ voorbereiding bij een Interne audit gekoppeld aan vereisten voor certificaten (BRC, IFS, AEO...)
Maakt werkinstructies , loopt veiligheidsrondes (Site tour, brand apparatuur) volgt op en borgt in ons systeem
Contact persoon voor externe bedrijven gerelateerd aan Qesh.
Melden, verwerken, opnemen en opvolgen van incidenten
Draagt zorg voor ontruimingsoefeningen, goed werkend BHV team en up to date Contingency plan
Werkt samen met Kloosterboer Qesh team aan corporate thema’s
Geeft voorlichting, training, uitleg en toolboxen aan medewerkers met betrekking tot QESH
Adviseert en ondersteunt de General Managers van de diverse locaties
Kennis- en ervaringsvereisten
Je hebt een afgeronde Hbo-opleiding richting Mvk/HvK
Geeft training on the best practice
Gedegen kennis van veiligheidsprotocollen
3-5 jaar ervaring, waarvan 1-2 jaar ervaring in de logistiek of scheepvaart.
Ervaring
Werkervaring in de logistiek/scheepvaart, bij voorkeur in koel-/vriesterminal
Ervaring in een operationele omgeving loods/magazijn/scheepvaart.
Vaardigheden en eigenschappen
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift.
Pragmatisch
Flexibel
Hands on mentaliteit
Reisbereidheid
Wij bieden jou:
Een goed salaris, afhankelijk van ervaring en opleiding
De mogelijkheid om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen
Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden
Een dynamische omgeving bij een groeiende organisatie.
Wil jij bij Kloosterboer komen werken?
Solliciteer dan direct met je CV en korte motivatie. Heb je nog vragen? Bel dan met Vanessa Thijssen, via telefoonnummer 0251-261111 of mail naar vanessa.thijssen@kloosterboer.nl

Kloosterboer is een financieel sterk en onafhankelijk familiebedrijf, met haar oorsprong in 1925. Meer dan drie miljoen kubieke meter aan koel- en vriescapaciteit maakt Kloosterboer toonaangevend in de logistieke dienstverlening voor temperatuur gecontroleerde voedselproducten (o.a. vis, vlees, fruit, vruchtensappen- en concentraten, zuivel en aardappelproducten) in Europa.

Wij zijn gespecialiseerd in opslag, stuwadoren, forwarding, douaneafhandeling en het ontwikkelen van innovatieve supply chain oplossingen. Kloosterboer heeft meer dan 850 medewerkers in dienst en heeft vestigingen in IJmuiden, Velsen, Rotterdam, Vlissingen, Harlingen, Lelystad, Harnes (Frankrijk), Bayside (Canada), Dutch Harbor (Alaska), Zweden en Zuid-Afrika.

152,health,Indeed,p_8721f91244ba77a7,1854 - Clinical Research Associate (CRA),Certara, Amsterdam Westpoort,"At Certara, we accelerate medicines to patients by partnering with life science innovators.

In the past 6 years, over 90% of companies that received new drug approvals by the FDA used our software or services. Our integrated and proprietary end-to-end platform with bio simulation, regulatory science, and market access solutions combined with our strong team of scientists and subject matter experts enable our clients to have:
Informed decision-making & reduced clinical trial burden
Higher R&D productivity
Improved patient outcomes & increased patient access to medicines
Accelerated regulatory approval

Certara is a global team that fosters and nurtures a diverse and inclusive culture. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. The collective sum of our individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, and unique capabilities and talent represents a significant part of our culture, our reputation and our achievement.
Together with our partners, we use bio simulation and technology-enabled services to transform drug discovery and development across all therapeutic areas and innovative therapies.
Job Overview:

We are seeking to appoint an organized, flexible Clinical Research Associate (CRA) specialized in observational and real world evidence studies, to join our Clinical Operations Team. The successful candidate will work closely with a team of highly skilled epidemiologists, statisticians, health economists and consultants.
Main tasks & responsibilities
Maintaining oversight on site related activities throughout the life cycle of project performing:
Site Selection
column2: Start-up/regulatory
column3: Site Initiation
column4: Monitoring activities
column5: Close out visits plus maintaining appropriate documentation

column1: Manage the relations with the clinical centers with ad hoc remote and on-site monitoring
Manage the progress of assigned studies on recruitment and enrollment, Case Report Form (CRF) completion and submission, and data query generation and resolution.
Manage the regulatory submissions and approvals of the assigned studies in an international framework by completing the application to Ethics Committee/IRB and preparing necessary
documentation enclosed to the application according to local requirements and in cooperation with Project Manager.
Manage contracts and payments with the centers of the assigned studies, in cooperation with Project Manager and Finance and Legal departments.
Required Qualifications / Experience
A Masters’ degree in the Life Sciences
Minimum 3 years of prior work experience as a Clinical Research Associate
column2: startup of projects including regulatory submission process.

column1: Minimum 1+ year of experience in Independent Monitoring
Previous experience/work in several 5 EU countries is a plus.
Possess the understanding of Good Clinical Practice regulations and ICH guidelines
Required Skills
Professional proficiency in English, written and spoken. Any other language is a plus.
Ability to work both independently and as part of the team
Ability to effectively prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects
Ability and willingness to travel in accordance with company and project requirements
Good interpersonal skills demonstrated as proactive and enthusiastic
OTHER INFORMATION:
Number of Employees Supervised: None
Percentage of Travel Required: 10% travel
Place of work: Home-based/Office (depending on location)
