column1: 153,health,Indeed,pj_a7032cba32986550,"Head of Retail Marketing, Benelux",ColgatePalmolive, Amsterdam,"No Relocation Assistance Offered
# 96682 - Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, Netherlands
Today we are looking for :
Head of Retail Marketing Benelux
(Full time)

In this position we are looking for an innovative leader who brings strong strategic perspective and vision and is able to translate Hub/Divisional strategy on a Benelux level. S(he) plays a vital role in guiding the Marketing Team by overseeing the planning and prioritizing of the multiple marketing projects across teams and contributing to the diverse day-to-day activities and brand initiatives. In this role s(he) is encouraged to develop and lead the marketing team to increase their skills, productivity, and focus on high priority initiatives. Additionally (s)he will further the simplification and standardization of processes within the team’s working and thus increase results.

It is a visible position within the organization directly reporting to the Benelux General Manager, responsible for managing a medium size Marketing team (counting 14 permanent positions including 6 direct reports and 6-7 interns) as well as taking upon a broader set of responsibilities within the Benelux management team.
Key accountabilities and responsibilities:
Lead the monthly commercial process to monitor business health and identify appropriate plans and incremental opportunities to deliver and exceed KPIs
Drive the category Budget and Planning process including forecasting of volume, ASP, category dynamics, volume/value shares and relationship of shipments to consumption
Drive RGM (Revenue Growth Mgnt) thru intensive collaboration with Hub Mkt
column2: Finance
column3: and Customer Development

column1: Develop RE strategies and shopper solutions based on robust insight
Marketing activation and local touch point expertise
Co-Develop WE Hub/Benelux innovation grid based on Division grids. Influence division bundle development and timing to improve local success and identify further opportunities
Lead and develop the Benelux Retail Marketing team: Motivate, mentor and empower the team in the development and execution of best in brand and digital (retail-) marketing plans
Profile
Internationally mobile: Weesp (NL) and Brussels (BE) – expect to work at least 40% of time in each country
Bachelor degree required
column2: Master degree is a plus

column1: Minimum 8 years of work experience, ideally in the FMCG branch
column2: management experience is a plus!

column1: Fluent in English and Dutch, French is a big plus
An excellent communicator easily adapting communication towards different audiences in a clear, concise, and appropriate manner / an engaging storyteller to conduct customer presentations
A leader with effective managerial and interpersonal style fosters a strong sense of collaboration
A positive can-do attitude that persists regardless of challenges
Can easily manage the creative process and facilitate brainstorming, always remaining open to the ideas of the others
Thorough planning and priority setting and keeps sight of the overall view
Strong analytic and decision making skills facilitating deep commercial and financial understanding
Offer
A unique opportunity to be part of an ambitious and successful team
An attractive salary package including a 13th month and bonus
Professional advantages of a multicultural environment that supports your development and recognizes your achievements
International career possibilities
Interested? Click further on the ""Apply button”.

Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.

Are you interested in working for Colgate-Palmolive? You can apply online and attach all relevant documents such as a cover letter and resume or CV. Applications received by e-mail are not considered in the selection process. Become part of our team. We look forward to your application.

Colgate-Palmolive is a leading global consumer products company, tightly focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition. Colgate sells its products in over 200 countries and territories around the world under such internationally recognised brand names as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, Tom’s of Maine, Sorriso, Speed Stick, Lady Speed Stick, Softsoap, Irish Spring, Protex, Sanex, Elta MD, PCA Skin, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Science Diet and Hill’s Prescription Diet.

For more information about Colgate’s global business, visit the Company’s web site at http://www.colgatepalmolive.com. 154,health,Indeed,p_04f6cde4511caa17,Senior projectleider,BovenIJ Ziekenhuis, Amsterdam Noord,"De afdeling

Het projectbureau bestaat uit drie projectleiders en wordt op dit moment aangestuurd door de Chief Information Officer (CIO). Het projectbureau werkt nauw samen met adviseurs, BI specialisten en de enterprise architect.
De functie
Als senior projectleider draag je bij aan de implementatie van integrale, transmurale zorg waarbij intensief wordt meegewerkt met (eerstelijns) zorg en welzijnsorganisaties in de regio.

De (voornamelijk) strategische projecten die nu worden gestart zijn onderdeel van de transitie naar ‘zorg veilig thuis’ en ‘zorg op de juiste plek’. E-health en andere innovatieve ICT mogelijkheden en de daarbij horende proceswijzigingen spelen een grote rol.
Organisatie brede veranderingen, waarbij meerdere projecten en afdelingen betrokken zijn, vragen om een coherent en centraal gecoördineerd proces om bedrijfsdoelstellingen te behalen.

Als senior projectleider ben je verantwoordelijk voor het zelfstandig beheren en uitvoeren van complexe ziekenhuis brede en decentrale projecten, zodat resultaten tijdig, conform budget en volgens gespecificeerde kwaliteit behaald kunnen worden.

Je ondersteunt en adviseert bij de implementatie van beleid, om zo een bijdrage te leveren aan een optimale projectvoering. Bij het leiden van de projecten sta je in nauw contact met alle lagen van de organisatie. In je projectportfolio zullen zowel landelijke meerjarenprojecten zitten als kortdurende interne projecten.
Wij vragen

Je bent een enthousiaste en daadkrachtige projectleider met ruime ervaring. Je bent stressbestendig, hebt een flexibele werkhouding en kunt snel schakelen tussen de verschillende partijen die iets van je vragen.
Daarvoor is het van belang dat jij goede communicatieve en sociale vaardigheden bezit. Je kan goed omgaan met weerstand, bent invoelend, en hebt overtuigingskracht.
Tevens voldoe je aan de volgende eisen en competenties:
aantoonbaar academisch werk- en denk niveau
ruime ervaring met proces- en informatieanalyses, procesverbetering en verandermanagement in complexe organisaties
ervaring in de gezondheidszorg is een pre
minimaal 5 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als projectleider
je bent een teamspeler die ook goed in staat is om zelfstandig te werken
uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, zowel in woord als geschrift
Wij bieden
Het motto van ons ziekenhuis is: “Zorg goed voor elkaar!” Vandaar dat je als (toekomstig) collega kan rekenen op:
een arbeidsovereenkomst voor 24-36 uur per week, voor de duur van één jaar met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband
voor deze functie gelden de arbeidsvoorwaarden conform de CAO ziekenhuizen.
salaris-inschaling ligt maximaal in functiegroep 65 (maximaal € 5.620,- bruto per maand op full time basis)
standaard valt onder onze beloning een vakantietoeslag van 8,33% en een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,33%.
daarnaast bieden wij een goed pakket aan secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een meerkeuzesysteem arbeidsvoorwaarden (MKSA).
Meer informatie?

Voor meer informatie over deze vacature en de sollicitatieprocedure kan contact worden opgenomen met Rob Vandewynckel, recruiter, via telefoonnummer 020- 634 6371.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=04f6cde4511caa17&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=7f898e90d4f6e992&assa=9722,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=04f6cde4511caa17&fccid=2204261f9fb76c32&vjs=3,6 dagen geleden,6 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
155,health,Indeed,p_c3d55af31004fd7f,Lead Market Access Specialist EMEA (remotely),Dexcom, Amsterdam,"About Dexcom

Dexcom, Inc. empowers people to take control of diabetes through innovative continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) systems. Headquartered in San Diego, California, Dexcom has emerged as a leader of diabetes care technology. By listening to the needs of users, caregivers, and providers, Dexcom simplifies and improves diabetes management around the world.
Summary

We’re on a mission to bring the benefits of our life-changing CGM systems to even more patients around the world. That is why we’re looking for a Market Access Manager to help us open up new markets across the EMEA region.
What is involved?

The EMEA market access team drives activities for strategic plans and opportunities to open markets for new products as well as expanding into new market segments and geographies. They lead research and analysis of the market in terms of coverage and reimbursement, existing and emerging payer policies, competitive landscape, trends, pricing, contracting strategies, potential barriers to provider and patient access. They provide information and support to engage with key opinion leaders, pertaining to improved outcomes and public policy matters.

As a Lead market access specialist, you will be an integral part of the EMEA market access team and participate in EMEA wide strategy development and projects. You will also be responsible for developing, and overseeing implementation of market access strategies and tactics for dedicated geographies within EMEA, including stakeholder engagement strategies and tactics to drive the funding and uptake of Dexcom products, HTA submissions, value based contracting strategies etc as applicable. You will be working closely with the Global and International Access teams to establish appropriate evidence and documentation including health economic data and arguments to be used for reimbursement and product positioning, and communication to and with third party payers, government entities and other market access partners, e.g. Government Affairs.

This role is a great opportunity make a profound difference to the lives of people living with diabetes, by helping us make Dexcom products available to the millions of people who could benefit from our CGM technology.
What you’ll need
Education and experience in a relevant field, e.g. health economics, health policy, public health
Knowledge of market access for diabetes products or related medical devices
Experience of the medical device industry
Experience with HTA submission in larger European markets is useful
Business/marketing or sales experience and the ability to link this insight to funding and reimbursement in-market
Fluency in English. Fluence in another European language is a plus
Experience of working and contributing within in a matrix organisation, including global and national MA teams
Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization
Functional Description: Professional Individual Contributor

Supports activities for strategic plans and opportunities to open markets for new products. Researches and conducts analysis of the market in terms of coverage and reimbursement, existing and emerging payer policies, competitive landscape, trends, pricing, contracting strategies, potential barriers to provider and patient access. Provides information and support to influence key opinion leaders, pertaining to improved outcomes and public policy matters.
Experience and Education Requirements
Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 8-12 years of related experience. At this level a graduate degree may be desirable with 4 years of related experience.
Travel Required
Functional/Business Knowledge
Having wide-ranging experience and uses professional concepts and knowledge of company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.
Possesses knowledge of advanced concepts, techniques, and standards.
Viewed as expert in the field within the Function.
Scope
Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation.
Work is reviewed upon completion for adequacy in meeting objectives.
Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise.
Judgement
Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.
Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignment.
Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and may coordinate activities of other colleagues.
Dexcom offers
An exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic, innovative and progressive multinational organisation.
You will be part of a high growth company with a true purpose and have the ability to shape and influence, making a real difference to those living with Diabetes.
Opportunity to carve out a long-term career.
Access to outstanding training and development programmes.
Work with over 5,000 awesome colleagues in an open, fast-paced and fun working environment.
We welcome applications from, and actively seek to recruit disabled people.

To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Dexcom. Only authorized staffing and recruiting agencies may use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes on specific requisitions. Dexcom does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to the Talent Acquisition team, Dexcom employees or any other company location. Dexcom is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=c3d55af31004fd7f&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=741015c0a2901274&assa=775,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=c3d55af31004fd7f&fccid=57e4f1a84f2d849b&vjs=3,6 dagen geleden,6 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
156,health,Indeed,p_80bc1e4a5ea01b8d,Associate Director Digital Strategy Support,Teva Pharmaceuticals, Amsterdam,"Company Info

Teva is a global pharmaceutical leader and the world's largest generic medicines producer, committed to improving health and increasing access to quality health solutions worldwide. Our employees are at the core of our success, with colleagues in over 80 countries delivering the world's largest medicine cabinet to 200 million people every day. We offer a uniquely diverse portfolio of products and solutions for patients and we've built a promising pipeline centered around our core therapeutic areas. We are continually developing patient-centric solutions and significantly growing both our generic and specialty medicines business through investment in research and development, marketing, business development and innovation. This is how we improve health and enable people to live better, healthier lives. Join us on our journey of growth!
Your role:

The Associate Director Digital Strategy Support is responsible for supporting subsidiaries in identifying digital opportunities, building & executing their multichannel plans. The candidate will also help identifying & managing the experimental digital project, aiming at providing commercial value leveraging innovative tools & techniques.
Key responsibilities:
For a number of Teva subsidiaries :
Provide ad hoc support to help them build, formalize and update digital / multichannel strategy, tactics and KPIs, e.g. through workshops
Conduct annual digital projects identification, analysis & prioritization exercises, as part of teva’s Annual Operating Plan
Where needed, facilitate local projects execution, working with local teams, IT and other members of the Digital Centre of Excellence team
Maintain through regular contact an up-to-date & formalized view of their digital maturity, stakeholders & initiatives
Act as their trusted voice in interactions with other members of the Digital Centre of Excellence Team & other central teams
Help grow their overall digital capabilities, through sourcing & sharing best practice.
Identify & manage experimental digital project, aiming at providing commercial value leveraging innovative tools & techniques – e.g. data science.
Your profile:
Knowledge:
5+ years’ experience in customer-driven marketing, sales and digital / multi-channel, consulting
Experience in pharma / healthcare is a plus, though not a pre-requisite
Previous experience with driving implementation of multichannel strategies & tactics
Successful track record of change management ability
Experience in a pan-market/region environment
Experience with coaching and training in the digital space.
Skills/qualifications:
Ability to drive change, regardless of ambiguity
Takes charge, inspires and get things done
Is proactive
Finds innovative opportunities for collaboration and driving change
Analytical strength with proven ability to gain insights from data to inform strategy
Relentless customer focus
Job conditions:
Able to work in a changing and flexible environment
International travel (approximately 35%).
Function
Marketing
Sub Function
Brand Marketing
Reports To:
Director and Head of Digital Strategy and Engagement
Already Working @TEVA?

If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on ""Employee Central"". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site

The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=80bc1e4a5ea01b8d&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=a9ae0a8b8ba364ba&assa=2059,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=80bc1e4a5ea01b8d&fccid=898362c5e54ec4c7&vjs=3,6 dagen geleden,6 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
157,health,Indeed,p_308327e72dc5df43,PhD student ‘kanker en individuele plaatsing en steun (IPS)’,Academisch Medisch Centrum, Amsterdam,"Wat ga je doen

Je werkt aan het project: ‘Individuele Plaatsing en Steun (IPS) aan mensen die werkloos of (gedeeltelijk) arbeidsongeschikt zijn na diagnose en behandeling van kanker’. In dit project wordt een IPS interventie opgezet en geëvalueerd, waarin voor (ex-)kankerpatiënten, die momenteel geen werk hebben, maar wel graag willen werken én direct inzetbaar zijn, gezocht wordt naar werk dat zij graag willen doen. Als een werkplek is gevonden, start de persoon direct met werken. Gedurende de eerste maanden op deze nieuwe werkplek wordt deze persoon vervolgens ondersteund met individuele coaching van een gespecialiseerde job coach. Als PhD student ontwikkel je de IPS interventie op basis van bestaande IPS interventies, een literatuurstudie en interviews met verschillende betrokkenen (zoals werkgevers, job coaches, job recruiters en (ex-)kankerpatiënten). Vervolgens voer je een gerandomiseerd gecontroleerd onderzoek (RCT) uit om de (kosten-)effectiviteit van de ontwikkelde IPS interventie te evalueren. Hier horen verschillende werkzaamheden bij, zoals het schrijven van een METC aanvraag, het werven van studiedeelnemers, het verzamelen en analyseren van data, het schrijven van (wetenschappelijke) publicaties en het presenteren van resultaten op nationale en internationale congressen. Tot slot ontwikkel je in samenwerking met verschillende betrokkenen een implementatieplan dat als doel heeft om de impact van de IPS interventie in de praktijk te optimaliseren. In deze uitdagende functie werk je als PhD student nauw samen met verschillende betrokken onderzoekers van het Amsterdam UMC en met professionals uit de praktijk (zoals job coaches en werkgevers). Daarnaast sta je in contact met experts vanuit verschillende instanties en praktijkorganisaties zoals de GGZ, oPuce en het UWV. Het onderzoek wordt gefinancierd door KWF Kankerbestrijding. De sollicitatiegesprekken zijn gepland op 5 maart 2021 en 11 maart 2021.
Wat we van je verwachten

We zijn op zoek naar een enthousiaste onderzoeker die zich zowel in de academische wereld als in de praktijk thuis voelt. Je hebt een academische opleiding afgerond, bijvoorbeeld gezondheidswetenschappen, psychologie, geneeskunde, gedrags- en maatschappijwetenschappen, of een gelijkwaardige studie

Je hebt uitstekende organisatorische en sociale eigenschappen. Hiermee ben je een echte verbinder tussen partijen met verschillende belangen, bijvoorbeeld tussen wetenschappelijke disciplines en professionals uit de praktijk

Je bent analytisch sterk, neemt eigen initiatief, en bent creatief in het vinden van oplossingen voor problemen die het werken in een complexe omgeving met zich meebrengt en je bezit het zelfvertrouwen en doorzettingsvermogen om deze problemen ook daadwerkelijk op te lossen
Je hebt uitstekende presentatievaardigheden en vindt het ook leuk om te presenteren voor wisselende (inter-)nationale doelgroepen
Je hebt kennis van en/of affiniteit met oncologische aandoeningen en met het onderwerp arbeid
Je hebt ervaring met zowel kwalitatieve als kwantitatieve onderzoeksmethoden
Je bezit uitstekende schrijfvaardigheden, zowel in het Nederlands als het Engels
Ervaring met IPS is een pre.
Ervaring met het schrijven van wetenschappelijke artikelen is een pre.
Waar ga je werken

Het onderzoek wordt uitgevoerd binnen de afdeling Public and Occupational Health van het Amsterdam UMC. De missie van deze afdeling is kwalitatief hoogwaardig onderzoek uit te voeren op het terrein van de publieke gezondheid en arbeidsgeneeskunde. Met dit onderzoek beogen we wetenschappelijke kennis te genereren die kan worden ingezet ter bevordering van de volksgezondheid, in verschillende settings. Hierin wordt expliciet samengewerkt met professionals uit de praktijk, om de maatschappelijke impact van deze wetenschappelijke kennis en van ontwikkelde interventies in de praktijk te vergroten.
Wat we je bieden

Wij bieden je ruime gelegenheid tot ontplooiing, verdieping en verbreding, extra scholing en een plek om te groeien! Werken bij Amsterdam UMC betekent werken in een inspirerende en professionele omgeving waar ontwikkeling, in alle opzichten, wordt gestimuleerd.
Het salaris bedraagt maximaal €2.495,- bruto per maand op basis van 36 uur in het eerste jaar, oplopend tot €3.196,- bruto per maand in het vierde jaar (conform OIO schaal CAO UMC).
Het salaris is exclusief vakantiegeld (8%) en een eindejaarsuitkering (8,3%).
Wij bieden een contract voor 48 maanden.
Naast uitstekende bereikbaarheid met het OV, zijn er voor medewerkers ook parkeerplaatsen beschikbaar.
Pensioen wordt opgebouwd bij Be Frank.
Kijk voor een overzicht van al onze andere arbeidsvoorwaarden op https://werkenbijamc.nl/arbeidsvoorwaarden-amr/
Laten we kennis maken
Wil je direct solliciteren? Gebruik dan de knop ‘solliciteren’ op deze pagina.

Wil je eerst meer informatie? Neem dan gerust contact op met Angela de Boer (UHD), via a.g.deboer@amsterdamumc.nl of Saskia Duijts (Onderzoeker), via s.duijts@amsterdamumc.nl of Michiel Greidanus (Post doc), via m.a.greidanus@amsterdamumc.nl.
De sollicitatiegesprekken zijn gepland op 5 maart 2021 en 11 maart 2021.
Wij zien uit naar onze kennismaking!

LET OP: In verband met de bestuurlijke fusie tussen AMC en VUmc, geldt voor deze vacature dat medewerkers van AMC én VUmc plaatsnemen in de selectiecommissie. Door jouw sollicitatie te versturen, ga je ermee akkoord dat jouw CV en Motivatiebrief door AMC ook gedeeld worden met (de bij de behandeling van deze vacature betrokken medewerkers van) VUmc en zij dus inzage hebben in de door jou opgestuurde persoonsgegevens.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=308327e72dc5df43&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=7c4f0a7bf3cd4ebf&assa=5993,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=308327e72dc5df43&fccid=280e9a541be45c33&vjs=3,16 dagen geleden,16 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

158,health,Indeed,p_6f5699399856df5a,EMEA Channel Marketing Manager,Infoblox, Amsterdam,"As the EMEA Channel Marketing Manager, you will provide strategic direction and support for execution to field marketing teams across EMEA. You will do this by driving marketing campaigns with and through the key resellers and distributors to end-customers across the regions. You will build the channel marketing program strategy, orchestrate the delivery of demand-gen journeys, and manage the tools needed to activate our European partner community to support scale partner-led demand generation strategy.

This position can be based in the UK, Amsterdam, or Germany and will report to the Vice President of Marketing based in the US. You will be part of a very close-knit team of field marketers who are equal parts creative, data-driven, and passionate. If you enjoy an environment where you have the freedom to experiment and continuously test new ideas, then this is the opportunity for you!
Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Marketing, Sales, and Channel team to determine programmatic market-, region- and partner-specific strategies, including support/participation in local shows and events, serving as the business product and program expert

Develop and manage the EMEA channel co-marketing strategy (both to and through) to deliver relevant, local marketing and demand-generation initiatives in tight collaboration with the partner managers and field marketing
Develop, with key stakeholders, the relevant KPIs and Channels performance metrics, ensuring that marketing strategies are appropriately targeted
Drive marketing programs with key tech partners i.e., Palo
Work with EMEA distribution partners to drive their Infoblox marketing strategy
Partner with the Product Marketing team to develop channel strategies for new product launches
Measure, analyze, and report on channel pipeline building activities to understand the contribution to pipeline health and to evaluate marketing effectiveness/return on investment
Partner with the customer advocacy team to grow the pipeline of public customer references for EMEA via the channel
Requirements:
BS in Marketing or related field
8+ years of technology channel marketing experience, ideally in enterprise security or networking
Proven success developing and executing channel marketing plans that address various buying cycle stages and personas
Deep expertise in a wide variety of demand generation tactics – particularly co-marketing, digital, and social
Preferably knowledge with partner success management or channel marketing tools, such as Zift
Adept at balancing and negotiating the needs of the region with the demands from corporate
Strong influencing and diplomacy skills – proven ability to get buy-in across a variety of stakeholders
Ability to work effectively with all levels of management and functional disciplines
Experience working with PR agencies a plus
Willing to travel 20-25% within Europe, and at least 2 times per year to the Corporate headquarters in the US.
Fluency in English

It’s an exciting time to be at Infoblox. We are the market leader in technology for network control. Our success depends on bright, energetic, talented people who share a passion for excellence in building the next generation of networking technologies—and having fun along the way. Infoblox offers a fast-paced, action-oriented environment. We promote a culture that embraces innovation, change, teamwork, and strong partnerships. Join the winning Infoblox team—our future looks bright, and so will yours. To check out what it’s like to be a Bloxer click here.

159,health,Indeed,p_953b2a6a42cafee2,Website & Content Specialist,SkinVision, Amsterdam Noord,"Did you know that 1 in 5 people get skin cancer during their lifetime? Not many people do, you can help change that.

At SkinVision, every single day is an opportunity to make a difference. We are on a mission to saving the lives of 250,000 people in the next ten years by revolutionizing the way we care about our skin. Our technology allows users to take ownership of their health, recognising signs of skin cancer from anywhere, at any time.

We are hiring a Website & Content Specialist who will play an invaluable role in helping skinvision.com to become the single most trusted and valued website for skin cancer, driving traffic to our website and creating engaging content that embodies our values as a company and business.
Do you see yourself in the description above and want to be part of this exciting journey? Please read on.

The Website & Content Specialist is responsible for the upkeep of skinvision.com, the company’s most important communication tool with all its stakeholders. The website is our content hub and the content we create for our website will be redeployed across other communication platforms like social media channels, the SkinVision app, PR, conferences and presentations. We expect you to produce content that underpins our values, drives brand quality and trust. As part of our growth strategy we want you to help us optimise the web to app conversion. This implies close collaboration with our product teams as well our customer success and commercial teams.
Daily Drivers
Ensure that skinvison.com is up to date and functions properly
Develop content for our website, e.g. client testimonials, health care professional content, brand partnerships
Ensure that our site is optimized (SEO) and steer paid digital efforts for SEA, paid social
Develop content for other channels, e.g. social media, healthcare partners (insurance companies) and key markets (NL, Ger, UK, AUS)
Develop the customer success team with content for user newsletters
Support our PR Manager with content
Manage relationships with external partners like media-agencies, Google, advertising agency
Create and manage the content calendar of Skinvision.com and our social media
What you will bring in
Proficiency in both Dutch and English is a must
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Advertising or related discipline
3-5 years of professional experience in digital, content marketing and/or brand storytelling
Experience managing/developing/implementing social media & email campaigns.
Prior experience writing email, blog, and social content for both broad and persona-based audiences
Knowledge of digital marketing tools and Content Management Systems such as LeanPlum (or comparable email automation platforms)
Understanding of (content) marketing tactics, such as SEO, digital advertising and social media marketing
Highly motivated and self-starting with a full understanding of the product you’re promoting
Experience optimizing/iterating upper-funnel campaigns
Excellent analytical, (verbal) communication and presentation skills
Strong Google Analytics/ Firebase, WordPress and Adobe Acrobat/Illustrator skills
Able to work closely with internal marketing/content/PR roles to create campaigns
Not sure if you are qualified?

Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women tend to only apply only when they check every box. If you feel energised by our mission and would like to use your first-class talent to accelerate the growth of SkinVision but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still apply. We'd love to receive your application and see if you could be a great fit.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 160,health,Indeed,p_030770f2e8ebfbe5,DIRECTOR OF EXPERIENCE DESIGN - CATEGORY EXPERIENCE,adidas, Amsterdam,"THE OPPORTUNITY
We're looking for a Director of Experience Design to join our Amsterdam-based Category Experience Design team.
We understand the different consumer needs applied to the context of categories and brand moments. Our aim is to deliver a seamless, premium experience across all digital touch points.

With our focus on categories, we create a deep understanding of the consumer needs and uncover business opportunities through ongoing discovery and delivery work. We're the category experts, working horizontally across the business and enabling premium experiences along the user journey. With the same dedication we are supporting the biggest brand moments, translating the brand ambition into experience directions that empowers brand messaging and commerce on our digital touch points.
Key responsibilities
Partner with Product and Tech to set the category experience vision
column2: plan short-, mid- and long-term business outcomes and design deliverables per category

column1: Become the expert for categories for digital touchpoints in close alignment with the business units
Collaborate horizontally across the organization, connect product to brand, content, and other relevant teams
Bring the consumer voice to every project, identify opportunities and gaps in insights
Bring your thought leadership to our design process and tools
Guide, mentor, and inspire your teams
Set expectations and build a highly collaborative team culture
Partner with cross-functional specialists and evolve product development processes
Hire great talent and combine the right practices, people, and tools to grow the design team
Build relationships with key stakeholders and promote product and experience strategy throughout our org
WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR
We're looking for experience design leaders who can mature our practice and set visions.

Our designers are passionate, outspoken advocates for our users' needs and aren't afraid to shake things up. We want innovators and experts who can help mature our practice and create delightful experiences that feel distinctly adidas.
You're a good fit for the role if
You've spent 10+ years delivering excellent design solutions and have experience leading teams
You're most at home in an agile/Scrum environment and can test, validate, and iterate on your solutions
You have experience growing high-volume businesses and achieving results
You're an effective communicator and can present, debate, and form consensus on complex topics at all levels
You're flexible and quick to adapt. Whether it's the fidelity of your designs, the direction of your roadmap, or your style of communication
You champion accessibility and inclusivity throughout the user journey
You can translate business goals into actions and opportunities for your area
You're familiar with reporting, KPI creation, and extracting insights from complex dashboards
Bonus points for
Experience building global products (international audiences, multiple languages, etc.)
Knowledge of or experience with front-end technologies
Experience with product management
ABOUT US
At adidas we believe that through sport, we have the power to change lives.
There's plenty of change around right now as workouts move from the gym to the garage and we take a timeout from many of the activities we're passionate about.
Our ambition is to be the best sport brand in the world and with that comes plenty of challenges. We thrive on solving these with the imagination and experience of our incredible teammates.
We're all on the home team for now - we'd love for you to join
ours.
WHAT YOU'LL GET

We get it, you want to know more than what we stock the fridges with. We asked our teammates for their favourite things about life at adidas, they said: the collaborative, supportive culture, the amazing team, and the sense of pride and purpose in their
work. You'll get all that, plus
Generous employee discount on our brands
Fitness activities
Opportunity to work for a truly global, multicultural team
Learning and development support
Discounted health insurance
HOW TO APPLY
Please note: though our teammates hail from all corners of the world, our working language is English so this is a requirement for all roles.
Hit 'Apply' and submit your CV along with a portfolio or samples of work that showcase your craft expertise.

If you're a good fit for the role we'll reach out to chat.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=030770f2e8ebfbe5&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=b539ab809e850523&assa=1322,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=030770f2e8ebfbe5&fccid=8686937f641f561b&vjs=3,16 dagen geleden,16 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
161,health,Indeed,p_6ac1dbd9be3c9eaf,Agile Lead,albertheijn, Zaandam,"Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek

Join AH Technology: Reinventing Food Retail every day. Ensuring the delivery of valuable digital solutions that comply with the highest quality standards, for millions of daily users of ah.nl and the AH app.

As Agile Lead for the AH Technology domain Marketing & Inspire, you set clear working procedures for our teams. You make sure these teams work in a uniform way, that the same optimized processes are followed and you ensure an efficient handover. Your efforts help the teams deliver extremely good performance. More specifically, as Agile Lead you:
are a valued coach, who facilitates and removes obstacles.
put the organization in a position to deliver value as quickly as possible.
ensure this is done using the most efficient and effective process.
create transparency in the organization’s performance, and support continuous improvement.
work perfectly with the Head of Tech Marketing & Inspire and Product Managers from the Product Organization.
Your new office

Albert Heijn, part of Ahold Delhaize, is the number one omnichannel food retailer in the Netherlands. We’ve been inspiring customers and building trust for more than 130 years. We like to say, “we’re always there for you.” And with more than 1000 stores in the Netherlands and Belgium and 24/7 shopping on ah.nl, it’s truer than ever! But now we want to take our business to the next level. By making better food accessible to everyone – and making shopping fit the way people live today.

By joining our team you are part of AH Technology, where you can make your mark on the daily lives of millions of people. AH Technology is a department transcending community consisting of the departments Data, Digital and Tech within Albert Heijn. Our smart professionals create digital solutions that make (online) shopping simpler and more inspiring. We’re continually rethinking the way people shop, pay and even enjoy food. That’s why we’re investing heavily in data, digital and tech. To further transform Albert Heijn into a leading Food & Tech company.

Curious about your colleagues? At AH Technology you work with the best experts in the field. In an open environment, where expertise is valued, where we learn from each other and have the freedom to innovate. You will work in a new domain within the Customer Technology platform called Marketing & Inspire. This new department has about 45 members of staff and various teams, with 7 members on average in each team, mainly DevOps Engineers and Product Owners. You also work with Agile Lead professionals from other technology domains. Are you going to help us to continue to build a successful IT organization? For more information about AH Technology, you can also visit our Stack Overflow page: https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/ah-technology-albert-heijn
Covid-19

Our main priority continues to be the health and safety of our employees and customers. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, this position will be remote until further notice. We will continue to monitor the circumstances and when we feel comfortable, this position will return to our Headquarters in Zaandam. There you will have the opportunity to collaborate face-to-face with a talented and diverse group of colleagues. This also means that all job interviews for this position will take place through video calls.
Dit bieden we jou
At AH Technology we aim to grow, and this is only possible if you grow along with us. And as we work together to build on our brand and your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week):
A competitive annual salary up to €85.000 gross.
A bonus on top of your salary.
20 vacation days and a Personal Budget for you to decide whether to spend it on 12.5 extra vacation days, discounts or a pay-out.
Flexible working hours.
An excellent pension plan with a personal contribution of 6.2%.
A travel allowance for traveling to and from Zaandam.
Attractive discounts on various insurance policies.
10% staff discount on groceries in all Albert Heijn stores, up to €300 discount a year.
A laptop and telephone.
Dit breng je mee
At AH Technology you'll be working for one of the biggest food retailers in the Netherlands. To become successful as our new Agile Lead you bring:
an HBO certificate.
certification as Professional Scrum Master I, a higher level is a bonus.
knowledge and experience on scaling up Agile, for example via the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), LeSS and Nexus. Certification in one of these areas is a bonus.
at least 5 years’ experience as Agile Coach/Scrum Master for multiple teams within a corporate IT environment. Experience in the field of Marketing Tech would be a major advantage.
outstanding command of Dutch and English.
a highly communicative personality with the ability to motivate people.
a natural affinity for stakeholder management.
Apply now

Do you want to play an active role in changing the food retail landscape as we know it? Then hop on board and join us on our expedition. Apply online, no later than Monday February 22. Would you like to learn more first, before you apply to AH Technology? Eva Kuijer, Talent Acquisition Partner – Technology, will be happy to tell you everything about this vacancy and AH Technology through eva.kuijer@aholddelhaize.com.
HBO
Senior
IT
NLD-Zaandam, Provincialeweg 11

162,health,Indeed,p_f43650e80e63b8d9,Board Director,Alimentiv, AmsterdamZuidoost,"Alimentiv Holdings Board Director Recruitment
About Us:

On May 1, 2018, Dr. John McDonald settled the Health Academic Research Trust (now Alimentiv Health Trust) with the purpose of developing health care innovation through investment in human health initiatives, research, and commercial entities and fostering collaboration and commitment among stakeholders. The beneficiaries of the Trust are the employees of those enterprises it holds.

Alimentiv Health Trust companies are built on the Evergreen principles that prioritize purpose and growing enduring companies to make a long-term difference in the world for 100+ years. Rather than the value of an exit strategy, we focus on how well an Alimentiv enterprise achieves its purpose. By following the core values of Evergreen companies (purpose, perseverance, people first, profit, paced growth and pragmatic innovation), we will positively impact our employees, sponsors, partners and the communities we serve. Alimentiv Holdings Inc sits directly under the Trust and owns the subsidiary companies. It supports both the Trust’s mission and the subsidiary companies’ strategies and operations.

The primary holding of Alimentiv Holdings is Alimentiv Inc (formerly Robarts Clinical Trials). Founded in 1986 at the University of Western Ontario, Alimentiv Inc is a contract research organization that has leveraged its internationally recognized academic research together with its commercial offerings to become the premier provider of GI clinical trial services. Headquartered in London, Ontario Canada and having offices in San Diego, USA and Amsterdam Netherlands, Alimentiv Inc has a global presence of nearly 400 employees offering its services to a broad number of pharmaceutical and biotech partners.
For more information on the Trust, our values and the primary holding, Alimentiv Inc. please go to https://alimentiv.com
We are currently recruiting for Board members for this entity.

The fundamental responsibility of the board of directors (the “Board”) of Alimentiv Holdings is to appoint a competent executive leader(s) and oversee the strategy and management of any subsidiary companies with a view to creating a collaborative, stable & rewarding global organization that fulfills its Trust mandate. Specifically, the Board will:
provide executive team oversight and support
ensure operational effectiveness and financial reporting
implement and monitor Board process and effectiveness
maintain investments in areas of interest to human health and maximize research gains
maximize beneficiary value and
ensure the corporation conducts itself in an ethical and legal manner and supports diversity and inclusion via an appropriate system of corporate governance and internal controls.
The Board collectively should possess a broad range of skills, expertise, industry experience and operational knowledge. Specifically, our current search is focused on those with the following:
start up and high growth operations and investment experience
current operations experience in a CRO or specialty pathology laboratory
leadership experience in human resources, data privacy, software development/commercialization

Preference will be given to candidates who reside or have deep business experience in the US, EU or Asia-Pacific and we are actively seeking to diversify our Board. This is a remunerated position. Time commitment: 4-5 meetings/year (1-2 in-person assuming safe travel conditions). Direct questions to recruitment@alimentiv.com",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 163,health,Indeed,p_90dbf1a9cfdeb97e,Red Team Manager,PwC, Amsterdam,"As we aim to rapidly grow our Cyber Security, Forensics & Privacy practice, we are looking for experienced consultants who are passionate about how strategy and technology can improve the role of cyber security, privacy and data protection in our digital world.

This team works on creating a more security society for major International and local organisations. Together with 150 professionals in the Netherlands you could work on leading and cutting edge projects covering the whole scope of Cyber Security from
column2: From Ethical Hacking to Threat Detection and Forensic Research both preventing and solving cybercrime. Also covering Privacy, Compliance, Policy & Governance to Security Architecture and implementation, to Identity and Access Management.

column1: If you want to deep dive into the possibilities of a Technology career at PwC take a look here: Technology_careers_PwC_Netherlands

Are you the next leader of our offensive security team? Do you have red team experience, are you a specialist on offensive security and do you want to inspire and lead our strong team? Then come and join us!
Responsibilities

You will have a number of responsibilities and we promise that no day as (Sr.) Red team manager will be the same. This is because your focus will still be on maintaining and leading the relationships with our clients, but you will also coach and lead the current red team members on their performances. Your responsibilities will consist out of the following tasks:
Operate and deliver red team operations at clients
Innovate and keep developing the approach to align with relevant TTP's and trends
Coach team members in the offensive security team
Lead client discussions, sales and delivery of advanced security testing.

In summary, in this role you will drive, deliver and further develop our red team operations portfolio. You will translate TTP's into new approaches, tools & content. For our clients you will be a trusted adviser for helping our clients defend against advanced motivated attackers. You will lead client discussions, presentations, sales opportunities regarding advanced security testing. All in all, you will be managing all main red team operation assignments. Last but not least: For your co-workers, you will share knowledge and will coach them to the next level.
Requirements

You are an experienced professional, working in this specific domain for over 5 years. Working in a red team does not contain any secrets for you, and your current colleagues often come to you when they encounter a problem. Preferably, you have experience as a manager already or have experience with leading teams in a project management environment.
Furthermore, you have these skills/ capabilities:
Deep understanding of attacker's tools, tactics and procedures (TTP)
Apply and customize TTP's to leverage at clients
Thorough understanding of detection, monitoring and IOC's
Out of the box thinker, able to come up with new solutions when others fail (eg: ""try harder"" attitude).

We prefer that you have a working background on an academic level (BSc or MSc). In your CV and motivation letter you will need to demonstrate that you mastered the above mentioned skills. We care more about your actual experience than your study background. However, the following backgrounds are usual suspects:
Computer science
Security and network engineering
Cyber security
Software engineering .
What do we offer?
Multiple training possibilities that contribute to your personal development.

A Suitable salary and extensive labor conditions such as a ‘well-being-budget’. This is a personal budget of €600,- which you may spend on your own health such as: Mindfulness, sports, lifestyle coaching, wellness but also technical gadgets such as a second screen for you home office.
A monthly reimbursement for your internet at home.
A lease car or car allowance.
A laptop or Mac (sometimes both depending on the role) and Iphone.
30 holidays per year.
(Virtual) events with colleagues.
Interested? Apply now!

If you are interested in this position, please apply by uploading your resume and cover letter. May you have relevant questions about this position, please contact Keesjan Bongaertz, Talent Acquisition CF&P via keesjan.bongaertz@pwc.com
We don’t accept applications via mail due to GDPR

Inclusion and Diversity are onTop of Mind at PwC!",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=90dbf1a9cfdeb97e&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=df467e0433b39221&assa=8566,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=90dbf1a9cfdeb97e&fccid=5e964c4afc56b180&vjs=3,16 dagen geleden,16 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
164,health,Indeed,p_5d6fc843b12778b3,InDomo | Implementation & Team Director,Ogilvy SocialLab, Amsterdam Zuid,"Overview:
InDomo designs together with clients a bespoke in-house marketing performance solution that drives business and brand performance.
Core of the solution is to progressively increase ROI by daily optimizing audiences, channels, media and content focusing on digital performance channels.

This is possible thanks to clearly defined E2E strategy with KPI's for each phase of the consumer journey linked with business KPI's, supported by the right in-house capabilities in one integrated team, an agile way of working and processes supported by an efficient tech stack.
Implementation & Team Director

The Implementation & Team Director is responsible for setting up and leading the first phase of the in-house performance team at client side until the moment the in-house solution is making business impact, from defining the capabilities required, leading and building the team to installing processes and ways of working.
Scoping the work, define the roadmap for implementation and the capacity / capabilities required.Spend most of the time at client side.
Responsibilities:
Manages the overall performance of the in-house team
Defining in-house roadmap to get to the desired in-house performance solutions, including capabilities, processes and tools required
Implement ways of working and processes and tools and building the required capabilities.
Qualifications:
10 years’ work experience in senior team management
Experience in Digital business & campaign management
Organizational design
Strong thought leadership and strong team lead, coach and manager
Strong leader in mobilizing organization and creating commitment in organization
Relentless in driving business results
Comfortable to work at multiple client sides and to lead transformation
Focus on driving result and whatever it takes mindset.
What we offer
As part of the WPP network, our benefits are incredibly comprehensive and you’ll have plenty to choose from. We’ve listed a few below - and there are many more on offer:
Superb development opportunities and ongoing support throughout your career
Light, open-plan office space with roof terrace, onsite bar and stunning views over central Amsterdam
Health insurance with Achmea and Zilverenkruis
Pension Scheme
WPP Group Discounts.

WPP is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=5d6fc843b12778b3&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=254d44e567010f53&assa=516,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=5d6fc843b12778b3&fccid=6409a89a253cca0b&vjs=3,16 dagen geleden,16 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
165,health,Indeed,p_6138abe29e8512cf,Customer Experience Manager,Skin Faculty, Amsterdam Noord,"Who we are?
Skin Faculty is building a digitally enabled, personalized skincare brand for the modern

consumer. The venture is based in Amsterdam, backed by a global leader in cosmetics and a venture capital fund and is looking for stellar talent to complete the core team in the run-up to a public launch in 2021.
Opportunity

Skin Faculty is looking for a Customer Experience Manager to become the bridge between our support operations and the product experience. You will set the foundations of our support and will work closely with the product manager and the content manager to create the best customer experience possible!
What you’ll do
Design & improve the customer experience (CX) through new frameworks/tools/processes to ensure optimal CX
Liaise with the product manager and the content marketing manager to ensure delivery of high quality experience
Increase customer satisfaction, loyalty, and advocacy through customer relationship management (CRM) tools used in coordinating and monitoring customer experience operations
Guide our customers into their skin care journey by using your knowledge of skin care, but also by liaising with different experts in the field
Create and formalize an (internal) skin care knowledge base
Who you are
Project Manager - Very organized, methodical and can deliver consistently on deadlines
Detail Oriented - high standards and a good eye for detail, and are not afraid to get hands-on with data and identifying operational efficiencies

Skincare aficionado - You are deeply passionate about clean cosmetics, know your active ingredients and take great pride in bringing clarity and honesty in an often confusing and intimidating industry.
Excellent Communicator - Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to win partners trust
Great Teammate - You collaborate well internally or across functional areas to get the best possible outcome for the company

Startup - You like working in a startup environment and you have some affinity with the health and beauty industry. You can manage your own time and you are flexible enough to go the extra mile if needed.

Ownership - You do what you promise and you take ownership of tasks. You always try to go for the best quality possible with respect to timing and budget. You understand the why of decisions and you suggest improvements when you see an opportunity
What you’ll need
MSc from a top university or business school in a relevant field
2+ years of professional experience
Highly knowledgeable on skin care - you know your way around how the skin care world works and are highly knowledgeable about skin care products and how people use skin care products
Experience in high growth environments and/or e-commerce
Fluent in English and French or Dutch (All of them is a big plus)
What we can offer
Become one of the key employees of an ambitious start up
Have a real impact on the company’s growth and direction
Work with a tight-knitted team who love what they do every day
Competitive compensation in accordance with the European startup market
Flexible working conditions
Unlimited holidays",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 166,health,Indeed,p_b8d1e42bf9f1a430,Program Lead - Physical Security Operations,Bookingcom, Amsterdam,"It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.

Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission. We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
The Role

The Program Lead - Physical Security Operations is a crucial role in the front-line defence of Booking.com in protection of their people, customers, partners and assets. The Global Corporate Security team sits within the wider Global Security and Resilience team
column2: a dynamic, lean team, requiring tactical support in day-to-day safety and security operations.

column1: The Program Lead will:

Manage and deliver global security risk assessments, manage the physical and procedural security improvements, upgrades and implementations and report back to management on the health status of each of our global offices
Work with internal stakeholders such as Real estate and workplace services, regional and local leadership and site management
Roll out global policies such as the Video Surveillance and Global Badge policies
Assist in responding to security incidents when the support of Global Corporate Security is needed
B.responsible
Risk assessments
Lead and execute security risk assessments of our offices globally and file outcomes in the dedicated Global Corporate Security Risk Management Tooling
Maintain accurate and clear status overview dashboards on all global risk assessments
Set up and maintaining clear status overview dashboards on the actual status of the office and/or office remediation phase following risk assessments and security upgrades
Manage the procedural implementation phase for the global physical security upgrades together with the Project Managers at Real Estate and the Program Lead - Physical Security System & Technology
Keep connected with the regions by carrying out security health checks with our local offices and reassessing these offices when needed
column2: Act promptly on deviations spotted

column1: Policies & Projects
Implement the new global security policies such as video surveillance and visitor and badge policies with internal stakeholders and external contractors
Work together with the Booking Security Awareness team to bring the policies live in an effective and fun manner
Implement a Booking Global badge program with workplace services globally
Building Relationships
Create and maintain a network of information sharing and partnering relationships
Build partnerships with internal strategic business partners and stakeholders
Collaborate with a broad and diverse range of stakeholders across the company from Commercial Operations, Legal, PR, Local Leadership and Real Estate/Office Management
B.skilled
Minimum of 3-5 years'+ experience with strong understanding of corporate security / security governance bodies / intel / crisis management / risk management experience in a supportive role
Security risk assessment experience
General administration / project management skills (writing of plans, communicating with diverse stakeholders, tracking)
Bachelors’ degree in a relevant field (e.g. Security, Resilience). PSP Certification is preferred but not essential
Investigations experience
Outstanding written and verbal communications skills
column2: ability to effectively advise at all levels of the organization
column3: Problem-solving mindset, agile thinking

column1: Independent self-starter
column2: detail oriented, organized, and ability to multi-task

column1: Ability to identify and apply innovative solutions to complex situations
Sound business judgment, with ability to anticipate firm needs and identify and implement practical, realistic solutions
Highly responsive, service oriented individual with ability to flex schedule to support customers in various locations and time zones
Genuine interest and curiosity around world events, with an understanding of how these may impact a corporate entity
Ability to manage confidential and highly sensitive information with the highest levels of discretion and professionalism
Team player
Ability to work with internal stakeholders on all levels
Joint operations centre/security operations centre experience preferred but not essential
B. Offered
Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
Working in a fast-paced and performance-focused culture
Opportunity to use your technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Promote and deliver impactful solutions
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal development with on-the-job opportunities, projects, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com.
Applications will be reviewed by week commencing 4 January 2021.

Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=b8d1e42bf9f1a430&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=f9b93da507551dac&assa=8217,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=b8d1e42bf9f1a430&fccid=62ee2fabbf8c93c5&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
167,health,Indeed,p_a7249c95ca768c14,Marketing Cloud Specialist,BasicFit, Hoofddorp,"This is what your assignment looks like

As a Marketing Cloud Specialist at Basic-Fit, you’re the bridge between a wide variety of business stakeholders and our IT teams. You’ll be a key player in the creation and maintenance of email campaign processes. This includes campaign optimization, customer journeys and automation, where you’re always striving for the highest standards possible. With your deep understanding of all the Salesforce Marketing Cloud possibilities and best practices, you’ll hit the ground running.
Responsibilities:
Create and maintain customer journeys, triggered sends and email templates within Marketing Cloud
Unlock new channels for communication with our members and help increasing the intelligence of our platform
Design and develop dynamic and personalized emails and SMS messages using AMP script
Create audiences through SQL to ensure we only contact the right members
Develop and execute the CRM strategy together with the Marketing and CRM team
Work closely with departments like Customer Service, Finance and Product to translate business requirements into automated journeys
Educate business stakeholders about SFMC possibilities
Be our Marketing Cloud guru - if anyone has a question about Marketing Cloud they can come to you for answers!
Meet your colleagues: Thom Hassler-Forest, Nicolò Camporese & Mirte Leloup
We ask
For this position, you’ll need to have a curious mindset and a can-do attitude. Furthermore, we ask:
2+ years' experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud and campaign management
Experience with Journey Builder, Content Builder and Audience Builder
Experience in Social Studio, Mobile Studio, Email Studio, Web Studio, and Automation Studio
Extended experience in AMP script. Solid understanding of SQL and JavaScript is a big plus
You love working in a dynamic, positive environment, whilst developing your own skills and interests.
Our promise

Basic-Fit is a young, dynamic and fast growing organization with a clear mission. We are the European market leader in the value for money fitness market and we are active in the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, France and Spain. We think sport should be affordable and accessible to make sure everyone who wants to be fit can become fit. In the coming years we are set to grow our member base and professionalize as a company. To make this happen we need enthusiastic, innovative and driven people. We do not select by color, we just ask you to embrace our orange color.
What to expect within Basic-Fit?
An informal (you can wear jeans and sneakers if you want), international (many cultures and languages) and friendly environment
Plenty of opportunities for your own initiatives and to grow
Unlimited access to the online training courses of GoodHabitz
Participation in pension scheme
Travel allowance
Collective health insurance
Within walking distance of Hoofddorp train station and free parking at our headquarters
And a beautiful gym (fitness equipment, spinning bikes, virtual group lessons) at our headquarters which you can use anytime.
Due to Covid-19, currently all headquarters employees work remote. We follow the guidelines of the RIVM.
Apply for this job

Until February 22 you can apply via the button (the vacancy will be taken offline sooner when we receive a high amount of applications). After we make our selection, we’ll inform you as soon as possible. The process consists of two video interviews.
Do you want to know more about this vacancy? Please contact Karen, Corporate Recruiter, via karen.degeus@basic-fit.com.

For all recruitment agencies: recruitment is done by our Corporate Recruiter herself, this means there is no help needed. If I do need a bit of help, I have some great agencies I work with. Thank you!
Resume
Basic-Fit Group
IT
32 - 40 hours a week
Questions about this vacancy?
Contact us via
recruitment@basic-fit.nl
Applications sent to this e-mail address will not be processed.

Acquisition is also not appreciated.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=a7249c95ca768c14&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=b5f605631642e9ac&assa=9528,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=a7249c95ca768c14&fccid=866742159440b006&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
168,health,Indeed,p_c1a3c23c382da2d5,HR Innovations Specialist,Adyen, Amsterdam,"This is Adyen

We took an unobvious approach to starting a payments company, building a platform from scratch. Today, we're the payments platform of choice for the world's brightest companies. Our unobvious approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity, of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives, is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business challenges are unique, we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. So no matter where you're from, who you love, or what you believe in, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.
HR Specialist

Adyen is looking for an eager HR Innovations Specialist that can join the HR Team to further drive the international growth of the company. Our aim as a team is to support with the development, management and retaining of our talented Adyen workforce.

At Adyen, our people are our greatest asset. Our unique company culture attracts the smartest people, who take initiative & ownership and can contribute to our fast growth and deal with our business challenges. We believe that people reach their utmost potential if we give them freedom, opportunity, and ownership over their work.
As an HR Specialist you will be part of the Global HR Team based in our Amsterdam office where you will be the support for our employees.
What you'll do:
Support full employment lifecycle of an Adyen employee
Maintaining personal files, support on immigration
Responsible for maintaining and analyzing HR data
Help manage our HRIS (Workday) and other HR systems
Lead the administration of employee benefits (pension, health insurance assistance)
Own communications with finance on payroll process and communication
Assist with the growth of the team by assisting recruitment and enabling the onboarding of new hires
Working closely with every part of the HR Team and close to the business
Continuously innovating and automating to further scale Adyen and the HR Department
Who you are
5+ years experience in an international HR environment
Experience with a HRIS, preferable Workday
Experience with Immigration is a plus
BA/BS degree
The ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Experience working in a fast paced environment
Able to handle sensitive information, discrete with a high standard of integrity
Ability to quickly learn new software platforms
Who we are

Adyen is the payments platform of choice for many of the world's leading companies, providing a modern end-to-end infrastructure connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. Adyen delivers frictionless payments across online, mobile, and in-store channels. With offices across the world, Adyen serves customers including Facebook, Uber, Spotify, Casper, Bonobos and L'Oreal.
Ready to meet us?

If this role looks like your next challenge, apply by clicking the link below. We can't wait to meet you!",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=c1a3c23c382da2d5&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=0f0597aa6c051195&assa=1560,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=c1a3c23c382da2d5&fccid=b5c24474d328dbc6&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
169,health,Indeed,p_96ada41f89126ef1,Quantitative Researcher,Optiver, Amsterdam,"Can you solve this puzzle?

Three players A, B, C play the following game. First, A picks a real number between 0 and 1 (both inclusive), then B picks a number in the same range (different from A's choice) and finally C picks a number, also in the same range, (different from the two chosen numbers). We then pick a number in the range uniformly randomly. Whoever's number is closest to this random number wins the game. Assume that A, B and C all play optimally and their sole goal is to maximise their chances of winning. Also assume that if one of them has several optimal choices, then that player will randomly pick one of the optimal choices.
If A chooses 0, then what is the best choice for B?
What is the best choice for A?
Can you write a program to figure out the best choice for the first player when the game is played among four players?

Did you like this puzzle? Are you looking for bigger challenges? Do you want to use your analytical skills to solve real world problems and see the results right away? Do you enjoy writing computer programs? Then the Quantitative Researcher position might be a great opportunity for you!
What you'll do

As a Quantitative Researcher you will work in a team with Traders and Researchers, right on the trading floor. You will spend your first weeks at Optiver in a structured training program to learn about options, market making and delta 1. You will then immediately start your first project, with the support of a Senior Researcher. We expect you to be versatile, flexible and very creative to think of new innovative solutions. In return we give you the freedom to pursue your ideas and implement them right into our production systems. Within a few months, you will play a key role in developing automated analysis programs and trading algorithms.
What you'll need
Academic degree with very good grades in Engineering, Physics, Maths, Econometrics, Computer science or equivalent
Programming experience in any language (C, C++, Python, Basic, JAVA, etc.)
Ability to apply basic concepts of probability, calculus and linear algebra
Ability to carry a project on your own in a structured way within a short timeframe
Competitive attitude and eagerness to constantly improve yourself
Self-starting, 'can do' attitude
Ability to learn quickly
Excellent verbal and written English skills.
What you'll get
The chance to start your career working alongside best-in-class professionals from over 40 different countries.

Our performance based bonus structure is unmatched anywhere in the industry. We combine our profits across desks, teams and offices into a global profit pool fostering a truly collaborative environment to work in.

Alongside this you will get great secondary benefits such as 25 paid vacation days, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, training opportunities, discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, Friday afternoon drinks and even weekly in-house chair massages. Being highly international, we are accustomed to guiding expats through their relocation, offering competitive relocation packages and providing visa sponsorship where necessary.
Are you interested in starting your career on one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe?

Apply directly via our website for the position of Quantitative Researcher. Please provide us with a CV, a solution to part (a) of the puzzle highlighting in bold your final answer and a letter of motivation in English. Solving part b and c of the puzzle is optional. Applications without an answer to the puzzle and a letter of motivation will not be reviewed.
The full puzzle solution is to be uploaded in the same document as the cover letter and submitted as a pdf.
If you have any questions feel free to contact the recruitment team on recruitment@optiver.com or on +31 (0)20 708 70 00.
Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role.
More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)
