196,health,Indeed,p_95bf993437163d84,Customer Delivery Executive,Trax Group, AmsterdamZuidoost,"Trax is a global leader in Transportation Spend Management solutions. Combining industry leading cloud-based applications with expert services, we are transforming traditional freight and parcel audit to help customers better manage and control their global transportation costs and drive enterprise wide efficiency. With a global footprint spanning North America, Latin America, Asia and Europe, we deliver data-based visibility and insights
column2: higher savings
column3: and better control of transportation spend for shippers of all sizes.

column1: We are currently looking for a full-time Customer Delivery Executive for our European Office in Hoofddorp, the Netherlands.
ROLE:

The Delivery Executive is the main point of contact for Trax customers and oversees the end to end delivery of our managed freight bill and pay services. In this role you are responsible for ensuring that all tasks leading up to the financial close for our clients occur in a timely manner. Additionally, the Delivery Executive is responsible for report preparation, records control, and special projects.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Ensure that clients’ deliverables are provided according to their processing calendar
column2: these tasks include processing invoices, providing audit results, resolving cost allocation exceptions and the settlement process.

column1: Prepare, analyze, and present weekly health reports.
Manage conference calls and/or participate in meetings for assigned clients to ensure clients receive proactive communication on the status of their deliverables.
Prepare and host monthly delivery business reviews as required
Respond to correspondence relating to client base and day to day customer service

Work in conjunction with all internal departments when necessary to research/resolve client and system issues, including timely response to, and accuracy in, invoice processing, audit reviews and cost allocation reviews
Review client data reports and develop modifications and/or recommendations to improve cycle times and/or content
Provide back-up support as designated by management
Occasional client onsite traveling as well as flexibility to work out of office hours when requested.
Perform other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS
At least 3 to 5 years of experience in the logistic industry with a focus on logistics data such as billing, cost allocation, data analyst or AP related tasks.
Good knowledge of excel including the ability to use V-lookups, pivots, macro, formulas etc.
Must be able to work under pressure and handle interruptions while maintaining flexibility in work assignments. The ability to manage multiple deliverables across multiple clients is a core skill.

We are striving to operate with a continuous improvement mindset. All members of the operations team are expected to participate and, in some cases, lead projects to improve our metrics around quality, efficiency or customer satisfaction.

Trax has a dynamic workplace which requires individuals who thrive in ambiguous situations by demonstrating the ability to lead others, even if their job does not include supervisory skills. Additionally, this role requires the ability to lead customers to make good decisions about their service delivery.
WHAT WE OFFER
Growing company
International setting
Possibilities for personal growth
REMUNERATION:
This role is a full time position. Remuneration will commensurate with the job and the experience level of the candidate.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 197,health,Indeed,p_626f63d1e3e0ad3f,Head of In Vivo Biology,uniQure, Amsterdam,"Location: Amsterdam (Netherlands)
Job category: Research

uniQure is dedicated to bring innovative therapies or unmet medical needs to patients. In doing so each function in uniQure is directly or indirectly responsible for the lives of patients. This responsibility should be part of our day-to-day working life by (i) living up to high quality standards and (ii) recognizing the sense of urgency in areas of high medical need.
Purpose of the role

The ideal candidate should have a deep knowledge of in vivo biology and analysis of administered gene therapy in terms of both efficacy and mechanism of action. The successful candidate will have proven leadership abilities with strong written and oral communication skills. We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled leader with a strong background in gene therapy to join our team.
Place in the Organization

The In Vivo Biology Group has two functions and responsibilities (a) design, execution, and reporting of efficacy in vivo studies in rodents (including dose-range finding studies), as well as sample analysis to get to lead selection. The group is based in Amsterdam.
Key result areas (major duties, accountabilities and responsibilities)
Lead and provide strong mentorship for a team of in-house researchers to support drug discovery and translational research
Select, design, and execute efficacy/mechanism-of-action/PK/PD studies in support of research and development programs
Work with CROs and manage outsourced in vivo studies
Develop and coach a team of in vivo scientists
Teach junior team members routine procedures such as dosing, bleeding, tissue collections, and necropsies, monitor animal health, collect and record data
Organizing a robust communication line to all other relevant function of the organization
Organizes appropriate documentation e.g. study plans/reports and facilitates writing of regulatory documents
Qualifications & Skills
PhD in (molecular) biology, neuroscience or related field with at least 10 years of in vivo biology and gene therapy experience in preferably a pharmaceutical industry setting
Proven scientific experience, preferably trained within the field of molecular biology, in vivo biology, neurobiology, gene therapy, virology
Strong publication record
Significant experience leading, developing, and coaching a team of in vivo scientists
Experience managing outsourced studies performed at CRO’s
Proven ability to create in vivo pharmacology sections of regulatory documents
Deep knowledge of small animal surgery, including stereotactic surgeries is required
Proven track record working with in vivo disease models and deep experience in performing and analyzing behavioral studies
PK/PD analysis and modeling desirable
Strong communication skills (oral and written)
Experience with working in a fast changing and demanding environment, willing and able to act a pro-actively.
Core competencies
Creativity and explorative thinking
Thinks about new working methods or new applications
Brings forward original solutions for problems related to the department and the function
Focus on flexibility, to act in a fast changing and demanding environment
Good Communication skills
Ability to manage own workload as well as workload of co-workers
Pro-active attitude, flexible, professional
Strong team player
Ability to explain complex technical issues, question, and answers in writing and orally to persons not familiar with the subject
Bring together and maintain conjunctions with other departments
Ability to direct reports of own team

Signals problems, recognizes important information, traces possible causes of problems",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=626f63d1e3e0ad3f&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=91a55344d71e02c3&assa=2771,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=626f63d1e3e0ad3f&fccid=137b20b742cbfe2b&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

198,health,Indeed,p_3d40bf275ff1a529,Senior Analyst Global Advertising,eBay Inc, Amsterdam,"eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with thirteen brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:

Classifieds is shaping the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to reach out to the community around them. We are comprised of more than 1,000 people who are passionate for local trade and maintaining the customer-centric nature of the Group, while exploring growth opportunities in both the countries where eCG already has a presence and in prospective markets.
About the team:
The Central Analytics team is responsible for Global Analytics and building Analytics capabilities across all Business Units.
We make decisions data-driven, by providing high-value data, deep insights, and addictive tools.""
About the role:
We are looking for a talented analytics professional to join our Central Commercial & Advertising Analytics team.

The purpose of this role is to leverage Data and Analytics to optimize for the monetization of our properties on a global level, focusing on our advertising business as a publisher. To this end, you will be involved in a variety of initiatives using data and Analytics, leveraging our platforms and tools, working in close contact with our Analytics community, our Advertising Center of Excellence, and external vendors when applicable.

As a member of the global analytics team, you will be proficient with data tools and sources, thrive on solving highly analytical problems, and turn data into actionable insights. This global role comes with the challenge of understanding and contributing to many facets of the business, including advertising operations, product, finance and data management.

This role is data and analytically intensive. Successful candidates should be quick learners, strategic thinkers, operational and execution driven facilitators, problem solvers, and have an entrepreneurial spirit. This role is heavily cross-functional and ideal for candidates who enjoy both defining and solving complex problems, while getting deeply involved in the design of our future advertising platforms and tools.

Skills in problem definition, rigorous analysis, recommendation development and influencing capabilities will also be critical, as well as demonstration of exceptional interpersonal skills, initiative and integrity.
Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities:
Own our advertising analytics platforms adoption and roadmap.
Monitor and collect appropriate data, create insights, and communicate with the teams to effectively infuse your expertise in our local markets.
Structure complex, ambiguous business questions and utilize analytical skills to synthesize actionable business insights, to the benefit of commercial leaders in the organization.
Analyze results and trends across business units, verticals & revenue streams, to uncover opportunities and improve business performance.
Design, plan, and execute methodologies to measure successes of business initiatives.
Collaborate with other analysts/data scientists and help guide strategy based on learning from other analyses/projects across the organization.
Perform ad-hoc analysis and benchmarking as needed.
Create and maintain insightful automated reports and dashboards utilizing typical data quality functions (e.g. standardization, consistency, etc.).
Work closely across the matrix with teams like Advertising CoE, Product & Technology, Engineering, Finance, Marketing, Product, and more.
Scale Analytics best practices and knowledge sharing across the organization.
Continually improve your knowledge of analytics tools, our data warehouse, the business, and best practices.
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Business, Engineering or other quantitative field
5+ years of professional experience in using data to facilitate business decisions
Excellent communication (written/verbal) and presentation skills in English
Exceptionally attentive to detail and embracing of teamwork
People-oriented
column2: eager to build positive and productive relationships with a variety of stakeholders

column1: General knowledge of the digital advertising ecosystem and related performance metrics
Experience manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools
Ability to shift priorities quickly, while maintaining a high degree of organization and control
Good knowledge of SQL or similar.
Experience in at least one visualisation tool (Tableau, Looker, Data Studio, PowerBI, etc.)
Highest proficiency in Excel & PowerPoint
Preferred qualifications:
Experience with AdTech (DV360, Google Ads, Ad Manager, AdSense, Bing, etc)
Hands-on experience with one scripting language (R, Python, Java, etc)
Familiarity with web and app analytics
Knowledge of A/B testing
Experience applying statistical modelling to drive business decision making
What we offer:
Dynamic, very international team with highly skilled personalities, a passion for e-commerce, integrity and a good sense of humor.
High team autonomy and agile environment
The chance to work closely with other teams across Europe, North America and APAC.
A competitive salary and benefits, and an excellent working environment.
Silicon Valley amenities, such as iPhones and MacBook Pros, exciting high spec dev machines and very nice office facilities.
An opportunity to build applications, which will be used by millions of people globally
Interested?

From the moment that you join, we seek to make your employment experience an outstanding and engaging one. If you are hardworking and thrive in a reciprocal and friendly environment then apply and send us your CV.
Benefits:

Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.

We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about our Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/
Covid-19
People are the heart of the eBay Classifieds business, and their health and well-being are our first priority.

We continue to monitor local government guidance and partner closely with medical advisors to determine the safest and best next steps for everyone. As a result, most teams are working remotely, with a few teams able to collaborate in person with enhanced safety procedures. We will discuss the particular case for your region during the interview process. As a general rule, interviews will be completed remotely over video calls.

199,health,Indeed,pj_17599f0abe924c0a,Customer Success Manager - NEUR,Nutanix, Hoofddorp,"Responsibilities:
Drive technology adoption (features, use cases, capacity, product stack) by providing insights on usage maturity, best practices, diagnosing barriers, and solving for those barriers
column2: Ultimate goal of driving expansion in the accounts

column1: Understand customer’s business and technology goals and co-create success plans working with the customer
column2: Conduct regular success plan reviews with customer
column3: Success plans entail building a roadmap to help the customer become operationally more efficient with Nutanix technologies, upskilling customer’s level of expertise, and driving return on investment

column1: Use data insights to track consumption/feature utilization/use cases, and make recommendations for increased adoption, up-sell & cross-sell
Orchestrate the breadth of Nutanix resources (Delivery/Consulting, Support, Product Teams) to improve the customer’s experience with Nutanix technologies
Monitor customer health and engage extended Nutanix teams to proactively create and execute “get well” plans, as needed
Be advocate for your customers and drive customer feedback back into the Nutanix ecosystem
Identify and develop customer references
Help drive customer satisfaction and Net Promoter Score
About you
7-10 years of customer-facing experience role (Account Management, Systems Engineer, Customer Success, or Client Services) with positive customer references
Technically oriented with strong understanding of Data Center technologies, particularly hyper-converged solutions/capabilities/use cases and associated applications/workloads
Relationship-oriented, credible customer leader with mid-senior level audiences
Strong analytical skills and consultative skill set to analyze current usage, customer goals, and recommend actions that drive success for your customers
Excellent written, verbal, presentation, and interpersonal communication skills
Willingness to travel to build strong customer relationships
BA/BS, advanced degree a plus
Fluent verbal and written skills in English is required for this position
Does this sound like you? Let’s talk.
About us

Founded in 2009 and headquartered in San Jose, California, Nutanix is a passionate team of 6000+ employees worldwide. Our people (we call ourselves “Nutants”) are the heartbeat of #LifeAtNutanix and one of the many things that makes Nutanix a great place to work at. We share an intellectual curiosity, a bias for action, and an obsession for our customers. We are builders and problem solvers with an entrepreneurial spirit. Above all, we celebrate what makes each of us unique.
We are humbled to be recognized as one of Bloomberg’s Top 50 Companies to Watch in 2020 and one of the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® 2020 .
We’re growing fast and disrupting the computing industry. Join us and make your mark.
About our business

Nutanix is a global leader in cloud software and a pioneer in hyperconverged infrastructure solutions, making computing invisible anywhere. Companies around the world use Nutanix software to leverage a single platform to manage any app, at any location, at any scale for their private, hybrid and multi-cloud environments.
We’re an equal opportunity employer

We hire and promote individuals solely on the basis of qualifications for the job to be filled.

We strive to foster an inclusive working environment that enables all our Nutants to be themselves and to do great work in a safe and welcoming environment, free of unlawful discrimination, intimidation or harassment.

As part of this commitment, we will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. 200,health,Indeed,p_4fb3970c00560899,Internship: Project Management Digital Marketing & E-Commerce (Non-Thesis),Philips, Amsterdam,"Job Title
Internship: Project Management Digital Marketing & E-Commerce (Non-Thesis)
Job Description
Start date: We prefer students able to start as soon as possible no later than April 2021
Duration: 6 months
This internship is not suitable to perform your thesis. For this reason, we require the student to work 40 hours per week on the projects.
In this role, you have the opportunity to
Drive impact by supporting the Program Management Office (PMO) operations and by enabling standardization of work being exposed to Agile ways of working.
You are responsible for
Digital Marketing & E-Commerce (DMEC) Communications: support the production of the communications activities such as the D2B and D2C newsletters
column2: manage and update the stakeholders’ lists.

column1: DMEC Knowledge Management System: implement the DMEC knowledge management system and socialize it towards the DMEC community
column2: maintain the DMEC knowledge management system and its repository
column3: ensure that the content providers are delivering on-time and qualitative contents

column1: DMEC PMO Knowledge Management System: implement the DMEC PMO Knowledge Management system
column2: track adherence of the PMO members to the PMO knowledge management system and support the PMO members in adopting the system
column3: support adoption of Smartsheet within PMO by managing the tool’s functionalities

column1: DMEC PMO Performance Management: track and monitor the DMEC PMO KPI’s
column2: ensure the roll-up of the projects and deployments KPI’s into a PMO KPI scoring
column3: report-out the KPI’s performance through the daily management board
column4: support the daily management activities

column1: DMEC PMO Quality monitoring: monitor and track adherence of PMO project managers to our quality standards (usage of tools, templates and project management methodologies)
You are a part of

An innovative and Agile Digital Marketing & E-Commerce team, working with talents across our PMO and DMEC organizations. This internship is positioned within the Program Management Office (PMO) of DMEC, PMO is an enabling group within DMEC that supports project and deployment management. PMO is also responsible for DMEC portfolio management, DMEC communications and for driving the Agile transition.
You will be working at our head office of Digital Marketing and E-Commerce in Amsterdam.
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience
Currently studying towards a University of Science (WO) Bachelor in Sciences and/or Master in Sciences in: Business Administration, Business Management, Business Econimics or Marketing
Knowledge of project management methods and Agile ways of working is preferred and a plus
High proficiency of MS tools such as Teams, Excel, PowerPoint, knowledge of other communication tools is a plus
Ability to engage with stakeholders, organized and structured, reliable and quality-driven
Self-propelling, capable to communicate to the entire team but also outside DMEC.
English language professional proficiency
In return, we offer you

Exposure to Digital Marketing and E-Commerce solutions, exposure to the transformation of an entire organization towards Agile, working with a highly talented and inclusive team, where best practice sharing and learning are fostered and encouraged.
Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.
Notes
Required documents in order for us to continue with your application:
Resume

Please note that in order to be considered for an internship, you need to be registered as a student during the entire internship period. Formal documentation of which may be requested at any time. Students from outside the EU need to fill in an NUFFIC agreement, which needs to be signed by the student and the university.
Please note that the contents of our regular internship assignments are not suitable for professionals (and/or MBA students) with professional work experience.
Contact
If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.
If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com.

(Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=4fb3970c00560899&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=9168b1668161c046&assa=9519,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=4fb3970c00560899&fccid=e4af9ca5b6d3a604&vjs=3,2 dagen geleden,2 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
201,health,Indeed,p_1ef51110041f3981,Product and Services Development Manager EMEA,OMRON HEALTHCARE, Hoofddorp,"Employment typePermanent
LocationHoofddorp, the Netherlands
Seniority levelExpert level
Education levelMaster degree

Omron Healthcare’s fast-growing Connected Services and Solutions team are looking for an experienced product manager to join us in shaping the future of remote patient monitoring and digital health. In this challenging role you will be responsible for developing and implementing our services product roadmap in collaboration with our international multi-functional team.

Are you a healthcare innovator looking for a challenging role with the opportunity to make a positive impact on the lives of patients and healthcare professionals? Are you up for the challenge? Then we want to hear from you!
Your role:

The Product and Services Development Manager leads the definition, design, development, and implementation of short- and mid-term (2-3 years) strategic projects for Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM), with the aim to meet the short and mid-term sales objectives
Key responsibilities:
Analyze Payer, Healthcare Provider and User insights to define and prioritize clinical and economic value propositions within the Remote Patient Monitoring space.
Build compelling internal and external business cases to support new service development.
Collaborate with internal and external subject matter experts to define and specify the clinical and user requirements for new product propositions.
In partnership with technical experts and R&D, ensure that user requirements are translated into product requirements.
Manage the product planning and launch process for new service propositions, working within a global multi-functional team
Desired Skills and Experience
The ideal candidate will have:
A Master’s degree in Business, Marketing or related discipline, or a medical degree.
At least 5-7 years product management experience, ideally in the medical / medical device area
Experience in developing product value propositions and business cases
Deep interest in telemedicine / remote patient monitoring
Experience in translating consumer and customer insights into product requirement specifications
Excellent project management and leadership skills
Good written and spoken English level
Academic working and thinking level
OMRON Core Competencies:
Passionate about customers
Entrepreneurial
Making it happen
Total team players
Transparent
Thorough

Please submit your CV in English.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=1ef51110041f3981&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=a3d3118e5c9902ba&assa=1752,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=1ef51110041f3981&fccid=74863a92805aacc3&vjs=3,2 dagen geleden,2 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

202,health,Indeed,pj_70b1112ebb882bc7,Microsoft Business Consultant,Exellys, Amsterdam Oost,"We are looking for a Business Consultant who will play a vital role in providing our clients with leading business applications based on current Microsoft technologies, particularly:
Office365
Azure DevOps
Azure AD
App & Storage services
SQL Data Management
Application Insights
Azure Automation
Machine Learning

You will define reference architectures for the Azure cloud native solutions and services, monitor the health and stability of client networks and respond appropriately when problems arise, perform server, desktop and network installations at client sites. You will collaborate actively with the Business Units and IT teams to translate business requirements into technical requirements and implement Azure capabilities. Finally, as an Azure admin, you will setup and manage DevOps project instances and build and maintain automated deployments with ARM templates.

As a solution expert in the area of the Microsoft O365, SharePoint and the Power platform, you will be working with multiple customers using remote support software and visiting client sites. You will also lead and execute small and medium size projects from functional requirements analysis to solution delivery.

You enjoy working with people and technology, solving challenging problems and learning new tools and techniques. You’re comfortable explaining technical issues, in a non-technical way, to owners and company executives.
Bachelor or Master in Information Technology or Computer Science
Graduated or 1-3 years of experience with 0365, SharePoint, PowerPlatform and Azure PaaS platform
Experience designing or overhauling IT systems
Solid understanding of server operating systems and small business networks
Informed about the latest digital technologies and tech evolutions
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
Ability to travel abroad occasionally (20%)
Fluency in English

Exellys isn’t your typical recruiting or consulting agency. We are truly a category of one. We coach young tech talent and prime them for the professional world. After two years of receiving coaching and upskilling from Exellys, you’ll have the opportunity to work directly for a client that suits your skill set and interest. Think of us as your personal career coach.
Here’s what you can expect from us:
Do meaningful work. When you join us, you’ll work on purposeful projects that push the envelope of technology.
Benefit from a personal career coach. Ongoing development and learning is a core part of our DNA, and it’ll be part of yours, too.
Career mobility. After two years, you’ll have the opportunity to directly work for a fintech startup and grow your professional mobility.

203,health,Indeed,p_f5649d1b5dcde9d2,Medical Advisor Dermatology,Sanofi, Amsterdam,"#LI-EUR
MEDICAL ADVISOR DERMATOLOGY
About the Opportunity

Sanofi is seeking an experienced Medical Advisor for the Dermatology therapeutic area in the Netherlands. You will be responsible for providing medical and scientific expertise both internally and externally. If you are an outgoing person, with special focus on cross-functional teamwork, then this could be an excellent opportunity for you.
About Sanofi Genzyme

Sanofi Genzyme is the specialty care global business unit of Sanofi, focused on rare diseases, multiple sclerosis, oncology, immunology and rare blood disorders. We help people with debilitating and complex conditions that are often difficult to diagnose and treat. We are dedicated to discovering and advancing new therapies, providing hope to patients and their families around the world.

Our ambition is to be the industry leader in specialty care. We currently provide more than 20 treatments to patients globally, with many potential new therapies being studied in clinical trials and in Sanofi laboratories.
Key responsibilities
Identify, develop and maintain collaboration with current and future scientific and medical experts within the Dermatology TA.
Lead local advisory boards, scientific projects and other relevant activities.
Conduct medical trainings adapted to internal as well as external needs.
Participate in relevant congresses, symposia and other meetings and provide feedback to the team.
Work cross functionally with business partners both strategically and at an operational level as aligned in the medical and brand plan.
Execute project management by planning, prioritizing and implementing the medical plan as aligned with the global strategy.
Provide support for launch excellence and market access processes concerning medical/scientific matters.
Be of assistance to the PV, regulatory and other relevant functions regarding medical questions related to the TA.
Liaise with colleagues across countries, by sharing best practices and knowledge.
Ensure to be updated on the latest scientific information concerning the TA.
Keeping up to date with the relevant clinical activities and cross functionally support and facilitate clinical trials.
Based on ethical, legal standards and local code (CGR) review of scientific and external communication material, (including marketing material), for medical and scientific accuracy.
Ensure that all activities and interactions comply with Sanofi business quality documents.
About you
University degree in Medicine, Pharmaceutical Sciences or related Biomedical area.
At least 5 years of relevant experience in a Healthcare / Pharmaceutical environment.
Medical affinity and product knowledge are preferred.
Experience with clinical studies is preferred.
Lead advisory boards and other cooperation with HCPs.
Working experience in a cross-functional team in an international environment.
Competencies
Ability to effectively engage with key external stakeholders and build long-term relationships.
Develop and conduct medical / scientific training.
Search and analyze scientific publications.
Communicate and collaborate with excellent interpersonal, presentation and networking skills.
Analytical whilst able to retain a broad perspective.
Able to work well with and lead cross-functional teams.
plan, prioritize and implement actions – project management.
Analytical and forward thinker, results oriented, organized and a self-starter.
Able to work independently as well as part of a team.
Candidate must be fluent in Dutch as well as English (both verbal and written), other languages are an advantage.
What Sanofi can offer you
A generous package including flexible benefits.
A healthy work-life balance throughout your career with us.

At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and is embedded in our Core Values. We respect the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our employees, patients and customers.
About Sanofi
Empower Life Everyday

At Sanofi we work across human health from vaccines to rare diseases, and consumer healthcare. This creates opportunities to work across different areas to build a diverse and exciting career. Sanofi has the capabilities and resources to support your aspirations to fulfill your ambitions and be the best you can be.

Our purpose at Sanofi is to work passionately every day to understand and solve healthcare needs of people across the world. Our ambition is by 2025, to be a top 3 innovative, global and diversified human healthcare company. One that embraces transformative technologies and is focused on its area of excellence, which means we’re not there to try to solve everybody’s problems. We want to focus on those areas where we know we are making a difference.
The values we live by are teamwork, courage, respect and integrity.

At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=f5649d1b5dcde9d2&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=a8b77d4ae7516467&assa=3879,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=f5649d1b5dcde9d2&fccid=5d3ed74ca4598964&vjs=3,2 dagen geleden,2 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
204,health,Indeed,p_e509c7fa40d60744,Senior Analyst,LOGEX, Amsterdam Zuid,"WE ARE LOGEX

LOGEX delivers analytics solutions that enable data-driven decision making in every area of healthcare – from operations and finance, to clinical and patient outcomes, in order to achieve the best possible value. The right people make this all possible. That’s why we’re constantly on the lookout for brilliant minds from a wide range of expertise: medicine, mathematics, health economics, software development and more. If you enjoy solving complex problems for the greater good, creating user-friendly solutions, and working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial culture, this is the company for you
DRIVEN BY DATA, POWERED BY PEOPLE

Data is at the core of the solutions we offer, but people are at the heart of everything we do. Our team of over 300 international experts – managers, consultants, data scientists, analysts, and experts in technology, healthcare economics, medicine, mathematics and statistics – are values for building long-term, mutually fulfilling partnerships with all our customers.
THE CHALLENGE

LOGEX receives the operational and financial data of 90% of the Dutch hospitals and converts these with self-developed software into performance benchmarks and financial forecasts. As an analyst you work on benchmarking the performance of the medial specialists, forecasting the needed care and/or making cost/price-calculations for hospitals. But also analyzing the “healthpaths” (from a medical/clinical perspective) with the goal of delivering effective and sensible care is an important part of your activities. Together with our ambitious team of consultants and developers you will develop state-of-the-art analytical models and application that give our clients insights in the complex issues where healthcare professionals struggle with.
Experience & skills
Msc degree with a quantitative/beta/technical background
At least 2 years of analytical and client facing work experience, preferably with a link to the health sector
You’re a real ‘number cruncher’ with great analytical skills
Result driven, with a structured way of working and pragmatic ‘can-do’ mentality
Advanced data analytics and ‘big data’ issues in healthcare excite you
You have a strong drive and want to have an impact on the business
You feel at ease in an informal and professional setting where you get a lot of freedom and responsibility
You speak and write Dutch and English fluently.
We offer
A challenging and alternating job where you’re not only offered the opportunity to excel quantitively, but also develop new products that anticipate on the specific problems in healthcare

Besides excellent working conditions, a nice working environment in a young, international, enthusiastic and talented team where hard work and having fun go hand-in-hand. We have weekly drinks and regularly fun team activities
Training and coaching
The opportunity to have a valuable social contribution to optimize the healthcare of the Netherlands.
Interested?

We would like to tell you more about this exciting opportunity! You can apply via the below button and upload your motivation letter, CV, and grade sheet. For more information or if you have any questions you can contact Elise Dijckmeester via elise.dijckmeester@logex.com.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 205,health,Indeed,p_b33ff941e630aa97,SHE Manager,XDES, Amsterdam,"Functie

As SHE Manager you must have excellent attention to detail to identify hazards. You will also be able to discover opportunities for improving conditions and execute various safety programs. The ability to communicate guidelines to a multidisciplinary & multi-cultural workforce is essential. The goal is to ensure the workplace meets all legal expectations and actively supports occupational health and safety.
Functie eisen
Minimum 5 years’ experience in industrial / chemical plant SHE operations
Health and Safety Diploma or Degree is essential.
Experience of ISO 9001 / 14001 and OHSAS 18001.
Experience communicating with local authorities (HSE, EA, etc).
Excellent skills in accident investigations / reporting essential
Outstanding attention to detail and observation ability
Deep understanding of legal health and safety guidelines
Accustomed to producing reports, recording KPIs and developing relevant policies
Excellent knowledge of data analysis and risk assessment
Experience of waste legislation and reporting.
Experience of a large scale chemical process plant.
Strong team player and a strong work ethic
Aanbod
An important function at a leeding company.
Sollicitatie Procedure

Contactpersoon voor deze functie is Lilian van Son, bereikbaar op telefoonnummer 023 55 78 529 of via e-mail: lilian@xdes.nl Kenmerk: 9143.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=b33ff941e630aa97&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=4df87af3d03f8833&assa=6028,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=b33ff941e630aa97&fccid=4e6a24aa81c1b23d&vjs=3,2 dagen geleden,2 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
206,health,Indeed,p_de60216e1a603bf3,Broadcast & Media Support Engineer,Ericsson, Hilversum,"RED BEE MEDIA

Ever wondered who the people are behind the delivery of TV and Radio content in the Netherlands and around the world? We are looking for a broadcast engineer to join our team who can make this happen. This is a multifunctional role from repairing and maintaining complex audio and video platforms to ensuring connectivity to broadcast live events around the globe. We have started the move away from legacy SDI video to IP switching by designing and developing platforms that will be used throughout the global Red Bee companies.
OUR EXCITING OPPORTUNITY

In this job you will be part of a team that is 24/7 responsible for maintaining, fixing and upgrading the systems used by Red Bee Media to put live shows, online documentaries and (live) tv broadcasts on air. This could be systems used for live radio broadcasts, for tonight’s Champions League match or a new online documentary on your favorite streaming platform. In your shifts you will be looking into the overall health of our systems, handle any on-air disturbances and you will be frequently used as the engineering team responsible for installing and building new platforms and new customer deliveries.
TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THE ROLE YOU MUST HAVE

Ideally you have the MBO/HBO degree in the area of IT or Technology. If you have any experience with IP networks that would be advantageous. We are looking for a great team player skills who easily communicates, willingly learns and shares knowledge.

Are you the person that loves to work with the latest IP technology in the TV, Radio and Media industry and do you love to dive into technical problems while every second counts on systems used for audiences all over the world? Then we are looking for you! Please click on “Apply” to start your new adventure!",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=de60216e1a603bf3&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=8bd7bbdfce70022c&assa=7530,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=de60216e1a603bf3&fccid=82656d64a9a3e6a7&vjs=3,2 dagen geleden,2 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
207,health,Indeed,p_739c71361b2b6166,InDomo | Analytics & Data Director,Ogilvy SocialLab, Amsterdam Zuid,"Overview:
InDomo designs together with clients a bespoke in-house marketing performance solution that drives business and brand performance.
Core of the solution is to progressively increase ROI by daily optimizing audiences, channels, media and content focusing on digital performance channels.

This is possible thanks to clearly defined E2E strategy with KPI's for each phase of the consumer journey linked with business KPI's, supported by the right in-house capabilities in one integrated team, an agile way of working and processes supported by an efficient tech stack.
Analytics & Data Director
The Analytics & Data Director brings data-driven marketing to the next level.
He/she lead the data strategy, roadmap and architecture at client side and develop the capabilities for InDomo by leading the Analytics/data functions.
He/she leads the process of defining KPI's and targets, sets up the data and tracking architecture, takes ownership of the marketing stack , analytics tooling, visualisation.
Responsibilities:

Leads the team that's responsible for defining KPI's and targets, designing both front- and back end of campaign performance dashboards and reports, providing insights needed for ongoing campaign optimizations, and preparing campaign evaluation reports for management.
Champions a data-driven culture where hypotheses are validated through experiments and opinions are backed up by data.
Defines the data architecture from ad platforms used, to standardized campaign trafficking structure, to web analytics & e-commerce tracking / reporting and visualization set-up.
Sets up campaign analyses that measure the incremental impact of campaigns (either through testing, switching ads off in one region, or marketing mix modeling).
Coaches the rest of the (client) team on how to test assumptions, interpret data and optimize digital media spend.
Strategise and develop the critical data, analytics , reporting capabilities of InDomo and lead the InDomo Analytics and Data organization.
Audit and select analytic tools for reporting and visualization for InDomo and for InDomo's clients.
Qualifications:
7 years’ experience in digital marketing analytics and optimization, preferably at multinational companies with brand, marketing and e-commerce experience
Understanding importance of data and analytics on continuous improvement of business results
Do whatever it take mentality , problem solving.
Knows their way around data visualization tools such as Qlik, Tableau, PowerBI, Datorama
Hands-on experience with advertising platforms and web analytics tools
Experience with marketing mix modeling is considered a pre
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
What we offer
As part of the WPP network, our benefits are incredibly comprehensive and you’ll have plenty to choose from. We’ve listed a few below - and there are many more on offer:
Superb development opportunities and ongoing support throughout your career
Light, open-plan office space with roof terrace, onsite bar and stunning views over central Amsterdam
Health insurance with Achmea and Zilverenkruis
Pension Scheme
WPP Group Discounts.

WPP is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=739c71361b2b6166&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=cf3cbff79a5a0429&assa=8970,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=739c71361b2b6166&fccid=6409a89a253cca0b&vjs=3,2 dagen geleden,2 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
208,health,Indeed,p_2f60b0bb4adfd36d,Sales & Operations Manager,Philips, Amsterdam,"Job Title
Sales & Operations Manager
Job Description
In this role, you have the opportunity to

Own the Sales & Operations (S&OP) process for the business, by monthly alignment of Sales and Marketing and Supply Chain developments (forecast, phase in/out, market actions) with key decision moments (costs, introductions, capacity) to respond to demand and supply variations and risks.
You are responsible for
Managing the monthly medium/long term planning process in order to prepare in time for capacity creation/reduction and the procurement of long-leadtime components
On behalf of the Business, facilitating the S&OP process, by teaming up with factories, supply centers and markets
Managing the integral inventory levels of the Business Unit with objective to realize the availability targets
Managing product phase in and phase out in close cooperation with product/marketing management and the industrial project team
Conducting scenario planning and risk analysis
Defining opportunities for improvement driven by operational excellence, customer satisfaction and cost reduction
You are a part of

Beauty business team, a diverse team based in the Netherlands and Hong Kong, working closely with marketing, procurement, engineering, finance and business development in the business, as well as demand planning and operations teams in the markets, and global supply planning and factories.
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience
Minimal Bachelor’s degree
5 yrs business experience in demand /supply management or SCM operations , preferably in consumer goods industry
Leadership skills, able to operate in dynamic environment with high interaction levels
Strong communication skills in international matrix setting, fluent in English
Persuasive, analytical, hands on mentality, authority, stress resistant
Adaptability to talk/manage different levels of audiences
Microsoft Office and SAP knowledge
In return, we offer you

A path towards your most rewarding career. Succeeding in this role in a complex environment will open many doors for your long term career, in other areas in Philips or otherwise. We also believe that we are at our best as a company when you are at yours as a person. Thus, we offer competitive health benefits, a flexible work schedule and access to local well-being focused activities.
Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.
Contact
If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.
If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com.

(Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=2f60b0bb4adfd36d&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=e1f7297e33bd85a6&assa=175,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=2f60b0bb4adfd36d&fccid=e4af9ca5b6d3a604&vjs=3,2 dagen geleden,2 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
209,health,Indeed,p_3a7f06c6798562b3,Visual Designer,BasicFit, Hoofddorp,"This is what your assignment looks like

As visual designer at Basic-Fit, you’ll be involved from the early stages in various projects, working together with the UX designer and stakeholders to visualize the solution direction. You will be working with both business stakeholders and technical engineers, helping to further evolve and detail out the solution being worked on.

Your main focus will be on the migration of our websites to a new platform (Salesforce Commerce Cloud). For this project, you’ll be working together with our developers (front- and backend), UX designer and analysts in a brand-new Agile team. You don’t need to have experience in the Agile way of working, but it’s important you are curious, like to take ownership and you like experimenting to make Agile working at Basic-Fit a success!
Your responsibilities:
Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product owners and development teams
Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets
Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and icons)
Illustrate design ideas using storyboards
Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders
Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
Adhere to internal style standards on fonts, colors and images.
Create and improve visuals for all component on the website
Meet your future colleagues: Jurre van der Aar, Romane L’Henaff & Thomas van Mastbergen.
We ask

A curious mindset and self-motivated, enthusiastic personality. You are a problem solver and you like to analyze. You love to work in a dynamic, positive environment to develop your own skills and interests.
Minimum 2 years of working experience as a Visual Designer
You can present a portfolio of design projects
Knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop is required
You have a team spirit and strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders throughout the organization
Good communicating skills in English, a second language (e.g. French, Spanish or Dutch) is a plus
Ability to understand and respond to business needs in a rapidly changing environment.
Our promise

Basic-Fit is a young, dynamic and fast growing organization with a clear mission. We are the European market leader in the value for money fitness market and we are active in the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, France and Spain. We think sport should be affordable and accessible to make sure everyone who wants to be fit will be able to be fit. Our goal is to professionalize and grow the next years. To make this happen we need enthusiastic, innovative and driven people. We do not select by color, we just ask you to embrace our orange color.
What to expect within Basic-Fit?
An informal (you can wear jeans and sneakers if you want), international (many cultures and languages) and friendly environment
Plenty of opportunities for your own initiatives and to grow
Unlimited access to the online training courses of GoodHabitz
Participation in pension scheme
Travel allowance
Collective health insurance
Within walking distance of Hoofddorp train station and free parking at our headquarters
And a beautiful gym (fitness equipment, spinning bikes, virtual group lessons) at our headquarters which you can use anytime.
Due to Covid-19, currently all headquarters employees work remote, we follow the guidelines of the RIVM.
Apply for this job

Until 17 February you are able to apply via the button (Please note we will close this vacancy sooner if we receive a lot of applications). Afterwards we make the selection and we inform you as soon as possible. The process consists of two video interviews.
Do you want to know more? Please contact Karen, our Corporate Recruiter, via karen.degeus@basic-fit.com

For all recruitment agencies: recruitment is done by our Corporate Recruiter herself, this means there is no help needed. If I do need a bit of help, I have some great agencies I work with. Thank you!
Resume
Basic-Fit Group
Marketing & Communications
32 - 40 hours a week
Questions about this vacancy?
Contact us via
recruitment@basic-fit.nl
Applications sent to this e-mail address will not be processed.

Acquisition is also not appreciated.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=3a7f06c6798562b3&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=ec34b451bff4a4e3&assa=1922,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=3a7f06c6798562b3&fccid=866742159440b006&vjs=3,2 dagen geleden,2 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

210,health,Indeed,p_5c3b4709834681b0,Customer Success Manager (MuleSoft),Salesforce, Amsterdam,"To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Mulesoft - Customer Success Group
Job Details
Role: Customer Success Manager (MuleSoft)
Location: Milan/Madrid/Amsterdam
MuleSoft, acquired by Salesforce in 2018, is the #1 Integration and API Platform. The mission of MuleSoft Customer Success is:

“ Leading with our values , our mission is to help every MuleSoft Customer connect their applications, data, and devices, and realize (and acknowledge) an outsized return on their investment in MuleSoft Software. ”
The values of MuleSoft Customer Success are Trust (say what we do
column2: do what we say) , Customer Success (our absolute priority) , Innovation (challenge the status quo as we continually improve), and Equality (equality and care for all).

column1: The role of MuleSoft Customer Success is to drive measurable customer success at every MuleSoft customer , which means a) drive adoption of MuleSoft software
column2: b) help customers to connect their applications, data, and devices to achieve measurable outcomes
column3: and c) create promoters of MuleSoft.

column1: In doing so, we secure sustainable, profitable growth for MuleSoft by retaining customers and creating add-on sales opportunities.
What You’ll Do
Partner with customers to deliver outsized returns on their investment in MuleSoft software, by:
Delivering, measuring, and communicating ROI for our customers, throughout the customer lifecycle
Being the trusted partner for customers on use-cases and product functionality, and how to align use-cases with Catalyst, MuleSoft’s best practice.

Coordinating various cross-functional teams at MuleSoft, to ensure customers get what they need to connect their applications, data, and devices, and receive an excellent and consistent customer experience, all the time, every time.
Accurately representing the voices of customers inside MuleSoft, ensuring the health of customers is properly captured, and making their voices heard as appropriate.

The Customer Success Manager is accountable for, and leads, customer success planning and execution across a portfolio of customers, and supports other cross-functional teams in the development and execution of account strategy, driving customer retention and expansion.
What We’re Looking For

Proven track record of performance in your career to-date in customer-facing roles with a technology bias, such as Consultant, Sales / Pre-sales, Technical Account Management, Project Manager, Enterprise Architect, Customer Success Manager, etc.
Alignment with our core values of Trust, Customer Success, Innovation, and Equality.
Ability to create structure in ambiguous situations and design effective plans followed up with flawless execution to exceed customer expectations.

Axiflex zoekt voor haar opdrachtgever een linked data analyst/engineer. Functieomschrijving Binnen het programma KIK-V wordt gewerkt aan de beschrijving van kwaliteits- en keuze-informatie in de vorm van een ontologie. Vanuit het perspectief van het operationele proces van een zorgaanbieder worden gegevens en relaties beschreven die samen antwoord geven op de vragen die rondom kwaliteit en keuze bestaan, met als basis het Kwaliteitskader Verpleeghuiszorg. Je werkt mee aan het realiseren van deze ontologie, en het toetsen van de ontologie bij diverse organisaties. Daarnaast is de opdrachtgever betrokken bij diverse onderzoekstrajecten op het gebied van FAIR-data en de Personal Health Train. Je levert hieraan een belangrijke bijdrage door het ‘FAIR’ maken van data en het uitleggen van de technieken, zoals bijvoorbeeld linked data. Je werkzaamheden:
ontwikkelen en beheren van ontologieën op het gebied van voornamelijk kwaliteitsdata verpleeghuiszorg
adviseren over en ondersteunen bij de praktische inrichting van tooling die gebruikt wordt voor de ontwikkeling en het beheer van ontologieën
ontwikkelen en beheren van R2RML-mappings tussen veelgebruikte applicaties en linked data conform de ontologie.
Benodigde competenties:
Je bent analytisch sterk.
Je kunt zowel abstract als praktisch nadenken.
Je neemt verantwoordelijkheid voor het resultaat.
Je bent doortastend.
Je bent initiatiefrijk.
Je bent zelfsturend.
Je bent proactief.
Functie-eisen Let op! Als je niet aan de eisen voldoet, dan heeft reageren helaas geen zin. Uit je cv moet blijken dat aan deze eisen wordt voldaan:
Je hebt minimaal een afgeronde hbo-bacheloropleiding.
Je hebt minimaal 6 maanden werkervaring met linked data.
Je hebt minimaal 6 maanden werkervaring met het ontwikkelen van datamodellen en/of ontologieën.
Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar werkervaring met technologieën/concepten uit de semantische web stack.
Je hebt minimaal 6 maanden werkervaring in de zorg opgedaan met linked data/data-analyse.
Je voegt een motivatie toe (maximaal 1 enkelzijdige A4-pagina). Geef daarin aan waarom je jezelf geschikt acht voor deze functie.
Je cv is in het Nederlands opgesteld en maximaal 4 enkelzijdige A4-pagina groot.

The GM oversees and is responsible for all aspects of the business, which vary from financials, marketing, budgeting, training & development and food & beverages to the overall experience for both guests and team members. The GM follows all SALSA SHOP policies and procedures and sees to it that his or her team members possess and act according to the same standards.

Our GM’s take a hands-on approach and are part of their store’s team: They are expected to help and assist their team members when needed and they consistently work with a sense of urgency, in order to be a leading example for all SALSA SHOP employees. A SALSA SHOP GM has an ambitious and motivated personality with the desire and ability to establish and maintain a positive working environment, by leading with enthusiasm and optimism and behaving in a proactive, professional and positive manner. At all times, a GM and his or her team reflects the values of both the company and our community.
Profile & Experience
Clearly speak, read & write in the company languages: English (and Dutch).
Relevant education/training and experience in Hospitality and Management.
Be successfully trained as a SALSA SHOP Training General Manager.
Ability to lead (the tempo of) a team and restaurant, according to SALSA SHOP standards and in order to achieve the company’s goals.
Have outstanding customer service and social skills.
Ability to adapt to changes and to succeed in challenging situations and a fast paced environment.
Ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships, attentively listen and create personal connections with all employees.
Be certified in First Aid, Food Safety, Health and Safety.
Knowledge & ability to use Microsoft Office.
Primary Reponsibilities
Include, but are not limited to
Successfully recruit, train and develop/promote Team Members, Junior Management and Training General Managers.
Have one-on-one conversations, evaluate performance, plan the development of their team to grow into top performing team members and (junior) management.
Recognize when employees have (not) achieved challenges and goals and follow up on performance on a timely basis, while taking appropriate measures.
Remove obstacles which obstruct our people and company from succeeding.
Ability to identify quality employees, train and retain them.
Establish and maintain an energetic and positive working environment.
Write schedules that reflects the needs of the business and that allow for a great customer experience.
Build sales, manage financial budgets, P&L, cash handling procedures and all cost controls of the restaurant.
Maintain and organize all administrative duties on a timely basis.
Develop and be accountable for a safety culture that creates a work environment where no one gets hurt and ensure that all employees follow safe and health working procedures.
Ensure that all new hires have the proper documentation to work and all payroll hours are submitted on time.
Make decisions in the best interest of customers, employees and the company.

Take part in local store marketing and participate in promotions/activations",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=5684f64669f98db8&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=2d84d56a426818cb&assa=655,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=5684f64669f98db8&fccid=f3ef24455f19ca3c&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

Powered by the Trend Micro Smart Protection Network infrastructure, our industry-leading cloud-computing security technology, products and services stop threats where they emerge, on the Internet, and are supported by 1,000+ threat intelligence experts around the globe. 220,health,Indeed,p_413358cff47c0898,Business Analytics Intern,VISUfarma, Amsterdam,"Posted: July 23, 2020
Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands

VISUfarma is a company with a vision: to bring global innovation to European eye health. It is an ambitious and fast-growing pan-European player. VISUfarma is active in six European countries: France, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Spain and the United Kingdom and has over 150 employees. Working for VISUfarma means you will be an important part of a “scale-up” environment helping to create a successful business within an international and multicultural team.
Currently we are looking a Trainee Business Analytics to join our team
Who are you

We’re looking for a bachelor or masters student in Finance & Control/ Economics (3rd/4th year traineeship) that is self-motivated, enthusiastic and has a hands-on mentality. We would like somebody that has an excellent proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint and some experience with Business Intelligence tooling (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau) or comparable legacy systems (PowerPivot). Somebody with good command of English, both spoken and written. Additional spoken languages are an advantage. The traineeship is working both hands-on and strategical.
In this traineeship you will:
Checking the quality of the processes and maintain, improve and develop existing and new Business Intelligence dashboards
Define, in cooperation with the Business Analysis & Strategy Director, the BI development roadmap
Analyse business performance and create new insights by combining different types of data
Provide support to users of the Business Intelligence service
Maintain integrity of (master) data
Learn and grow in the field of Business Intelligence and Business Analysis.
What we offer you

An international, dynamic Traineeship starting September 2020, where you work in an International team together with colleagues from all over Europe. Next to this, we offer you a EUR 350 gross Internship/travel compensation and a workplace with a view.
Your work location
This traineeship is based in our Amsterdam headquarters located in the Rembrandt tower in Amsterdam close to public transport and easily accessible by bike.
How to apply
If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you! Please send your resume and a short motivation to hr@VISUfarma.com",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 221,health,Indeed,p_6e1e7828b7c2a0f6,Operationeel Customer Service Manager,MyParcel, Hoofddorp,"Introductie MyParcel.

MyParcel is een dynamisch, snelgroeiend bedrijf dat innovatieve online software ontwikkelt die het logistieke proces voor webshops én consumenten gemakkelijker en voordeliger maakt. Ons team zit vol creatieve ideeën die ervoor zorgen dat ons bedrijf zich snel ontwikkelt. Wij helpen onze klanten met uiteenlopende logistieke en andere e-commerce gerelateerde vraagstukken. De markt waarin wij ons bevinden is dynamisch en volop in beweging, wij bezitten de ambitie om hier een leidende rol in te spelen en zoeken iemand die ons daarbij kan helpen.
Speel Stop
De functie.

Wij zoeken een nieuwe Operationeel Manager om onze Customer Service afdeling naar een volgend level te tillen. Ben jij ervaren, een echte aanpakker, gedreven en kan jij goed het overzicht behouden binnen een hectische omgeving? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

Als Operationeel CS Manager houd je je bezig met het aansturen, verder ontwikkelen en verbeteren van processen binnen Customer Service. Je bent onderdeel van het MT en houdt het team op de hoogte middels o.a. data, ontwikkelingspunten en de actuele statussen. Wij zoeken een echte aanpakker die graag de leiding pakt, uit zichzelf met ideeën komt en die graag aanwezig is op de vloer tussen de collega’s van het CS team.
Jouw werkzaamheden.
Je stuurt dagelijks de Customer Service afdeling aan, welke is onderverdeeld in vier branches: New Customers, Health, Fashion & Overig en Home & Garden en Fragile.
Je geeft direct leiding aan 4 teamleiders en indirect aan 40 tot 60 Customer Service medewerkers.

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de gehele operationele performance van de Customer Service afdeling. Je bekijkt en analyseert de kwantitatieve en kwalitatieve resultaten. Je stuurt data-driven, maar houdt daarbij te alle tijde de mens achter de cijfers in het vizier.
Je bent continue op zoek naar manieren om de operatie beter, slimmer, efficiënter te laten werken. Je zet verbetertrajecten op en zorgt dat deze geïmplementeerd worden.
Je weet als geen ander hoe belangrijk het is om resultaten te verbeteren door mensen te motiveren en te ontwikkelen.

Klantvriendelijkheid en het zoeken naar de juiste oplossing zijn de belangrijkste pijlers van MyParcel. Je stimuleert je teamleiders/medewerkers om de klant zo goed mogelijk te bedienen en de verwachtingen te overtreffen. Klanttevredenheid is immers een van de belangrijkste targets van de branches.
Je denkt in efficiency.
Je motiveert, inspireert en hebt oog voor individu en teamproces.
Dit ben jij.

Jij bent van nature een verbinder, een motivator (met mensgericht leiderschap) en analist in één. Het is aan jou de uitdaging om dagelijks de juiste combinatie te vinden! Ondernemerschap, open en eerlijke communicatie en niet praten maar gewoon doen liggen aan de basis van ons succes. Jij past binnen onze informele, resultaat- en mensgerichte cultuur en brengt de afdeling Customer Service naar een hoger niveau.
Jij neemt mee: energie, enthousiasme en positiviteit.
Je bent altijd op zoek naar nieuwe mogelijkheden.
Je bezit goede communicatieve, analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden.
Je hebt ervaring in het managen van een positieve servicecultuur en persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Je hebt HBO werk- en denkniveau.
Je voelt anderen goed en snel aan. Je kunt je makkelijk verplaatsen in de gevoelens en situaties van zowel klant als collega.
Je stuurt op goede, meetbare resultaten. O.a. klanttevredenheidsscore, reactiepercentage, verzuimcijfers, enzovoorts.
Je hebt 4-5 jaar ervaring in een dienstverlenende/ customer service omgeving. Kennis en affiniteit met WFM is een pré.
Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in een leidinggevende functie waarbij je ervaring hebt opgedaan met zowel directe als indirecte sturing.
Je hebt affiniteit met automatisering en software. Kennis van Salesforce is een pré.
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal goed.
Dit is wat wij jou bieden.

We zijn een jong en enthousiast team van collega’s dat iedereen thuis wil laten voelen. Daarnaast staan we altijd open voor nieuwe ideeën. Hiermee streven we naar de beste en meest persoonlijke service voor onze klanten in een professionele maar ongedwongen werksfeer. Benieuwd naar wat wij jou kunnen bieden?
Een zeer veelzijdige en afwisselende functie met veel verantwoordelijkheid.
Goede koffie.
Informele werkomgeving met platte organisatiestructuur.
25 vakantiedagen per jaar.
Reiskostenvergoeding.
Een pensioenregeling.
Ben je geïnteresseerd en herken jij jezelf in bovenstaand profiel?

Reageer dan snel! Stuur je CV en motivatie op via onderstaand sollicitatieformulier en wie weet tot snel! Voor eventuele vragen over de functie of de vacature kun je contact opnemen met Madelon Hulsbos, HR Manager.

Achternaam
E-mailadres
Telefoonnummer
CV (Word of pdf, max. 10 MB)
Toegestane bestandstypen: pdf, doc, docx.
Upload
Motivatiebrief (Word of pdf, max. 10 MB)
Toegestane bestandstypen: pdf, doc, docx.
Upload
Sollicitatie versturen
Sollicitaties zonder volledige motivatie worden niet meegenomen in de procedure.

Maggie Kramar, Recruitment tel. 0621904651
No recruitment agencies please.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)
