column1: 223,health,Indeed,p_56d5dddad7ed13a3,Consultants Zimbabwe,Aflatoun, Amsterdam,"TERMS OF REFERENCE
Research Institute / Consultants to conduct a Randomised Control Trial and qualitative analysis on the Aflateen+ Life Skills and Financial Education programme in Zimbabwe
From: Aflatoun International, Amsterdam
When: January 2021 – August 2023. The candidate should be available in February – April 2021 and December 2022 – February 2023.
Deadline for submitting proposals: Monday 25 January 2021
Background

Aflatoun International is a non-profit organization, which offers social and financial education to children and young people worldwide, empowering them to make a positive change for a more equitable world. Aflatoun creates high-quality curricula, for different age groups, which are contextualized to local needs and specific circumstances. In 2019, Aflatoun reached 10.5 million children in 108 countries through over 345 partner organizations.

Aflatoun programs inspire children to discover their talents and put them to use, to stand up for their rights and those of their communities, to play games, and to solve problems. They learn how to save, how to budget, and how to set up social and financial enterprises that benefit themselves, their families, and their communities.

Aflatoun has been identified as a best in practice organisation by The Brookings Institution in the report 'Can We Leapfrog? The Potential of Education Innovations to Rapidly Accelerate Progress’. The report presents a forward path in global education by examining the possibility of using innovations to ‘leapfrog’, rapidly accelerating educational progress to ensure that all young people develop the skills they need to thrive in a fast-changing world. Additionally, in 2019, HundrED Connect officially recognized Aflatoun as one of top 5 Spotlight Innovators for its work on financial education. HundrED Connect is an initiative that aims to improve education and inspire a movement by encouraging pedagogically sound and ambitious innovations to spread across the world. Aflatoun was also selected as an official Vanguard Member of the Million Lives Club, which celebrates innovators and social entrepreneurs who are reaching new horizons of impact and improving the lives of those living on less than $5 a day, and who have already scaled to serve at least 1,000,000 people.
Project information

While significant progress has been made towards universal primary school attendance, the reality is that a third (34%) of children of lower secondary school age (12-14 years) and more than half (58%) of 15 to 17-year-olds in sub-Saharan Africa are not in school. Hence, majority of those who should be acquiring the skills to prepare them for the job market, or move into further education, are not in the classroom, making it less likely that they will have a positive impact on their countries’ development.

Improving youth’s future prospects for decent work helps break the intergenerational cycle of poverty and is beneficial for entire communities. To do so, it is crucial that adolescents understand money, resources and the markets that increasingly affect them, as they become consumers, workers and active citizens. This greatly improves their prospects for the future, as it prepares young people for a complex and turbulent job market.

In this context, Aflatoun will roll out its Aflateen+ programme in Zimbabwe through its partnership with implementing organization Junior Achievement Zimbabwe. Junior Achievement Zimbabwe is a not-for-profit organization aiming to prepare and inspire young people to value free enterprise, business, economics and entrepreneurship.

Aflateen+ is a comprehensive educational programme to transform the lives of adolescent girls and boys aged 14-19 through social and financial education, and entrepreneurship with a gender lens. The programme’s biggest strength is its flexibility to adapt to the local needs of the girls and boys, while offering a variety of lessons on life skills, sexual and reproductive health and rights, and financial empowerment. Throughout the lessons, the connection between gender equality and economic prosperity is emphasized. The project’s overall objective is

To socially and economically empower young girls and boys (ages of 14 to 19) in Zimbabwe by providing them with the social and financial skills necessary to make informed choices about their health, financial situation, and education.
Impact assessment

To assess the impact of the Aflateen+ programme on adolescent girls and boys in Zimbabwe, this research will use a mixed-method approach, with a heavy quantitative component. The study will collect and evaluate quantitative data through a Randomised Controlled Trial (RCT) and qualitative data from e.g. Most Significant Change or Focus Group Discussions.
The main question of the research is: What is the effect of the Aflateen+ programme among participants of the Aflateen+ programme, relative to the representative control sample in Zimbabwe?

Since the project runs over three years, we aim to not only measure knowledge, awareness and attitudes of adolescent girls and boys, but also assess the impact of the programme on SDG outcome and impact indicators like school retention/attendance/drop-out, teenage pregnancy, gender based violence, and HIV-risk behaviour.
Capacity assessment

In order to assess the effectiveness of the capacity building component of the project, the research will include two tools assessing the capacity of both trained partners/NGOs, as well as trained teachers/educators.

Adding to that, as a follow up to the training of teachers, weekly push messages will be sent to the teachers or trainers via SMS or social media platforms. These messages may be questions or surveys on the progress of Aflateen+ activities. Additionally, micro content that reinforces learning, or guides teaching activities will be shared.

The evidence generated through this study will assist in regional advocacy and Aflatoun’s engagement with regional bodies like SADC and the African Union, which will contribute to our efforts towards education system change.
Experience requirements
Research institute/consultants should have:
1. Experience conducting Random Control Trials
2. Extensive experience with leading a team of researchers and data enumerators incl. training of data enumerators on the use of evaluation tools
3. Extensive experience in survey development and contextualisation
4. Experience with statistical analyses using statistical software such as STATA or R
5. Experience developing and contextualising qualitative evaluation tools e.g. Most Significant Change or Focus Group Discussions
6. Experience with collecting qualitative data and qualitative analyses
7. Experience with writing quantitative and qualitative evaluation and capacity assessment reports.
Skill requirements
1. Fluency in English
2. Master’s degree or PhD in a relevant field (e.g. Development Economics, Social Sciences, M&E)
3. Contextual knowledge of Zimbabwe.
Scope of the assignment
Research institute/consultants agrees to:
1. Liaise with implementing partner to understand implementation design
2. Attend the training of teachers to understand programme methodologies and content
3. Execute the randomisation based on a list of schools/informal centers provided by implementing partner
4. Write an inception report with the proposed research design, sample size, effect size calculation, randomization, and work plan
5. Contextualize the quantitative and qualitative tools based on the already developed Aflateen+ survey and Most Significant Change guidelines
6. Develop a simple monitoring tool to track programme attendance to be used by teachers
7. Develop two tools to assess the capacity of both trained partners/NGOs, as well as trained teachers/educators
8. Procure ethical approvals from Independent Review Boards before commencing data collection activities
9. Test the internal validity of the developed evaluation tools in a pilot phase, report results and provide recommendations and integrate those for tool improvement
10. Recruit and train data enumerators on the use of the contextualised evaluation tools
11. Collect quantitative and qualitative data from a minimum of 30 treatment and 30 control schools
12. Collect data on the capacity of the trained partners/NGOs, as well as trained teachers/educators
13. Import all the quantitative data into statistical software and analyse the quantitative and qualitative data
14. Write a high quality baseline and endline report with the impact and capacity assessment results and recommendations.
Timeline
Research institute/consultants agree to work within the following timeline:
1. Contracted should be available to prepare for the job starting in the last week of January 2021 in Zimbabwe:
a. Preparation visits/meetings to organise the impact and capacity assessment
b. Inception phase
2. Throughout the rest of the time the contracted will work on collecting quantitative and qualitative data, analyses and report writing.
a. The baseline takes place in February 2021
b. The endline takes place in December 2022
Payment
The budget for this assignment is 60.000 EUR and the payment schedule is as follows:
30% upon approval of the inception report20% upon approval of the baseline report30% upon completion of the endline data collection and receipt of the data file20% upon approval of the endline report
Submission and questions
Submit any questions and proposals by email to:
Livia Remeijers. E-mail: livia@aflatoun.org
Bid for research institute / consultant services
Interested candidates must include the following:
a. Technical proposal including experience conducting RCTs
b. Detailed financial proposal including daily rates of all team members and activities (incl. VAT)
c. Curriculum Vitaes of all team members who will be involved, clearly stating their role
d. At least three references.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 224,health,Indeed,p_4bed363e7b041ddc,Microstructure Performance Researcher,Optiver, Amsterdam,"Optiver is a leading trading firm driven by technology with over one thousand employees globally. We pioneer our own trading strategies and systems using clean code and sophisticated technology, running a global network with thousands of high-performance low-latency applications that solve problems in nanoseconds.

We are seeking to grow our Performance Research team which specializes in exchange connectivity, low latency technologies, and competitive analysis. This team is responsible for keeping Optiver ahead in the market market by understanding and optimizing the interplay between trading strategies, exchange connectivity and market microstructure. This could be done through the analysis of exchange protocols and analyzing the physical setup as well as business approaches. Experimentation and a data-oriented mindset are key to being successful in this role. Whatever ideas you have, we can try!

A Microstructure Performance Researcher is responsible for tying our systems back to the trading problem using data analysis while working closely with traders, engineers and other researchers to help develop new pioneering ideas. This role is about validating, modelling, and providing metrics on the systems we build and use.
What you will do:
Understand exchange microstructure and rules and how they affect trading strategies. Optimize existing or create new models and strategies based on this knowledge
Develop, improve, and standardize exchange infrastructure optimization methods and guidelines
Guide the development and standardization of exchange optimization protocols
Conduct progress reports and establish exchange protocols for multiple locations and ensure those protocols are implemented across relevant infrastructure

Critically review co-locations and the technologies used for potential infrastructure changes to maximize efficiencies and fine tune our exchange relationships. This could include analysis of market microstructure, exchange protocols, speed-sensitive communication systems, trading opportunities and performance advantages
Help develop and expand other relationships for diversification of region and product across other exchanges

Contribute to the design, development and implementation of Performance Engineering solutions for our global business, including elements of latency analysis and the development of tools to assess performance
Look for adjustments that can be made to our engagements and protocols that will increase our performance

Liaise and collaborate with all relevant Optiver technical teams and trading technology groups as well as relevant trading and research leads to develop new projects, products and low-latency strategies, all driven by data
Seek out competitor intelligence, legal analysis and trading analysis
Help develop and expand ideas and techniques onto new markets.
What you will need:

There are unconventional ways to seek out information sources for the best trading cycles and it requires an inquisitive mindset to garner that knowledge and seek out new sources of detail. A technical appreciation of the following will be of benefit:
A degree in Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or similar
A quantitative mindset and a good working knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and data analytics.
A research approach in order to tackle algorithmic and optimization procedures on exchange and trading systems (gateway/switch routing/warming, line arbitration)
Solid programming skills in Python for data analysis. C/C++ knowledge is a plus
Prior exchange connectivity and market microstructure analysis experience as well as the ability to develop efficient data pipelines to analyse this data
Experience with highly distributed, high frequency and low latency systems
Knowledge of exchange infrastructure and FIX protocols
Involvement with database & protocol decoding infrastructure.
What you can expect from us

We understand that our best work is done together. We constantly ask ourselves how to do better, which creates a stimulating and fun environment, where you are seriously rewarded for your performance We offer excellent remuneration and great secondary benefits, such as an attractive profit sharing structure, training opportunities, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, a premium-free pension, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, even weekly chair massages and of course Friday afternoon drinks. We are used to guiding candidates through their relocation and offer relocation packages and discounts on health insurance.
More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

226,health,Indeed,p_25fd50d1b7d6d8a3,Data Center Engineer,interxion, Amsterdam,"What's in it for you?

Effective communication skills
Independent working method
Ability to apply specialist and detailed technical expertise
Why Interxion?
The opportunity to make an impact
Highly collaborative teams that build relationships with world-class customers
A high-performing international business at the heart of the digital economy

The Data Centre Engineer position is a contributing member to the site level Data Center Operations team assigned to one or more of our data center properties reporting directly to the Data Centre Manager. The Data Centre Engineer will have experience in mission critical infrastructure, including Generators, UPS Systems, HVAC Systems, Fire/Life Safety Systems, BMS Systems, and CMMS systems. It is expected that the Data Centre Engineer candidate has expertise in either electrical work or mechanical work and it would be expected that he/she would be competent in the area of non expertise. The responsibilities of the Data Centre Engineer are: to contribute to the daily site operation, including creation and modification of site operating procedures, contribute to creation of change management tickets, creation of timely incident reporting, site maintenance and repairs/inspections to help ensure Digital Realty’s data center operations achieve the highest level of availability.
What you'll need:
Minimum of 3 Years’ experience as a Building Services/Facilities Engineer in a similar, critical environment
column2: Relevant equipment experience, e.g. UPS, HVAC, generators, fire/life safety systems

column4: Extensive experience and understanding of health and safety and statutory compliance
column5: Effective communication skills and customer focus
column6: Good knowledge of Dutch and English (written and spoken)
column7: The ability to work effectively under pressure
column8: A flexible approach to on call requirements with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
column9: Willingness to undertake a 24/7 shift rota if required.

227,health,Indeed,p_6548b8ba1d77b188,Senior Data Scientist,Tiqets, Amsterdam,"Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Data Scientist to join us!
FULL-TIME · AMSTERDAM
Who are we?

We’re revolutionising the way people buy tickets to culture and attractions in cities all over the world. Our technology allows users to easily browse and book tickets to the best attractions in seconds, meaning customers can enter museums, zoos, theme parks and more simply by showing their smartphones. About time, right?
We’re dedicated to bringing simplicity to the world of travel and entertainment. If you want to join our team, working as a Senior Data Scientist, send us your resume. We might be looking for YOU!
Our values
Be accessible: Help out, communicate honestly, and be there for each other.
Be remarkable: Have fun, think creatively, and celebrate great moments together.
Skip the line: Be fast, flexible, and smart
column2: take responsibility and push forward.

column1: Life at Tiqets
What you will do

The Data Team is responsible for supporting the data needs of a large number of teams at Tiqets by helping them become more data-driven in the way they operate. As a Senior Data Scientist on the Data team, you will have the opportunity to lead and drive several key projects related to Marketing Campaign Optimization, A/B Testing, Conversion Funnel Optimization, Recommendations, Forecasting and much more.

You will work closely together with other Data Scientists, ML Engineers, Data Analysts, Developers and Product Owners to ask the right questions, challenge the status quo, build new hypotheses and help Tiqets improve through an iterative process of testing and learning.
If you are passionate about Data, enjoy working on challenging business problems in a fast-moving environment and believe in the importance of teamwork then this could be the right opening for you.
Responsibilities
Architect intelligent, creative Data Science solutions to complex business problems with a bias for starting simple and iterating

Collaborate with other Data team members on short and long-term Data projects related to Experimentation, Product Ranking, Recommendations, Internal Search, Forecasting, Retention, Marketing Campaign Optimization, etc
Think beyond just the Data. Interact directly with Product Owners, Developers and other teams to build a strong understanding of how Tiqets operates and the opportunities/challenges ahead
Design, run and analyse A/B Tests across our products
column2: Help propagate a hypothesis-driven culture of testing and learning

column1: Mentor junior members of the team by building a strong culture of Data Science best practices and ensuring that we pick the right tools (and techniques) for the right job
Continuously look for ways in which Tiqets can improve its Products and InternalOps by staying up-to-speed with latest trends, tools and techniques in Machine Learning
Qualifications
Masters degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or equivalent
5+ years of experience in Data Science and/or Machine Learning roles (past experience at a Tech company desired)
Strong Analytical and problem-solving skills
column2: Ability to break down complex problems into simpler components

column1: Expertise in Machine Learning algorithms
column2: Sound fundamentals in Probability & Statistics, Calculus and Mathematics

column1: Prior experience designing, running and analysing A/B Tests
Strong SQL skills
column2: Proficiency using Python and popular ML libraries like scikit-learn

column1: Experience working with a modern Data Warehouse like Redshift, Snowflake or BigQuery, and using BI tools like Looker, Tableau or Qlikview
Excellent oral and written communication skills
column2: Capacity to thrive in a startup/scale-up environment, adapt quickly, work independently and take ownership of your work

column1: Nice to have: past experience working in PPC Marketing and/or travel industry experience working at an OTA like Tiqets
Fluent in English
column2: Living in the Netherlands/EU

column1: Perks at Tiqets
Young, dynamic, international working environment
Bright, welcoming office located in the centre of Amsterdam
Opportunity to make an impact in the fastest growing tech scaleup
20% personal Tiqets discount code to explore great museums/venues worldwide
Annual company getaway to undisclosed location
Health insurance

Friday drinks

Summer party

Sports activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing and more

Pension scheme and travel compensation",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=6548b8ba1d77b188&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=126296d422b3b808&assa=3609,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=6548b8ba1d77b188&fccid=91a9123df086a3a9&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

228,health,Indeed,p_05b454a166229a68,"Global Senior Manager Diversity, Inclusion, & Belonging - Identity",Bookingcom, Amsterdam,"In 2019 Booking.com was names #1 in the Financial Times Diversity List out of 700 employers assessed on diversity of gender, age, ethnicity, disability and sexual orientation.

As we approach our third year of having a centre of excellence dedicated to Diversity & Inclusion, Wellbeing, and employee volunteerism we find ourselves taking a broader role across our organisation but also our corporate portfolio. As such, we are looking to add a seasoned professional with deep global D&I experience.

As a Diversity & Inclusion Senior Manager you are responsible for thought leadership in the development, implementation and monitoring of Inclusion, Diversity, & Belonging (IDB) strategy & programs. This role is responsible for leading and driving cross business strategy, communications, interventions, and initiatives that create and foster an open and inclusive environment for the organisation in a global environment.

This leader will also be responsible for creating our strategy and deployment of our identity work (e.g., disability, gender, nationality, parenting/carer status, race/ethnicity, sexual orientation/gender identity, etc.) and working with various parts of the organisation to promote inclusive policy, interventions, etc. inside and outside of the organisation.

You bring deep experience within this field, in building internal and external programs, and supporting internal stakeholders, including our executive committee, to deliver on IDB initiatives across a global multi-office environment.
This role is preferably based in our Global HQ in Amsterdam, but open to location.
Role Responsibilities:
Function as a second to our Global Director Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging, Wellbeing, and Volunteerism in the creation of strategy.
Drive the building of high performing teams by connecting the business needs to IDB opportunities.

Proactively evaluate and predict strategic interventions where Booking.com needs to develop and critically evaluate impact against industry standards and innovations particularly in the areas of leadership competency & well-being/mental health.
Contribute to the development of our enhanced People data strategy and success metrics, and continuously track, to ensure an equal and diverse spread of people across the organization
Drive knowledge and expertise with various senior stakeholders in the People department to attract, retain and promote a diverse workforce for the organization
Lead business unit development of IDB goals both in product and colleague interventions
Work with the internal communications team create awareness around our diversity statement
Your experience and skills:
Experience with building global programs while understanding the complexity of local differences across the globe
Deep knowledge on identity and the possible implications of difference and how to address, prevent, and counteract.
Experience in working in a multi stakeholder environment and continuous representing all stakeholders and their needs
Experience managing up to include senior leaders
+5 years of relevant work experience highly desirable
Previous experience in the areas of social justice, identity theory, equality programs, etc.
Previous experience in a fast paced commercial and international environment (preferably e-commerce)
Excellent verbal and written communication and editing skills in English
Strong organizational and program management skills
Ability to translate business strategies into practical solutions that strengthen our core values
Ability to influence and align stakeholders and define clear goals and progress
Ability to work independently to plan and prioritize workload in line with business needs
Strong employee experience focus and proactive attitude

A educational background in Human Resources, Sociology, Psychology, Anthropology, or other human related field is highly desirable",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=05b454a166229a68&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=792e8ec0c9040430&assa=4422,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=05b454a166229a68&fccid=62ee2fabbf8c93c5&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
229,health,Indeed,p_3b6039ee1d0e4854,Data & AI Strategist,Philips, Amsterdam,"Job Title
Data & AI Strategist
Job Description
In this role, you have the opportunity to

Philips is one of the largest Health technology companies in the world. Every day we connect millions of people to our offerings generating terabytes of data. Our purpose is to help improve people’s health and wellbeing through meaningful innovation. We want to help drive the transformation of healthcare to achieve this. The relentless progression of digital technologies, such as the Internet of Things and Artificial Intelligence will be the key enabler for this transformation. As we continue our digital transformation journey towards digital relevance, Philips Personal Health Cluster needs a leader to drive strategic activities and ground-breaking capabilities around all aspects of Data & AI (Artificial Intelligence). This includes but is not limited to development of Data and AI Strategy, explore new monetization models, orchestrate ecosystem play, technology road-maps, develop and establish data governance and associated implementation plans to bring the transformation journey to fruition.
You are responsible for
Work at the intersection of Group strategic objectives and the data, analytics and AI strategies required to enable the transformation for chosen value spaces and propositions
Identify value creation opportunities using data, conduct market intelligence scans and provide key strategic insights
Develop controls points and associated mitigation strategies to secure control points
Abreast with the latest developments in the area of data and AI strategies, management and ecosystem play
Define, implement and monitor metrics and key performance indicators for Data & AI Strategy maturity and ensure continued strategic alignment with short and long-term business objectives
Be an authority in this domain and a key data and AI evangelist across all functions that intersect the data & AI discipline
Development of potential solution directions and requirements for people, processes and technology to support business outcomes

Enable efficient & effective partner management and working relationship with businesses and functional organizations. Act as the primary liaison to Chief Architect Office and other strategic partners for the chosen value spaces and propositions
Establish and be responsible for key data & AI strategy initiatives. Identify and manage risks, changes, issues and scope. Orchestrate mitigation through relevant partners and governance processes.
Present recommendations, secure buy-in for the strategies, and associated implementation plan to effectuate change from cross-functional and Business management.

Team-up with AI & Data Science Center of Excellence, to conduct maturity assessment and needs analysis for Data Strategy, including Enablers, Competencies, Platforms and Practices for chosen value spaces and propositions leveraging upon the Group data strategy framework.
You are a part of

You are part of the Personal Health Innovation team reporting to Personal Health Data Strategy & AI leader. The job is based in Amsterdam with some flexibility while visiting the sites in the Netherlands, US, China and India.
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience
Master’s Degree in Information/data or in a technical/functional area such as Computer Science or Engineering. MBA is preferred
A minimum of 10 years’ experience, of which 5- 8 years in Data/Digital Transformation
Experience in defining and implementing strategy in the AI/ML (machine learning) and e-commerce domains.
Experience developing and implementing ML/AI algorithms.
Knowledge with a major cloud platform such as Amazon AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure and ML tools
Demonstrated experience managing the design, development and implementation of data solutions across a variety of data management platforms and architectures.
Demonstrated experience with relational data warehouse design and management, with modern data architectures and technologies including Hadoop, Elasticsearch.
Knowledge of Agile Development, continuous integration and automation testing.
Demonstrated ability to thrive in a dynamic environment, meet deadlines, and simultaneously work on multiple activities.
Fluent grasp of the digital technologies, ecosystems and business models
Passion for strategy, innovation, and business development
Passion for cultivating long-term relationships with key partners and manage priorities
Network and history of successful work with senior cross-functional leaders across large multi-national organizations
Strong Leadership Identity being a strategic thinker, results oriented, an effective communicator, a self-starter and able to operate with minimal direction
In return, we offer you

A path towards your most rewarding career. Succeeding in this role in a complex environment will open many doors for your long-term career, in other areas in Philips or otherwise. We also believe that we are at our best as a company when you are at yours as a person. Thus, we offer competitive health benefits, a flexible work schedule and access to local well-being focused activities. Furthermore, Philips University is available to all employees for learning and development opportunities.
Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.
#LI-EU
Contact
If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.
If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com.

(Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=3b6039ee1d0e4854&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=ccf1511f1c25c11b&assa=5855,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=3b6039ee1d0e4854&fccid=e4af9ca5b6d3a604&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
230,health,Indeed,p_48898037db079b5d,CloudOps Administrator,vpsmodel, Amsterdam,"Job Description:

Have you ever wondered what happens inside the cloud? Based in Amsterdam, vpsmodel is a dynamic, high-growth technology company that serves a robust and passionate community of developers, teams, and businesses around the world. We believe that today’s entrepreneurs are changing the world through software. Our mission is to empower these entrepreneurs by bringing modern app development within reach for any developer, anywhere in the world.
We want people who are passionate about troubleshooting complex problems with systems, networking and storage at scale.

We are looking for a seasoned system administrator to help us keep the cloud running smoothly. Reporting to the manager of Cloud Operations, the Cloud Operations Administrator monitors and provides first-response to all cloud health issues that impact, or could potentially impact, customer experience. You will interface with teams across the organization to research and troubleshoot issues from single droplets to cloud-wide disturbances. This role works our second shift, 4pm-12am EST.
What you will be doing:
Ensuring maximum uptime for our 10K+ system global infrastructure
Automating processes and building tools to improve operational efficiency
Coordinating operational work across teams to improve the platform with minimal impact
What we will expect from you:
Solid experience with Linux operating systems and day to day upkeep
Familiarity with virtualization technologies and troubleshooting virtual machine instances
Basic networking concepts and technologies
Basic storage concepts and technologies
Experience with monitoring systems
Experience scripting in one or more of the following languages: Bash, Python, or Ruby
Experience with configuration management systems
A passion for good documentation and open communication
Proven ability to learn!
Why you’ll like working for vpsmodel:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

We have amazing people. We can promise you will work with some of the smartest and most interesting people in the industry. We work hard but we always have fun doing it. We care deeply about each other and take our “no jerks” rule very seriously.

We value development. We are a high-performance organization that is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development. You’ll need to be great to get hired here and we promise you’ll get even better.

We care about you. We offer competitive health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents, a monthly gym reimbursement to support your physical health, and a monthly commute allowance to make your trips to and from work easier.

We invest in your future. We offer competitive compensation and a 401k plan with up to a 4% employer match. We also provide all employees with Kindles and reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.

We want you to love where you work. We have great office spaces located in the heart of Amsterdam and offer daily catered lunches to keep your hunger at bay. We’re also very remote-friendly—we use Slack to communicate across the company—and all remote employees have the opportunity to onboard in-office and take an all-expenses paid trip to our annual company offsite, Shark Week, to get quality in-person time with the team at least once a year. We also allow employees to customize their workstations to meet their needs—whether remote or in office.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=48898037db079b5d&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=8bf76e4ac5b9e200&assa=6631,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=48898037db079b5d&fccid=eac0bd9a4e632e7b&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

column1: 232,health,Indeed,p_2e887e6337471250,Research Technician Molecular Microbiology,Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, AmsterdamZuidoost,"The Molecular Microbiology group, located at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is looking for a research technician with experience in Molecular Biology.
Location: AMSTERDAM
Job description

Our international research group is active in the field of protein trafficking in bacteria with applications in the development of antibiotics and vaccines. We share a lab in the new OI2 research building with the Medical Microbiology and Infection control group. Technically, our work involves Microbiology, Molecular Biology and Biochemistry with a focus on protein interactions. The successful applicant will participate in our research projects and work in close collaboration with other technicians, PhD students and senior scientists. In addition he/she will assist in practical courses and perform lab management tasks.
Your duties
Play a constructive and responsible role in the daily management of the laboratory.
In particular you will:
support the research projects of the section Molecular Microbiology
ensure that equipment is in optimal working order
instruct and support other lab members
assist in practical courses
Requirements
a qualification in laboratory skills, i.e. Hoger Laboratorium Onderwijs or equivalent
demonstrated hands-on experience with recombinant DNA techniques such as PCR and cloning
experience in protein expression, purification and analysis
strong communication, organization and social skills
column2: high competence in either English or Dutch (both are preferred)

column1: eam player with the ability to work independently
strong motivation for scientific research
What are we offering?
A challenging position in a socially involved organization. On full-time basis the remuneration amounts to a minimum gross monthly salary of €2,656 (scale 8)
and a maximum €3,548 (scale 8), depending on your education and experience.
The job profile is based on the university job ranking system and is vacant for at least 0.8 FTE.
The initial employment contract will affect a period of 1 year, with the possibility of extension.
Additionally, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam offers excellent fringe benefits and various schemes and regulations to promote a good work/life balance, such as:
a maximum of 41 days of annual leave based on full-time employment,
8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus,
solid pension scheme (ABP),
contribution to commuting expenses
optional model for designing a personalized benefits package
About Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam

The ambition of Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is clear: to contribute to a better world through outstanding education and ground-breaking research. We strive to be a university where personal development and commitment to society play a leading role. A university where people from different disciplines and backgrounds collaborate to achieve innovations and to generate new knowledge. Our teaching and research encompass the entire spectrum of academic endeavour – from the humanities, the social sciences and the natural sciences through to the life sciences and the medical sciences.

Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is home to more than 26,000 students. We employ over 4,600 individuals. The VU campus is easily accessible and located in the heart of Amsterdam’s Zuidas district, a truly inspiring environment for teaching and research.
Diversity

We are an inclusive university community. Diversity is one of our most important values. We believe that engaging in international activities and welcoming students and staff from a wide variety of backgrounds enhances the quality of our education and research. We are always looking for people who can enrich our world with their own unique perspectives and experiences.
The Faculty of Science

The Faculty of Science inspires researchers and students to find sustainable solutions for complex societal issues. From forest fires to big data, from obesity to medicines and from molecules to the moon: our teaching and research programmes cover the full spectrum of the natural sciences. We share knowledge and experience with leading research institutes and industries, both here in the Netherlands and abroad.

Working at the Faculty of Science means working with students, PhD candidates and researchers, all with a clear focus on their field and a broad view of the world. We employ more than 1,250 staff members, and we are home to around 6,000 students.
Molecular Microbiology Group
The Molecular Microbiology group belongs to the Molecular Cell Biology department and the Amsterdam Institute for Molecules, Medicines and Systems (AIMMS
column2: https:// www.aimms.vu.nl/en/index.aspx). Within the group we are interested in the mechanisms of protein trafficking in model and pathogenic bacteria. This also forms the basis of more applied projects in which we develop antimicrobials. The section is also involved in teaching such as the BSc programs “Biology”, “Biomedical Sciences”, “Health and Life Sciences” and the MSc programs “Biomolecular Sciences” and “Infectious Diseases”.

column1: Application

Are you interested in this position? Please apply via the application button and upload your curriculum vitae, letter of motivation, track records and details of references (all in English) until March 15, 2021 . Applications received by e-mail will not be processed.
Vacancy questions
If you have any questions regarding this vacancy, you may contact:
Name: Dr. Joen Luirink
Position: Associate Professor Molecular Microbiology/CSO of Abera Bioscience
E-mail: s.luirink@vu.nl

233,health,Indeed,p_102f4a6701b0ff3e,Europe Market Marketing Insights & Analytics Leader,Philips, Amsterdam,"Job Title
Europe Market Marketing Insights & Analytics Leader
Job Description
In this role, you have the opportunity to:

You will act as the Lead Business Partner and main point of contact for MI&A in the regional management team. The regional MI&A team is responsible to provide the necessary insights and analytics support across several countries in their market using standardized tools, platforms and methodological approaches.

As Lead of the regional MI&A team will lead a group of Business Partners which focus on providing local market insights for their respective cluster/business. The regional team will also cover sales analytics across customers and with D2C channels. You are accountable for the insights and analytics deliverables of the team. Furthermore, in close collaboration with the global MI&A CoE the regional team ensures standardized collection of relevant data at a granular level. Driving specific needs of analytics solutions to the Global MI&A team, whilst applying operation on a daily basis the global solutions that can be used for operational sales and marketing excellence.
You are responsible for:
Part of the regional management team, leads regional MI&A activities and is main point of accountability within the region

Responsible for team management, end-accountable for planning, prioritization and deliverables of that team, including: Sales-in, Sales-out, Market share, report out on IGM and Pricing, Unique local customer data (e.g.: local retailer data), promotional effectiveness, retailer segmentation, shopper data.
Ensures measurement and impact of business insights and actions driven by the team, drive PDCA from the insights across countries and application of best practice

Lead validation (regional for regional) and localization (global for regional) of local relevance of global IVP’s and opportunity areas within the region, including definition of categories and competition

Responsible, in collaboration with the CoE and the European marketing team, to identify the regional sources of business, and translating into impact on commercial strategy, global & market marketing planning
Drive regional Daily Management, ladders down to market Daily Management
Understand retailer & customer needs, ensure local relevancy of global proposition & communication insights
Translating AOP in daily management metrics e.g. market share/sales-in/sales-out targets
Accountable for driving actions from customer feedback and optimizing the approach accordingly together with CoE
Prioritize and orchestrate the data, research and insight-needs for the Region. Proposing key insight topics to global planning, then executing in line with agreed plans.
Ensure standardization of data flows into central data lakes and application of central analytical tools and methods
Part of global MI&A leadership team reporting to the global head of Marketing Insights & Analytics
Coordinates iteration and improvement of global ways of working, feeding back to central teams to standardize and share best practice
Drive customer, businesses and D2C/ level insights and trends, to drive strategic marketing planning and execution at regional level
You are part of:

The new European Market leadership team. This team will be responsible for the transformation and innovation in the European market. We will have a virtual diverse network organization, with passionate colleagues who are energized to fulfil our purpose of improving people’s health and well-being through meaningful innovation, whilst always delighting consumers.
Skills & Experience
BSc/MSc degree in marketing, business or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Thought leadership and shaping the transformation and change management
15+ working experience, in consumer focused, complex, matrixed, multinational environment. Preferably with experience in consumer goods, online services, e-commerce, or mobile applications
Experience of working in Consumer Health or Healthcare is a plus
High level of expertise in technical knowledge on emerging and innovative insights and analytics techniques, tools /platforms
Broad and deep research experience across qualitative, quantitative and agile research methods. Ability to reframe synthesized data & learnings into new frameworks to bring consumer insights to life.
High affinity with AI powered insight tools and engines.
In return, we offer you

To grow your career in a company with a unique purpose to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. You can join an innovative health-tech company that values the interaction between technology and people, working in a multinational and multicultural environment. You will be surrounded by diverse colleagues who share your passion to create superior consumer experiences. Your work will be challenging and full of opportunities for growth. Variety and challenge will be part of your daily routine.
Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability, protected veteran or marital status.
#LI-EU
Contact
If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.
If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com.

(Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=102f4a6701b0ff3e&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=7d177296ec7991f3&assa=2828,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=102f4a6701b0ff3e&fccid=e4af9ca5b6d3a604&vjs=3,9 dagen geleden,9 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

234,health,Indeed,p_2306928681e47392,Customer Success Manager Benelux (m/f/x),Celonis, Amsterdam,"The time is now to start your next career step at Celonis, one of the fastest growing global tech companies worldwide

Celonis is the execution management system leader. Powered by its market-leading process mining core, the Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications, with a developer studio and platform capabilities for business executives and users. The Celonis EMS offerings help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management, actions, and automations. For Global 2000 companies, transforming to an intelligent enterprise has become a key strategic priority.

Celonis has thousands of global customers including ABB, AstraZeneca, Bosch, Coca Cola, Citibank, Dell, GSK, John Deere, L'Oreal, Siemens, Uber, Vodafone, and Whirlpool. All rely on Celonis technology to unlock their full execution capacity and drive change to business processes. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York, US, and has in total 15 offices worldwide.

The company has grown 5,000% in 4 years and 300% in the past year. In 2019, Celonis reached a $2.5 billion valuation, after receiving a $290 million Series C funding round. Celonis is continuously expanding, especially in Europe to be able to serve the local markets. Recently offices were opened in Paris, Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Madrid, as Center of Excellence for international tech talent. Particularly in these uncertain times Celonis plays an impactful role in helping customers to use their execution capacity the best way possible.
Are you bored about continuous slides validations with different levels?
Do you want to lead customer engagements independently?
Have you have a passion for Change Management, relating with People and explaining complex concepts with simplicity?
Do you love planning and organizing kick-off meetings and executing them to drive value at your customers?
At Celonis, we believe that every company can unlock their full execution capacity - and for that we need you as a Customer Success Manager.
As we expand into the Benelux market, we are looking for a Customer Success Manager who can turn every customers' Process Mining journey into a success story.
As a Customer Success Manager, you will:
...own and develop a portfolio of circa 20-30 Enterprise customers
...be accountable for retention, adoption and upsell
...deliver and communicate value for our customers, throughout the entire customer lifecycle
...be responsible to define success plans, support change and help your customers achieve their desired outcomes out of using Celonis
...actively engage with stakeholders at all levels of the organization (including C-Level), through different dedicated touchpoints
...develop a deep understanding of customer needs, use cases, and objectives in order to ensure that the Celonis platform is properly leveraged to achieve them

...own key activities in the customer lifecycle, such as Adoption Workshops, QBRs (Quarterly Business Reviews) and support implementations, driven by our internal Consulting teams or external partners
...own the renewal forecast for your Book of Business and actively monitor and report on the overall well-being of customers, tracking key health and usage indicators
...serve as a point of escalation for key customer issues and ensure swift resolution, aligning effectively with internal and external stakeholders
...actively drive customer advocacy through case studies and references
You...

...have 5+ years of experience as a Customer Success Manager within the SAAS industry OR as a Consultant (ideally in IT projects, such as Change Management, etc...) working with large Enterprise customers
…have strong communication skills
...can easily understand and break down complex business processes and datasets
…have strong business acumen and ideally already an understanding of different industries, their processes and key KPIs
... are capable of building and navigating long term relationships with executives and key stakeholders
…are looking for a product that you can push with passion and drive
...are passionate about making customers successful
...are self-motivated, proactive team player with innovative ideas to inspire customer loyalty
We...
... see people as the fundamental pillar of our success. Therefore, we invest into the personal growth and skill development of each individual alongside with the strength finder test
… offer attractive compensation models (best-in-class salary, stock option packages, employee referral bonus, family service, flexible working hours, …)
... are visionary and one of the fastest growing Software-Unicorns in the world

… are experts in the field of Process Mining - the new Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications: the EMS offerings help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management, actions and automations

… distinguish ourselves through a unique combination of innovative start-up atmosphere paired with great professionalism and self-responsible work",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=2306928681e47392&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=9809cb4ef2e01638&assa=3801,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=2306928681e47392&fccid=e4a5e7f93e374233&vjs=3,9 dagen geleden,9 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

235,health,Indeed,p_998c94c6aa7025af,Talent Acquisition Specialist,Irdeto, Hoofddorp,"In this role you will be managing recruitment activities for Irdeto globally for both tech and non-tech roles. To achieve our mission, we need the best talent in the industry to join us.
This is where you come in.

Whilst the Netherlands is our largest office, we also have offices in 15 other countries and your vacancies can be based in China, the US, Singapore, France, Poland, India, South Africa, Dubai and Canada.
You can pro-actively research the best talent in the market and help implement projects to improve our effectiveness.
You can deliver our candidate experience, ensuring a smooth, engaging and efficient process, whilst at the same time providing our internal managers with great talent insights.
It’s A-Z recruitment, and you’ll be helping Irdeto be the employer of choice in the cybersecurity industry.
You will be joining a progressive, creative and passionate recruitment team.
We are aiming to deliver outstanding technical and supporting talent to our partners in Irdeto by solving complex talent problems with creative solutions, diligent research and compelling analysis.
What you will be working on:
Partner with the business to manage current opportunities and future talent gaps.
Select and assess prospective candidates, conduct interviews and technical tests for candidates
Assist with interviews for all level roles, this is a role with a strong advisory component to it
Deliver a great candidate experience to all applicants.
Assess and screen talent for core competencies, culture fit and potential.
Assist in creating brand marketing content for talent and find effective channels for communication
Assess and engage social media and traditional web strategies to promote Irdeto’s employer brand
Market Mapping and create effective sourcing strategies, including agency management
Train hiring managers on recruitment topics (e.g. effective interviews and unconscious bias)
Negotiate, extend offers of employment – the best part of the job!
Invent and Implement a wide variety of Talent projects to deliver a recruitment edge.
What can you bring to the team?
A passion for talent and delivering an outstanding candidate experience
Inquisitive and intuitive, ready to try new solutions to talent challenges
Creative – in your thinking and your writing, and with a love for great visuals
Good English communication skills - written, verbal and interpersonal
An ability to translate organization needs into talent profiles and ultimately into new hires
Experience of sharing complex information in a compelling and attractive way
Able to effectively prioritize tasks and manage recruitment process and tools
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree – a completed degree (in any field, as long as you see 'recruitment' as your profession)
Why join Irdeto?

We are on a mission to build a secure future, where people can embrace connectivity without fear. Our lives are increasingly connected. At Irdeto, we enable people and companies to experience connectivity effortlessly by protecting them from cyber attacks. Security is the enabler of the connected world we live in. Our solutions and services ensure that you can enjoy the latest video games, the best blockbuster movies and your favorite live events. And it does not stop there
column2: our technology also secures connected transport and IoT connected industries – just to name a few. With 50 years of expertise in security, we protect over 5 billion devices and applications for some of the world’s best-known brands.

column1: What do we offer you?

Irdeto is a people first organisation where you can secure your future. Our values of Trust, Accountability, Agility and Innovation inform our culture. We believe in connecting people and developing careers with a strong focus on collaboration, creativity, health and happiness among our globally diverse workforce.
In addition to competitive remuneration and an extensive benefits we offer:
An international & multicultural environment where diversity and inclusivity are celebrated and embraced
Professional educational opportunities and training program
Innovation sabbatical
Volunteer Day
State of the art office space
On the job coaching and mentoring
Flexible work arrangement
Some of us run city marathons and even go on snowboarding trips together!
Casual Friday? Casual every day!
And many additional perks customized to global locations (canteen, fresh fruit, amazing coffee, parking, on-site gym, yoga room to name a few)

With over 50 successful years of business innovation behind us, and an exciting digital and connected future ahead of us, Irdeto is a progressive company to join. We are looking for people who will keep us at the forefront of innovation and creativity.
Welcome to Irdeto!

Irdeto is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on identity or innate characteristics, instead we aim to build a diverse, inclusive culture where your talent counts",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=998c94c6aa7025af&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=85ea6f0c17d19aa6&assa=4726,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=998c94c6aa7025af&fccid=46c644705d3bbe7a&vjs=3,9 dagen geleden,9 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

236,health,Indeed,p_2b2d557a8f71ca77,Global Operational Risk Manager,Optiver, Amsterdam,"Are you ready to develop your career in the field of Risk management within a fast-paced, dynamic and international trading company? Do you have an interest in financial markets and a desire to surround yourself with the inner workings of it? And would you like to apply your strong technical and analytical ability to improving our risk framework? Then you might be the new Global Operational Risk Manager we're looking for.
Who we are:

Optiver is a leading global electronic market maker, focused on pricing, execution and risk management. From our offices in Amsterdam, Chicago, London, Shanghai and Sydney, we provide liquidity to financial markets using our own capital, at our own risk, trading a wide range of products: from listed derivatives, cash equities, ETFs and bonds to foreign exchange. What really sets Optiver apart from other companies is its openness, honesty and our colleagues. People have very strong opinions, but they are also open to listen and to change their mind if the facts presented by others have more value.
What you will do

As our new Global Operational Risk Manager, you will be working in an ambitious and results-driven team. Part of a small team, reporting to the Global Chief Risk Officer, you will be exposed to a wide range of risk areas, primarily focusing on Operational Risk. Your main responsibility will be analysing, monitoring and reporting on Key Risk Indicators (""KRI"") across all Optiver offices. Next to that you will develop extensive relationships with internal and external stakeholders while supporting global oversight and supervision on control frameworks and incident management processes across all offices. Please note that this position is based in Amsterdam but might require travelling to other offices.
As our new Global Operational Risk Manager you will be:
Monitoring and reporting aggregated KRIs to Senior management
Investigating incidents and incident management processes in the local offices
Supporting the wider Group Risk function with data driven analysis
Identifying new trading initiatives and emerging risks within the organisation
Exercising supervision and oversight of the Operational Risk departments in all offices
Enhancing current reporting and monitoring processes
Establishing relationships with internal stakeholders and advise them on several risks.
What you will need to be successful:
An academic degree preferably in Econometrics, Economics, Finance or equivalent
Strong analytical skills
3-5 years of working experience within the financial industry
Proficient scripting skills and experience with using Excel VBA and Python or similar
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
An affinity for financial markets and trading
Knowledge of IT processes and Information security (desired, not required).
What you will bring:
A proactive, analytical and inquisitive mindset with a willingness to speak up
Great multitasking skills
An eye for detail
A collaborative to solving problems
The ability to stand your ground when under pressure
A professional attitude and strong communication skills.
What you will get:

We understand that our best work is done together. We constantly ask ourselves how to do better, which creates a stimulating and fun environment, where you are seriously rewarded for your performance. To be concrete, we offer competitive remuneration and great secondary benefits, such as an attractive performance related bonus structure, training opportunities, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, a premium-free pension, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, even weekly chair massages and of course Friday afternoon drinks. We are used to guiding expats through their relocation and offer relocation packages and discounts on health insurance.
Interested?

If you are interested, please apply directly below by uploading your CV and Cover letter in English. Applications without a letter of motivation will not be reviewed. If you have any questions feel free to contact Claire van Raay at clairevanraay@optiver.com.
More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy.
Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 237,health,Indeed,p_d3da533fbeceb9cd,Senior Advisor Digital Health,EY, Amsterdam,"EY is een wereldwijde speler actief op het gebied van (Tech) Consultancy, Assurance, Tax, Transactions. Met onze expertise, systemen en financiële diensten dragen we bij aan een betere werkomgeving. Dat begint met een cultuur waarin je training, kansen en creatieve vrijheid krijgt om jezelf en EY continu te verbeteren.

Door globalisering en technologische ontwikkelingen is de omgeving van organisaties sterk aan het veranderen. Als EY (Tech) Consultant begeleid je organisaties bij deze transformaties. Teams bestaan uit gespecialiseerde consultants in verschillende disciplines en de projecten waar consultants zich mee bezig houden variëren van strategieontwikkeling tot strategie executie. Onze consultants adviseren onder andere op het gebied van Data Analytics, Technology, IT, Data Privacy, Cybersecurity, Finance, Risk, Supply Chain & Operations, Life Science & Healthcare en Strategy.
Wat je bij ons kunt verwachten – een verrijkende ervaring waarvan je een leven lang profiteert

De dienstverlening bestaat vooral uit multidisciplinaire projecten met als doel om de klant steeds de beste mix van kennis, ervaring en inzicht te bieden. Onze klanten bevinden zich in alle deelgebieden van de gezondheidszorg: cure, care, zorgverzekeraars en overheidsorganen in de zorg.

Als senior consultant Digital Health begeleid je organisaties in de Health sector met de strategische inzet van digitale technologie. Dit betreffen o.a. opdrachten als het formuleren en implementeren van een digitale visie en strategie, de optimale inzet van resources met behulp van geavanceerde technologie en het ontwerpen en implementeren van Smarth Health organisaties en ecosystemen.
Werken bij EY betekent dat je opdrachten uitvoert die de strategische agenda bepalen van de bestuurders van onze klanten. Ook als senior consultant zit je rechtstreeks aan tafel bij de opdrachtgever.

Samen met je collega’s bepaal je de meest geschikte aanpak voor de opdracht. In de uitvoering van de opdracht heb je - naast een uitvoerende - ook een sturende en coachende rol naar jongere collega’s.

Op het gebied van marketing en sales lever je een actieve bijdrage aan het uitbreiden van het klantnetwerk door het organiseren van (virtuele) events, aanwezigheid in social media met blogs en publicaties en signaleer je kansen bij potentiële en/of bestaande opdrachtgevers.
Wat je meebrengt – vaardigheden waarmee je de toekomst vorm geeft
Minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring
Een relevante afgeronde academische studie variërend van bedrijfskunde, (technische) geneeskunde, gezondheidswetenschappen tot data science
Ervaring met (digitale) transformatie in de zorg, tevens praktische kennis van het primaire zorgproces
Affiniteit met de toepassing van geavanceerde technologie
Daarnaast ben je ondernemend en zelfstandig met goede, commerciële, communicatieve en analytische vaardigheden. Je bent een goede sparringpartner voor zowel collega’s als onze opdrachtgevers
Wat we je bieden – een inspirerende werkomgeving

We bieden je een aantrekkelijk arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket waarbij je wordt beloond voor individuele en teamprestaties. Daarnaast bieden we je flexibele werktijden en voldoende mogelijkheden tot loopbaanontwikkeling. Bij EY bepaal je jouw eigen carrière aan de hand van jouw competenties en interessegebieden. Aanvullend bieden we je:
Aansprekende carrière mogelijkheden dankzij een uitgebreid opleidingsportfolio, individuele coaching, deelname aan uitdagende projecten en een sterk (internationaal) EY netwerk
Een steile leercurve en de mogelijkheid jouw skillset te verbeteren en (management) verantwoordelijkheden op je te nemen.
Een omgeving met inspirerend leiderschap. Daarbij ontbreekt de funfactor niet. Het (team) management is gericht op het inspireren van medewerkers, zowel professioneel als persoonlijk.
Klik hier voor meer informatie over wat werken bij EY aantrekkelijk maakt
Word onderdeel van ons highest performing team!
Heb je vragen, neem dan contact op met Liselotte Breitenstein via +316 21251438 of via email liselotte.breitenstein@nl.ey.com
Onderdeel van de sollicitatieprocedure is een (online) assessment en een pre employment screening.

Door wet- en regelgeving en doordat EY (en in sommige gevallen haar klanten) hoge eisen stelt aan de betrouwbaarheid en de integriteit van haar medewerkers wordt elke nieuwe medewerker gescreend. Afhankelijk van het functieniveau kan de pre employment screening uit de volgende onderdelen bestaan: Verklaring omtrent Gedrag (VOG) of – indien geen VOG in Nederland kan worden aangevraagd – Criminal Background Check uit het land waar je op dit moment woont of de afgelopen vijf jaren hebt gewoond, integriteitsvragenlijst, verificatie van ID, diploma’s en/of werkervaring en het raadplegen van het centraal insolventieregister.

Als je hier vragen over hebt, kan je deze stellen aan de hierboven vermelde recruiter.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=d3da533fbeceb9cd&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=201d57c119f8fe06&assa=6504,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=d3da533fbeceb9cd&fccid=1544766d4c2915b0&vjs=3,9 dagen geleden,9 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
238,health,Indeed,p_9287775e492c45e2,International Compensation Manager,Kraft Heinz Company, Amsterdam,"Kraft Heinz, The Company

As one of the world’s largest food and beverage companies, we are proud to spark joy around mealtimes with a global portfolio of more than 200 brands. Some are iconic brands like Philadelphia Cream Cheese, Kraft Peanut Butter, Kraft Dinner and Heinz Ketchup. Others are fast growing new sensations that defy status quo like CRAVE. No matter the brand, we are united under one vision To Be the Best Food Company, Growing a Better World . Bringing this vision to life are our 36,000+ teammates around the world, making food people love.

Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership and commitment with Rise Against Hunger. And we also stand committed to sustainability, and the health of our planet and its people.

Every day, we are transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you’re passionate like us - and ready to create the future, build on a storied legacy, and participate as a conscientious global citizen - there’s one thing to do join us.
Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration
We’re not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. It all comes down to the way we empower our people to own their work. It’s true Our employees are our competitive advantage.

As part of the Kraft Heinz family you’re supported to grow and achieve. You’re recognized and rewarded for outstanding performance at every level. You’re given the opportunity to leave your mark and build legacies. But you won’t do it alone. This is where our values and teamwork thrives and collaborative spirit fuels every day.
Job Description
About the Position

We have an excellent opportunity available for an experienced Compensation/Analytics Manager to make a difference at Kraft Heinz in the Amsterdam office. This position will report to the Head of Total Rewards International Operations. T his role will support the management of Operations cycles, processes and projects across International Operations zone (ANJ, ASIA, EAST, WEST, LATAM, CENTRAL) in alignment with the global compensation strategy. This position will partner with regions’ HR Leads providing advice and guidance on the delivery of compensation/analytics initiatives and ensuring adherence to policies and processes. This role focuses on compensation harmonization, process standardization, data accuracy, and leading the implementation of Total Rewards projects.
In brief, you will be responsible for

Lead of all aspects of compensation strategy: compensation model, offer adherence to guidelines, salary increases, incentive plans, compensation initiatives communication, and compensation policy implementation

Support the development and implementation of zone rewards communication plans (merit cycle, salary adjustment, inflation, salary ranges, etc.) - point of contact for advice and guidance to HR local teams and the business on salary queries, including offers, promotions and merit review

Assist on job grade evaluation - evaluation for positions up through middle management using Hay Methodology, preparation of job slotting initial assessment with documentation, consolidation of positions banded (create and automate routines and controls)
Provide detailed Market data analysis for salaried and hourly positions to ensure market competitiveness and alignment with our global compensation strategy
Leading/Coordination of different Total Rewards projects:
1. Implementation of a BC grading structure to ensure consistency across all International structure
2. Implementation of an automated organizational structure map to allow visibility across International
3. Implementation of a recognition program for all factories
Qualifications
Hard Skills and Capabilities
High level of Microsoft Excel proficiency
Strong knowledge of Hay methodology
Strong benchmark knowledge (Mercer/Hay)
Minimum 3 years’ experience in the rewards space
Experience working in a fast paced ever changing environment
Experience managing multiple global stakeholders
Specific EMEA, LATAM or APAC experience would be highly advantageous
Fluent in English
Professional Attributes
Communication Skills

At Kraft Heinz you’ll easily be exposed to senior management, no matter your level. Therefore, it’s important you have excellent communication skills, to deal with all kinds of different stakeholders.
Ability to Simplify
We like to keep it simple. And to execute fast. Your ability to simplify will be highly appreciated, when you provide simple solutions dealing with complex challenges.
Analytical
We’re a very data driven company. You know how to translate complex data into a simple solution with your analytical mindset.
Result driven
You don’t only focus on your own results, but always do what’s best for the company.
What we offer you (Adjust per country/location)
An ambitious employer
column2: we only want to the best for you

column1: A fast career track like only few other companies can match
A competitive salary and excellent bonus structure (above market)
Permanent contract
column2: for we believe in doing big bets on people

column1: Always room for new ideas
column2: if you have an excellent idea, please let us know and we can set it in action!
