239,health,Indeed,p_c20acea4fc301d06,Trader (Amsterdam or London),Optiver, Amsterdam,"As a Trader at Optiver you will work in an entrepreneurial manner to fully manage your own trading book. Your tasks will encompass many different responsibilities, primarily making good risk/reward trading decisions but just as importantly working closely with the technology, research and control departments to make continuous improvements.
If you have an academic degree, excellent numerical skills and a passion to prove yourself, then you could be the Trader we are looking for.

Optiver is an industry leader across everything we do. We don't just meet industry standards we aim to set them! With trading teams focusing on a broad range of options and delta1 products we are able to provide an unrivalled universe of exciting opportunities for our employees. Through our core function as a market-maker we continuously improve the market by being the source of liquidity for market participants.
What you'll do

The Optiver trading floor is one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe. As a Trader you will continuously price and trade financial products to fulfill our market making responsibilities, managing the risk of the complex portfolio of financial instruments you trade in the process. You will process information from multiple sources and take action to adjust trading parameters.
We value Traders who take the initiative to work closely together with the technology and research functions to improve everything we do. In summary, as a Trader you will:
Entrepreneurially manage your own trading book
Make markets in financial instruments
Manage the risks of a complex portfolio of financial instruments
Process and act on the flow of information from various data sources
Seek improvement in everything you do
Work closely with colleagues across multiple departments

Upon starting as a Trader you will be immersed in an intensive two-month training program alongside other new recruits and employees from other departments within the organisation. The first month will be classroom based, bringing you up to speed with the theoretical basics of pricing and the workings of the wider organisation. The second month you will compete against your peers in live simulation trading. Upon graduation from the training program you will join one of our trading teams. We believe hands-on experience is the best way to learn and that is exactly what we provide.
What you'll need
An academic degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, Econometrics, Finance, Computer Science or equivalent
Excellent numerical and analytical skills
A pro-active problem solving nature
Fast decision making skills under pressure
Competitive attitude and eagerness to constantly improve yourself
Great attention to detail
Computer programming skills are not required but definitely a plus
What you'll get
The chance to start your career working alongside best-in-class professionals from over 40 different countries.

Our performance based bonus structure is unmatched anywhere in the industry. We combine our profits across desks, teams and offices into a global profit pool fostering a truly collaborative environment to work in.

Alongside this you will get great secondary benefits such as 25 paid vacation days, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, training opportunities, discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, Friday afternoon drinks and even weekly in-house chair massages. Being highly international, we are accustomed to guiding expats through their relocation, offering competitive relocation packages and providing visa sponsorship where necessary.
Are you interested in starting your career on one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe?

Apply directly via the form below for the position of Trader. Please provide us with a CV and letter of motivation in English. Applications without a letter of motivation will not be reviewed. When we think there is a potential match, you will hear from us sooner than you expect. If you have any questions feel free to contact the Recruitment team on recruitment@optiver.com.
N.B. Once you have applied for the Trader position and been selected, you will be required to take 3 tests to measure your numerical and analytical skills.
Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role.
More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 240,health,Indeed,p_5366a33dd157d1af,Senior Technologist Analytics,Avantium, Amsterdam,"Company

Avantium’s Renewable Chemistries (RNC) works on our own proprietary technologies. Our experience and expertise in the catalytic area give us the opportunity to come up with unique ideas and solutions. We have the capability to develop many other breakthrough technologies that enable other companies to make chemicals, fuels, plastics from renewable resources. In this way we try to make a change in climate change, environment and sustainability.

Avantium is also developing technology to produce green building blocks for materials and fuels, called YXY. The technology converts carbohydrates directly into furanics. YXY can replace oil as the raw material for the production of fuels, car parts, clothing, carpets, water bottles and a very wide range of plastics.

Next to our own R&D projects, our business unit Catalysis provides research services (Services) and research laboratory equipment (Systems) for (petro)chemical companies worldwide. Our Services and Systems project teams work together with customers in joint research and development projects in the area of catalysis. Avantium developed unique technology to prepare and test catalysts. This enables customers to significantly reduce time and money needed for development and optimization of catalytic processes.
Department

The analytical team provides the analytical solution for all the different chemistries, from standard to very sophisticated techniques, and it is up to the analytical team to determine what is needed for each project.

For our Renewable Chemistry business, we are looking for a Senior Technologist Analytics who will report to the Team Leader of Application Development and Analytics. This position covers a broad spectrum in a high-throughput organization, ranging from method development to closing the mass balance, and from equipment troubleshooting, configuration re-design to lab management, combined with strong organizational, communication and interpersonal skills.
Responsibilities
We are looking for an enthusiastic colleague with the following skillset:
Taking ownership of the analytical challenges
From hands-on troubleshooting on equipment to sample preparation
Processing large sample sets, performing under time pressure
Making the analytical connection with the project chemistry
Data interpretation, peak identification and calibration
Proactive communication with your colleagues, project and team leaders, including planning, guarding timelines and reporting
Requirements

The Senior Technologist Analytics has hands-on experience with analytical chemistry from the chemical industry including adapting and configuring the analytics units, and is interested in learning how to develop new methods and strategies.
HLO, BSc, or a MSc degree in analytical chemistry with 5 to 10 years of experience in a relevant area in an industrial or research laboratory
Experience both in GC and LC method development
Preferable experience to apply other techniques, e.g. IC, ICP, GPC, GC-MS, LC-MS, titrations, (IR)spectroscopy, etc
Preferable background in analysis of Biomass chemistry
Ability to communicate clearly in English, transferring complex information both verbally and in writing
Actively contribute to the laboratory management, safety and adhere to our Health & Safety regulations
Offer

As we are a small company, we also offer you a unique chance to learn a lot about many fields, not only science, but also business and management, leading people and operations, market strategies, quality and last but not least safety. Learning paths can be steep and we do not offer you predefined career paths and development tracks. You are in the lead of your career, what you bring to the table will be noticed and taking initiative is rewarded and recognized. We have an informal culture, a flat organization and we recognize and celebrate the many cultures that we represent. And on top of that we offer good primary and secondary benefits.
Additional Information
Do you fit our profile and do you want to apply? Please apply below by uploading your CV and motivation letter (both in Dutch or English).

For more information you can contact: Santiago Gómez Quero, Team Leader of Application Development and Analytics, at +31 (0)20 586 0128, santiago.gomez-quero@avantium.com.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

242,health,Indeed,p_48ca05482e8796e6,Senior SQL Database Administrator,Trivium Packaging, Schiphol,"Location: Netherlands or UK

Reporting to the SAP Solution Architect, you will be responsible for operational SQL admin maintenance, running smaller (100K) and mid-sized (500K) projects within time, budget and above customer satisfaction.
Key Responsibilities:
Manage SQL Server databases through multiple product lifecycle environments, from development to mission-critical production systems.
Configure and maintain database servers and processes, including monitoring of system health and performance, to ensure high levels of performance, availability, and security.
Providing regular guidance and support to other internal and 3rd party SQL database administrators.
Apply data modelling techniques to ensure development and implementation support efforts meet integration and performance expectations.
Independently analyse, solve and correct issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end.
Refine and automate regular processes, track issues and document changes
Assist developers with complex query tuning and schema refinement.
Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours.
Share domain and technical expertise, providing technical mentorship and cross-training to other peers and team members.
Deliver projects in time, within budget, while meeting customer expectations.
Overseeing all other SQL DBA activities.
Key Skills & Experience:
MS SQL Server Administration experience required.
Proven team leadership experience.
Experience with Performance Tuning and Optimisation (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools.
Experience with backups, restores and recovery models.
Knowledge of High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for SQL Server.
Experience working with Windows server, including Active Directory.
Ability to multitask and context switch effectively between different activities and teams.
Sound knowledge of SAP, MES and Middleware.
Good presentation and communication (verbal and written) skills. Fluent English is essential.
MCTS, MCITP, and/or MVP certifications are a plus
The benefits you will enjoy:
As our name is new, you can expect exciting IT related projects and challenges,
We take care of your growth you can always learn from our charismatic, professional leaders,
A career path that will indicate you to develop,
A company culture, where we are proud of each other, and where fun and the attitude of giving back to our environment are highly appreciated
A community where you can freely share your own creative ideas and suggestions to create a better world
Flexibility and home office based on team agreement - here you can find real work life balance!

243,health,Indeed,p_ebce92837ff23252,Senior Product Owner Digital Health Services,CareXS, Amsterdam Noord,"Ben jij een Senior Product Owner die zich graag inzet om de medicatieveiligheid in de zorg beter te maken door middel van digitalisering? Heb jij interesse in Digital Health Services en ben jij diegene die ook de rol van mentor kan vervullen om anderen te coachen te begeleiden? Lees dan snel verder!
Lees meer
Solliciteer nu
Wat je gaat doen
Als Product Owner Digital Health Services houd jij je bezig met bedenken en realiseren van onze digitale oplossingen gericht op medicatiezorg, ziekenhuis verplaatste zorg en digitale diagnostiek.

Met jouw kritische en analytische blik bewaak jij de balans tussen marktontwikkelingen, continue verbetering, functionaliteit, betrouwbaarheid, privacy en veiligheid. Je specificeert, prioriteert, coördineert en bewaakt alle acties die er nodig zijn om de productontwikkeling en dienstverlening vlekkeloos te laten lopen.

Als Senior Product Owner Digital Health Services ben jij mentor van meerdere collega-Product Owners. Je weet op een professionele wijzen collega’s te coachen en begeleiden op zowel inhoudelijk gebied als op het ontwikkelen van softskills. Tevens lever je een actieve bijdrage bij het verder professionaliseren van het Product Owner team middels processen, tooling en andere zaken.

Je werkt nauw samen met met cross-functional Scrum teams van ontwikkelaars en testers, onze service reliability engineers en onze klantenservice. Hiernaast is het belangrijk dat je in nauw contact staat met klanten en (eind)gebruikers.
Wat kan je van ons verwachten?
Een maatschappelijk betrokken organisatie
Focus op teamspirit en mogelijkheden voor professionele en persoonlijke groei
Een informele en pragmatische werkgever met een kantoor in Amsterdam-Noord in de buurt van de pont van Amsterdam CS
Een jaarcontract met een werkweek van 32-40 uur met de intentie tot een contract voor onbepaalde tijd
Flexibele werkuren en de mogelijkheid om thuis te werken
Een goed salaris met 8% vakantiegeld
25 vakantiedagen (op basis van 40 uur)
Een pensioenregeling
De sollicitatieprocedure
Interesse in deze positie? Stuur dan snel jouw CV en motivatiebrief. Onze recruiter Cynthia neemt binnen 2 werkdagen contact met jou op om je meer te vertellen over de rol en over CareXS.
Deze vacature willen wij graag zelf invullen. Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.
Solliciteer nu
Om succesvol te zijn in deze rol heb je:
HBO of WO werk– en denkniveau
Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring als Product Owner, Product Manager of Product Engineer
Het is een must dat je kennis hebt van de zorgmarkt en zorprocessen
Professionele ervaring in samenwerking met cross-functional Scrum teams
Aantoonbare ervaring in het professioneel coachen van teams en individuen
Een Agile Scrum Product Owner certificaat of ben je bereidt dit te halen
Je kunt goed schrijven en spreken in het Nederlands en je kunt je goed verstaanbaar maken in het Engels

244,health,Indeed,p_c32c3c1a406b491b,Management Assistant for Finance and Administration MIDI | Amsterdam,Boehringer Ingelheim, Amsterdam,"Management Assistant for Finance and Administration MIDI | Amsterdam-210939
OUR COMPANY

At Boehringer Ingelheim we develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company, we focus on long-term performance. We believe that, if we have talented and ambitious people who are passionate about innovation, there is no limit to what we can achieve
column2: after all, we started with just 28 people. Now, we are powered by 50,000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture.

column1: THE OPPORTUNITY
Are you up for a new challenge within a pharmaceutical company? Then join our team!

We are looking for a Management Assistant for our office in Amsterdam who loves to interact with people. You will have various cross-functional tasks and responsibilities within the MIDI* Finance & Accounting functions (Finance, Controlling, Purchasing, IT, Supply Chain, Commercial Quality, GBS , EHS and Security).
You will supervise the reception of our office in Amsterdam (incl. office security services, contribute to the office project and support the taskforce and assist the crisis management team).

Furthermore, you will have the opportunity to work with different functions and colleagues and learn a lot of new things while developing your personal skills: each day at work will look different from the other!

This role is initially for one year (with possibility of extension) and currently located in our office in Amsterdam RAI. We will move to the EDGE Amsterdam West in 2021, a very modern architecture with a sophisticated technology platform. You will report directly to the local Head of Finance & Administration.
Further tasks & responsibilities:

Organization/ facilitation of (complex) meetings, including content management (internal, local BI participants), taking care of location, dinner, flight transfers social and communication with the participants
Support handling of remote meetings via MS teams using chat rooms, whiteboard, Mural etc.
Management Assistant support for the F&A leadership team
Work with GBS Systems: create POs via WeBuy, create vendors via MDM e.g. for facility services
System administrator (MyBI, LOS, Idea, Concur, InvoiceTrack) and respective creation of reports
Maintenance of sharepoints, MSTeams: set up and manage files structure and teams, manage access rights, archiving etc. for the functions in F&A
Follow up on Open PO’s for MIDIc with budget responsible
Monthly capacity reporting and regular update of the Authorization matrix
Support in maintenance of contracts as well as Records Retention and cleansing.
What you should bring to the team:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or similar working experience
Minimum 1-3 years of experience in an assistant role or similar (e.g. organizing activities, coordinate things and projects between multiple parties, experience on financial tasks)
Experience in operational planning and in a multinational environment
Strong communication skills: you are outspoken, cooperative, able to work with people and not afraid to challenge others if it comes to get things done!
Flexible, agile and able to deliver efficient and effective support in a continuously changing environment
Good in working with diverse people in a cross-functional environment
Attention to detail and accuracy and excellent knowledge of the English language
Process orientation and digital savvy: there is always something new to learn
Excellent problem-solving skills and can-do-attitude
Service oriented mindset: helping and supporting BI colleagues is a big part of this role. With your positive and warm mindset you create a good spirit around the office.
Please note, only applications in English will be considered.
What’s next?

Does this sound like you? Then we are looking forward to receiving your application! We will then have a look at your CV and cover letter. If we see a match, we will invite you for a video call or a face to face interview to get to know each other. Are we still positive? We might schedule a second interview. We will keep you posted during the process!
If you have any questions related to the recruitment process, please do not hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition MIDI: TalentAcquisitionMIDI.EU@boehringer-ingelheim.com.
DIVERSITY & INCLUSION

At Boehringer Ingelheim we share the opinion that diversity and inclusion is essential for the growth of our business and that our strengths and competitive advantage are also the result of the diversity of our company – diversity across the three dimensions of inclusion: Gender, Geography and Generation. Our people are part of a deep-rooted, family company philosophy that welcomes everyone! We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.
WHY BOEHRINGER INGELHEIM?
This is where you can grow, collaborate, innovate and improve lives.

We offer challenging work in a respectful and friendly global working environment surrounded by a world of innovation driven mindsets and practices. In addition, learning and development for all employees is key, because your growth is our growth. We also offer a competitive salary, generous amount of vacation time, and numerous benefits towards your wellness & financial health and work-life balance. Want to learn more about us? Visit https://www.boehringer-ingelheim.com/
ROPU MIDI is a Regional Operating Unit consisting of 8 mid-sized European countries
column2: Belgium, Denmark, Finland, Greece, Norway, Portugal, Sweden and The Netherlands. MIDI is a multicultural and diverse work environment. More than 1.800 employees are striving to work together to improve lives for patients and animals in our region.

column1: Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment, which benefits our employees, patients and communities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.
Screening:

In order to comply with applicable export control laws, Boehringer Ingelheim periodically screens business relations (including job applicants) against sanctioned party lists (“SPL”). These checks may be performed by Boehringer Ingelheim or by any of its Affiliates. You acknowledge that Boehringer Ingelheim and/or its Affiliates will screen you against SPL and that for this purpose your personal data may be processed in relevant databases, including databases of third-party vendors that perform SPL screening for or on behalf of Boehringer Ingelheim or its Affiliates which may be located or accessible outside the EU. Boehringer Ingelheim is committed to ensuring an adequate level of protection of your personal data.

Primary Location - Europe-NL-North Holland-Amsterdam
Organization - NL-Boehringer Ingelheim B.V. (Netherlands)

245,health,Indeed,p_6ff813a827141862,Category Management & Brand Growth CMI Director,coty, Amsterdam Noord,"COTY is one of the world’s largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, hair color and styling, and skin and body care. COTY is the global leader in fragrance, number two in professional hair color & styling, and number three in color cosmetics. COTY’s products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to a range of social causes as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. For additional information about Coty Inc., please visit www.coty.com.
ABOUT GLOBAL MARKETING, CONSUMER BEAUTY BRANDS

In Consumer Beauty, we are currently in process to drive turnaround and value creation on our most Iconic brands under the leadership of our incoming CEO Sue Y. Nabi. Our global marketing team in Amsterdam will drive Coty Consumer Beauty transformation and deliver a successful turnaround. This transformation effort includes re-centering our brand activity and innovation program on strong consumer centricity, establish a strong Global Category thought leadership and growth story leveraging emergent needs and trends, fixing base business restrainer to unlock our ability to invest into future growth. A once in a lifetime opportunity of which you could now be part of!
THE ROLE

As the Category Management & Brand Growth Director, you will re-establish strong practice and thought leadership around category growth, and how current and future demand spaces comes to life into our CB portfolio. You will provide insights on the effectiveness of our $ spent to drive mental and physical availability and ultimately top line growth.

You will be an expert on Brand Health, identifying restrainer and working with the team to turn around and restart top growth. You will be familiar with both Media and Store opportunities and will be pivotal to define the right strategy to close existing gaps, de-risk brand building blocks and construct a balanced and robust category growth story for the markets.

You will also help the team understand biggest restrainers to brand growth and how to optimize plans based on in market KPI for both physical and Mental availability. You will develop a strong expertise on Category Management, Brand spending effectiveness and KPIs predictive of in-market success. You will play a critical role in the transformation of CB by recognizing what works and which gaps need to be addressed, displaying a bias for action and positively influencing CB leaders to adjust plans that are not set up for success.

You will play a pivotal role in instilling an inquisitive consumer-centric mindset in Consumer Beauty by driving MFT understanding of how Brand plan works through Media and in store to improve social content and improve effectiveness of $ spent.
Detailed Roles and Responsibilities:

Be the go-to expert on category demand & portfolio strategy You understand category dynamics and triggers that drive brand choice and purchase. Drive clarity on future demand spaces and how these should come to life in our portfolio over time.

Understand restrainer to base brand growth on our priority BMU Provide insight and data-based recommendations on how to best drive base brands productivity by fixing restrainers to mental / physical availability. Share best practices for reapplication.

Build a strong and consistent Category Growth Story over time enable to team to understand how this translates this into strong Store / Shelf / Media activities. Balance scale with needed adaptations to specific contexts such as Media channels or store formats.
Consolidate CB Category Management best practices . Providing strong consumer/shopper centricity to the team

Support Yearly Strat Plans With Brand teams, the Analytic Director, Innovation S. Director ensure more robust SOP estimate with balanced building blocks grounded in the brand and market reality and expected projection
Balanced demand sizing behind Brand plans ensure realistic assumptions around spending, distribution, shelf execution, Ensure incrementality accounts for borrowing.

Collaborate closely with media team in defining sufficient / effective media spending vis a vis desired goals Leverage Media calculator, MMM, sufficiency tool to ensure budgets are balanced and realistic. Help team to understand cost of being dark.

Digital Media effectiveness With Media Team/CMI Data scientists & external Partners (eg Google, Zenith…) understand best practices to drive improved conversion among different audiences within the varying path to purchase.
Develop strong understanding on how to better leverage halo Leverage lessons learnt via MMMs, tracking and success stories to improve our understanding of Halo onto Base Brands

In this full-time role, you will provide Strategic Insights to drive global category management, Brand turn-around and portfolio growth. You will report into the Consumer Beauty Insights & Strategy VP and work hand in hand with the:
CB Global Brand team. Opex & Media Team
CB Innovation transformation S. Director,
CB Analytics Director and data scientist.
WHAT YOU’LL BRING

To be successful in this role, you will bring solid professional expertise in consumer and market insights, analytics expertise and a strong understanding and application marketing principles and how media works. We are looking for a proven ability to drive strategic insights into business decision making, preferably in a variety of Brands.

Experience in Category Management at local/global level, Media planning, Brand plans are appreciated along side strong bias for action and ability to manage diverse stakeholders. Understanding of digital data alongside more traditional Media & Equity KPIs is a plus.

246,health,Indeed,p_839512e3156387df,Secretaresse Endodontologie,Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, AmsterdamZuidoost,"Ben jij proactief en kun je zelfstandig werken? De sectie Endodontologie zoekt een secretaresse.
Locatie: AMSTERDAM
Functieomschrijving

Het onderwijs en onderzoek binnen de sectie Endodontologie richt zich op het verzamelen van kennis en de bevordering van de mondgezondheid. Dit aandachtsgebied van de sectie is van oudsher stevig verankerd binnen ACTA.
Jouw functie
bestaat uit management ondersteunende en administratieve taken, zoals:
telefoonverkeer
agendabeheer van de sectievoorzitter
ad-hoc opdrachten t.b.v. de sectievoorzitter
post verwerking
correspondentie
archivering
organiseren en notuleren van vergaderingen en bijeenkomsten maar ook uit: organisatorische en administratieve ondersteuning bij onderwijstaken binnen de sectie:
verantwoordelijk voor de uitwerking van de roosters, tevens aanspreekpunt voor de roostercommissie
logistieke workflow bij practica, zowel ten behoeve van studenten als docenten
workflow registratie tentamen- en examenresultaten en inzage
inzet als surveillant of ondersteuning (bijvoorbeeld inrichten station etc.) bij sommige toetsvormen

eventuele surveillance bij enkele tentamens/toetsen voor een kleine groep studenten (bijvoorbeeld Oral Health Sciences, een eventuele derde gelegenheid voor enkele Bachelor of Master studenten Tandheelkunde)
van tevoren dubbelchecken tentamens op typefouten, layout etc.
aanspreekpunt voor studenten
ondersteuning van de coördinator bij het plaatsen en onderhouden van Canvas
actueel houden van de website en ACTA-zorgnet van de sectie endodontologie
Functie-eisen
HBO werk- en denkniveau
relevante administratieve werkervaring
schakelvermogen binnen een breed takenpakket, dat zowel precisie als behoud van overzicht vereist
affiniteit en ervaring met geautomatiseerde systemen, bij voorkeur ervaring met SAP
een op samenwerking en resultaatgerichte mentaliteit
zelfstandige proactieve teamspeler met een dienstverlenende instelling
Wat bieden wij

Een aantrekkelijke functie in tijdelijke dienst voor de periode 1 jaar, met de mogelijkheid tot verlenging. Het salaris bedraagt afhankelijk van relevante werkervaring op voltijdse basis minimaal € 2.329 en maximaal € 3.144 (schaal 7) bruto per maand. De functie is ingedeeld volgens UFO-profiel Secretaresse 2 en staat open voor ten minste 0,8 fte (32 uur per week).
Daarnaast beschikt ACTA over aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden en regelingen die een goede combinatie van werk en privé mogelijk maken, zoals:
29 vakantiedagen bij een voltijds dienstverband van 38 uur
8% vakantietoeslag en 8,3% eindejaarsuitkering
een ruime bijdrage aan ABP-pensioenregeling
ACTA

ACTA is het samenwerkingsverband van de Faculteiten der Tandheelkunde van de Universiteit van Amsterdam en de Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam. ACTA verricht wetenschappelijk onderzoek, geeft onderwijs en verleent patiëntenzorg op het terrein van tandheelkunde. Internationaal gezien is ACTA toonaangevend in onderzoek en onderwijs.
Bij ACTA werken circa 500 medewerkers en volgen circa 900 studenten de opleiding Tandheelkunde. Dagelijks levert men circa 600 patiënten tandheelkundige zorg.
Diversiteit

Diversiteit is een kernwaarde van de VU. Wij staan voor een inclusieve gemeenschap en geloven dat diversiteit en internationalisering bijdragen aan de kwaliteit van onderwijs en onderzoek. We zijn dan ook voortdurend op zoek naar mensen die door hun achtergrond en ervaring bijdragen aan de diversiteit van onze campus.
Solliciteren

Ben jij geïnteresseerd in deze functie? Reageer dan door middel van onderstaande solliciteer button vóór 28 februari 2021 . Denk hierbij aan het uploaden van jouw curriculum vitae en motivatiebrief. De eerste ronde sollicitatiegesprekken wordt gepland op maandagmiddag 8 maart 2021 en de tweede ronde op vrijdagochtend 12 maart 2021.
Sollicitaties ontvangen per e-mail worden niet in behandeling genomen.
Vragen
Voor inlichtingen kun je contact opnemen met:
Naam: mevrouw dr. Suzette van der Waal
Functie: sectievoorzitter Endodontologie
Telefoonnummer: 020 5980442 (alleen op woensdag)
E-mail: s.vd.waal@acta.nl
Voor meer informatie kun je terecht op: www.acta.nl

247,health,Indeed,p_cd1bb1f4a5a70d65,Technical Customer Service Manager BEKP & Birch,Stora Enso, Amsterdam,"We are looking for for a Technical Customer Service (TCS) Manager (BEKP/birch) to ensure an excellent customer experience in technical service for our BEKP & birch pulp customers. Preferred locations are Helsinki, Stockholm, Amsterdam or other Stora Enso European locations. You will be working in TCS Biomaterials Division. You will report to Head of TCS Biomaterials.
Stora Enso is a leading global provider of renewable solutions in packaging, biomaterials, wooden constructions and paper. Come grow a renewable world. And you will grow too.

As a TCS Manager you will be responsible for tasks defined in the job description to ensure excellent technical customer service for the customers within the product segment. A part of the working time will be spent on customer service-related tasks, e.g. managing claim handling process, providing technical expertise during customer troubleshooting and optimization projects and managing customer qualification processes. The position requires extensive travel (mainly to customers, but also to our mills). You will also participate in development of customer service models and internal processes such as ensuring efficient delivery of relevant technical information and availability of necessary data in systems (e.g. SAP, CRM, SmartSupply). The TCS Manager will work in co-operation with various instances and stakeholders to improve and develop the customer experience, whether that be IT-systems, processes, or other relevant issues/groups.
What we offer

With our values, “Lead and Do what’s right”, we endeavor to set an example in all aspects of our business as well as sustainability. We dare to take the initiative and constantly ask ourselves what more can we do, what can we do better. This is an excellent opportunity for you to be a part of the journey Stora Enso is on – transforming from a traditional forest industry company, into a renewable materials growth company – an industry with great potential driven by global megatrends. As a TCS Manager, you have the opportunity to join a new growing team of professionals who value sustainability and want to make a difference.

“Passionate about forest products technology and manufacturing processes? Eager to utilize your expertise to the benefit of our customers? Join our journey to make Biomaterials excel in customer service. “
Qualifications

Your proficiency is preferably based on a degree in a university degree from technical field or another relevant area. You have good understanding of business logic and practice of pulp and paper manufacturing business, as well as understanding of customer manufacturing processes and needs for pulp. You can manage complex processes that include multiple functions. Also, you have good analytical skills, you are able to develop processes and services.

You are a great communicator with very good teamwork skills, and you communicate fluently in English, other language skills (e.g., French, German, Italian, Spanish) are considered as a benefit. This position requires travelling.
To continue to drive a strong culture we are looking at a number of behaviours in each individual which is based upon our leadership themes set forth for driving our renewable materials agenda:
Customer Needs
column2: Keeps up-to-date with market factors impacting our business and enhance or invent new products and solutions, always considering the customer and consumers perspective.

column1: Business Acumen

249,health,Indeed,p_184c9bb28c1d2787,CRO/Website Manager Ecommerce,flinndal, Haarlem,"Vacature CRO / Website Manager Ecommerce, Haarlem
Bedrijfsprofiel:

Vision Healthcare (VHC) is een ambitieus internationaal bedrijf met een groot aantal Europese merken in de beauty en healthcare categorieën. Bekijk hier de website: www.visionhealthcare.eu. Vision Health Care heeft diverse kantoren binnen Europa. In Haarlem bevindt zich een van de Nederlandse vestiging waar diverse labels worden beheerd. Denk daarbij aan voedingssupplementen merken als www.flinndal.nl, www.cutenutrition.com, www.purasana.com en www.vitaminenoprecept.nl maar ook aan lichaamsverzorging zoals www.mylene.eu. Wij geven de voorkeur aan producten van hoge kwaliteit die eenvoudig en gebruiksvriendelijk zijn, maar zeer effectief. In onze vestiging in Haarlem verzorgen wij de E-commerce activiteiten voor bovenstaande merken maar hier zullen komende tijd nog meer merken aan toegevoegd worden. Wij zijn dus enorm aan het groeien en zullen daarom binnenkort ook verhuizen naar een geweldig nieuw pand dicht bij het station van Haarlem.
Functieprofiel:

Als websitemanager ben je verantwoordelijk voor de prestaties en doorontwikkeling van verschillende webshops die gemanaged worden door VHC Haarlem. Je coördineert projecten tussen het development team en e-commerce/marketing. Je doel is om de performance van de websites te verbeteren door het inzetten van je kennis over UX, CRO en AB-testing. Je bent commercieel gedreven en hebt de juiste technische kennis om met onze e-commerce websites leidend te blijven binnen het digitale landschap.
Wat je gaat doen:
Conversie-optimalisatie van verschillende merkwebshops
Initiëren en testen van CRO en UX-verbeteringen gebaseerd op bezoekersgedrag, klant feedback en de laatste best practices samen met het design- en IT team
Werken met een scrum team aan uitvoering van taken die zo snel mogelijk een bijdrage moeten leveren aan de klantervaring en/of klantwaarde
Coördinatie van projecten tussen het development team en e-commerce/marketing
Fungeren als aanspreekpunt voor marketing en e-commerce voor website functionaliteiten
Managen van verschillende tools en applicaties voor search, survey, personalisatie, feed management enzovoorts
Up to date blijven met de digitale best practices en monitoren van concurrerende websites
Oplossen van website issues of bij de juiste afdeling uitzetten
Opleiding/ervaring
Je hebt de laatste kennis over CRO, UX en AB-testing
Je begrijpt het belang van contentuele en technische SEO en kent de laatste trends
Een goede mix van commerciële en technische kennis
Oog voor detail met een analytische invalshoek en probleemoplossende skills
Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden
Ervaring met CMS en e-commerce platformen zoals Shopify en nopCommerce
(Minimaal) basiskennis van html, CSS en javascript
Goede bekendheid met Google Analytics, GTM, Datastudio en Optimize en/of vergelijkbare tooling
Bekend met Agile / Scrum
Zowel schriftelijk als verbaal goed in Nederlands en Engels.
Jij bent:

Een sociaal persoon die doorgaat tot de oplossing is gevonden. Een professional die elk probleem benadert als uitdaging. Een ‘vakbroeder’ waar pro-activiteit in het DNA zit. Iemand die zelfstandig is, zeer gedreven is in het behalen van succes en stressbestendig is.
Wat kun jij van ons verwachten?
Een marktconform salaris.
Een telefoon en laptop van de zaak
26 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld
Goede pensioenregeling die voor 75% gedekt wordt
Gratis lunch in onze keuken
Goedkoop lidmaatschap bij sportschool Kenamju of The Human Fabrique
Een toplocatie in het centrum van Haarlem (ook met auto goed bereikbaar)
Fijne informele werksfeer in een ambitieuze omgeving
Vrijdagmiddagborrels met je collega's
Solliciteren:
Ben jij de collega die wij zoeken? Dan maken wij graag kennis. Je kunt je CV en motivatie sturen naar [email protected] t.a.v. Lennard.

252,health,Indeed,p_e1dbe9dcc93b07ec,Consultants Mozambique,Aflatoun, Amsterdam,"TERMS OF REFERENCE
Research Institute / Consultants to conduct a Randomised Control Trial and qualitative analysis on the Aflateen+ Life Skills and Financial Education programme in Mozambique
From: Aflatoun International, Amsterdam
When: January 2021 – August 2023. The candidate should be available in February – April 2021 and December 2022 – February 2023.
Deadline for submitting proposals: Monday 25 January 2021
Background

Aflatoun International is a non-profit organization, which offers social and financial education to children and young people worldwide, empowering them to make a positive change for a more equitable world. Aflatoun creates high-quality curricula, for different age groups, which are contextualized to local needs and specific circumstances. In 2019, Aflatoun reached 10.5 million children in 108 countries through over 345 partner organizations.

Aflatoun programs inspire children to discover their talents and put them to use, to stand up for their rights and those of their communities, to play games, and to solve problems. They learn how to save, how to budget, and how to set up social and financial enterprises that benefit themselves, their families, and their communities.

Aflatoun has been identified as a best in practice organisation by The Brookings Institution in the report 'Can We Leapfrog? The Potential of Education Innovations to Rapidly Accelerate Progress’. The report presents a forward path in global education by examining the possibility of using innovations to ‘leapfrog’, rapidly accelerating educational progress to ensure that all young people develop the skills they need to thrive in a fast-changing world. Additionally, in 2019, HundrED Connect officially recognized Aflatoun as one of top 5 Spotlight Innovators for its work on financial education. HundrED Connect is an initiative that aims to improve education and inspire a movement by encouraging pedagogically sound and ambitious innovations to spread across the world. Aflatoun was also selected as an official Vanguard Member of the Million Lives Club, which celebrates innovators and social entrepreneurs who are reaching new horizons of impact and improving the lives of those living on less than $5 a day, and who have already scaled to serve at least 1,000,000 people.
Project information

While significant progress has been made towards universal primary school attendance, the reality is that a third (34%) of children of lower secondary school age (12-14 years) and more than half (58%) of 15 to 17-year-olds in sub-Saharan Africa are not in school. Hence, majority of those who should be acquiring the skills to prepare them for the job market, or move into further education, are not in the classroom, making it less likely that they will have a positive impact on their countries’ development.

Improving youth’s future prospects for decent work helps break the intergenerational cycle of poverty and is beneficial for entire communities. To do so, it is crucial that adolescents understand money, resources and the markets that increasingly affect them, as they become consumers, workers and active citizens. This greatly improves their prospects for the future, as it prepares young people for a complex and turbulent job market.
this context, Aflatoun will roll out its Aflateen+ programme in Mozambique through its partnership with implementing organization Wona Sanana (WS).

Wona Sanana (WS) is a Mozambique-based organization dedicated to Child Protection and Education through providing technical assistance to local actors focusing on youth and education, and through advocating for the involvement of government agencies to ensure inclusive education and child protection policies.

Aflateen+ is a comprehensive educational programme to transform the lives of adolescent girls and boys aged 14-19 through social and financial education, and entrepreneurship with a gender lens. The programme’s biggest strength is its flexibility to adapt to the local needs of the girls and boys, while offering a variety of lessons on life skills, sexual and reproductive health and rights, and financial empowerment. Throughout the lessons, the connection between gender equality and economic prosperity is emphasized. The project’s overall objective is

To socially and economically empower young girls and boys (ages of 14 to 19) in Mozambique by providing them with the social and financial skills necessary to make informed choices about their health, financial situation, and education.
Impact assessment

To assess the impact of the Aflateen+ programme on adolescent girls and boys in Mozambique, this research will use a mixed-method approach, with a heavy quantitative component. The study will collect and evaluate quantitative data through a Randomised Controlled Trial (RCT) and qualitative data from e.g. Most Significant Change or Focus Group Discussions.
The main question of the research is: What is the effect of the Aflateen+ programme among participants of the Aflateen+ programme, relative to the representative control sample in Mozambique?

Since the project runs over three years, we aim to not only measure knowledge, awareness and attitudes of adolescent girls and boys, but also assess the impact of the programme on SDG outcome and impact indicators like school retention/attendance/drop-out, teenage pregnancy, gender based violence, and HIV-risk behaviour.
Capacity assessment

In order to assess the effectiveness of the capacity building component of the project, the research will include two tools assessing the capacity of both trained partners/NGOs, as well as trained teachers/educators.

Adding to that, as a follow up to the training of teachers, weekly push messages will be sent to the teachers or trainers via SMS or social media platforms. These messages may be questions or surveys on the progress of Aflateen+ activities. Additionally, micro content that reinforces learning, or guides teaching activities will be shared.

The evidence generated through this study will assist in regional advocacy and Aflatoun’s engagement with regional bodies like SADC and the African Union, which will contribute to our efforts towards education system change.
Experience requirements
Research institute/consultants should have:
1. Experience conducting Random Control Trials
2. Extensive experience with leading a team of researchers and data enumerators incl. training of data enumerators on the use of evaluation tools
3. Extensive experience in survey development and contextualisation
4. Experience with statistical analyses using statistical software such as STATA or R
5. Experience developing and contextualising qualitative evaluation tools e.g. Most Significant Change or Focus Group Discussions
6. Experience with collecting qualitative data and qualitative analyses
7. Experience with writing quantitative and qualitative evaluation and capacity assessment reports.
Skill requirements
1. Fluency in English
2. Fluency in Portuguese
3. Master’s degree or PhD in a relevant field (e.g. Development Economics, Social Sciences, M&E)
4. Contextual knowledge of Mozambique.
Scope of the assignment
Research institute/consultants agrees to:
1. Liaise with implementing partner to understand implementation design
2. Attend the training of teachers to understand programme methodologies and content
3. Execute the randomisation based on a list of schools/informal centers provided by implementing partner
4. Write an inception report with the proposed research design, sample size, effect size calculation, randomization, and work plan
5. Contextualize the quantitative and qualitative tools based on the already developed Aflateen+ survey and Most Significant Change guidelines
6. Develop a simple monitoring tool to track programme attendance to be used by teachers
7. Develop two tools to assess the capacity of both trained partners/NGOs, as well as trained teachers/educators
8. Procure ethical approvals from Independent Review Boards before commencing data collection activities
9. Test the internal validity of the developed evaluation tools in a pilot phase, report results and provide recommendations and integrate those for tool improvement
10. Recruit and train data enumerators on the use of the contextualised evaluation tools
11. Collect quantitative and qualitative data from a minimum of 30 treatment and 30 control schools
12. Collect data on the capacity of the trained partners/NGOs, as well as trained teachers/educators
13. Import all the quantitative data into statistical software and analyse the quantitative and qualitative data
14. Write a high quality baseline and endline report with the impact and capacity assessment results and recommendations.
Timeline
Research institute/consultants agree to work within the following timeline:
1. Contracted should be available to prepare for the job starting in the last week of January 2021 in Mozambique
a. Preparation visits/meetings to organise the impact and capacity assessment
b. Inception phase
2. Throughout the rest of the time the contracted will work on collecting quantitative and qualitative data, analyses and report writing.
a. The baseline takes place in February 2021
b. The endline takes place in December 2022
Payment
The budget for this assignment is 60.000 EUR and the payment schedule is as follows:
30% upon approval of the inception report20% upon approval of the baseline report30% upon completion of the endline data collection and receipt of the data file20% upon approval of the endline report
Submission and questions
Submit any questions and proposals by email to:
Livia Remeijers. E-mail: livia@aflatoun.org
Bid for research institute / consultant services
Interested candidates must include the following:
a. Technical proposal including experience conducting RCTs
b. Detailed financial proposal including daily rates of all team members and activities (incl. VAT)
c. Curriculum Vitaes of all team members who will be involved, clearly stating their role
d. At least three references.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 253,health,Indeed,p_5c46b543aada4582,B2B Integration Analyst,Merck KGaA, AmsterdamZuidoost,"A career at our company is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 57,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in healthcare, life science and performance materials. For more than 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others.

Your role: We have an exciting opportunity for a B2B Integration Analyst to join the team on a 12 month fixed term contract. As a B2B Integration Analyst, you will be part of our Life Science Division. The current market is promptly moving from analog to digital and so are our resources, greatly expanding to be ahead of the curve. This is a future-oriented and strategic topic. This role offers a very versatile spectrum of activities, interacting as a business partner with internal and external stakeholders across countries. Your role focuses on implementing and providing support for B2B components with our trading partners across multiple platforms and third party platform providers. Your role includes 4 main verticals of activities: Implement B2B components, routine support/maintenance of Trading Partner Interactions within the EMEA region (main focus), participate in corporate/divisional/regional projects as B2B/EDI subject matter expert and documentation. This position can be office based or home based, in the Netherlands and in further locations across Europe.
Who you are:
You are a solution-oriented business partner
Educated to Bachelor’s degree level or gained equivalent industry experience
Previous EDI experience is essential
Knowledge and experience working with SAP would be advantageous
Have previous experience implementing electronic transaction formats (EDIFACT, IDOC, X.12, XML)
Experience working with B2B communication channels (Http/s, VAN, AS2, FTP) and in a customer facing service role
Working knowledge of “order to cash” business process
Have strong analytical/problem solving skills
Excellent communication skills (oral, written, presentation)

What we offer: With us, there are always opportunities to break new ground. We empower you to fulfil your ambitions, and our diverse businesses offer various career moves to seek new horizons. We trust you with responsibility early on and support you to draw your own career map that is responsive to your aspirations and priorities in life. Join us and bring your curiosity to life!
Curious? Apply and find more information at https://jobs.vibrantm.com
Job Requisition ID: 213582
Location: Amsterdam Zuidoost
Career Level: C - Professional (1-3 years)
Working time model: full-time
Careers during Covid-19

Thank you for visiting our careers website, we are always looking for curious minds to join our teams. We understand how much the world is being impacted by the Covid-19 crisis and we want to assure you that your safety is very important to us. To ensure that everyone’s health is protected, instead of a standard face-to-face interview, it is likely that you will be offered alternative digital interview options.

254,health,Indeed,p_664c01f4bc50d95d,"Supply Planner, EMEA","Brooks Sports, Inc", Amsterdam,"Who We Are:

Brooks is a team of passionate people united by a desire to do meaningful work, lead healthy lives and make a difference. We share a focused mission: to inspire everyone to run and be active. That’s it. No distractions—it’s all about the run. Through science, creativity, service, authenticity and connection, we obsess over delivering the best running gear on the planet. We do it our way, with our unique spirit, with a goal of being more relevant to runners than any other brand, day after day and mile after mile. We are determined to innovate, challenging ourselves to lead thought at every turn. Inside these walls and on the roads, tracks and trails, we live and breathe Run Happy, celebrating the positive impact running has on our lives and others. We inject it into all we do because it makes everything better, smarter, more fun and more memorable. Our company culture defines us, bonds us together and creates the conditions for success. It is lived daily as a behavioral expression of our collective set of brand values: Connect with People, Innovate for our Customer, Compete as a Team, Build Trust, Have Fun & Bring Passion, and Be Active. If you’re on our team, it means you’re part of creating something extraordinary. You’re part of Brooks.
Your Job:

As a Supply Planner, you are responsible for the execution of tactical supply plans and managing inventory levels to achieve the sales, supply chain and financial objectives. Your responsibilities will be focused on supply planning accuracy, inventory optimization, profitability, and delivery precision across the seasonal planning horizon for the EMEA Region.

In this role you will partner closely with EMEA Logistics, Demand Planning, Customer Service, Sales, Global/NA Supply Planning and offshore production planners to ensure on time in full product availability.
Your Responsibilities:
Manage short and long-term EMEA supply plans to balance the (wholesale and eCommerce) demand forecast considering cost, efficiency, and capacity constraints.
Advise EMEA inventory strategies to determine cost-effective use of inventory investment while maximizing inventory turns and meeting service level targets.
Develop and monitor buy plans, submit PO by size and monitor purchase orders changes.
Identify and solve key supply issues by working cross-functionally to develop alternative solutions that mitigate cost and customer service impacts.
Establish and maintain supportive relationships with stakeholders. Serve as a liaison between demand forecast and supply chain partners.
Follow the planning calendar and buy process cadence.
Maintain inventory item master for assigned styles and warehouse. Audit systems to ensure data integrity.
Use and optimize supply planning system to create tactical inventory and supply solutions.
In charge of Seasonal Sample Purchase Order placement and delivery tracking.
Special projects as assigned
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain or related field.
3+ years of experience in supply planning or inventory management required.
Understanding of supply chain/supply planning/production planning systems and concept.
Strong computer skills with advanced Microsoft Excel required.
Strong organizational skills, the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, and an analytical, investigative approach to problem-solving.
Experience in fashion/sports preferred
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, demonstrating effective listening through concise, clear verbal and written communication.
Fluency in English, other European language skills are a great plus.
Excellent interpersonal skills that inspire and build trust resulting in effective working relationships across the organization.

Passionate participation in Brooks’ sports activities a plus, overridden by the ability to understand and empathize with the runner to develop loyal, engaging relationships with our customers and the Brooks community.
Embraces and lives the Brooks values!
Our offer:
1-year contract, fixed term.
25 paid vacation days and 8 national holidays per year
Contribution to your pension.
Travel expenses reimbursement - but we currently work from home
Health insurance contribution of 90%.
Bonus potential.
Fantastic work location, as our offices are inside the Olympic Stadion!
Fun team activities, such as (virtual) Bootcamp, Yoga, #RunHappy runs, along with gym discounts.
Discount on Brooks products.
By submitting this application, you expressly make the following representations and warranties and give your consents as described below:

Brooks Sports, Inc. collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Brooks Sports, Inc.'s recruitment related activities as well as for organizational planning purposes globally. Consequently, Brooks Sports, Inc. may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants including for example setting up and conducting interviews and tests, evaluating and assessing the results thereto and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment processes including the final recruitment.

Brooks Sports, Inc. does not disclose your personal data to unauthorized third parties. However, as a global corporation consisting of multiple affiliated companies in various countries, Brooks Sports, Inc. has international sites and Brooks Sports, Inc. uses resources located throughout the world. Brooks Sports, Inc. may from time to time also use third parties to act on Brooks Sports, Inc.'s behalf. You agree to the fact that to the extent necessary your personal data may be transferred and/or disclosed to any company within Brooks Sports, Inc. group of companies as well as to third parties acting on Brooks Sports, Inc.'s behalf, including also transfers to servers and databases outside the country where you provided Brooks Sports, Inc. with your personal data. Such transfers may include for example transfers and/or disclosures outside the European Economic Area and in the United States of America.

At Brooks, we celebrate diversity & equity. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment, and encourage people of all backgrounds, perspectives, experiences, and skills to apply. Brooks is proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, the presence of a sensory, physical or mental disability, medical condition, military status, marital status, pregnancy or child birth, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, political ideology, or any other non-merit based factors.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=664c01f4bc50d95d&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=1eb6639ec136aa1f&assa=2164,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=664c01f4bc50d95d&fccid=64f9ec9618aa764d&vjs=3,6 dagen geleden,6 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

255,health,Indeed,p_cdec154d44d64bba,"Principal Analyst, Health Analytic Solutions – (EU based)",Panalgo, Amsterdam,"Join our team at Panalgo and help advise our clients on utilizing Instant Health Data (IHD), a next-generation healthcare data analytics platform to help improve the quality and efficiency of medical research. Established consulting company with proven publication track record and exciting new health technology platform is looking to grow European-based support services to the next level with the help of an outstanding Principal Analyst, Health Analytic Solutions.

Panalgo, formerly BHE, has served the life sciences industry for the past 20 years, specializing in data analytic solutions and custom research services. You’ll work with an interdisciplinary team from outcomes research, informatics, epidemiology, medicine, and software development backgrounds to further the company’s mission of improving healthcare through innovative data analytics.

The Health Analytics Solutions team is at the forefront of engaging IHD’s customers, advising on analytic and methodological considerations, and collaborating on product development to ensure our customers are successful in using IHD to address all of their health care research needs.

The ideal candidate for this position will be based in or near Amsterdam and will have a strong interest in healthcare and technology, excellent quantitative skills, and experience analyzing large databases. The candidate must also be a self-starter and capable of working with teams based in both the U.S, and Europe. S/he must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills so as to work effectively in cross-functional internal teams and communicate externally with clients. An ability to work in a fast-paced environment, sometimes under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient, with a high level of professionalism is crucial to this role at Panalgo.
Responsibilities:
Advise clients on the design and implementation of studies using large healthcare datasets
Become an expert in the features, benefits, and applications of IHD
Become proficient with a variety of large, complicated healthcare datasets
Lead trainings, 1-on-1 or small group working sessions with IHD users
Support the deployment of new platform features
Lead development and management of technical documentation for both internal and external consumption
Lead question generation, protocol development and project build out for research & development projects
Lead internal and continuous improvement trainings and/or mentor junior Panalgo staff
Qualifications & Required Skills:
Master’s or PhD in relevant area (e.g., economics, health economics, epidemiology, biostatistics, health services)
Minimum 7+ years of relevant experience in outcomes research, health economics, epidemiology, or consulting for life sciences companies
Minimum 3+ years of experience working as a project manager or equivalent
Demonstrated analytical, organizational, creative problem solving and structured communication skills
Advanced understanding of healthcare databases (e.g., claims, EHR, hospital, registry) and the pros/cons of various sources
Ability to manage time and prioritize tasks
Focus on attention to detail
Entrepreneurial spirit, drive, and work ethic
Must be currently located in the Netherlands

Panalgo provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

column1: 256,health,Indeed,p_b7668f4706edd49d,Docent/onderzoeker Ontwikkelingspsychologie,Universiteit van Amsterdam, Amsterdam Centrum,"Publicatiedatum 19 januari 2021
Sluitingsdatum 15 februari 2021
Opleidingsniveau Gepromoveerd
Functieomvang 15,2 tot 30,4 uur per week
Salarisindicatie €3.746 tot €5.127 bruto per maand
Vacaturenummer 21-031

Ben jij een collegiale wetenschapper op het gebied van de klinische ontwikkelingspsychologie en / of ontwikkeling en gezondheidspsychologie, die enthousiast wordt van zowel onderwijs als onderzoek? We zoeken per direct een (parttime) docent/onderzoeker, die in het onderwijs wetenschappelijke vraagstukken weet te verbinden aan vragen uit de (klinische) praktijk en zo studenten een gedegen wetenschappelijke basis kan bieden voor hun latere loopbaan.

De programmagroep Ontwikkelingspsychologie van de Universiteit van Amsterdam (UvA) biedt een bachelor-specialisatie in de klinische ontwikkelingspsychologie, de master tracks Klinische Ontwikkelingspsychologie en Development & Health Psychology, en neemt deel aan de tweejarige Research Master opleiding. Het onderwijs in de bachelor en de master track Development & Health Psychology is in het Engels, terwijl het onderwijs in de master track Klinische Ontwikkelingspsychologie in het Nederlands is.

Het programma wordt ondersteund door ongeveer 15 vaste faculteitsleden en biedt onderdak aan ongeveer 25 promovendi en postdoctorale onderzoekers. Het programma is internationaal actief en ontvangt regelmatig internationale bezoekers.
Wat ga je doen?
Bij een totale omvang van 0,8 fte (30,4 uur per week) is de verdeling van de werkzaamheden:
0,55 fte Onderwijs, bestaande uit:

individueel onderwijs (begeleiding van klinische en niet-klinische stages, theses) binnen de master tracks Development & Health Psychology en Klinische Ontwikkelingspsychologie. Ook onderzoeksprojecten in de bachelor Psychobiologie zullen incidenteel begeleid worden. Thesen en onderzoeksprojecten bieden de mogelijkheid om publiceerbare data te verzamelen, passend binnen de eigen onderzoekslijn van de kandidaat
begeleiden van het schrijven van verslagen voor de Basisaantekening Psychodiagnostiek (master track KLOP)

werkgroeponderwijs als vervanging van collega’s bij sabbatical of een onverwacht hoog aantal studenten. In de master track Development & Health Psychology wordt met probleemgestuurd onderwijs gewerkt. In de master track Klinische Ontwikkelingspsychologie gaat veel aandacht naar het aanleren en oefenen van klinische vaardigheden.

0,25 fte Onderzoek, bestaande uit het uitbouwen van een eigen onderzoekslijn op het gebied van de (klinische) ontwikkelingspsychologie en/of gezondheidspsychologie. Werving van onderzoekssubsidies behoort ook tot de taken.
Wat heb je hiervoor nodig?
Je hebt:
een doctoraat (of voltooid doctoraat binnen 3 maanden) op het gebied van de psychologie of aanverwante discipline
een kwalitatief hoogstaand onderzoeksprofiel op het gebied van ontwikkelingspsychologie, gezondheidspsychologie of aanverwante discipline
ervaring met het geven van cursussen en begeleiding op BA en MA-niveau en bij voorkeur een BKO
basisaantekening Psychodiagnostiek
goede Nederlandse en Engelse taalvaardigheid.
Wat bieden wij

Een uitdagende werkplek met afwisselende werkzaamheden en volop ruimte voor eigen initiatief en ontwikkeling bij een inspirerende organisatie. De Faculteit Maatschappij- en Gedragswetenschappen (FMG) speelt een leidende rol in het adresseren van de grote maatschappelijke uitdagingen waar de wereld, Nederland en Amsterdam mee worden geconfronteerd, nu en in de toekomst.

Werken bij de UvA betekent werken in een kritisch, onafhankelijk, innovatief en internationaal klimaat, met een open sfeer en een sterke betrokkenheid bij Amsterdam en de (internationale) samenleving.
Inlichtingen
Heb je nog vragen of wil je meer weten? Neem dan contact op met:
Dr Brenda Jansen, Universitair Hoofddocent
Meer weten over werken bij de Faculteit de Maatschappij- en Gedragswetenschappen? Kijk op onze website.
Ons aanbod

Het betreft een tijdelijke aanstelling van 30,4 uur per week (0,8 fte) tot 1 januari 2023. Het salaris bedraagt, afhankelijk van opleiding en relevante werkervaring, minimaal €3,746 tot maximaal €5,127 bruto per maand bij een volledige aanstelling van 38 uur per week (conform schaal 11 Cao Nederlandse Universiteiten).

Daarnaast bieden we een uitgebreid pakket secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een ruime vakantieregeling en een eindejaarsuitkering en vinden we het belangrijk dat je jezelf blijft ontwikkelen en professionaliseren. We hebben hiervoor uitstekende studie- en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden.
Sollicitatie

Als werkgever handhaaft de UvA een beleid van gelijke kansen. We vinden diversiteit belangrijk en zetten ons volledig in om een plek te zijn waar iedereen zich thuis voelt. We koesteren de onderzoekende geest en het doorzettingsvermogen en laten de ruimte om door te vragen. Bij ons vormen nieuwsgierigheid en creativiteit de heersende cultuur.
Herken je je in het profiel? Dan zien we natuurlijk jouw brief en cv graag tegemoet.
De sluitingsdatum is 15 februari 2021. De sollicitatiegesprekken zullen plaatsvinden op dinsdag 23 februari.
Wij stellen acquisitie niet op prijs

257,health,Indeed,p_daf2dcf1da26eae4,Trading Analyst (Academic Part-time Job),Optiver, Amsterdam,"Interested in trading and looking for a part-time role during your studies? We have an exciting job opportunity for you: become a Trading Analyst at Optiver!

We are looking for ambitious students that are based in the Netherlands, studying towards an academic degree in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics). If you want to kick-start your career with a part-time job in a dynamic and international environment, with a competitive salary and flexible work hours, this could be the opportunity for you.
Who are we

Thirty years ago, Optiver started business as a single trader on the floor of the Amsterdam's options exchange. Today we are at the forefront of trading and technology, employing over 1000 Optiverians from over 40 nationalities in Amsterdam, Chicago, Sydney and Shanghai. We stick to what we're good at: making markets in a wide range of financial products on more than 50 exchanges around the world.

With a focus on a broad range of options and delta1 products, our traders work in collaboration with the technology, research and control departments to create solutions that continuously improve trading strategies.

Optiver brings together a multidisciplinary group of talented people from all over the world who together strive to be better tomorrow, than they are today. Our culture supports and empowers Optiverians to develop and be at their best both personally and professionally. The dynamic, collaborative environment and the nature of work we are involved in means that your problem solving, creativity and analytical skills can be well leveraged in the pursuit of excellence.
What you'll do

As a Trading Analyst you will work directly on the Optiver trading floor, where over 100 individual traders manage their own trading book – making this one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe. You will analyze day-to-day trading performance, work on projects to improve our strategies/pricing and make sure trading sheets are well structured. All of this will take place in close collaboration with our traders, analysts and engineers who constantly invite you to challenge the status quo and to propose areas of improvement. The opportunities to develop yourself in this role are endless and a steep learning curve is guaranteed. You can participate in our Trading for non-traders' program, sign-up for Python and SQL courses after work, join the morning trading meetings and work on your personal effectiveness by participating in one of many courses our education department has on offer. All in all, the Trading Analyst role is a fantastic stepping stone to becoming a full-time Trader at Optiver.
What you'll need
Be in your 3rd year of your Bachelors or 1st/2nd year of your Masters, preferably in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Econometrics, Quantitative Finance or equivalent
Have experience with Excel (we are happy to train you in SQL and Python)
Excellent numerical and analytical skills
Strong affinity for financial markets
Great attention to detail
Excellent communication and teamwork skills
What you'll get
The chance to work with best-in-class professionals from over 40 different countries
The opportunity to get to know our systems and way of working which will highly benefit you if you move into one of our full-time positions
A competitive part-time salary
Full flexibility to schedule your own hours (min of 16 hours, ideally 20 hours)
Access to training such as trading lectures and Python courses

Alongside this you will get great secondary benefits such as fully paid first-class commuting expenses, training opportunities and discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, Friday afternoon drinks and even weekly in-house chair massages.
Former Trading Analysts on their experience:

'Everyone is passionate about what they do and always willing to help each other out and you are constantly improving. The daily challenges and puzzles you come across makes this job so interesting. This collaborative, high-pace atmosphere makes working at Optiver exciting.'
Bob Muijs, Trader at Optiver, former Trading Analyst
My time as a TA has been both fun and super useful. You get to know a broad part of the company and when you start as a Trader, this experience and in-company network gives you a huge advantage.""
Luit Elbers, Trader at Optiver, former Trading Analyst
Interested in starting your career on one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe?

column1: 258,health,Indeed,p_c04360bc10477a42,Execution Trader,Optiver, Amsterdam,"As an Execution Trader at Optiver you will become the face of our company externally, executing trades with our long established network of brokers and in addition, maintaining and building relationships in the process.
If you have an academic degree, excellent communication skills and a passion to prove yourself you could be the Execution Trader we are looking for.
What you'll do

The Optiver trading floor is one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe. As Execution Trader you will communicate with our network of brokers, handling incoming price requests and relaying information onto the traders. It is your responsibility to get the full information and best execution for our non-screen based trades and ensuring a smooth trade process. Alongside this you will maintain and build upon our longstanding relationships within the broker community. In case of conflict you must be able to handle it constructively whilst preserving Optiver's long standing relationships.You will also work as part of a diverse team of both recent Graduates and more experienced Execution Traders.
Who you are
Either a final year student/recent graduate or a Trader or Broker with at least 2 years of relevant experience
You have an academic degree
You possess excellent verbal and written communication skills
You have superior interpersonal skills and the ability to positively influence outcomes
You are detailed oriented
What you'll get
The chance to further your career working alongside best-in-class professionals from over 40 different countries.

Our performance based bonus structure is unmatched anywhere in the industry. We combine our profits across desks, teams and offices into a global profit pool fostering a truly collaborative environment to work in.

Alongside this you will get great secondary benefits such as 25 paid vacation days, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, training opportunities, discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, Friday afternoon drinks and even weekly in-house chair massages. Being highly international, we are accustomed to guiding expats through their relocation, offering competitive relocation packages and providing visa sponsorship where necessary.
Are you interested in furthering your career on one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe?

Apply directly via the button below for the position of Execution Trader. Please provide us with a CV and letter of motivation in English. Applications without a letter of motivation will not be reviewed. When we think there is a potential match, you will hear from us sooner than you expect. If you have any questions feel free to contact the Recruitment team on +31 (0) 20 708 70 00 or recruitment@optiver.com.
Please note, if you are selected from your application to proceed to the next round for the position of Execution Trader you will be required to take an online assessment.
Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role.
More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)
