column1: 259,health,Indeed,p_10b575f8d4a9173f,HSE Specialist,Enza Zaden, Enkhuizen,"Wat ga je doen?

Jij bent mede verantwoordelijk voor een actief Health Safety and Environment (HSE) beleid gericht op de gezonde en veilige arbeidsomstandigheden op de hoofdlocatie en andere vestigingen in Nederland. Je bent de spil in het proces om HSE binnen Enza Zaden naar een steeds hoger niveau te brengen, zowel op de productievloer als bij het management en directie.

Je zorgt samen met je collega HSE specialist voor up to date procedures, ontwikkelt en ondersteunt implementatie van beleid en adviseert directie en management omtrent nieuwe wetgeving. Het is een dynamische functie waarbij samenwerking en het opbouwen en onderhouden van (interne) relaties op basis van vertrouwen centraal staat. Van overleggen met het management over de opzet en de uitvoer van de Risico Inventarisatie & Evaluatie (RI&E) tot aan het beantwoorden van vragen van medewerkers over hun eigen werkplek
column2: Mensen weten jou te vinden, maar het zit ook zeker in je karakter om proactief op de mensen af te stappen.

column1: Je begrijpt de dynamiek van een innovatief en snel veranderende organisatie en focust op het identificeren en verlagen van HSE risico’s. Je stelt de juiste vragen en gaat te werk als specialist én ambassadeur om de standaard met betrekking tot veiligheid en goede arbeidsomstandigheden binnen Enza Zaden zo hoog mogelijk te krijgen. Je bent adviserend, ondersteunend, controlerend en kan escaleren wanneer dit nodig is. Je rapporteert aan de Global Infrastructure Director.
Je verantwoordelijkheden zijn:
Samen met de verantwoordelijke managers initiëren en coördineren van de opzet en uitvoering van RI&E en Preventief Medisch Onderzoek (PMO)
Ondersteunen bij het opstellen van acties en maatregelen voorkomend uit het plan van aanpak n.a.v. de RI&E en PMO en het bewaken van de voortgang
Registreren en onderzoeken van ongevallen, bijna ongevallen en gevaarlijke situaties en zorgdragen voor wettelijk verplichte meldingen aan externe instanties
Vertalen van nieuwe wet- en regelgeving evenals relevante ontwikkelingen, technieken naar consequenties en mogelijk praktische toepassingen voor onze organisatie
Toezicht houden op de naleving van wet- en regelgeving, voorschriften en vergunningen op het gebied van HSE
Analyseren, adviseren en vertalen naar praktische voorstellen rondom proces veiligheid en RI&E
Continu verbeteren huidig HSE beleid, ondersteuning van management, instructie van medewerkers, etc
Coördineren van de uitvoering van bedrijfshulpverlening (BHV) en preventie
Het onderhouden van contacten met externe organisaties en overheden.
Jouw kracht

Als operationeel en tactisch HSE deskundige weet jij verbinding te maken met alle lagen van de organisatie. Je zegt waar het op staat en spreekt mensen aan op hun veiligheids- en gezondheidsbewustzijn, maar wel op een coachende manier. Je bent een initiatiefnemer en zichtbaar binnen de organisatie.

Je durft kritische vragen te stellen en hebt oog voor de diverse belangen, maar ook voor de diversiteit van onze medewerkers. Verder is het een pré als je ervaring hebt opgedaan met machineveiligheid, brandveiligheid, explosie-veiligheid en het werken met gevaarlijke stoffen.
Jij staat in je kracht als je een rol kan vervullen waarbij samenwerking centraal staat en waarbij het belangrijk is dat je met overtuiging een advies kunt geven.
Kortom jij
hebt minimaal een afgeronde HBO diploma, bij voorkeur richting Hogere Veiligheidskunde
beschikt over minimaal 6-8 jaar relevante werkervaring
hebt sterke interesse in veiligheidsonderwerpen en verandermanagement
bent flexibel en sterk in pragmatisch en procesmatig denken.
Onze kracht

Enza Zaden is een groenteveredelingsbedrijf dat groenterassen ontwikkelt. En de zaden hiervan over de hele wereld produceert en verkoopt. Zowel voor de gangbare als biologische tuinbouw. Om je goed (en zo kort mogelijk) uit te leggen wat we doen, hebben we een animatie gemaakt.

Al ruim 80 jaar werken we met het beste dat de natuur ons biedt. En dat ondersteunen we met innovatieve technologieën. Zo maken we het veredelingsproces sneller en efficiënter. En dat is nodig, want het ontwikkelen van een nieuw groenteras duurt op dit moment nog zo’n 6 tot 10 jaar.
Het resultaat? Sterke, gezonde en lekkere groenterassen die meer opleveren per m2, minder gewasbeschermingsmiddelen nodig hebben en bestand zijn tegen het veranderende klimaat.

Onze kracht? Ruim 2000 gepassioneerde collega’s wereldwijd die dagelijks samen werken aan de groente van morgen. Met onze Enza Academy investeren we daarom continu in nieuwe kennis en vaardigheden en onder de vlag van EnzActive organiseren we verschillende sportactiviteiten om vitaal te blijven.
Contact
Stuur je sollicitatie naar onze HR afdeling via onderstaande button.
Meer informatie:
Martine Rook, Recruiter, tel: 0228 – 784 638 of 06-55220474, email
column2: m.rook-wijnker@enzazaden.nl

260,health,Indeed,p_3c24e3d9bcb543d6,Field Clinical Specialist Neuromodulation,Boston Scientific Corporation, Amsterdam,"Purpose and Passion • Comprehensive Benefits • Life-Work Integration • Community • Career Growth

At Boston Scientific, you will find a collaborative culture driven by a passion for innovation that keeps us connected on the most essential level. With determination, imagination and a deep caring for human life, we’re solving some of the most important healthcare industry challenges. Together, we’re one global team committed to making a difference in people’s lives around the world. This is a place where you can find a career with meaningful purpose—improving lives through your life’s work.
About the role:

The Field Clinical Engineer Neuromodulation will provide expert clinical product and technical assistance and training to physicians and sales representatives on the effective and safe use of the Neuromodulation products during case procedures.
Your responsibilities include:

Commercial Support: Under general direction, serve as primary resource for clinical support consisting of tackling a wide range of issues relating to troubleshooting, programming, and patient follow-up for company products.

Educate customers on the merits and proper clinical usage of company products by giving presentations and demonstrations using appropriate formats and platforms (e.g., slides, manuals) to keep all customers abreast of the latest product, therapy, and technology developments and current items of interest in the industry.
Perform clinical and library research and participate in case reviews and clinical observation by working with physicians and hospital lab staff.
Attend unit implants in the labs and operation rooms of hospital accounts and perform patient follow-up to assure customer and patient success with the implanted products.

Meet with existing and potential clients to identify their clinical needs, goals and constraints related to patient care and to discuss and demonstrate how company products can help them to achieve their goals.

Develop business relationships with hospital personnel (e.g., through casual conversation, meetings, participation in conferences) to make new contacts in other departments within hospital and to identify key decision makers in order to facilitate future sales.

Respond to complex customer needs and complaints regarding products and service by developing creative and feasible solutions or working with other related personnel (e.g., sales, clinical, research, marketing, technical support) to develop optimal solutions.

Clinical Trial Support: Managing and providing technical support for clinical trial activity within assigned territory by supporting the site authorization process and study procedures as defined in the clinical investigational plan.

Providing initial and continuous training, education and support for clinical center personnel on clinical trial protocol, clinical process, products and features under investigation, and procedures involving those products and features.
On-call duties may be required 24 hours a day, 7 days per week.
What we are looking for:
Medical education (bachelor) background, preferably with hospital working experience, with at least 5 years of experience in medical devices / pharmaceutical industry
Strong clinical advising/ educating skills and ability to build credibility with surgeons and OR staff.
Demonstrated verbal, written, interpersonal, presentation and communication skills.
Ability to understand and communicate complex technical and clinical details
Strong motivation and ability to adapt to working environment
Fluent in Dutch and English, both oral and written
About us

As a global medical technology leader for more than 35 years, our mission at Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) is to transform lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients. If you’re looking to truly make a difference to people both around the world and around the corner, there’s no better place to make it happen.
If you are interested in this position please apply through the company website.
Requisition ID:443675

Job Segment: Clinic, Medical Technologist, Neurology, Medical, Medical Technology, Healthcare",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=3c24e3d9bcb543d6&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=48e3c76a2a45eeba&assa=2905,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=3c24e3d9bcb543d6&fccid=d13187a50c252e33&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
261,health,Indeed,p_0294c5bcf2d62487,Associate Director/Director - Healthcare and Chemicals Research,Sustainalytics  MyHire, Amsterdam,"ABOUT SUSTAINALYTICS

Sustainalytics has been a leading independent provider of Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) research for the last 25 years. Our insights are used by clients to make better informed investment decisions, engage with companies in relation to their business activities and drive change.

Sustainalytics is a growing organization with 800 employees and 17 offices globally. We have a flexible and supportive working culture and empower our employees to progress and develop quickly in an entrepreneurial environment.
For more information, visit www.sustainalytics.com (https://www.sustainalytics.com/)

Under COVID-19 circumstances, all Sustainalytics employees are now working from home. More than ever, ESG factors are critical to building a more ethical and sustainable global economy. Our teams need passionate colleagues to join us in delivering quality research products to our clients worldwide.
Our recruitment and selection process is continuing via phone or video meetings. New team members are onboarded and start their first day with the company from the safety of their homes.
We rely on virtual team meetings and management practices, as well as a remote buddy program, to support a smooth integration in our virtual offices.
POSITION PURPOSE

Sustainalytics is seeking a qualified Associate Director / Director to lead our Health Care and Chemicals analyst team, focused on the global Health Care, Pharmaceuticals, and Chemicals industries. This position presents an exciting opportunity to lead industry and company ESG analysis for our flagship ESG Risk Ratings. Asset owners, investment managers and other investment professionals leverage the ESG Risk Ratings and its underlying research to enhance investment processes.

Leading an analyst team, you are ultimately responsible for high-quality analyses and insights your team brings to our clients via our ESG Risk Ratings, written thought leadership pieces and external/client presentations. You will play a pivotal role in these activities directly and support the other analysts in the team to develop their own expertise and industry-specific capacity.

You will join a strategically important group of industry-focused ESG analyst teams based in Amsterdam, Toronto and Frankfurt, and contribute to the development of a vibrant community of sector analysts. You will also engage in training and development programmes which support your further development as a top ESG analyst.
The ideal candidate for the senior analyst role will have both a longstanding and strong track record in capital markets research as well as relevant sectoral expertise.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead an analyst team of two to three analysts focusing on the global Health Care, Pharmaceuticals, and Chemicals industries
Take end-responsibility for all analysis and insights developed and produced by the analyst team
Maintain coverage of a select group of industry constituencies
Perform holistic quantitative and qualitative analysis across assigned subindustries to ensure that our research processes lead to optimal ratings outcomes
Build team capacity on these industries, supporting the analysts in your team in their professional development
Research and track ESG trends and issues relevant in your global industries of expertise
Be client and market facing, responding to client queries and supporting clients in integrating your (teams') analyses and insights into their investment decision-making
Turn your expertise into meaningful input for further ESG Risk Rating product enhancements
Contribute to the development of intellectual capital and thought leadership.
QUALIFICATIONS
Master's degree in related discipline (life sciences, business, economics, finance, etc) or Bachelor's degree with relevant experience
column2: MBA/CFA considered an asset

column1: At least 8-10 years of work experience in Health Care, Pharmaceuticals, or Chemicals, and/or ESG research in these industries
column2: we welcome more experienced candidates as well

column1: Very strong people management skills
Strong knowledge and understanding of the SRI/RI market
Excellent research, analytical and writing capabilities
column2: Experience leading a research team considered an asset

column1: Skilled in quantitative and qualitative analysis
Solid presentation skills (both in spoken and written formats), e.g. ppt skills, client interaction skills
Alignment with Sustainalytics' mission, vision and values (http://www.sustainalytics.com/about-us/)
Resourceful, flexible and embraces change and innovation
English is the sole working language for this role. Fluency in business English (speaking and writing) is therefore required.
APPLICATION & INTERVIEW PROCESS

In keeping with our ongoing efforts to represent the diversity of our community, we strongly encourage people from diverse groups to apply. Sustainalytics is committed to providing accommodations for individuals with disabilities, upon request.
Sustainalytics thanks all applicants for their interest, however only those applicants requested to participate in the interview process will be contacted.

Your privacy while being in contact with Sustainalytics is one of our fundamental commitments here. Review our Privacy Policy (https://www.sustainalytics.com/privacy-and-cookie-policy/) to find out more about how we handle the personal data you provide us during the recruitment process.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 262,health,Indeed,p_a88188a0b540e669,Director of Marketing,Synthesis Retreat, Amsterdam,"Since 2018, Synthesis has been offering legal, medically supervised and science-based psychedelic retreats in Amsterdam for open-minded seekers who want to utilize moderate-to-high doses of psilocybin truffles to catalyze creative breakthroughs, explore consciousness, find meaning, improve confidence, and open up to a mystical experience.

With the FDA designating psilocybin therapy a “breakthrough therapy,” and thereby helping to speed up the process of researching and approving it to treat major depressive disorder (MDD), now a new era is upon us—one in which psychiatrists will be able to legally prescribe psychedelics in the United States.

Deeply rooted in its vision that everyone has access to mental health and wellbeing, Synthesis is uniquely poised to usher in this new era, pioneering as a global leader in advancing research, convening community, educating the public and engaging in activism to promote safe, legal, widespread access to psychedelics.
Standing on its years of experience and reputation for offering world-class psilocybin experiences,
Synthesis is also uniquely qualified to set the standard for practitioners to safely, ethically and effectively support people on a journey for healing using psilocybin.
The Synthesis Institute is an Amsterdam based company. We are accepting candidates globally and will consider candidates willing and able to telecommute.
Position Overview:

The Director of Marketing is a full-time position with responsibilities critical to our success. This person will champion the branding and positioning for the organization, ensuring it authentically and ethically reflects our core values and leverages the existing brand-equity we’ve worked diligently to establish as an industry-leading pioneer, while also innovating as we expand our reach through growth via the diversification of our live retreat and digital training offerings.

The ideal candidate will be an experienced and savvy marketing professional with a deep passion for supporting the positive change that’s possible through psychedelics. This person is willing, ready and able to be the organization’s public evangelist for the leading-edge breakthroughs that are possible when psychedelics are embraced in the evolution of the current mental health care and wellness paradigm.

Responsibilities include the development and delivery of a cohesive, integrated marketing strategy that encourages individuals to engage with Synthesis and ultimately select us as their provider of choice for safe, legal and effective psychedelic experiences and training. Excellent communication, collaboration and leadership skills are required to build, guide and grow a team of progressive, mission-oriented marketers. Experience in both sales and marketing with service and/or education based products, plus proven success in a fast-paced, startup environment is preferred. This candidate must demonstrate expert-level understanding of branding, website design and social media strategy and have executed strategic public relations campaigns successfully. Experience executing targeted content marketing campaigns and building engagement inside digital communities is ideal.
Responsibilities:
Champion the The Synthesis Institute brand strategy, consistently projecting the mission and vision of the organization while increasing brand awareness and growing market share

Create a compelling and deeply ethical client path using high-value and transformative no-charge content to build an engaged audience eager to participate in our immersive retreats, clinical services and professional trainings
Lead our multifaceted brand building activities, including but not limited to, storytelling, short videos, interviews, partnerships, scientific education, open sourcing models, etc.
Oversee multi-channel, integrated marketing campaigns including: Social, email, paid marketing and affiliate strategies
Execute a high level multi-year SEO strategy
Grow the organizations affiliate marketing efforts by aligning with mission-aligned organizations
Create effective, brand-congruent customer retention programs (alumni, referral programs, community platform, etc.)
Generate innovative concepts for attracting highly-targeted customer segments
Work closely with external public relations firm maximizing all corporate publicity efforts
Manage the companies content strategy and design a cohesive editorial calendar that delivers high-quality, brand-congruent copy
Deliver organized and useful marketing analytics using data to inform go-forward strategy and be able to clearly communicate insights gained to other departments

Work closely with the Product Development, Clinical, and Ethics teams ensuring consistency and accuracy of product and service offerings is distributed to Synthesis’ prospective clients, partners, and community
Required Experience:
5+ years experience in senior-level marketing role
Proven success building B2C and B2B marketing campaigns in a service and/or education business
Experience in recruiting, training, growing and leading a dynamic, high-performing group of marketing professionals
Experienced with CRM’s (Hubspot or other) and leveraging technology to create highly-curated and meaningful customer communications
Excellent written and spoken English skills
Understand the deep responsibility that comes with delivering safe, legal and ethical psychedelic care
Highly independent self-starter that is detail oriented and organized
Have highly-effective judgment to make sound and responsible decisions
Model professionalism through excellent, compassionate, and effective interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work well with people of all ages, backgrounds, etc.
Able to proactively solve problems and remain grounded while working inside projects with limited time and resources
Radiate enthusiasm, charisma, creativity, humor, and servant leadership skills
Have a daily wellness/self-care practice and value introspection and personal growth as a priority
Outstanding organizational and leadership abilities
Experience in strategic planning and helping to ensure the efficient operation and growth of the department.
Extensive project and leadership management experience with a positive progression resulting in greater levels of responsibility and leadership based upon proven success preferred.
Excellent delegation skills
Excellent project management skills
Impeccable understanding of the ethical and legal considerations for marketing psychedelics
Nuanced understanding of Synthesis’ unique position within the developing psychedelic ecosystem
The ability to negotiate and resolve conflicts and build teams.
Effective analytical ability in order to develop and analyze options, recommend solutions to and solve complex problems and issues.
Proven track record of innovative ideas that have shaped client engagement, brand awareness, culture, or other
Inspires confidence, appropriate risk taking and achievement of high standards
Flexibility in work schedule, on-call required as needed
Ability to effect collaborative and promote teamwork
Ability to make judgments in demanding situations
Ability to lead through frequent changes in duties and volume of work
Solid understanding of scientific psychedelic research and capacity to replicate in writing
Highly-Preferred Qualifications:
Deep personal experience with psychedelics
Compensation:
Competitive base salary commensurate with experience

Annual performance and salary review",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=a88188a0b540e669&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=39eff24b1a8a5ce6&assa=5418,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=a88188a0b540e669&fccid=10f8c0d67636d5c2&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
263,health,Indeed,p_b0ca9d0592a3eff7,Beauty Care Global SHEQ Intern,Henkel, Amsterdam,"HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?

If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.

264,health,Indeed,pj_ab595788da302a4f,EU Payroll and Benefits Specialist,CarNextcom, Amsterdam,"EU Payroll and Benefits Specialist
Amsterdam

Do you have experience in setting up and maintaining payroll and benefits processes and systems on a European level? Do you have a degree in HR or finance combined with at least 5 years of relevant working experience in an Payroll role? Do you have solid working knowledge of wage taxation, social security and employment law? If you answered yes to all there questions, we have a great position for you at here at Carnext.com and you should apply.
Who are we?
We are CarNext.com and we're transforming the way Europe buys its cars.

The days of scouring the showroom, searching through piles of old, battered cars for a diamond in the rough are over. CarNext.com uses a trusted network of suppliers to source high-quality used cars, gets them showroom-ready and offers them to consumers through our cutting-edge digital platform. But we can’t do this without you.
What will you do?

In this role you are part of the CarNext.com People Shared Service Center. The PSSC runs, improves and maintains all the operational People processes and systems. In your role, you will be responsible for the operations of the end-to-end payroll and benefits processes and systems for CarNext employees (500-700 fte) in several European countries. You will design, develop and deliver payroll/HRIS projects, processes & activities. You will be handling expatriate administration and 30% ruling, manage our suppliersand will be involved in all hires/terminations, changes, promotions, leaves of absence and bonus payments.
Your key responsibilities
Collaborate with partners (3rd party payroll providers) and vendors
Payroll administration: processing mutations for all different countries in different systems, creating first-time-right payment files to Finance.
Benefits administration including a wide variety of insurances (health, accidental, pensions administration).
Supporting Finance with month-end close and reporting activities.
Provide periodical reporting to relevant stakeholders including pension funds, social security, etc.
Serve as escalation/2nd line support for questions concerning the salary administration asked by CarNext HR, accounting, Tax Authorities and local governmental institutes.
Advise on matters impacting payroll like changes in regulations, benefits.
Reply to tax notices, wage orders, unemployment claims, government correspondences.
Support various internal and external audits.
Drive improvements on policies and processes related to payroll and benefits
Support and guide junior payroll administrator(s).
Identify improvement areas, create plan of approach and assist in continuous improvements.
Advise, lead, design C&B projects and manage the further roll out of the implementation.
Which skills and experience should you have to be successful in this position?
A bachelors degree in Finance or HR
A minimum of 5 years of working experience in an Payroll role
Good working knowledge of wage taxation, social security and employment law
Experienced knowledge of Payroll software or other relevant HRIS.
English, other languages as French, Spanish, Portuguese are an asset

Having managed functional relevant projects.

265,health,Indeed,p_4783a8ef1b3c4f70,Digital Project Manager,uButler, Amsterdam Centrum,"uButler is a 24/7 service that provides digital assistants to international local hires that need to find their way in the Netherlands. Our Relocation Assistants, who work under the alias ‘Sophie’, arrange everything that a newcomer needs when settling in a new country via our special created software. Think about opening a bank account, taking out health insurance or to arrange personal matters, like arranging a holiday or looking for a hobby. Our golden formula of well-trained people, combined with a smart system, ensures that international local hires will find their way in the Netherlands within a few weeks! Are you the new link in this technical and innovative start-up?*As the Digital Project Manager you ensure that your team has everything they need to carry out their work as good as possible. It's your responsibility to communicate with both the engineering team, management and the rest of the teams to have a clear idea on what work is on 'the backlog' and what the priority for this work is. You should always have an overview of what the team is working on and be able to give a status update to management and other parts of the business.You should be the person to reach out to with any type of request for new features or bugs. This way the software engineers can find the focus to get the actual work done with the least amount of distractions.Furthermore, you are responsible for actually running the sprint planning, sprint grooming and retrospectives. You are making sure the correctly prioritised work makes its way into the software engineering sprints. All tasks need to be clearly defined before work commences and you need to make sure any questions or unknowns are discussed with the relative stakeholders. Questions will however always arise so it's also important that you help to answer any questions the software engineers will have while planning sprints or while doing the actual work.Our tech stack and tools are the following so it would be great if you've worked with some of these before', as it's not at all need, but just to give a feel about the tech side of things:Technical knowledge: React.js, Expo, Typescript, Node.js, GraphQL, Meteor, Docker, AWS, HerokuNon-technical: Agile (Scrum), Jira, GithubWhat do you like to do? Break down initiatives by the organisation into tasksPlan project timelines and monitor task completionHave an impact on strategic decisions by providing technical and non-technical guidance to your teamEnsuring that our software solutions and engineer team can meet the constantly changing and growing needs of uButlerWhat do we ask from you?+3 years of professional work experience in project managementComfortable with working autonomously and as part of a teamStrong time management skills, quick thinking and ability to meet project deadlines as necessaryYou have strong communication skills and are able to explain the right technical decisions to technical and non-technical colleagues.You would like to work in an Agile environment and are used to working with Scrum or KanbanYou speak fluent EnglishYou live in Amsterdam or surrounding areaWhat’s in it for you?Full time contractA company laptop22 holidaysA subscription to SwapfietsRoom for own initiatives and improvementsAn extensive lunch every dayFun activities like sport events or drinksBeing part of a cool team, we are always in for a good joke!Do we have your attention?Nice! Our mission is to create the best digital relocation service and we will not stop until we succeed! Do you want to be part of this great journey? Register quickly or contact:Medea Weertman | HR-manager*Contractduur 7 maandenDeadline sollicitaties: 11-2-2021Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Bepaalde tijdArbeidsvoorwaarden:BedrijfsfeestenExtra vakantiedagenFietsplanKerstpakketLunchkortingReiskostenvergoedingTelefoonplanVrijdagmiddagborrelWerk vanuit huisWerkschema:DagdienstThuiswerken:Tijdelijk vanwege COVID-19",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 266,health,Indeed,p_5e42752fcaa3812e,Corporate Recruiter,Omnia Retail, Amsterdam,"Independent and perseverant, the Corporate Recruiter will be an Ambassador of Omnia values to the external world. You will be responsible for the full cycle recruitment: from intake with the manager through writing the vacancy text, setting up and managing the recruitment process to facilitating the hiring decision and assisting with the employment offer. Reporting to the Operations Director and alongside the Office Manager you will form the People Operations Team. Together you’re responsible for creating a high-performing company culture that delivers strong top company results, drives great employee experience and unleashes our employees’ Superpowers.

Omnia Retail is a high performance environment targeting top of the market candidates and not making any concessions on quality. We are obsessed with excellence, committed to continuous improvement and learning, our people are the beating heart of the organisation. The Recruiter will have an important role in the upcoming growth of the company making sure that we keep adding the right people to our teams.
Key responsibilities for this position are:
Ownership of the complete recruitment process
Hands on sourcing of candidates (we do not work with recruitment agencies)
Job marketing and employer branding ensuring visibility and conversion,
Continuous and proactive support of the business, anticipating future recruitment needs and building prospective pipelines
Building an excellent reputation of Omnia on the market
Working with data in order to optimize the recruitment process, conversions and other relevant KPIs
Minimum 3 years of recruitment experience of which at least 2 years in a an inhouse role preferably gained from a fast moving, technology driven company
Demonstrable experience sourcing for both technical and commercial roles
Relevant experience managing the full recruitment cycle is a must: you need to know what it takes to hire the right people for your organization from A to Z
Experience with recruiting international candidates, knowledge of rules and regulations related to hiring and relocating internationals to the Netherlands
Comfortable working in a fast moving, performance and technology driven organization
Strong interpersonal skills and used to work in an international environment
Strong communicator in English, both written and oral. Dutch or German will be considered as a plus
Currently based and eligible to work in the Netherlands
What’s in it for you?

At Omnia, attracting and retaining top talent is one of our highest priorities. Employee happiness is important to us because we think it is vital for a thriving organization. Therefore, we offer top-notch perks and benefits to make sure we promote happiness. We offer:
Everything you expect:
Competitive salary
Generous pension plan
Recognition program
Excellent growth opportunities
Referral bonus program
Stock Appreciation Rights program
Extras:
NS business cards
Self-development: training and coaching
And much more, to make you even happier:
Full flexibility in working hours, working from home and abroad flexibility
Wednesday Omnia lunches
Health & wellness: sponsored memberships
Free drinks and fresh fruits
Company sponsored social events
Extended leave for new parents
Green and flexible transportation
Volunteering events
More information:
Maggie Kramar, Recruitment tel. 0621904651

No recruitment agencies please.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=5e42752fcaa3812e&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=3a0ba3e77982c48f&assa=1837,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=5e42752fcaa3812e&fccid=cf6004f73ebbb362&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
267,health,Indeed,p_b4233b930c9a3972,Category Specialist Products,Emesa, Amsterdam,"Wie ben jij?

Jij bent commercieel ingesteld en hebt ervaring in een e-commerce omgeving. Je kan snel schakelen, bent analytisch ingesteld, werkt planmatig en vindt het leuk om in hoog tempo met veel partners te schakelen. In samenwerking met Buying & Marketing zie jij waar commerciële kansen liggen en weet deze te benutten. Communicatief vaardig, overtuigend en klantgericht zijn termen waar jij jezelf in herkent.
Ben je nieuwsgierig naar de functie van Category Specialist Products? Lees dan snel verder!
Ook als ambitieuze starter nodigen we je graag uit om te solliciteren!
Wat ga je doen?

Als Category Specialist Products ben je verantwoordelijk voor het beheren van jouw producten portfolio van B2B partners en werk je samen met je team aan zo optimaal mogelijke veilingopbrengst. Je coördineert bestaande en nieuwe veilingen, plant veilingen in, monitort deze, analyseert de resultaten en zoekt continue naar verbeteringen.

In jouw rol ben je op de hoogte van trends in de markt en weet deze naar kansen in vraag en aanbodoptimalisatie te vertalen. Zowel individueel als in teamverband ben je verantwoordelijk voor het commercieel uitbreiden van toegewezen productcategorieën. In samenwerking met Buying & Marketing werk je aan de uitvoering hiervan. Je rapporteert aan de Category Manager over de resultaten, kansen en aandachtspunten van jouw producten portfolio.
Wat verwachten we van jou?
Afgeronde WO of HBO opleiding, bij voorkeur in (commerciële) economie of bedrijfskunde
1-3 jaar commerciële werkervaring
Je beschikt over een uitstekend analytisch vermogen
Jouw communicatieve vaardigheden zijn sterk ontwikkeld
Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal
Affiniteit met e-commerce is een must
Cijfermatig inzicht en kennis van MS Office (Excel) zijn vereist.
Een dag als Category Specialist?

Het is maandagochtend 8:30 uur, je opent snel je laptop met een kopje koffie want je bent benieuwd hoe je veilingen de week ervoor hebben gepresteerd. Je analyseert de resultaten en verwerkt deze met een toelichting in het slide deck voor de wekelijkse team meeting. Deze week staan er 2 belangrijke afspraken op de planning met partners. Jouw resultaten zijn een belangrijke leidraad voor het gesprek bij de partner dus je analyseert de resultaten en kijkt vooruit hoe we de omzetten voor beide partijen nog beter kunnen optimaliseren.

Voor over 2 weken staat er een campagne op de planning voor jouw categorie. Je checkt met de verantwoordelijke accountmanager welke content er nog in de pipeline zit, welke content al getekend is en geeft aan wat voor content je nog nodig hebt om de campagne optimaal te kunnen laten verlopen.
Voordat de Bootcamp les begint, zet je nog een nieuwe veiling live. Morgenochtend snel de eerste resultaten bekijken!""
Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Natuurlijk word je maandelijks beloond met een goed salaris incl. bonusregeling. Je bouwt aan je toekomst door deelname aan onze pensioenregeling. Ook bieden we je een uitgebreide aanvullende verzekering op het gebied van arbeidsongeschiktheidsrisico's
Een veelzijdige, afwisselende plek met jonge en enthousiaste collega's in een leuke veranderingsgerichte organisatie
Veel zelfstandigheid en verantwoordelijkheid en ruimte voor eigen inbreng

We hebben oog voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Daar ben je bij Emesa primair zelf verantwoordelijk voor, maar met onze Emesa Academy, individuele trainingen en vele doorgroeimogelijkheden dragen we daar graag aan bij

Met de uitgebreide lunch en koffiebar beneden kom jij vol energie de werkdag door. Mocht het weer mogelijk zijn: Op vrijdagmiddag sluiten we de week af met een VrijMiBo :-) en zorgt de Emesa Health Club dat je fit blijft.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=b4233b930c9a3972&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=37d1cb00b3a8ead8&assa=3785,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=b4233b930c9a3972&fccid=67d4b8bca8c0b716&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

268,health,Indeed,p_7568018f063ffa06,"Global Strategy & Ops Mgr, Trust & CX",eBay Inc, Amsterdam,"eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with ten brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust.
About the business:

Classifieds is shaping the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to reach out to the community around them. We are comprised of more than 1,000 people who are passionate for local trade and maintaining the customer-centric nature of the Group, while exploring growth opportunities in both the countries where eCG already has a presence and in prospective markets.
Our team:

Trust & Customer Experience is eCG Global operations team working across different platforms (Marktplaats, Gumtree, Kijiji and more) in 6+ countries. We’re responsible for Trust and Safety, Customer Support, and we’re the voice of the customer for the local and global teams. As Strategy & Operations Manager you’ll have a global impact and report to the Director of Trust & CX. The ideal candidate has experience in crafting strategic scenarios, executive communication and partner management, and is a self-starter who proactively identifies and solves problems, driven by data. This individual has a 'willing to take action' mentality and thrives and enjoys a fast-paced and cross-functional environment
Join us!
Responsibilities:
Develop a deep understanding of Trust and Customer Experience Operations that can connect the dots between teams and countries to identify areas for improvement, efficiency, and collaboration.
Help form Trust & CX Operations strategy and vision for the future.
Drive goal setting and performance management, and run rhythm of the business reporting and monitoring of key performance metrics.
Develop executive-level communications and presentations for eCG’s leadership.
Strengthen the Trust & CX community and build a better communications strategy.
Explore new ways to measure and communicate the impact of trust & customer service contacts on business
Support forecasting and budget process and cost optimization
Own or support ad-hoc strategic projects, requests and/or analysis, as needed.
Drive key leadership meetings and facilitate alignment on key issues and opportunities
column2: follow up on action items and progress.

column1: Preferred qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Business, Finance, or other quantitative fields
column2: MBA is preferred

column1: Experience leading strategy, operations and process improvement projects at a leading management consulting firm or in a relevant strategy/operations team.
Experience in communicating with and making pitches to senior leaders
Experience leading strategic projects and strategic analytics
Proven partner management and influencing skills in a cross-functional environment
Sophisticated analytical skills
Experience with Consumer Products, Trust & Safety, Community Operations, Customer Service area is a plus!
Benefits:

Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.

We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about our Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/
Covid-19
People are the heart of the eBay Classifieds business, and their health and well-being are our first priority.

We continue to monitor local government guidance and partner closely with medical advisors to determine the safest and best next steps for everyone. As a result, most teams are working remotely, with a few teams able to collaborate in person with enhanced safety procedures. We will discuss the particular case for your region during the interview process. As a general rule, interviews will be completed remotely over video calls.

eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.
For more information see: EEO is the Law Poster and EEO is the Law Poster Supplement
This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies

View our privacy policy and accessibility info",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=7568018f063ffa06&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=1869b9d05042074d&assa=5242,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=7568018f063ffa06&fccid=0da3ed18c20a248d&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
269,health,Indeed,p_1c6833e0d988ebf3,Internship: Marketing Insights & Analytics Personal Health,Philips, Amsterdam,"Job Title
Internship: Marketing Insights & Analytics Personal Health
Job Description
Starring Date: January
Duration: 6-9 months
In this role, you have the opportunity to

Manage and/or participate in projects related to Market Analysis, Consumer Innovation research, and create Knowledge Zones on key strategic topics for Domestic Appliances businesses. We invite you to further develop your talents in a fast-paced market environment and gain broad experience in various aspects of marketing.
You are responsible for

Supporting the Global Business Partner MI&A for Domestic Appliances in creating market tracking reports, new market analysis, competitive analysis, and underpinning of market opportunities with strategic deep dives
Support with projects around Consumer Insights, Innovation Development, Usage & Attitudes, and Consumer Satisfaction
Building Knowledge Zones from insights across multiple Centers of Expertise on strategic Key Insight Topics
Building future-focused trend overviews
Answering daily ad-hoc requests coming from the Business Managers.
You are a part of
The Global Marketing Insights & Analytics (MI&A) team within Philips Personal Health based in the Head Quarters in Amsterdam. Your focus will cover the biggest business in Philips PH: Male Grooming.
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience
Currently studying towards your University Bachelor/ Master in Marketing Analytics, Business Administration, Business Economics, Business Management, Economics or related field
Strong command on MS Office (Excel and PowerPoint). GFK is a plus
Great analytical skills and Interested in market research, data analysis, competitive analysis, and consumer research
Good understanding of different research methodologies (qualitative research, quantitative research)
Some experience in desk research (preferred)
Fluent English communication both verbal and in writing
Excellent networking / social skills and Team player
Interest in the Domestic Appliances category
In return, we offer you

The unique opportunity to gain experience with a global market and consumer analytics, innovation and strategy building on a wide range of topics and work closely together with a large number of disciplines within the business, under the supervision of the Business Partner
Market Intelligence & Analytics.
Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.
Notes
Required documents in order for us to continue with your application:
Resume
#LI-EU
Contact
If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.
If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com.

(Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=1c6833e0d988ebf3&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=9ba8637fe3922cf8&assa=7087,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=1c6833e0d988ebf3&fccid=e4af9ca5b6d3a604&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

270,health,Indeed,p_8eea83f45927b118,Digital Advertising Specialist,Hearst Netherlands, Amsterdam,"Bij Hearst Netherlands zoeken we een digital advertising specialist, met een brede basiskennis op het gebied van online marketing, met minimaal 2 jaar relevante operationele werkervaring met het opzetten, beheren en optimaliseren van social mediacampagnes. Deze advertising specialist kan hoog-over meedenken met onze klanten en heeft een strategisch, data-gedreven inzicht. Er wordt gewerkt met concrete en harde KPI’s en dat maakt daadkrachtig handelen en pro activiteit een absolute pré. Als sparringpartner voor zowel onze klanten als je collega’s ben je bovendien communicatief vaardig. Je hebt een natuurlijke nieuwsgierigheid naar de nieuwste features en je kan niet wachten om deze uit te rollen naar nieuwe innovatieve campagnes.
Wie ben jij?
Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring met Facebook Business Manager, Google Analytics en Google AdWords. Ervaring met advertising op Pinterest, YouTube, Snapchat en Tik Tok zijn mooi meegenomen
Je hebt hbo werk- en denkniveau
Je hebt alle social media apps op je telefoon en een natuurlijke interesse in de dynamische wereld van social- en online media, influencer marketing en videocontent
Je hebt een hands-on mentaliteit
Je bent ambitieus en beschikt over een onophoudelijke drive om jezelf te ontwikkelen
Je hebt een sterk cijfermatig inzicht, de nodige kennis van Excel en het vermogen tot het analyseren van data met oog voor details
Je hebt een sterk commercieel inzicht en begrijpt goed wat onze klanten willen bereiken
Je hebt een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse & Engelse taal en een gevoel voor de juiste tone of voice in de communicatie
Je bent een team player
Je werkt gestructureerd en nauwkeurig
Je hebt ervaring met projectmatig werken, ervaring met Asana is een pré.
Wat ga je doen?
Zelfstandig uitwerken en opzetten van paid (social-) mediacampagnes voor branded content, events en producten
Optimaliseren van social advertising campagnes om ervoor te zorgen dat alle KPI’s behaald worden
Rapportages maken en hieruit de belangrijkste learnings trekken voor toekomstige campagnes
Presenteren van deze rapportages aan interne en externe klanten
Jezelf en het team om je heen inspireren met nieuwe mogelijkheden, ideeën en ontwikkelingen in de branche
Pro-actief zorgen voor verrijking rapportages vanuit data-inzichten en nieuwe digitale producten/toolings die beschikbaar zijn
Direct aanspreekpunt voor de projectmanagers en brand managers binnen Hearst
Bouwen van dashboards om campagne resultaten inzichtelijk te hebben
Projectmanagement, projecten van A tot Z managen.
Wat bieden we jou?
Een marktconform salaris met goede arbeidsvoorwaarden

Je komt te werken in een gezellig en dynamisch team met de mooiste inspirerende merken van Nederland zoals Vogue, Quote, Esquire, ELLE, Jan, Runner’s World, Men’s Health, Glamour, National Geographic etc
Opleidingsmogelijkheden in digital advertising
Werkweek van 36 uur
Een plek waar je ruimte krijgt mee te bouwen, te leren en veel werkplezier te hebben
Borrels en andere leuke dingen.

Lees je het functieprofiel hierboven en denk je: dat ben ik? Stuur dan jouw persoonlijke motivatie met je CV naar Heidi Duits, Commercial Strategy & Partnership Manager via HRM@hearst.nl",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 271,health,Indeed,p_48d3388c479a74a0,Business support professional in the area of financial administration/bookkeeping,NLC, Amsterdam,"NLC is the European Healthtech Venture Builder. Our mission is to advance health by making impactful medical technologies accessible for everyone. We achieve this by building startups following our unique NLC approach: entrepreneurship at scale. This allows us to scout thousands of inventions each year, select the most promising and turn these into impactful healthtech ventures. We are a team of 50+ impact driven professionals with a fast growing portfolio of over 50+ life changing ventures (in the Netherlands and in 5 other countries).
NLC

NLC comprises a group of five core NLC legal entities, two funds (special financing vehicles) and 50+ ventures (10%-100% subsidiaries of one of NLC’s core entities). The 50+ subsidiaries act, to a large extent, as independent companies with NLC as the founding and often majority shareholder. The five core NLC entities contain one main operating entity, two holding / financing entities and two entities for management services.
Your role

NLC insourced its financial bookkeeping process, being supported by an outside third party accounting firm, which also provides the compilation accounts (samenstelverklaring) for each of the NLC core entities. Together with one other team member you perform/execute, manage/oversee and monitor/improve all the financial, tax, and HR administration activities under final supervision of the CFO. You will be instrumental in getting the whole administration process right/accurate and ‘on time’ (speed is essential).
Responsibilities include:
Day-to-day bookkeeping (journal entries) into NLC core administrative system (Exact Online)
Quarterly closing procedures and preparation of year-end figures for the outside third party accounting firm (so they can conduct their review activities)
Consolidation process and supporting the implementation of standard consolidation software in 2021)
Tax management and filings (CIT, VAT, Wage taxes, etc), in conjunction with the outside third party accounting firm and tax advisors
HR and salary administration, which is largely outsourced to the third party accounting firm
Control and monitor WKR and other sub-budgets
Treasury, cash management, payment runs, creditor management / administration

Monitor quality of the financial administration of all 50+ ventures (including the interaction with the 50+ CEOs of these ventures) and interaction with the 5-10 third party admin/accounting firms involved
Organise, draft, monitor and administer agreements and CA/loans between NLC and its ventures

Growth opportunities / optional activities: (i) support the CFO and the business in designing, implementing, monitoring/controlling and reporting of decision support KPI’s and management reports (financial and operational)
column2: and (ii) support the re-design / set-up of a future-proof internal control framework and description of all administrative and approval processes

column1: The role of “Business support professional in the area of financial administration / bookkeeping” reports to the CFO.
Your profile
No-nonsense and experienced bookkeeper / administrator (“knows her/his stuff”)
Experience with Exact Online (and related tooling such as DizzyData add-on) is a plus
Smooth with Excel (and/or Google sheets), Word (and/or Google Doc) and Powerpoint (and/or Google Slides)
Proficient in English. All in-house written communication is in English (including the ledger systems and internal management reports) and the standard language amongst colleagues is English
Self-starter, connector, open and optimistic personality (can do mentality)
You are process- and data/IT-driven (e.g. you embrace and look actively for process improvement opportunities and new tooling). You ensure structure and efficiency in everything you do.
You are firm and have the right personality to work with, support and challenge the business
Commuting distance of Amsterdam, albeit working from home is, and will remain a cornerstone of our ‘way-of-working’ philosophy (also after Corona)
We offer:
A full time pivotal position in our rapidly growing company, with plenty of flexibility
Great personal growth and career opportunities for candidates able to create the next level NLC
A lean and positive team culture which we call ‘TODO’: Together, Open, Decisive and Optimistic
Remuneration is partly equity based – own our joint success!
Let’s advance health together!
Contact Mark van Rooijen (Managing Consultant at Finanxe) at m.vanrooijen@finanxe.nl or +31613903126 with any questions or your application.
At NLC, we believe diversity drives innovation. We are committed to being an equal opportunity employer.

NLC is a certified B Corporation and part of it’s community of leaders, driving a global movement of people using business as a force for good.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=48d3388c479a74a0&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=cc57928a31b5e35c&assa=8802,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=48d3388c479a74a0&fccid=eece6bb778a064b5&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
272,health,Indeed,p_238a207face306f1,Schadebehandelaar Multibranche - Interim Professional - Amsterdam,DEKRA Claims and Expertise BV, Amsterdam,"Wat ga je doen
In jouw functie als schadebehandelaar multibranche vind jij de afwisseling leuk. Of het nou verkeer, brand of aansprakelijkheidsschades zijn, jij weet de klant goed te helpen.

Als schadebehandelaar multibranche ben jij verantwoordelijke voor het afwikkelen van schadedossiers op het gebied van verkeer, brand en aansprakelijkheid. Dat vraagt om flexibiliteit en snel kunnen schakelen. In deze functie heb je veel contact via de telefoon met o.a. adviseurs en experts. Het is dan ook belangrijk dat jij sterk bent in het telefonische contact.
Deze functie past bij jou omdat jij je graag aansluit bij een jong en gezellig team en omdat jij ook over een gezonde dosis humor beschikt. Een grapje tussen het harde werken door moet zeker kunnen.
Jij brengt mee
Je krijgt energie van het delen jouw kennis en blijven ontwikkelen
Beschik jij over een HBO diploma (juridisch)
Ben je in het bezit van relevante Wft-diploma’s
Heb je een goede beheersing van de verzekeringstechnische en juridische aspecten van verzekeringen
Maar bovenal heb je een juiste mindset en natuurlijk passie voor het vak!
Wij bieden

DEKRA People biedt nieuwe kansen in de verzekeringswereld. Onze organisatie is op de hoogte van de laatste trends en ontwikkelingen in de markt en weten hier tijdig op in te spelen. DEKRA People kan je helpen de juiste stappen in jouw carrière te zetten.
Persoonlijke ontwikkeling staat centraal binnen DEKRA People.
Over ons

DEKRA werkt al meer dan 90 jaar aan het vergroten van de veiligheid. Het is één van 's werelds grootste expertiseorganisaties. Met ruim 45.000 medewerkers, een omzet van 3,3 miljard euro en activiteiten in meer dan 50 landen.

In Nederland zijn we met ruim 1.000 medewerkers actief op verschillende terreinen, waaronder Product Testing & Certification, Business Assurance, Material Testing & Inspection, Occupational Health & Safety, Rail en Claims and Expertise.
DEKRA People detacheert sinds 2012 professionals gekoppeld aan het portfolio van DEKRA Claims & Expertise en DEKRA Rail.

Zo zijn we gespecialiseerd in interim inzet op het gebied van schade (schadebehandelaars materieel/personenschade, schade acceptanten) en rail (rail engineers en projectleiders). Inmiddels hebben we een fantastisch interim team met een landelijke dekking en brede ervaring op grote- en kleinschalige projecten.
Wij hebben een duidelijke ambitie: in het jaar 2025 is DEKRA dé wereldwijde partner voor een veilige wereld. En jij bent welkom!
DEKRA zoekt graag zelf haar nieuwe collega’s, acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature is daarom niet gewenst.
Vragen?
Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Neem contact op met:

Arlene Wierda +31 72 575 7706",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=238a207face306f1&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=ac260ba7bfcd732a&assa=9617,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=238a207face306f1&fccid=4e328e5e98aab303&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
273,health,Indeed,p_680b025bed60a861,DA - Manager Group Consolidation & Reporting,Philips, Amsterdam,"Job Title
DA - Manager Group Consolidation & Reporting
Job Description
In this role, you have the opportunity to

As Manager Group Consolidation and Reporting you work on the creation of consolidated financial figures of Domestic Appliances (DA). You will be part of a team of experts, combining strong accounting and reporting knowledge with a thorough understanding of processes and reporting systems. You will analyze financial figures, coordinate reporting processes, own an area of reporting expertise and start / ensure corrective actions are taken in order to maintain the integrity of financial data. Teamwork will be intense, our processes are smart and efficient and our output is instantly used throughout the finance function. You will work with various stakeholders across the globe ranging from Accounting Operations, FP&A and Group Functions. Our work is highly valued.
You are responsible for:
Monthly and yearly financial reporting and analytical review, focused on the consolidated statements of income at group level of DA
Support the team that prepares the annual report of DA
Prepare presentations for the Group Chief Accountant and the Review Committee Finance (committee in which CFO, Group Accounting and Internal Control are signing off on the annual figures)
Work on improvement initiatives, enabling more efficiency and transparency in our closing processes
Serve as bridgehead between the Group Accounting team in Amsterdam and the Infosys support team in Chennai (India) supporting the Month-end Closing process
Perform process improvements projects, coming along during the year (e.g. participation in IT-projects).
You are part of:

Within DA, accounting is the responsibility of the Group Controller. The Group Controller manages two teams: the Group Accounting and Consolidation team and the Accounting Operations team. You will be part of the Group Accounting and Consolidation team. Besides accounting and consolidation, various initiatives are executed by this team such as finance knowledge management and improvement projects on accounting and reporting. We take part in review meetings, analysis meetings and project teams. As such, we are part of all significant events happening throughout DA.

The Group Accounting and Consolidation team is based in Amsterdam and has a size of 11 persons of various nationalities. The team members have high education (in general master+). We will give a warm welcome to newcomers and give a boost to your knowledge and insights.
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience:
A master’s degree in business economics and affinity with accounting
Strong project management skills
Strong sense for cultural differences and how to bridge them
Excellent communication and analytical skills, work accurately and with a structured approach
3-6 years of relevant experience in an international business environment
Experience with SAP solutions (SAP/r3, BCS) and skill set in data analysis
Fluent in English.
In return, we offer you

A meaningful career, with new challenges in our dynamic organization, working in an encouraging multinational and multicultural environment. We are happy to provide you with this opportunity to work with new technologies. You will be surrounded by passionate and committed, colleagues who share your ambition to create outstanding customer experiences. Your work will be ambitious and full of opportunities for growth. Variety and challenge will be part of your daily routines.
Why should you join Domestic Appliances?

Philips’ Domestic Appliances business is a global leader with EUR 2.3 billion in sales in 2019 in kitchen appliances, coffee, garment care and home care appliances, with successful products such as the Airfryer, Perfect Care Steam Generators, Automatic Coffee Machines with LatteGo and SpeedPro Max Aqua vacuum cleaner, and many more that are used by millions of people every day across the world.

In January 2020, Philips announced that it would be considering new ownership options for Domestic Appliances, as it is not a strategic fit for the company’s future as a health technology leader, and committed to finding the right home for the business to ensure that it is set up for continued success serving customers, leveraging the Philips brand and driving growth across the markets that it serves.

In its 128-year history as a leading innovator, Philips has had to reinvent itself a number of times to remain competitive. This has involved several high-profile divestments, resulting in the company’s successful track record in managing complex change of this scale. Such transformations offer unique opportunities for employees to ‘make their mark’ and gain expertise in a specific and dynamic environment - those who can deliver results while navigating and contributing to changes will gain unique skills and perspective that will prove valuable for the rest of their careers.
#LI-EU
Contact
If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.
If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com.

(Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=680b025bed60a861&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=e0a8c4c6aa60112b&assa=530,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=680b025bed60a861&fccid=e4af9ca5b6d3a604&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

274,health,Indeed,p_5ef677cf34424d67,"Customer Success Manager, Trello",Atlassian, Amsterdam,"Atlassian is continuing to hire with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. All new and existing Atlassians will continue to work from home until it’s safe to return to our offices. When our offices re-open, we will provide the choice to work from home or return to work in an office unless a job requirement makes it necessary for a particular role to be performed at an Atlassian office.
Are you an experienced Customer Success Manager in search of that next challenge? This could be the role for you!

Customer Success Managers at Atlassian are responsible for maintaining relationships with key customers. Following their purchase, we meet regularly with customers to better understand their business needs, guide them through onboarding, and provide input into their implementation planning. We work strategically with customers on an ongoing basis to ensure that they are consistently achieving their goals and realizing value. We serve as an internal liaison and voice of the customer to bring contextual feedback into Atlassian regarding how customers use our products, customer requests for improvement, and insights into their overall experience. We monitor customer health and craft success plans to further drive their continued adoption of our product, all while collaborating with the larger account team.
More about you

You are passionate about the success of your customers, the value they receive from the solution you helped create, and you enjoy building strong partnerships. Adept at listening, documenting, translating, and conveying customer feedback to internal teams (Sales, Product Management, etc.). You possess the ability to learn, collaborate, communicate, and configure our product capabilities to meet the customer's needs. You are capable of researching and devising solutions based on your expertise, but able to solicit and incorporate input from other teams. You are an independent, self-motivated, results-focused individual. You strive to improve customer success practice through self-study, elevating industry standards, data analysis, and practical operational changes. You are focused on improving broader customer experience and having a visible global impact on processes, products, and teams.
On your first day, we'll expect you to have:
5+ years of experience working with customers adopting SaaS solutions
2+ years of Enterprise Customer Success Management experience
Project management and coordination skills
Customer monitoring and management skills
Experience helping an organization adopt an Atlassian product or similar
Proven aptitude for learning new technologies and understanding how to utilize them in a customer-facing environment
Demonstrated ability to take customer insights from the field and inspire changes to the business
Experience in handling high visibility escalations
Experience in communicating with a technical audience
Analytical skills to identify and articulate beneficial themes derived from customer data
Experience engaging closely with Sales, Product Management, and other teams
Confidence and motivation to creatively tackle problems, self-learn, and the ability to pivot and adapt quickly to change
It would be great, but not required, if you have:
Atlassian product experience with Trello or Access
Prior development or scripting skills
Salesforce and Tableau experience
Integration Products experience
Experience collaboratively brainstorming and developing strategic recommendations for how to improve post-sales processes (Implementation, Customer Success, etc.)
Ability to optimally communicate as the internal specialist with customers at an executive level on in-depth technical details, progress, and next steps
Experience in technical support, software services, and/or system administration for a large end-user community
Fluency in German or French
More about our team

Atlassian Customer Success partners with our customers to improve the value they realize in using our solutions through a high-touch engagement approach. We engage during onboarding and adoption, establish good relationships, and work to proactively mitigate any risks customers may encounter on their journey. We promote best practices and deliver insights back to the business.
More about our benefits

Whether you work in an office or a distributed team, Atlassian is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year for your favourite cause, an annual allowance to support your learning & growth, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years and lots more.
More about Atlassian

Creating software that empowers everyone from small startups to the who’s who of tech is why we’re here. We build tools like Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello to help teams across the world become more nimble, creative, and aligned—collaboration is the heart of every product we dream of at Atlassian. From Amsterdam and Austin, to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who want to write the future and who believe that we can accomplish so much more together than apart. At Atlassian, we’re committed to an environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to thrive, as well as the support of like-minded colleagues who are motivated by a common goal to: Unleash the potential of every team.
Additional Information

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Learn more about Atlassian’s culture, interviewing flow, and hiring process by checking out our Candidate Resource Hub.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=5ef677cf34424d67&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=0ee0333033911bb3&assa=1729,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=5ef677cf34424d67&fccid=e6d4ba9e2cfe7902&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

275,health,Indeed,p_29340672e8cbc830,Risk Manager,Optiver, Amsterdam,"Are you ready for the next step in your career in the field of Risk management within a fast-paced, dynamic and international trading company? Do you have an interest in financial markets and a desire to surround yourself with the inner workings of it?

Would you like to apply your strong technical and analytical ability to improving our low-latency risk framework? If the thought of early responsibility and fast career progression in a truly meritocratic environment excites you, then you might be the new Risk Manager we're looking for.
What you'll do

As a Risk Manager based on the trading floor you will be responsible for developing and implementing a standardised framework to identify, measure and monitor principal risks across the firm. Working collaboratively with stakeholders from trading and technology you will take ownership of strengthening and developing the risk framework and its individual components, as well as driving the delivery of new initiatives balancing the right risk and reward.

As a Risk Manager you will be responsible for ensuring that appropriate protections are in place to prevent the firm from incurring material losses. Furthermore, you will be actively employing and strengthening the components of the internal risk management framework.
Other key tasks of the Risk Manager include:
Assisting in the enhancement of risk processes by identifying and evaluating business critical exposures
Overseeing the monitoring and control of the positions in the trading books on a real-time basis to make sure that business activities remain within the pre-defined risk appetite
Actively contributing to the continuous improvement of the risk framework
Effectively, credibly and critically challenging others when necessary as a second line of defense
Coordinating assurance and testing efforts of existing risk controls.
Expertly assessing new business activities to ensure risks arising from new products, activities and markets are properly mitigated
What you'll need
An academic degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Ecomometrics, Finance, Physics or equivalent
0-3 years of experience in a similar role and sector
A proactive, analytical and inquisitive mindset with a willingness to speak up
Strong interpersonal skills and an eagerness to continuously improve
Being proficient in Python and VBA is a distinct plus but not a fixed requirement.
A keen interest in the financial markets
What you'll get
The chance to further your career working alongside best-in-class professionals from over 40 different countries.
A very competitive base salary combined with a performance-related bonus.

Alongside this you will get great secondary benefits such as 25 paid vacation days, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, training opportunities, discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, Friday afternoon drinks and even weekly in-house chair massages. Being highly international, we are accustomed to guiding expats through their relocation, offering competitive relocation packages and providing visa sponsorship where necessary.
Are you interested in furthering your career on one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe?

Apply directly via the form below for the position of Risk Manager. Please provide us with a CV and letter of motivation in English. Applications without a letter of motivation will not be reviewed. When we think there is a potential match, you will hear from us sooner than you expect. If you have any questions feel free to contact the Recruitment team on +31 (0) 20 708 70 00 or recruitment@optiver.com.
Please note, if you are selected from your application to proceed to the next round for the position of Risk Manager, you will be required to take an online assessment.
Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role.
More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)
