column1: 276,health,Indeed,p_8bfef450aae3e799,Senior Manager Strategy and BD International Markets,Philips, Amsterdam,"Job Title
Senior Manager Strategy and BD International Markets
Job Description
In this role you have the opportunity to

Influence strategy and growth in a leading Health Technology company. Are you a strategic thinker, obsessed with productivity/efficiency and a data geek? Do you understand that we don’t rise to the level of our ambitions, but instead fall to the level of our systems?
As a Senior Manager in the International Markets Strategy team you will directly support, and influence key decisions made at the highest level of the International Markets organization.
You are responsible for

Our Strategic Operations Systems:Building and running the systems, processes, rituals, and artifacts that help teams and leaders across International Markets keep strategy front and center and align on the most important strategic prioritiesFacilitating the strategy planning & execution cadence. We know what needs to be done by when, how to get it done and get support to navigate the processContinuously improving our strategic operations machine, by creating capabilities, not dependencies

Owning and driving strategic deep dives:Conducting high quality, meaningful, evidence-based business analysesContributing to the development and communication of actionable strategy recommendationsWorking with and presenting recommendations to internal stakeholders
Making the data speak to help answer complex questions:
Finding, collecting, organizing the data required to inform strategic analysis by understanding and tapping into the Philips data landscape as well as external sources of data
Building models and conducting analysis to make the data “speak”, surface patterns, expose correlation and causations to contribute to the formulation of actionable strategy recommendations
Helping other understand insights by effectively communicating the story told by the data, explaining the variables, mechanics and assumptions built into the models
Supporting markets in managing new business deals and coordinating with content experts, businesses and operations for integration
Supporting change management and new processes for IM and markets by deploying LEAN methodologies and standards
Responsibilities range from supporting strategy formulation and execution at group level to high-impact projects within specific markets.
You are part of

The International Markets Strategy team, reporting into the Head of Strategy and New Business Development of International Markets. The team works with Philips businesses, market organizations and functional teams, supplying them with deep business and market insights, actionable strategic direction and thought leadership. Further, you work closely together with the Strategists in the Markets and with Group Strategy.
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience
At least 5 years of experience in data analytics, data science, and research – a data geek
Experience with the design and facilitation of strategic planning & execution processes
Storyteller, you can explain the data in a concrete, vivid and easy to understand manner
International business experience acquired in a multi-national technology company
Master’s in Business, Science or Engineering with excellent academic track record
MBA from a top tier business school is a plus
Experience in a top tier Strategy Consulting firm (BCG, Bain, McKinsey, Roland Berger, etc.) is a plus
Fluency in English, both written and verbal
You are obsessed with personal productivity and use all the hacks, tools, apps and tricks to keep yourself and others around you organized
Willingness to travel (0- 25%)
In return, we offer you

We offer you the unique opportunity to be actively involved in the decision-making process of the Philips Executive Committee, plus the ability to work in a wide variety of business environments and geographies. We will also support your personal and professional development. Our benefits package includes:
Extensive set of tools to drive your career, such as a personal development budget, training and coaching
Variable bonus based on both Philips results and personal performance
Solid company pension scheme
Opportunity to buy Philips shares and products at a discount
25 Days of leave and the possibility to purchase up to 20 additional days off annually

Within Philips, the Strategy team is a proven landing spot for strategy consultants, and a stepping stone for future leaders. There is the opportunity to develop further within the strategy career track, but many predecessors have successfully moved into other areas of business – from general management to marketing. Projects form the ideal opportunity for members of the Strategy team to get to know the business better and vice versa. https://youtu.be/4G4RkM1Z_DA

The position is based in Amsterdam - A city consistently ranked in the top 15 in the world for Quality of Living, Startups and Innovation, Economic Prosperity, and Top City to Work In. Learn more about living and working in the Netherlands: http://www.relocationguide.philips.nl/
Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

Contact
If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.
If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com.

(Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=8bfef450aae3e799&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=248783af6d8789fd&assa=8028,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=8bfef450aae3e799&fccid=e4af9ca5b6d3a604&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral

277,health,Indeed,p_f20a747a54496465,Facility Management Internship,Sircle Collection, Amsterdam Centrum,"Do you like being the reliable multitask-er in an organization? Are you looking for an internship in which you will have to deal with all Facility aspects? Do you get a kick of being our Facility Management intern for our head office in Amsterdam?

As Facility Management intern you will be responsible and support the entire Sircle Collection headquarter. As an independent person in this role, you will be the first point of contact for our employees and suppliers. You will also work with the regional chief engineer and report directly to our Chief of Staff. Together with you, we want to optimise our health & safety processes and ensure the work happiness of our employees.

Our interaction with each other is characterized by personal attention and a scaling-up mentality to use our expertise to help each other maximize our shared goal of creating an even more respectful and inclusive corporate culture.
How do we intent to accomplish this?
By getting in touch with you, to hire the best talents in the industry.
About you
Would your best friend describe you as a social and integrity person
Are you a proactive and independent person who is always there for everyone
It is in your nature to switch and adapt quickly and always solve problems in the most creative way.
Responsibilities
Welcoming colleagues and suppliers with your ""Colgate smile”
Securing the ""Sircle Collection Office look & feel""
Keeping track of different mailboxes
Picking up the phone
In charge of optimizing the office and administrative processes
Taking care of the office/cleaning supplies
Guaranteeing the safety and security policy (e.g.: fire safety, COVID-19 regulations)
Ensuring and being ready for inspections (e.g.: NEN 3140, W Installation, elevators etc.).
HBO work and thinking level and currently in your final year of Facility Management study
Excellent command of the Dutch and English languages in word and writing
Good communication and computer skills
Good handling of confidential information
You are available from September 2021 for a minimum period of six months.
About Sircle Collection

We are an independent group of creative hospitality brands founded in 2011 by award-winning industry expert Liran Wizman. In our 9 years, our Amsterdam-based company has grown to include three hotel brands across 13 locations, three restaurants, one design concept store and three landmark properties—all set in some of Europe’s most inspiring neighborhoods. Our brands include Sir Hotels, Max Brown Hotels, Park Centraal Hotels, X BANK, Seven North, The Rooftop at Sir Victor, Bar Claes, as well as the properties of the W Amsterdam, the Edition Milan and more. In everything we do, we are focused on creating singular and surprising experiences for our guests. Learn more on sirclecollection.com.
Our Company Values
We provide heartfelt service: we believe in the importance of hospitality, and we respect and nurture the communities around us.
Creativity is our backbone: each member of our company is creative, and we use that to create tailor-made, one-of-a-kind experiences.
We are ambitious: we are always looking for the new, next and different, and we believe in growing ourselves.
We are surprising: we are fluid, we don’t settle, and we embrace uncertainty.
Benefits
Placement fee of € 500,- per month
Housing allowance
column2: € 80,- gross per month (if you move to Amsterdam)

column1: Discounts:
Hotel benefits (The Netherlands, Spain, Germany and Austria)
Discount: Employee rate (50%) and Family & Friends rate (30%)
Restaurant benefits - The Entourage Group (25%)
Sale moments at XBANK (10%)
Fun (for free)
Bootcamp every Monday @ Sir Adam
Birthday & Christmas Gifts
Paid moving day
Time to relax
Department events
Staff Society Membership (small contribution)
How to apply?

Please send us your CV and motivation through the apply button below.",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=f20a747a54496465&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=24a8eb5b4eb0dd87&assa=8967,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=f20a747a54496465&fccid=97b43d6adc1f948b&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
278,health,Indeed,p_864e704eae157a5d,Product Analytics Manager,Miro, Amsterdam,"About the team

Product data analytics is focused on a quantitative understanding of what users are doing within Miro and how product features perform. We consider ourselves a bi-direction driver. On the one hand, we transform business goals to data requests and reports/dashboards, on the other - proactively explore data to bring insights on how users extract value from the product to drive right decisions in a hyper-growth setting.
About the role
As we have centralized-embedded analytics org you will be an integrated part of 2-3 agile teams working within one of core product streams:
horizontal product (elaborating on core whiteboard UI/UX, cross-device experience, smart layout etc.)
use-cases (developing functionality for specific personas regarding their key use-cases with current focus on workshops and interactive meetings)
enterprise (building functionality for Enterprise customers, including user and content management, security, analytics & insights feature for corporate decision makers, etc.)
platform (optimizing external developers experience
column2: building efficient marketplace, etc.)

column1: That 'embeddedness' in agile teams will provide you with a great opportunity to directly affect how we build and measure the value for Miro end users in specific product areas.
What you'll do
End-to-end lead analytics area (hands-on, prioritization, stakeholders management, communications and knowledge sharing)
Start coaching more junior analysts in the future
Actively contribute in building analytics processes and data culture dissemination across the company
Identify and lead strategic analytics initiatives in your dedicated area and/or product wide
In some companies you can find this scope of responsibilities behind the title Senior data scientist - Analytics / Insights.
What you'll need
4+ years of data analytics work experience, including 2+ years in product company
Leading the team / coaching other analysts
Intermediate in using statistical methods, experimental design and quantitative analysis to impact key decisions
Advanced experience writing SQL queries and working with large data sets (DBT, Spark are a plus)
Experience in product analytics and BI tools (eg. GA, Amplitude, Looker, Tableau, or similar)

Experience in delivering analytical solutions for complex product-related tasks (user pattern research, supporting experiments, feature analysis to improve the product metrics, use-cases analysis, etc.)
More driven by creating business value than complexity of technical solution
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions
High-level written and verbal communication skills
What's in it for you
Highly competitive salary
Stock option grant
Relocation bonus
Health insurance for you and your family
Allowance to facilitate current remote working during WFH period
Help with relocation when back in the office
Weekly remote team activities to keep the spirits high
Yearly budget for professional growth, internal educational events
About Miro

Miro is an online collaborative whiteboard platform that enables distributed teams to work effectively together, from running brainstorming sessions and workshops to planning projects, from designing new products and services to facilitating agile ceremonies. With more than 10 million users and counting, Miro is trusted by Dell, Cisco, Salesforce, PWC, EY, Deloitte and many more global companies of all sizes.

At Miro, we are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves everyday. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you!

Check out our career page for all our open roles or hop onto this Miro board to learn more about us!",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=864e704eae157a5d&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=5b86544d43e3be78&assa=9755,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=864e704eae157a5d&fccid=d490918b85670b46&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
279,health,Indeed,p_493c292fa9cf26b4,Internship: Negotiation Excellence (Non-Thesis),Philips, Amsterdam,"Job Title
Internship: Negotiation Excellence (Non-Thesis)
Job Description
Start date: We prefer students able to start as soon as possible, no later than Q2 2021
Duration: 6-12 months.
This internship is not suitable to combine it with your thesis. We do require a 32-40 hours per week availability to work on this assignment.
In this role, you have the opportunity to
Experience how Game Theory and Mechanism Design are applied in practice in procurement within Royal Philips, an innovation leader in Healthcare and Consumer Lifestyle.
You are responsible for
The organization of negotiation trainings and support in the continuous improvement of the training material
Support the team during the preparation and execution of high impact negotiations in cooperation with Procurement Commodity Managers and Procurement Engineers
You are a part of

A small team of negotiation experts within Royal PHILIPS Procurement set up to globally support Commodity Managers in high impact negotiations of running business and new awarding. The team's responsibilities include the identification of projects, their preparation and execution. Part of the preparation is to tailor the optimal awarding mechanism design based on Game and Auction Theory.
We prefer as primary location Amsterdam, but Eindhoven is also possible. Occasional trips between the two offices might be expected
Due to the current COVID19 situation, we do support you working from home. Depending the rules and conditions as provided by our Philips Management, we might be able to grand you visit our offices.
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience
Currently studying towards your Bachelor or Master in: Economics, Business Mathematics, Business Administration, Industrial Engineering, Math or related studies
Knowledge in and enthusiasm for Microeconomics including Game Theory and Mechanism Design
Independent and organized way of working
Analytical and abstract thinking
Excellent knowledge in Excel and Data Analysis
Fluent in oral and written English
In return, we offer you

First hand, insights in the entire sourcing process with the experience how to systematically apply theoretical knowledge to business practice. Excellent career perspectives as 2 former interns hold now permanent positions in the team.
Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Life at Philips is an opportunity for personal and professional growth. And a journey into the unexpected
column2: our people often experience moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.

column1: In addition to being purpose-driven, we deeply believe in equality and that our people should be a reflection of the society and countries in which we operate. So we value our people in all aspects of diversity, whether generational, gender, experience, ethnicity, race, sexual orientation, ability, nationality, or other aspects. We believe that a flexible and inclusive culture invites a full spectrum of ideas, opinions, and experiences, and strive to create it wherever possible.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Resume

Students from outside the EU need to fill in an NUFFIC agreement, which needs to be signed by the student and the university.

280,health,Indeed,p_678a748e66ab7dbf,Containers,BAM Vermeer, Amsterdam,"Local and international trips with sea containers or box trailers to transport variety products (often ADR cargo) between airports and seaports in Holland, Belgium, Germany. Transported cargo is often high value, so driver have to respect all procedures and pass safety trainings.
Trips are local mostly, so drivers are at the base each week.
We offer
Employment with stable work and Dutch contract at the company B.A.M. Vermeer Uitzend B.V.
Your salary will be in category C0 and build up from the following amounts:
Basic bruto salary of € 11,40 euro bruto per hour up to 40 hours per week
Overhours (after 40 hours per week) will be paid 130%
Hours on Saturday will be paid: 150%, hours on Sunday and working on national holidays: 200%
Delegation of € 49,08 euro per day when you are full day from the base
4week period payment in euro’s, till 10th day after end of period
For 4 weeks period the average salary is about 2200 - 2600 euro.

You are obligated to have Dutch health insurance, we can arrange this for you for a competitive price of € 104,63 per 4 weeks. A refund for a part of these costs can be requested at Dutch government by applying for so called ‘Zorgtoeslag’, the refund depends of your salary level and private circumstances. Further, we are using collective services that contains: calamity coverage, legal liability insurance and accident insurance for € 8,12 per 4 weeks.
Worktime
Most used work schedules are 3 weeks at work and 1 week at home.
Shorter or longer periods are possible but yearly there should be not less then 36 weeks at work.

Travels from and to your home country are for costs of the employee, we can make a reservation for a place in one of our buses or book a plane ticket for you, the costs of this travel will be deducted from your salary. In case of flights to Eindhoven or Weeze airport, we can arrange transport to and from the airport. These transports to and from the airport can be for free in the weekend if we have option to make a combination trip.
What do we expect from you?
Experience as a truck driver is preffered
Digital tacho card
Clean background for Certificate of Good Conduct
ADR basic
Polish, English or German language
5 year background
Further information
Facilities at the base:
Bedrooms
WiFi internet
toilets + showers (shared)
washing machine + dryer
kitchen
Hours 50-60
Salary € 2.200 for 28 days

City Amsterdam",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nl/rc/clk?jk=678a748e66ab7dbf&from=vj&mvj=0&vjfrom=vjs&pos=bottom&astse=69731c50467df1b9&assa=2664,https://nl.indeed.com/vacature-bekijken?jk=678a748e66ab7dbf&fccid=cf9c59abbb598a49&vjs=3,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,Meer dan 30 dagen geleden,2021-02-11,en,Neutral
281,health,Indeed,p_f4442d035b113b9d,Business Process Expert Philips Lifecycle Solutions and e-Commerce,Philips, Amsterdam,"Job Title
Business Process Expert Philips Lifecycle Solutions and e-Commerce
Job Description
In this role, you have the opportunity to

Design and deliver effective services lifecycle business and e-Commerce capabilities in close collaboration with key services stakeholders in the markets and business. This ranges from catalog set up, price setting and associated commercial policies to how to apply pricing, associated discounts and approvals during the quoting and contracting process, review of configure-price-quote (CPQ) performance and relevant controls. Special focus will be on lifecycle business and e-Commerce capabilities for recurrent business opportunities to serve our customers towards the highest levels of experience. You will create globally harmonized services business and experience processes as the basis for existing and new to be developed IT tools and ensure change management in the services organization to move and adopt our teams to new and more effective ways of working. Main focus will be on a key transformation program to maximize customer experience throughout the customer life time, which aims to deliver a new transactional backbone – from solution introduction, opportunity, quotation and contract to order and fulfilment and customer success management – that supports our current business as well as the transition from a product to a solutions business.
You are responsible for

Managing and supporting the design, build and lead deployment of new services Philips Lifecycle Services (PLS) and e-Commerce capabilities (process, tool, people, data) for the Services lifecycle business and e-Commerce domain, covering models for (new) deal types, opportunity management, configure-price-quote (CPQ), order management with associated performance reporting and controls management

Maintain, develop, and safeguard relevant Services Philips Lifecycle Services and e-Commerce processes and KPIs according to standard architecture as part of the Philips Excellence Process Framework (PEPF)

Interact and collaborate with stakeholders and peers in the markets, business and supporting functions like IT, configure-price-quote (CPQ), Enterprise Information Management and Philips University to ensure services PLS and e-Commerce capabilities are well designed, deployed and adopted in line with the business’s needs
Drive real change in Services PLS and e-Commerce and controls through implementation, adoption and continuous improvement of processes, solutions and best practices in our markets and businesses
Initiate, challenge, support and lead improvement opportunities in the services lifecycle business and e-Commerce configure-price-quote (CPQ) domain
Drive and manage services capability performance in line with defined services KPIs and business objectives
Build and operate a strong network of stakeholders, subject matter experts and peers in Markets, Businesses and other functions
You are a part of

A diverse global Business Process Excellence team for the lifecycle business and e-Commerce domain, where you will support the markets and businesses in different areas of commercial capability building, talent and competency development and performance management. You will focus on one of the key End2End transformation programs called Customer Experience. You will report to the Business Process Owner (BPO) Services for Market to Order (M2O).
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

Minimum 5 years international experience in lifecycle business and e-Commerce in the commercial services configure-price-quote (CPQ) domain, with demonstrable experience in services transactional backbone – from solution introduction, opportunity, quotation and contract to order and fulfilment management
Hands on experience with e-Commerce and platforms

Hands-on experience working with scrum teams to perform technical and functional analyses, platform customization, configuration, development, deployment, troubleshooting, code review, migration and integration activities
Experience with Salesforce, Apttus CPQ, Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and SAP- Hybris integrations
Self-starter who takes initiative, values impact over effort and is motivated to drive performance
Strong communicator, able to interact with internal and external stakeholders, experts and peers at different levels
Willing to travel internationally up to 20% of the time
Fluent in English speaking and writing, other languages are a plus
In return, we offer you
We welcome you to a challenging, innovative environment with great opportunities for you to explore.
Our benefits are very competitive and designed around your preferences:
A market conform salary
25 Days of leave and the possibility to purchase up to 20 extra days off annually
A variable bonus based on both Philips results and personal performance
Extensive set of tools to drive your career, such as a personal development budget, free training and coaching
Solid company pension scheme and attractive collective health insurance package
Opportunity to buy Philips shares and products with discount
Healthy work-life balance
Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com.

(Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Je bent werkzaam binnen de afdeling bedrijfsvoering. Je werkt samen met je collega (project)controllers en de administrateurs en rapporteert rechtstreeks aan de adjunct- directeur. 283,health,Indeed,p_ccad063d1fbb3488,Business Analyst,Picnic, Amsterdam,"At Picnic we care about health and safety, so currently all interviews are done online and our team is working from home. We keep a close eye on the developments around Covid-19, and support your relocation to Amsterdam when it is safe to do so. It is possible to start working remotely with us - have a peek at how the remote onboarding is going here.

Picnic is data-driven and complex – from pricing strategies, forecasting, warehouse automation, to the ever-expanding growth of our company, we are constantly faced with new challenges and opportunities…that's where you come in!

We are on the hunt for business analysts who present their understanding of what drives consumer behavior and operational efficiency. You'll glean actionable insights from large data sets - but your eyes won't be glued to data all day! You also offer entrepreneurial, realistic, and practical business opportunities.
Have a forward-thinking idea? Tell your team, modify it, evaluate, experiment, and then make a real impact in our company!
Your responsibilities
Drive implementation and improvement of projects from kick-off until the final whistle
Design, implement and evaluate numerous experiments
Optimize tools, systems and business processes
Relentless focus on creating habit-forming product ideas
You
You combine first-class analytical skills with a creative and problem-solving mindset. You don't only see numbers in data sets, but you see opportunities.
As an innovative thinker you constantly generate your own ideas. You're also ambitious – you come up with smart solutions, not easy ones.

Superior presentation and communication skills allow you to convert complexity into digestible information for your team. You are confident and take ownership of your projects, but also collaborate with and motivate your colleagues!
Basic requirements
Master's degree in Engineering, Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics or an equivalent quantitative study
0-5 years of work experience
Excellent Excel and data analysis skills
Fluency in both verbal and written English
Full-time availability
Holder of an EU work permit
Desirable requirement: knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and Python
Why Picnic

Do you want to be part of the supermarket revolution? At Picnic you get the chance to join a young and forward-thinking startup culture, where everything you do matters. With a data-driven approach and an incredible service, Picnic strives to make grocery shopping simple, fun, and affordable for everyone. Known for our just-in-time supply-chain and a unique last-mile delivery strategy, we have become one of the fastest-growing companies of the Netherlands!

In our modern Amsterdam office, you will have the freedom to experiment and evolve your own projects as well as the chance to test them on real customers. We offer you training in both professional basics, such as 'presenting with confidence' and 'impactful feedback', and hard skill workshops, such as a SQL and Python training. We also offer Dutch language classes for our international colleagues.

You will be part of an international, all-star team of ground-breaking entrepreneurs, brilliant engineers, and data wizards that work with desire and dedication each day. But don't worry, at Picnic groceries aren't a chore – we play as hard as we work!
Are you looking for an experience abroad? We also offer you the opportunity to join our office in Düsseldorf.
Want to get a better view of what working as a Business Analyst at Picnic is like? Then read the story of Matthijs Roobeek or former consultant Susan Lagerweij.
FAQ
Which team would I be joining?

Almost every team of Picnic consists out of multiple Business Analysts. Examples of Picnic teams you could join: Fulfilment, Distribution, Growth, Trading, Merchandising, Partnerships, Payments, Customer Success, Finance, People, Store, Tech and so on. We will discuss the team we have in mind for you during the final stages of your interview process. Of course we take your preference into account too!
What does the application process look like?

Online application -> online assessment (36 minutes) -> video or phone call with recruiter -> first interview round (behavioral + case interview) -> case day -> closing interview with one of the Picnic founders
The entire process can be done digitally, in the case that meeting in person is impossible due to COVID-19 restrictions.
When can I start?
We organize two onboarding sessions a month at Picnic, and you could join the one at your earliest convenience!
-Please submit your application in English-",-1.0,-1,https://indeed.nljavascript:void(0)

column1: 284,health,Indeed,pj_05ea5965da57fc43,Senior International Product Manager Insurance,NN Group, Amsterdam Oost,"Do you want to contribute to NN’s future and help set up and maintain new opportunities in the platform economy? Do you believe there is a whole new way for financial services to reach their customers, and do you want to explore, experiment, and build a business out of that? The (Sr.) International Productmanager is responsible for developing and managing new financial propositions that enhance the propositions of our third-party platform partners. Interested? Apply!
Your impact as (Sr.) International Productmanager Third-party Platforms at NN

As (Sr.) International Productmanager Third-party Platforms you are responsible for the development of new products and the management, improvement and maintenance of existing products. This includes designing the products’ financial constructions, track performance and initiate improvements. You are also the owner of relevant product documents such as the terms and conditions, operational instructions, regulatory documents etc.

Together with your colleagues and our external partners you devise creative solutions to meet customer needs and improve on them. You understand what it means to build and manage a product from an operational, legal, IT and financial point of view and you are our go-to person for your colleagues and our partners concerning the workings of our offerings. In order to fill this role, you have strong analytical skills, understand and can work with legal challenges and never forget the customer focus. And last but not least, you have a can-do mentality and enjoy growing together.
Your responsibilities
Co-Design, track and improve the operational, technical, legal and financial (including pricing) elements of our propositions
Formalization and maintenance of relevant official documentation (e.g. policy terms, operational instructions, regulatory documents)
Aiding with opportunity analysis and proposing creative solutions to win new deals
Maintaining interaction with platform partners on product aspects (operational, continuous improvement)
Managing legal & compliance requirements to get and keep the necessary approvals
Who you are

You bring with you relevant knowledge and experience in the field of Productmanagement of financial retail products in a European context. Retail Non-life insurance is essential, life and banking a bonus. You have a strong customer focus and proven (data) analytical capabilities. You are naturally curious, have the right mindset to always keep learning and improving and are a true teamplayer. You are also comfortable working in a ‘start-up’ environment and not afraid to take calculated risks and dealing with adversity.
Furthermore you bring:
Master’s Degree or similar level of education, preferably in the area of Insurance Administration or Business Administration
Minimum of 5 years of working experience in the financial services industry. Preferably in a Productmanager role
Minimal General WFT certification (additional certificates is a plus) or European equivalent
Fluency in Dutch and English (additional European Languages are a pro)
Strong affinity with and understanding of digital technologies and business models
Experience working with Agile ways of working and tooling
Your colleagues

You will be part of the Strategic Transformation Office (STO) of NN Group. STO is responsible for bringing innovation to NN’s business, and has over 50 people working with great enthusiasm on new concepts. This is a dynamic and inspiring environment, and the people are keen to help you, test ideas and bring them to life.
Continue developing
It is important to us that you continue to develop yourself. We give you the space and the confidence to grow in your career as well as a person. We help you with:
Plenty of training and learning opportunities in our Learning & Development Centre
A large (international) network of colleagues who are keen to share their knowledge with you
The autonomy to set out your own development path
About NN

We help people care for what matters most to them. The world in which we live may change, but what really matters to people remains the same. Family, friends, love, health, home and of course work. You help to make our services more personal and relevant. As an organisation we can really make a difference with all our brands: Nationale-Nederlanden, NN Investment Partners, ABN AMRO Verzekeringen, Movir, AZL, BeFrank, Zicht and OHRA.
Employee benefits

You are more than a colleague and we understand that very well at NN. You have different roles in life and that involves choices. We give you the opportunity to select the employee benefits that are important to you and that match your personal situation. This includes buying additional leave, flexible working hours or working four nine-hour days. Your holiday allowance and 13th month are paid with your salary monthly, so there is no need to wait.

Because of coronavirus, all NN colleagues are currently working from home fully digitally. It is currently not yet clear when we can return to the office. The official location for this job is Amsterdam.

As (Sr.) International Productmanager you are based in our fantastic office in the Amstel district, close to Amsterdam Amstel station. To relax, you can train in our in-house gym, walk along the Amstel or walk to the Weesperzijde with all its cafes and restaurants.
Will you be our new colleague?

If you are enthusiastic about this vacancy and think that you would be a good fit for the team at NN, we would like to invite you to apply. We are very keen to find out who you are, what motivates you and what you can contribute to this role at NN.
Apply now

If you have any questions about the vacancy or the process, give us a call or let us know on WhatsApp. You can reach out to Roger Goossens, Platform Builder via +31-(0)6-54778018 or via roger.goossens@nn.nl or you can contact Michèle Borsjé via +31-(0)6-46360105.

This is a permanent position. A candidate will receive a contract from NN and we are not open to interim/freelance assignments and/or candidates or recruitment agencies.
